title: Wanderlog - Travel Planner
description:
Wanderlog is a free travel app (with an optional subscription) for planning every kind of trip, including road trips and group travel: create a trip itinerary, budget costs, organize flight and hotel reservations, view places to visit on a map, and collaborate with friends. With an optional subscription, you can also export your trip to Google Maps and link your Gmail account. After your trip, share a travel guide to inspire other travelers.

- See flights, hotels, and attractions in one place (like TripIt and Tripcase)
- View plans on a travel map & map your route (like Roadtrippers)
- Rearrange the order of places easily by drag-and-drop
- Planning a road trip? Add unlimited stops for free, optimize your route, view times & distances between places, and export places to Google Maps
- Planning group travel? Invite friends and collaborate in real-time just (like Google Docs)
- Automatically import reservations by forwarding emails or connecting your Gmail
- Add things to do from top guides with 1 click (like Tripadvisor and Google Trips/Google Travel)
- Access your trip plans offline
- Add notes and links to your stops
- Have your trip plans automatically sync across devices
- Set budget, track expenses, and split bills with a group

-------

SEE IT ON A MAP

Every time you add a place to visit, it’s immediately pinned on your Google Maps-based travel map. No need to pull up different travel apps and websites to organize plans and see them on a map - you can do it all in the Wanderlog trip planner app! Plus, if you’re visiting points in order, lines will connect the different pins on the map so you can see your route (perfect for road trips!). You can also export all your places to Google Maps too.

STORE PLANS OFFLINE

All your plans are automatically stored offline on the Wanderlog travel planner app - especially helpful during a road trip with poor signal and international travel.

GET ON THE ROAD

Looking for a road trip planner? Travelers can plan their trips and stops with Wanderlog. See your route on a map, or try our route optimizer to automatically rearrange and plan your route to save travel time. See estimated times & distance traveled between places to make sure it all fits, and total time and distance traveled for a given day to make sure you’re not driving too long. Plus, you can add unlimited stops along your road trip for free.

COLLABORATE WITH FRIENDS

For group travel planning, add your tripmates with their email address or by sharing a link to the itinerary. Like for Google Docs, everyone can collaborate in real-time. Set permissions and choose whether people can edit or just view your travel plans.

STAY ORGANIZED

Access flights, hotels, and attractions in one app. Forward flight and hotel confirmation emails to import them directly into your trip plan, or connect your Gmail to automatically add them. Prefer to keep high-level plans? Make generic lists like ‘Things to do’ and ‘Restaurants’ you want to eat at. Traveling on a tight schedule and want to create a detailed itinerary? Organize your day by adding start (and end) times, perfect for keeping track of tickets and reservations.

GET INSPIRATION & INFORMATION

For each place, see key info like a description and picture of the place, average user ratings with links to reviews, opening hours, address, website, and phone number. Stay inspired by exploring top travel guides from the web that feature viewpoints, attractions, and restaurants, and from lists from Google Trips and Google Travel, as well as by other Wanderlog users, and add things to do from those guides to your trip plan with 1 click.

CONTROL YOUR SPENDING

Set a budget for yourself or a group. Take control of your spending and keep track of all expenses. For a group trip, split a bill with other people and easily calculate the cost. Keep a record of who paid for what, how much everyone owes or is owed, and settle debts between tripmates.
releaseNotes: Wanderlog's available in more languages! We're launching Chinese, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, Japanese, and Korean support. We fixed a bug that prevented sharing with emails. Our Dream Trip Contest for a chance to win a $1,000 trip to anywhere in the world will also continue until April 15!
developer: Travel and Vacation Planner App LLC
reviews:
I liked that you are able to see the places you want to visit in a map, that way you can organize your itinerary by area. That helped me creating my route to my trip to Japan. I will definitely use it for my next trip. | This app is so amazing. I highly recommend it. After using it to plan a 4 month trip I love it. It does all it says it does. A thing or 2 I could only do on the app or on the computer but I could do all it says it does. On one thing I had a question and got a quick & detailed response from the developer (email is in the help section of app). | I was hoping this would work for road trips. Things do do from Point A to Point B | Just got back from a 9 day on-the-go Spain trip.  Wanderlog made planning the trip easier (being able to visualize everything on the map and drag-and-drop places to different days/times was great!).  We put in all of our flights/trains/rental-cars, restaurants, sites...  And my wife and I were able to collaborate. I'd get excited seeing her putitng in a Flamenco concert she booked for one evening for example. And then on the trip, it was so nice to have one place to reference for everything about our plans. 

I can honestl say Wanderlog made our trip better than it would have been. | I literally unsubscribed from the free trial offer five minutes after adding it and was still charged. And with you’re “refund policy” being only if an enforcement company requires you to, you actually don’t care about your users. Just greedy. I would like my money back | Great app for organizing your trip!  From collecting reservation information to identifying attractions to creating itineraries. It does it all. Highly recommended! | I’ve been using Wanderlog for close to a year now and very much love the app + website. For each destination, I start with a master list of places of interest. Using existing lists are extremely helpful to make the master list. Then I build an itinerary from it. Adding approximate time spent at the place and the app providing time between the places helps a lot when planning. What I’ve been most impressed with is the robustness of the app. I haven’t had any issue with incorrect information, data loss, app crashing or unavailability. The UI / UX is very intuitive. They have quite a few other features that I can being useful. | This app has made planning vacations so much easier to organize! I love how simple it is to build my itinerary and see how things are situated on the map. It’s also great for tracking how much money I’m spending! A must have for travelers! | Well, I was told I would get notification after my free trial period before they took my money. But that did not happen and they refuse a refund. So try at your own risk, but you might get your money stolen. | I don’t ever really write reviews, but I love to travel. I had mostly been writing out my itineraries on paper, but than I decided it might be easier to do with an app. So I downloaded a bunch, like 10, and just tried them out. Wanderlog was truly, by far, above the rest. The budget feature in particular was fantastic, I went to Europe with a bunch of friends and it was really helpful for tracking expenses, and the fact that it automatically converts currency within calculations is really helpful and a nice touch. I now use wanderlog every time I travel and I really love it. | This app has it all. I love all of the organization. The mapping is the best part! I also love knowing how long it will take to get from place to place. The only drawback is, in some there google driven guides the places are closed for good. | Love the sharing option. Makes itinarary so much easier. | This has been amazing app from throwing ideas together to really finalizing the smallest details.  However, what is more important is the support team, I spent months putting a trip together and accidentally deleted it, within hours they were able to restore my trip and save me hours of recreation, and many more tears. | One of the best apps i used in japan, it really organized my trip. | first of all, it is deceiving when it says sign up for the pro version for roughly around three dollars a month when in reality you sign up for the annual price it does not give you a month-to-month option. 

Second of all the pro features don’t even work the whole point was for it to pull your itinerary information and add your flight info automatically. instead it pulled old itineraries from the last year or two that are already irrelevant. I don’t understand why it would search that far back and my most recent emails with the upcoming flight info couldn’t even be added into the app. I had to manually add my flight info. 

third of all as soon as you create your account, your bombarded with 20+ pop-ups I selected no more tips and it’s still kept coming up with all of these pop-ups. It was so annoying. | Would recommend it to anyone 
Help me and my girlfriend sort out everything we needed easily during our travels | I acquired this app based on its outstanding reviews; however, it has proven to be a profound disappointment. Not only is it functionally inadequate, but it also requires a subscription. Rather than providing useful suggestions, it merely retrieves articles about activities in various cities, a task I could easily perform myself. My primary desire was for quick itinerary suggestions, a feature this app fails to deliver. Additionally, its incessant interruptions to offer tips on its interface only compound the frustration. One must question the design decisions that led to such a cumbersome user experience. | Such a nice app to lean on when you have a trip planned and have a lot of cooks in the kitchen of planning 😄 | Really great app | I have waited all my life for a way to plan trips this efficiently. Thank you for making such an incredible app! I tell everyone about it. | This app helped me keep a month long multi-city trip through Europe organized.  I love that it has the ability to forward emails to your itinerary and it will upload the confirmation directly for hotels, transit and other reservations.  I was able to share it with my co-travelers and they can add points of interest and help with to-do list and wish lists.  If this can keep me organized so easily, then it’s definitely worth it! | If you’re a freak about organizing your trips, everything about this app is spot on! | I tried this for LA and it had locations WAY far off like Palm Springs Liberace house. It also had a charity museum that had no activity on instagram since 2020….unless I’m missing something.  Also the charity location is an hour away from the location I input.  It had a “permanently closed” restaurant listed.  Wasted my time.I don’t get it . | this app would be amazing if fully worked!! won’t let me add certain places to my lists. no reason. just does nothing when you click add. don’t have this problem using the web version ?? | I use my home town in Delaware and asked for it to suggest some places to go out to eat. Well it picked three places I never heard of, the name of the town was right but they were in Canada a few hundred miles away. 
Ok so I understand this is a trip planner but I’d love to have a better control over where the heck this AI thinks I should go. Nope, not going to buy this one! | So helpful!! This made our trip so much better. It makes planning easier and more fun, and traveling so much less stressful. Love the map feature where you can see the layout of your itinerary. I kept everything in my notes app before and it was a pain. You need this! Love the free features too. | I love this app! I can make checklists (packing lists and lists to help me remember what I need for each daily adventure). The way you can forward a hotel or flight or rental car reservation and it automatically adds it all to your itenerary including confirmation numbers, addresses and cost for your budget is phenomenal. I love how it offers suggestions on sights to see and things to do and places to eat. Plus all of my friends or family whom I invite to share it with can also have all the information right at hand. I’d give this app 100 stars if possible. I’ve used it for 5 trips now and will never use anything else. | A great app for traveling together with friends. Easy to upload accommodations, schedules, and finances. If you are traveling with friends this app is perfect. I highly recommend it!!! | Ever since I discovered Wanderlog, I’ve used it to plan every trip I’ve been on and have told anyone who will listen about it. The app’s itinerary building functions, the option to create different lists, and the ability to share with others makes it indispensable. It’s near perfect and I recommend the following to the developers: allows old trips to be archived automatically based on dates, allow blocking for nonspecific activities in the itinerary, incorporate the visited map from the web into the app, and add a feature to organize places you’d like to visit by continent, country, etc. | Overall this is an amazing all. I’ve always used google sheets to plan my trip because the alternatives weren’t great. For the first time, I started using an app that solves my need right from planing to on the road. 

Having said that, the app is slow when you add many locations. Additionally, the drive times are incorrect on the app. So I have to switch to computer. The route optimization cannot be done across multiple days. If some of these can be fixed, I’ll be happy to pay for the app. | I’m type A personality and I knew for my trip I needed somewhere I could write down an itinerary. Wanderlog was that and more! I loved being able to plug in all the things and have everything in one place. Thank you thank you thank you! | I had great hopes in using this app. However, it is not sophisticated enough to insert manual planning. I have a trip already planned that I tried to set up in this app and it just doesn’t work. I already have plane tickets, hotels, cruise, etc. It just won’t let me EASILY add everything. Not worth the effort in trying to figure it out. Stick with the spreadsheet!! | I downloaded this app to plan a roadtrip to the Philippines. I love how simple and customizable it is. I also love that you can share it to people and they don’t have to download the app to view or edit it. Most locations I need are searchable. It’s mostly free until I want to save it offline which is great because I can plan free before my trip and only pay for it when I need it.

Some suggestions that would make this app even better: 
- Having the option to make certain pages private
- Being able to mention your tripmates and make action items so it’s clear on who is responsible for what
- Being able to pool money as a trip mate and assigning who is responsible for paying. I feel like a lot of group trips, there is a designated person for food, lodging, gas, etc.
- Being able to customize the color of Notes. I have a few and it blends in really well with the Places because they are the same color.
- Being able to assign sub-budgets, perhaps by Place you’re going to or by type of expense (food, lodging, gas etc) | We used Wanderlog for the first time on a 10 day trip and it was amazing!  Easy to set up, great recommendations!  Will be using for all trips from now on. | Please make this app compatible with Airbnb!!! It’s a pretty good app, but there seem to be a lot of minor glitches. I really like that it gives me a time frame to get from one point to the other and it creates the most seamless transition, but it is super slow and I can’t add accommodations for Airbnb. Also, once I’ve gotten rid of a box, I don’t want it to keep popping up…it’s incredibly frustrating. | Wowed by the amount of information I can find in this app. Wanderlog has asked and answered all of the questions you have about traveling, organized them and put them all in one app. SO useful!  I'm just at the tip of the iceberg and can't wait to explore more! | This app really was essential in the planning of my trip. It allowed me to make a list of all the things we wanted to do and see and then work to fill in the gaps!  I referred to it when e had some down time or looking for a place to eat nearby. | Literally the best app for planning trips. So easy to use and able to collaborate with friends! | Loved this app. It really helped me plan for a better trip as to maximize areas and sites I wanted to see. I will definitely use it from now on when planning. | Very User Friendly!  My son recommended this app and honestly I was hesitant. I normally turn to paper and pen. But boy what a revelation this app turned out to be; so convenient to have everything in one place. Loading travel plans was a breeze!  Adding places to visit was easy. Also the app provides ideas for stops. Love it. | I had plans to use this and after 1 week got a hard stop. | This app has every feature I would put into a travel planning app! I am thrilled with it! | I am really enjoying the app. It would be helpful if there was a driving map, so we don’t have to use other apps for planning. | I used this app to plan my trip to Japan and absolutely LOVED how easy it was to plan out all the restaurants, landmarks, train stations, and hotels on the map and organize everything into their own respective categories! I found it so helpful that they also auto color code the points on the map based on the category I put them in (I put them in categories of cafes, restaurants, transportation stops, etc.). I had the best trip all because I was able to add all my notes into this app, and now I send my itinerary to everyone I can and always tell my friends and family to plan everything using this app! | Wonderful app! I love to able to save all the places of interest and it auto populates in the map & numbered too. Great for organizing my days on a trip and even adding what restaurants I want to visit etc. Super helpful app and very easy to use! Love it and highly recommend it. | This app totally changed how I plan and travel!!! I am recommending it to everyone I know. We went to Berlin as a family of 5. Everyone had access to the itinerary for planning purposes. And I, as the planner, was able to put all of our trip details (and all my research) in one place, making a huge improvement in how we sightsee. This is a very robust and useful travel tool! | I have always used Roadtrippers until they started ripping people off with their prices.   I made the switch and really like using wonderlog now.   It is different from when I was used to using, but I think I like it a lot better.  I love the easy way you can keep all of your documents together in one place. | I really hate planning trips…not because I don’t enjoy picking out cool places to go, but because I struggle with things like timing and organization. This app really helped me to put together an itinerary that included all of the places I wanted to go, plus gave me a few suggestions to fill in some gaps. 

Will definitely use it for future trips! | Wanderlog is awesome for helping organize and coordinage those big trips--especially internationally. It was super useful to both plan our own daily itineraries as well as utilize the recommendations made by Wanderlog. Fantastic stuff! | Way way better than competing apps. Intuitive, excellent organization.

title: TripIt: Travel Planner
description:
Join nearly 20 million travelers on the world's highest-rated travel planner app for trip and itinerary organization!


TRAVEL ITINERARY

As soon as you book a flight, hotel, rental car or other travel plan, simply forward it to plans@tripit.com and we’ll automatically add it to your comprehensive itinerary. Seamlessly sync travel plans to your calendar or share them with anyone you choose.


RESERVATION DETAILS

No more frantically searching through your inbox for important details about your travel plans, like when your flight gets in or the confirmation number for your hotel. Find them in a flash with TripIt — even when you’re offline. Access this information hands-free with Siri shortcuts!


Upload PDFs, photos, boarding passes, digital passport QR codes and more to your travel itinerary, so you can track everything in one place.


MAPS AND DIRECTIONS

The TripIt app includes all the map-related tools you’ll need on-the-go (it’s great for road trips).

-	Plot out your entire trip on Google Maps or Apple Maps
-	Quickly pull up transportation options and driving directions between two points (powered by Rome2Rio)
-	Easily locate the closest restaurants, parking, ATMs and more


TRIPIT PRO

For roughly the price of checking your bags, upgrade to TripIt Pro to access exclusive travel perks all year long. When you upgrade, TripIt Pro will do all this for you (and more!):


• Share real-time flight status alerts and check in reminders
• Notify you if you're eligible for a refund if your fare price drops after booking
• Track your reward programs and alert you if points are expiring
• Navigate you through the airport with interactive maps
• Keep you informed when a potential disruption may impact your trip


Your iTunes account will be charged when the purchase is confirmed. Your TripIt Pro subscription will be good for 1 year, and automatically renew each year at $48.99 unless you turn off auto-renew at least 24 hours before your term ends. To manage your subscription, including auto-renew, visit iTunes Account Settings.


FREE TRIPIT PRO FOR SAP CONCUR USERS

If your company uses SAP Concur, you may receive complimentary TripIt Pro benefits that most travelers have to pay for. Make sure you’re connected to TripIt to get itineraries created for you as soon as you book, and receive a complimentary subscription to TripIt Pro, if you’re eligible.


For more information, see the TripIt User Agreement (https://www.tripit.com/uhp/userAgreement) and Privacy Policy (https://www.tripit.com/uhp/privacyPolicy).
releaseNotes: • Introducing our newest TripIt Pro feature, Risk Alerts! Get proactive alerts about events that have the potential to disrupt your trip, so you can modify your itinerary if needed and still enjoy your trip. Alerts may cover inclement weather, unplanned airport closures, protests or strikes, public health events, and more. Enable these push notifications by toggling “Risks and Disruptions” to “On” within Settings.
reviews:

Easy to use and email notifications were great | I stumbled upon this app about 5 years ago before it became huge and my opinion has never changed. It is one of the best apps out there! | I luv this app, it keeps my entire itinerary when I travel in one place and I get alerts through the TripIt app before the airlines send updates. It’s amazing. Dust wish it was easier to upload travel itineraries created on ChatGPT/or other AI to track the entire vacation. | I do not find a way to contact personnel at TripIt.  Poor customer service options-currently | Not sure how this app has not been acquired by the likes of Apple or some big outfit. It is beyond AMAZING. 

Works like magic and makes checking emails for trip information a thing of the past. Don’t travel as much as I used to but when I do, TripIt is a must use app for all aspects of the trip. Is giving free app vibes, when I know I’ve spent money… | I have used this app for over 10 years and consider it one of my go-to apps for travel. Pulls all travel plans from email. I receive notices before the airlines notices come through. | I googled for a trip organizer or some sort of reminder for events. And this app popped up. Yes, that info is already in my calendar, but TripIt segregates my travel schedules in a much more accessible way. Perfect for capturing all of the other vacation/travel related items and categorizing them appropriately. When someone asks if I’m available in September, I look at TripIt first.
