And I can share my travel info with family that are not traveling, if anyone needs to contact me. Great app. | I just received an alert from TripIt saying that the price had dropped on my flight by $160. Just called the airline and got my $160 credit.

I also like that, all of my reservations are in one place car, hotel, flights. It even gives you warnings when things don’t look right. | This app not only helped me organize my trip and order the activities, but it is SO simply to get everything added! And you can share it with everyone on the trip so everyone has all the information and access to tickets, etc. I would give this app 10 stars if I could! Well done! | This is so great to plan your itinerary. | Excellent app. | Just started testing out this app to see if I want to purchase the pro version. So far it has kinks that need to be fixed before I’ll pay for it. When adding multiple flights to a single trip, it won’t allow you to have multiple confirmation numbers, even when selecting different airlines. I book a lot of separate tickets so this is very frustrating.

Updated to add that if you forward the itineraries, the confirmation numbers are correct. It only glitches if you enter them manually. | This app works the best for coordinating your vacations itinerary. Just email your confirmation s and it sorts out date time and everything. It’s especially helpful in keeping you in sync with the location time zones. Highly recommended for anyone going on trips. | Love the ease of the app. We set up a special email for tripit that we use for all trip notices that integrates with tripit. We have done 370 trips and don't plan on switching apps. I love that Pro keeps your history. I love the text alerts they keep me on the right path and saves me so much time. Everything I need for a trip is here. | Trying to access app, unfortunately crashes started to happen with notice that app is temporarily unavailable. Very disappointing. Removed/Uninstalled app and started again to try and login, same error. | I love the idea everything is in one place but It’s taking forever to add documents and keeps freezing so I have to close and restart every time | Love how it imports trip info from my email. So easy to stay on top of flights and hotels | It is so helpful and so easy to use! | This is my favorite app of all time. If you travel you need this. Easy, even for old folks to use. 10 stars. | I’ve thought this was a solid app for tracking travel plans, but had a wonderful surprise today when I received a text that my Southwest flight in 2 months was $60 cheaper (same flight) and not only told me to call to get a flight credit, but gave me the number. To say I was happy is an understatement. | Love it | Love to organize my trips on this app. Added bonus with Tripit Pro- they notify you if price changes on your flight allowing you to request refund! Love it | There are certainly areas to grow.  But, from my experience this the best and easiest app to use.  I do wish when I send confirmations for events such as concerts, sporting events, tours or excursions it would do a better job in adding to the plan with the appropriate event type. 

My wife and I share the travel planning.  This really helps us keep track of what’s been purchased and what still needs to be addressed.

 In the future I could imagine this app or a competitor leveraging machine learning and/or AI to do something special.  Probably would get purchased by one of the big players in the space like Expedia or booking.com | Love the one stop shop for tracking all my business travel

One thing. I wish that when I check into to flights it would allow me to add the boarding pass to my apply wallet, but I have to go on the website to do that, rather than TripIt. I mainly fly southwest so it may just be with that airline. | I’m having trouble importing new trip details from my emails on file. Not sure why this stopped happening. | TripIt is my favorite travel app. I don’t know how they do what they do, but they always beat the airlines when it comes to providing flight delays, cancellations, and gate change notifications. if you travel a lot, TripIt Pro definitely is worth it. | I’ve planned two trips in a few weeks. I’ve used this app and it has made them so easy. I have coordinated a trip for three people with three different airline itineraries, nightly dinner at six different locations for the week, to and from transportation and events. Talk about an easy effort, everything set up automatically and I was able to email it to the folks involved! Thank you for creating an app that actually does what it says it’s going to do and works so effectively!! | Simple and easy to coordinate hotel/car/flight information. Simple to look back and find the info as well. | I have had this app for about a year and I love, love, love it. I usually have several trips in the planning stage. This app lets me keep track of everything in one place. I easily see exactly what I have booked from flights, hotels, tours, restaurant reservations, theater performances and just about anything else. It is easy to use and edit any change of plans. I have recommended this app to friends. I am so glad I have this app. | It has been a great help to me in organizing my trips. | Oh my God I just learned about this app today and played with it for 10 minutes and it’s so helpful to organize my itinerary and saved me a lot of manual work. I’m totally impressed. | I have almost 4 million seat miles on AA.  I use this for every trip business and personal.  Saves a ton of time and it organizes everything involved in travel.  It’s awesome. | This travel app is absolutely amazing!
Create a trip and send confirmation emails to input!  Helps you catch errors, make sure you have no gaps, etc. includes all transportations, reservations, lodging etc with all the info you need in it. | Was seriously loving this app to plan a big trip with the family. Lots of planes, trains, hotels to keep track of. Once I realized the max PDF files was 3 with the free version I immediately upgraded to Pro to then only find out that they once again maxed out at 25 uploads. Geez…. It was my main reason for paying! | This is the best app ever I shared it with two friends that are not Internet savvy, and they are very excited to use this for their upcoming European trip.  My friend and I are able to share our updates and I love the expansions on each location that provides more detail that we don’t have to look up. I do wish they could add some sort of budget where you could see the total of your budget at the top or something but other than that it’s amazing. It’s a great app they can be used with, anything you’re doing on your trip and I love the chronological order | I’ve been using KAYAK for a while to plan and share trip information, but it isn’t a perfect tool, so I thought I’d try TripIt for a while. 

It is easy to add your plans to TripIt, just forward it reservation emails; Kayak does this too. You can also enter or change details manually. Tripit is somewhat better than kayak for this. 

With TripIt, it is easy to share a trip with participants who can update the trip with you (e.g. one person works on transportation, another on lodging, etc). The whole trip collaboration thing is easier with TripIt than KAYAK. 

The subscribed calendar support in KAYAK is much better than TripIt. With KAYAK you can see all your trips, including flights and lodging, on your device calendar. I can easily see how my trips fit into all my other plans. Other people can see my trips on their calendars too. I just share a calendar link with friends and family so they can see where I am and how to reach me on their own device calendars without using the kayak app at all; they like that. 

Tripit also supports subscribed calendars, but doesn’t include the detailed plans. This is a showstopper for me; it should be straightforward for TripIt to improve their support, but until they do, I’ll stick with KAYAK. | My account has an odd email added to it, and with every click I get an error. It’s been less then 10 min since downloading it and I want out | I’ve used this app for years and never cease to be impressed by how easy it makes keeping track of travel plans.  Especially because I travel a lot. | This app makes organizing travel simple. I email my confirmations to the app and it organizes my itineraries. I’ve planned complicated itineraries for a few weeks in Europe with tour guides, show tickets, hotels, drivers, trains and planes.  The app keeps it all organized and recommends options near where I’ll be. It’s really awesome.

title: Tripsy: Travel Planner & Guide
description:
Tripsy is a travel planner that helps you plan your entire trip in one place. You can share your itinerary with family and friends, receive flight alerts, store documents, and make wish lists of places to visit.

During the trip, the app helps you by providing a 10-day weather forecast, updated flight information, offline access to everything, time zone changes, and much more!
 
**WHAT EVERYONE IS SAYING:**
 
App Store Featured: “Making the most of your holiday time requires some planning. With Tripsy, that’s plain sailing. Enter flight times, hotels, and places you want to visit, then share your itinerary with your travel mates with a tap of a button”.
 
MacStories: “Tripsy does what I’ve long wished for: offers a compelling trip planning experience in a modern app that takes advantage of iOS’ core technology strengths.”
 
9to5mac: “The app’s interface is extremely user-friendly, and it also offers data synching in the cloud, automation service, and Siri Shortcuts.”
 
**Tripsy is your ultimate travel companion**

Here are some of its key features:

– Organize all your travel information, from flights and hotels to restaurants and tours, in one place.
- 10-day forecast weather on your itinerary.
– Receive flight updates via push notifications and never miss a gate or time change again.
– Share your trip with friends and family and collaborate on itinerary planning.
– Store all your travel memories, from images and notes to videos and documents, and easily share them with guests.
– Automatically import reservations from over 700 providers, including Booking.com, Hotels.com, and major airlines.
– Sync your trip data with your calendar app to stay on top of all your activities and events.
– Get one-click access to popular mapping services like Waze, Google Maps, and Uber from any of your destinations.
– Stay informed with real-time flight alerts on departure and arrival times, terminals, gates, and baggage claims.
– Customize your travel itinerary with background images or colors that match your style.
– Configure each activity with the time zone you want, making the organization of your trip more practical.
– Explore exclusive travel itineraries curated by Tripsy with tips and insider information to make your trip as fruitful as possible.

With Tripsy, you can effortlessly plan your entire trip and stay organized every step of the way.
  
Tripsy is free, but we also offer a pro version called Tripsy Premium with unlimited trips, exclusive itineraries, cloud, documents, and more. Premium is available in monthly and yearly subscriptions, and a lifetime purchase option is available.
 
- View our Terms of Service at: https://tripsy.app/terms
- View our Privacy Policy at: https://tripsy.app/policy
releaseNotes: This update contains bug fixes and minor improvements.
reviews:
The pro premium is well worth the $ i currently have 8 trips planned and 5 past trips that I dont want to forget and everything is so easy to add. Links and documents are seamless from emails,  webpages, maps, pictures, anything you want to add to your itinerary is done. It is extremely user friendly, easy to update, change, delete or add something. Reservations directly from your multiple emails (including my friends) upload instantly into my itinerary. I love being able to choose my own background pictures for my trips and see them all lined up on my phone. I do wish there was a print feature and maybe a rating system for entries in old trips so i can remember which restaurants/tours etc were worth it and which to skip although i can always just put notes so I’m nitpicking. Really well done and i love not having to worry about adding too many documents or links or trips. Excellent app for travelers! | I love how I can put in items without an and time.  Having issues syncing between devices.  Don't like if you just assign a location as "afternoon" it will show at the bottom of the day's itinerary vs in timeline order. Parking also doesn't show on itinerary, but does have it on the main trip page.  I like it better than TripIt and Wonderlog. | I'm a longtime user of TripIt but just switched over and it's 95% of what I was using before. The one (very odd) omission is that when importing flights, for some reason Tripsy doesn't read the name of the passenger—there doesn't even seem to be a field within Tripsy to store that information. It's a very strange product choice, as it can create confusion when a single trip contains multiple flights for multiple people. I emailed the developer about this but didn't get a response. Anyway, it's not quite a dealbreaker and I'm otherwise really happy with Tripsy—a great translation of TripIt's functionality into a beautiful, Apple-native experience. | La aplicación es hermosa estéticamente. Para mí nunca funcionó porque quise compartir el itinerario, el cual me tardé demasiado capturando, para que nunca pudiera compartirlo. Me salia un mensaje que estaba sincronizando con su nube y nunca lo pude compartir. En una lástima, pero tuve que regresar a TripIt. 😔 | I am a Tripsy Pro subscriber and like this app. I use it for dozens of shared trips a year. But it has major problems with editing events. 

Half the time edits don't stick and you close out of an item and find it totally unchanged on your itinerary. 

Time zone support is also a disaster. Time changes don't stick, trips and events move around the world from time zone to time zone. There's no consistent anchor or method to handling and entering times. 

Perhaps all the problems relate to the way the app stores data. Its sync just doesn’t work well and you need to be aware that data loss can occur. Sometimes events revert to previous versions hours after a change was made. If you move an attachment from one event to another, sometimes the attachment will simply disappear; it is neither on the old event nor the new. Sometimes you simply cannot change the time of an event no matter what you do.

Usability and UI design could really use some work. | Setting an itinerary is an exercise in frustration as destination times refuse to save at least 40% of the time. When they do save, the app decides to change dates on relaunch. Needs work.

4/13 And latest update broke the widgets. Sigh | The design of the app is definitely 5 stars. Where the Tripsy is legging no live updates on flight delays or gate changes, other similar apps provide that info. | Takes so much stress out of traveling, especially with a group. Love this app and wouldn’t want to travel without it. | Tripsy is by far the most advanced and user-friendly travel planner that I've used so far and I do not know how there could be an app better. It also is a Macbook friendly app, which is a HUGE plus. Definitely recommend! | Tipsy has many positive features to organize travel. For the most part I really like the app, but there’s one glaring flaw.
When a 5:30am wake-up time becomes 3:30 am, for no good reason except that Tripsy wants to send “emergency “ notifications on the watch that a gate has been assigned or changed, the missing sleep makes this app so. Not. Worth. It.
I have my watch and phone in sleep mode. Only emergency notifications should come through. But Tripsy manages to get them buzzing me anyway. I don’t know why or how, nor can I find a setting to turn it off. II just know that I’ve lost more than a few nights of good sleep before travel due to this bug.
“Why are you wearing your watch at night?” —> sleep monitoring and afib monitoring. 
An app that is this disrespectful of the importance of sleep doesn’t deserve more than two stars, no matter how good or bad it is otherwise. | I love having all trip details in one place, and it’s made convenient to forward confirmation emails to the app and automatically on my phone calendar.  It would be useful to have a pre trip checklist of things I need to do and a place for a packing list. 

I like having a trip history to refer to later if traveling to the same place again. It would be helpful to have a section to rate the restaurant, museum, etc after to help jog my memory for recommendations or if a restaurant is worth a repeat visit. | As I sit here loading EACH and EVERY RESERVATION by Hand, MANUALLY, I absolutely wonder WHAT exactly, I am paying for????
I Can do this MUCH EASIER in my Calendar, Except for the "supposed to be" ease of seeing it all on one page? NOT HAPPENING, YET! 
Certainly there has to be a better way. | I am planning our anniversary trip, and I have to say this app is awesome. It not only allows me to add everything to a quick view schedule, but also allows me to add documents that I normally had to rewrite not notes on other apps. Ir can find your flights, carrier, hotel and resort! All in a nicely laid out interface. I use it on an iPad Mini and it looks awesome. | I love I can organize stuff for myself and collaborate on trips with my wife, and it supports everything. Tours, cruises, restaurants, adding files and photos, everything. And lots of clever features sprinkled throughout. Fantastic app. | I've been using TripIt (Pro) for years, but I've always found its interface cumbersome and confusing. While TripIt's new interface is better, I much prefer Tripsy for all my travel planning and tracking.  

Tripsy's clean visual design is beautiful and efficient. The main screen displays the most essential information for my trip or, when traveling, for the current leg of my journey. Details for any portion of the trip are usually just a click away. Tripsy has all the main features that you'd expect from a travel app, such as multiple ways to gather travel documents into a trip (search email, forward an email, Mac/iOS sharing, etc), integration with device calendars, support for multiple travelers and non-traveling planners, document upload, etc. TripIt still has an edge in integrations with other travel apps or services. I suspect Tripsy will add more partnerships as they grow and develop. If there is something you want or need to do in TripIt, Tripsy has the option to sync from  TripIt automatically. I used this option when I started using Tripsy, which made that initial transition (or even a trial) so much easier because I didn't need to reimport my documents for planned trips. 

Tripsy lost a few points in this review because of a few areas where it took effort to accomplish some tasks. There are some quirks in importing the cruise portion of a trip. Most cruise data was imported without a hitch; however, it didn't grab the departure time for days in port. I tried manually adding the departure times for a day in port, but it was annoyingly complex. I'd open the detail for a particular day, but I needed help figuring out how to add the departure time, or when I did, I could only choose from predetermined times. Eventually, I found that I had to select a predetermined time, save the changes, open the details again, scroll down to the proper date of my trip and then I could finally set the appropriate time. This problem doesn't happen often, but it is currently a pain. 

Overall, though, I love using Tripsy!! It is now my go-to travel app. | It really helps plan trips and only one person needs a subscription for everyone to collaborate in the app for a trip. | overall great program.  needs a slight interface overhaul (each day should be very subtle different color than others to easily differentiate them).  And I would highly recommend a calendar view. | If you have an itinerary already defined, this app may help document it.  But if you're actually planning and exploring options, it will get slow you down and make a mess in your calendar database.  Also, I got billed for a month even though I cancelled quickly. | Here are my issues so far-- 1) Multiple times, the entries I have put in and saved change on their own. Train times, for instance, will modify themselves to whatever they want (right now I have a train entry that leaves at 8:42PM and arrives at 8:42PM, despite putting in the accurate times). It is not a time change issue, either, they're just random times and AM/PM. This is very annoying and I'm about to give up on this tool. 2) We're flying halfway across the world and you have to scroll to see the map entirely, no way to zoom out and show the whole trip on the screen. You can zoom in...but you can't zoom out to show Florida and Australia on the same map screen. 3) I subscribed to a monthly plan and was surprised to have recently been charged for a year's access. It just seems like "Save" doesn't mean what you think it does in this app. I was really excited to get organized, but I think I'll have to look elsewhere, like TripIt. | Unable to even put in dated. Date Screen does not scroll to find the correct month. Figures a work around but once I put in the ending date, the program changes the start date so the trip is ony 1 day....unless I set the trip up without dates but it is difficult to add places for the new days. | 如果加上每段行程花费多少钱这个功能就更好了 | Tried to change to this because I was over trip it. Not pulling in the text from the email and when I search for what I need it keeps showing something in the wrong country. No thanks. Making my life harder | This product can do more to help plan for your vacation than the free platforms. Both this company and apple customer service are unwilling to listen and help resolve my issue with this platform. | This is a great travel planner APP. It works very well and is reliable. Their customer service is excellent as well. If you are looking for a travel planner APP with a lifetime purchase, just try this one! | I am offering 4-stars in this review solely based on the apps' potential and the current user interface design friendliness. The apps' current state and functionality is actually about a 2-star. I hope to update this review shortly to full 5-star based on some things getting taken care of.
Easier itinerary control - went to manually add (I didn't have easy access to the email), a pre-trip hotel stay near the airport for an early flight, and I couldn't do that because the app had already defined the trip as Thursday to Tuesday based on the flight, with me trying to add a Wednesday "activity". I had to go into the settings for the itinerary and change the beginning date. (A further annoyance, rather than just changing one date, once I set the new start, it also required the ending, rather than keeping it on the same by default. There should be a way when adding an activity to go “outside the dat boundary” and have the app automatically update the overall itinerary timeframe.
Side-note to above… The share-to-Tripsy function in the Hilton app only brought hotel name and phone number, not the booked dates, res# or other actual booking details - another potential fix? I don’t know if that is Tripsy not importing correctly, or Hilton not exporting & sharing properly.
Better functionality required for the planning part of a trip. Right now, this app just kind of “catches” all the emails you forward it (or painfully add in manually). When you think of booking a trip, say a vacation getaway, there are many pieces to it (the very reason for this app). Resort, flights, transport from airport to resort, excursions while there, maybe a pre-trip hotel stay near the airport with park-and-fly arrangements. Not all that stuff is booked at once. So being able to easily add in each aspect that needs to be booked, and then have each of those activity icons color-coded on the itinerary page (ie. Red for needs booking, yellow for booked, green for booked and pre-paid) really is necessary. Being able to manually change the color of each activity icon would be a simple step. More complex would be adding in 2 checkboxes in the activity (or right-click / hold-click pop up menu) to indicate when it is booked and when it is paid. Next level of complexity would be for the app to automatically color code based on the details provided in the activity (company and res # fields filled out automatically determines “booked” status, I’m not sure how it would determine paid).
 
Again, overall I like the direction this app is going, but it really needs these updates to become the true “Go-To Travel Planner”. Currently, it is leagues beyond it’s main competitor. Enough that I subscribed to Pro for a year. But without these necessary changes, that subscription will not get extended. Yes, those changes are that necessary, and without them I will go back to Excel and OneNote to manage all my travel, as the app would be missing the “ease” functionality that it should have vs. a more manual process.
Hopefully the devs read this and put these ideas in place very soon. I am sure they have a “roadmap”, but for true traveler functionality, these need to be inserted in the immediate stages of that roadmap.
Thanks guys! Keep up the great work!!! | Several of my trips that are complete on one device are showing up as one-day trips on days where I don’t have travel planned. For example, if I have a trip planned from 11-17 March, the trip shows up as 25-25 March on other devices and shared links. None of the activities are syncing across devices. Reached out to support several weeks ago but haven’t heard back and the issue still hasn’t been fixed. Just know that paying for the premium features is worth it when it works, but if it stops working you’ll be dealing with awful customer support. I’ve also never been able to get the import function to work. I like the interface though. | 地图可以增加高德和百度吗？以及板块如果可以自定义就好了，比如我，只想用 app 收集餐馆。旁边的证件对我来说没什么用。我相信有这样需求的人也不少。

"Can maps include options for Amap (高德) and Baidu (百度)? Additionally, it would be great if users could customize categories. For example, I might only want to use the app to collect information about restaurants, and licenses nearby are not relevant to me. I believe there are many users with similar needs." | A great app that keeps all your travel plans in one place. A suggestion - would you please consider adding a feature that allows me to set to-do reminders for my trip? It would would be so helpful to be able to set a reminder then later received a push notification. Thank you!! | I was a long time TripIt user and Tripsy is better in every way imaginable | I had been searching for a good itinerary app ever since Google Trips shut down years ago. Tripsy is the best one I've used since then. The auto-import by email (for flights, hotels, cars etc) works great and has only gotten more reliable over the year I've been using it. The iOS and Mac apps are both super easy to use and visually appealing. | have you considered adding a "packing list" feature for our trips? | This is a great app. I have used it on multiple trips and I can’t live without it now. The only thing missing is that I would like a way to keep a packing list with a quantity field. So I can always make sure I have everything ready prior to a trip and before a return. | Sadly, was hoping this would be app that might work to share itinerary with other humans traveling with me without them having to buy. Nope. Also, had to manually enter 4 of 6 flts and 1 hotel. Even when trying to share from hotel app to create event had to manually enter data. All of this would be fine but when share itinerary with others it does not provide any details (times of flights, flt #, resv etc | Just got it and it provides no guidance as to how to use the app, how to upload reservations; adding guests seems impossible.... | This app is pretty good and very helpful. However I wish the native Mac app felt more Mac-like. As it is, it feels very much like a big iPhone app. I was hoping that planning my trip and making adjustments would have been much easier on my Mac, but I feel the UI and workflow is very limited since it feels like it is a scaled up iPhone app that does not adequately take advantage of the Mac. It is very good, but I wish it could better take advantage of what the Mac can allow for productivity! | Good app and looking forward to using it for future trips.  Would greatly appreciate a field for cost/expense.  We like to work withina budget and this would greatly help. | Searching and adding a flight is too clunky, taking too many steps. The whole UI feels huge like the buttons are massive, but it doesn't make it more usable. You can have different dates than your flights and it doesn't auto update the actual trip dates. You can accidentally add the same flight twice. Buttons aren't labeled, making the intended flow unclear. Basically feels like a more manual version of Kayak, since I'm not paying for the pro version so I can't do email sync. | I download Mac App and iPhone app. At first I ran into problem where the trip from Mac app does not sync. I email support and the Co-Founder responded to me and help diagnose the issue really fast. In face I never had this fast response from app developer before. And the step to diagnose and communication this is straightforward and sincere.

Apart from that, the app has intuitive user interface and easy to understand and can sync with multiple devices and with friends whom I shared the trip with. This eliminated the need to manually create initerary, which reduce times and free us to explore the activities instead. | Wowww. What a good travel app. Very easy going and with all the information and set up for the best experience travel management | I decided to try the app out because I'm looking for an app that can handle travel planning and has a nice UI, which this one does. 

However I noticed while creating an account that the form fields aren't labeled correctly so you can't auto-generate a password from Keychain.This is coming from a developer so I know how easy it is to integrate those small security features in form fields. This was the first red flag. 

So I made a temporary password and I thought I'd change it afterwards to a more secure password, but there's no option to change my password in the app? I read the other reviews about the support being non-existent, along with the developer not responding to feedback in the app store reviews makes me not trust the construction of this app, or being able to get basic support if something goes wrong (keep in mind this app has paid features). I just deleted the app after deleting my account. | The interface is beautiful but the actual implementaion is terrible. Tried several times to add an event and itinerary and it never showed up. I might have even duplicated the subscription in trying to fix the issue. My reccomendation is to go with TripIt. Not as pretty but it works. | Pro user here for a few years now. I absolutely love the planning aspect but the number of unresolved bugs is incredibly frustrating. Support is nonexistent, you won’t get an answer for weeks. There are issues with timezones, findings things, flight schedules, sync and many others. Each update breaks something. I am really unhappy at this point and will not renew our subscription next year. | A really solid travel organization app. All the nice features you want. If you travel it’s easily worth the subscription price. | I love this app and use it constantly. It has been a game changer for me. Very much appreciate the regular improvements. | I would have probably signed up for the paid service and enjoyed the app. However, I found a charge on my card via my apple account before ever using the app. Canceled subscription. | I have used this app twice this year - a two week trip to Spain, and a five week road trip of the east coast of the united states.  In both cases, I found myself a slave to the app. The cost of setting up parts of a trip, in terms of effort, was much greater than the benefit I got from it. I put this app in a drawer and only pulled it out occasionally. I am happy to let this infernal subscription expire until I MAYBE want to use it again in two years.

I like the app, kinda. It looked good at first. It is good at organizing itineraries, as long as those itinerary are AirBnB and organized tours and have a rigid order that will NEVER change. Other parts of my travel plan, like mapping, seem forced and clunky. I had to find ways to do these outside this app.

After a while I started treating this app as a wallet that held a collection of ideas. Adding and removing things from the itinerary took WAY too much effort. Items simply didn't like to move.

I guess I am not their target market. It is too much of a marginal benefit for me keep paying for. It would be worth a fixed charge with paid upgrades, but this is in no way such a life-changing app that I want to keep paying and paying for it. A folder with a collection of links and copies of my reservations works just as well.

Subscription cancelled. | It does not sync with phone and laptop and my phone is missing trips that i put on my laptop!
PLEASE FIX BECAUSE I LOVE THIS APP IF IT WOULD SIMPLY JUST DO THAT | I've been looking for something like Tripsy for a long time.  the closest thing has been tripit but Tripsy seems setup to add the functionality to be the travel suite everyone will use.  It does a pretty good job parsing emails but my AirBB reserveration didnt work. There doesnt seem to be an option for it monitor emails automatically.   It would be nice to be able to drag items from one day/time to another.   The search functionality for new evetns works well.   I love the map feature.  The whole app is worth it for this feature.    Support has been super responsive.  I'm looking forward to growing with them.  Finally theyre doing what no one else could. | I only see, weekly, monthly and yearly as option but not lifetime | Such a great app - but I wish it had 2 small things:

1. The ability to hide flight paths on the map view. I dont want the map to always default to a zoomed out view that doesn’t show many much relevant detail of the stuff I have planned in my actual destination 

2. The ability to add a location to the itinerary on a certain day, without having to assign it a specific time. I.e. “I want to go here on the second day of my trip, but I don’t care specifically when”

title: Trip Scout - My Travel Planner
description:
The New York Times, USA Today, and Travel & Leisure have said Tripscout is THE essential app for the modern traveler. 


Discover a destination like a local insider and plan the perfect trip with your personalized, always up-to-date travel guide - and it’s 100% FREE! 
 
See why the world’s top travelers plan their trips with Tripscout:

1. THE BEST TRAVEL ARTICLES & VIDEOS ARE HANDPICKED FOR YOU:
Discover the best articles and videos from top publishers and local influencers for YOUR trip so you can stop filtering through irrelevant recommendations, sponsored ads, and out of date guidebook content.

2. TURN INSPIRATION TO ACTION WITH TRAVEL PRO EFFICIENCY:
Every restaurant, cafe, shop, or site featured in the content is mapped to our 100M+ points of interest so you can efficiently save anything you discover with one tap, compare photos and local tips from recent travelers, and easily stitch together a full, personalized itinerary and map on your phone.

3. A PERSONALIZED EXPERIENCE THAT PUTS YOU FIRST:
The best travel content is not one-size-fit all and we personalize all content based on your actual trip dates, budget, interests, and travel companions to make sure you’re always in-the-know on the experiences you care about.

4. TRAVEL GUIDE & MAPS WORK COMPLETELY OFFLINE
Travel stress-free by downloading your entire travel guide and map offline so you don’t have to worry about using data when traveling overseas or cruising at 50,000 feet in airplane mode.

Hundreds of travel bloggers and publications have featured Tripscout as the essential resource for the modern traveler and have given our apps some very high endorsements, such as:

-- “Basically the best thing ever for travelers.” - Conde Nast Traveler
-- “Helps travelers explore the local side of the city” - USA Today
-- “Perfect for the curious traveler” - American Airlines
-- “Makes travel easier, but just as exciting.” - Forbes 
-- "Finally, a travel app that’s purposefully, blissfully simple” - Travel+Leisure

Keep exploring and stay curious! 

P.S. You can review our terms of use and privacy policy together at: https://tripscout.co/privacypolicy/
releaseNotes: Stability and performance improvements.
reviews:
It took my dates, but nothing would populate when searching for “hotel”, “bar”, or anything else.  I even typed “store” into the search bar, but it just said “no results”.  Went with another app called TripIt.  Much better. | This app seems abandoned. Last update was a year ago. Most contents in the app just wouldn’t load. Nearly unusable. | Planning a trip to the Ark Encounter in Williamstown Ky and the Creation Museum in Petersburg Ky.  Neither available. 

So not very helpful for us trying to plan a vacation. Will try again someday. | I used this app in Paris, great. However, when I tried to use it in Portland ME, I could not find Portland Head Light, one of the oldest lighthouses in America, commissioned in 1791 by George Washington. There is no way to add manually. We can only add what’s already there. Need to update please. | Very short overview.   Limited content. | If you’re into 70%+ of their posts being TikTok videos that they share, along with nondescript titles or descriptions, cool I guess. But that’s literally all it is, along with the thumbnails/ previews all being broken. 
Trash. | It won’t let me change “searching in xx” if I try to switch the card pulls up from bottom of screen then immediately goes back down. Unable to swap and use a big portion of the app’s functionality. | It has a really nice interface, easy information at a glance! It’s really helpful and I can see myself using it in the future. It doesn’t have Istanbul, which is my upcoming trip, though. Would be nice! Thanks, lots of potential! | It seemed easy at first. I want to have hotels, museums and restaurants in my itinerary. The app couldn’t locate one restaurant. Also, I set up an itinerary and the app lost all the information so I would have to start over. | Like the idea. Unfortunately it is Very buggy. I can’t search what I want. And the design is not very intuitive | Don’t bother, this app is designed to serve ads and collect personal info in exchange for doing basic google searches. | Great idea and app, has great potential if the searches were more up to date | Literally just an app for bookmarking travel spots.  Obvious features that would make it far more useful such as notes, personal ratings, and being able to jointly share itineraries are missing. | I cannot recommend this app. The last update wiped my itinerary! Now I’m hoping support fixes it before I need to rebuild it all. 

I feel dumb for not taking screenshots of each day. But I liked the flexibility of changing my plans in here. | No se cómo manejar bien el app, para mi falta información de su manejo. | This app has no original content.   It just refers you to other articles and links filled with advertisements.   Stick with apple guides if you’re looking for crisp, well curated guides | Nothing original about this and they post terrible content all on Instagram. They just use other people’s work! | This app has a lot of good content, but the amount of notifications this app spams you with is absolutely insane. I heard a lot of good things about this app, so I just downloaded it the other day and I’ve been immediately bombarded with 30+ notifications per day. I just looked to see if there was a way to personalize what kind/how many notifications you get and there doesn’t appear to be any options for it. It’s either you get spammed with notifications all day, or you don’t get any at all. Or you just deselect a bunch of things that you’re interested in, but that totally defeats the purpose of the app. I don’t think I’ve ever left a negative review on here before, but I expected much better from such a highly regarded app. | best travel Apps EVER!!! | I couldn’t find anything, and it was much easier to just google locations. The app was much too complicated for my liking. | All this App does is refer you to TicToc or Instagram which I have no interest in adding to my phone. Very little original content. | Almost no useful info for places | Gracias | Kind of pointless. Miss Google Trips. | Too many error messages. Can’t even make a profile to start. App is updated. Just a lousy app | we can for our next one in Fall? | I love love love this app. I even use it when not traveling just to daydream and plan for the future. Love it! | Love it. Best place to get travel inspiration ideas. | Easy to use for travel plans and has lots of good information! | The perfect pocket guidebook for all of my travel needs! Helps feed my wanderlust, plan my upcoming trips and guides me while I’m in my destinations traveling! The content seems to be endless and always updating with the most recent things I should know about where I’m going! ♥️♥️♥️ | Planning a trip to Iceland and it was so helpful.  All the great places to stay and so informative to plan just about everything.    Such a genius idea creating this app.     Thanks Trip Scout | Very helpful | Literally opened the app to use it for the first time and nearly panicked thinking I got my own dates wrong. Calendar isn’t synced, sept is really October’s calendar for example. Event locations not updated to show new location addresses… not really impressed. 

I’ll stick with my old school way of planning. | These are tons of experienced travelers. They don’t take you to the top rated five star restaurant everyone is talking about... they take you to the hole in the wall, home cooked meal that seats a total of 7 people. And the meal is better than you’ve ever tasted. I have used this app from Cairo to Croatia to Iceland and it has saved me so much time on trying to find the interesting, desolate places! | Although Covid has put a damper on our travel this past year, we are ready to get back on the horse and continue seeing the wonders of the world.  We used TripScout exclusively to plan our last trip to Europe and it made our planning and executing seamless and informative.  Their network of travel experts, and travelers input makes it an extremely useful tool both for the novice traveler and nomads like my wife and I….on the road again yada,yada,yada | Amazing app. Need an android version for my friends. | I love how tailored everything on Trip Scout is for my travel plans! I have all the best recommendations and tips for a great vacation right in this app! | By far the most diverse yet organized platform out there for anyone planning to travel, or who travels frequently!! A must have app! | Love this app. Easy to use. Great for trip planning and inspiration. | Huge fan of this app and loving the upgrades!  I recommend this app to all of my traveler friends - backpackers, luxury vacation, solo travelers, family travel, etc - because it is so easy to navigate and sort through based on your own specific travel profile and what fits you as you plan your trip.  When I’m not able to get away, I love reading articles on TripScout’s app and dreaming about future travel! | Incredibly easy to use and packed full of worthy trip planning information. Tripscout offers multiple perspectives on travel and helps plan my dining, lodging and short term excursions given the content is so up to date. It’s also an enjoyable escape where I can take a few minutes and feel inspired about my next trip. | It’s amazing so helpful and perfect ♥️♥️♥️♥️♥️ | Absolutely love using this app. Travel is much easier and far more interesting when using Tripscout to plan and execute trips. As added bonuses the Tripscout Instagram account has incredible photos and the new Facebook group is really helpful when considering travel | [Updated to reflect app updates] I’ve been using TripScout now since the early years, and I can’t be happier. The updates are amazing, the new design is sleek and beautiful, and it makes me want to get back out there, whenever that will be possible 🤞🏻🤞🏻

Can’t wait to see where things go! | The best travel app. | Best Travel app. Fun and easy to use and full of information needed for planning much needed trip. | The agenda and sites are great, especially for Nola | Still exploring the app, so far I have found good articles on what to do and with each place it explains the story behind it which I think it’s awesome | Super easy to find activities, place them on a map and then see them. | Even now that we can’t travel still useful for planning future trips 💓

title: Viator: Tours & Attractions
description:
Welcome to Viator, the leading marketplace for travel experiences. With over 300,000 tours, activities, and attractions—from simple excursions to extreme adventures (and all the niche, interesting stuff in between)—we empower you to make memories all around the world. 

Thanks to industry-leading flexibility and last-minute availability, it's never too late to make any day extraordinary. And with our mobile app putting world-class travel experiences in the palm of your hand, your dream trip is just a few taps away. Whether you need inspiration for things to do on your trip or want to access your tickets on the go, the app has you covered. Here’s how: 

Book and manage your trip on the go:
• Browse our amazing selection of tours and activities before and during your trip
• Easily access tickets offline
• Modify, edit, or cancel your bookings from wherever you are
• Get same-day notifications about your activity with directions to your departure and pickup points
• Free cancellation up to 24 hours in advance

Easy trip planning:
• Read millions of reviews from Tripadvisor and our Viator travel communities
• Contact tour guides directly for easy communication
• Create wishlists of all tours and activities you want to book

Flexible payment options:
• Reserve now and pay later
• Pay in installments with Klarna
• Book with Credit Card, PayPal, or Apple Pay

Exclusive app-only promos:
• Take advantage of in-app messaging offering the latest promos and special offers 

Viator Rewards
With Viator Rewards, you’ll earn rewards on every eligible purchase.  The best part? You can use them to save actual money on future bookings. Do more with Viator. Earn. Redeem. Repeat. Simple as that. 

No matter what type of traveler you are, Viator will help you make memories that will last a lifetime.

But don’t just take it from us. Here’s what our travel community says about the Viator app:

“So easy and efficient. Even ol’ guys like me can easily maneuver using the Viator app! Awesome!”

“Great app. Easy to navigate, lots of options, and great info.”

Rated 4.3/5 on Trustpilot with over 57,000 verified reviews.

P.S. Having technical issues with the app? Please email mobileappsupport@viator.com

Join the Viator App Feedback Team
Share your thoughts about the Viator App to make it better for our travel community.
https://www.userinterviews.com/opt-in/bTQXz4p6A6krCkVi475HFRm7
releaseNotes: We've squashed bugs (yuck) and made performance improvements (whoosh) for an overall better Viator app (yay!).
reviews:
I’ve traveled and toured with Viator all over the world and always love what I do! | I'm pretty confident the high rating for this appis not for the app itself bit for the experiences people are having. Those experiences are provided by independent organizations and people and not by Viator.

The app itself is very poorly designed. I wanted to search for tapas tours in Barcelona. If you just enter Barcelona you get 1000s of events, 99% of which are not tapas. You can filter by type of event but it wasn't all that helpful.

So, you try searching for "Barcelona tapas" directy. This gives you a list of one line each results. You click on and then want to check another result. So you click back but this takes you all the way to the top of the app, not back to the search results. So you click search again and now you have to manually enter "Barcelona tapas" again because the search history only shows the one result you picked, not the search terms you entered? Now you have to try to remember where you left off. Why don't the search results look exactly like the city results???

Other issues include that nothing is copyable. Needed to copy the address. not copyable. Description had urls in it of sites and apps related to the event. They are neither clickable nor copyable so you have to manually memorize them and type them into the browser or app being referenced.

It feels like the problem is the company had fooled itself by the high ratings. Those ratings are not for Viator itself though | We’re seniors and this is our first and most likely our last visit to DC. The convenience of reviewing, selecting and booking tours with Viator is so stress free! | Thank you,
 love being a repeat customer, I feel like you take care of me personally . | I was lucky enough to have a private tour with the very lovely and informative Roy. I enjoyed hearing all about the history of the temples, the mountains and his life here in Cambodia. Highly recommend Roy! | I’m deleting the app as Viator sells me tickets for tomorrow despite my filter for today.  Then, the are worthless in getting you a refund.  

I’ve spent thousands with this app but they put all of the work on their customers while they just step back and count the money.  Zero customer service.
  
Be careful to triple check that date before you purchase. | Even though the code was good through in of month it would not give me the 10 % on the new download app | I love using the Viator app. It’s easy to navigate, has great photos, and quick access to honest reviews. Thank you for making travel even more fun! | After chatting with a rep ,
Imputing my info and cc number numerous times,
I was told to try a different cc. That produced the same result. Then it was suggested I wait 72 hours and try again. As far as holding the time of the tour we selected , they could not guarantee it. In spite of all that I tried one last time , and was successful. 
I hope it’s smooth sailing from now on! | I installed this app two days ago and I am about to delete it. Tried searching for bioluminescent kayak tours near Orlando knowing there are some out near Melbourne and it gives me results way out in Puerto Rico and Costa Rica. When I change the search term to “bioluminescent Kayak tours near me“ I got zero results. | We just returned home for a two week trip in central America. We use Hector as a day car tour guide  when we visited San Salvador city

 he was prompt, and on time, picked us up at the hotel, clean vehicle was very passionate about the city and sharing all his inside knowledge as a local that actually lives on site, can’t say enough good things about Hector and his service 

The only downside it goes through violator and a third-party, which kind of garbles the communication on the front end, but we were able to crack the code and get the vouchers and everything sorted out the day of the actual tour | What a great site! I travel all around the world and this is so simple and organized!  The “booking.com” for activities!! | Thank you 🐴🤍♠️ | I recently booked the Albir, Altea, Benidorm & Calpe: Guadalest & Algar Excursion through Viator, and I must say, it was a huge letdown. The troubles started with the lack of accurate information provided by Viator regarding the meet-up point. Despite my efforts to clarify the meet-up location by calling, emailing, and texting a day before the tour, I received no response whatsoever.

On the day of the tour, the meet-up point had apparently been removed without any notice. Not even the digital ticket contained updated information. This lack of communication and support from Viator left me stranded and frustrated.

To exacerbate matters, when attempting to contact the tour company, they rudely informed me that it wasn't business hours, despite it being the day of the tour. When they finally did answer, they were unhelpful and dismissive, insisting that the information was in an email. However, I had proof through emails that the information they claimed to have sent was not provided.

Overall, this experience has left me deeply dissatisfied. Both Viator and the tour company displayed a lack of responsibility and poor customer service, making for a thoroughly disappointing and frustrating experience. | I love booking excursions with Viator. App is easy to navigate through and I find some great excursion in all places I have been to within and outside the United States. We used Viator for New Orleans, New York, Alaska ,  Puerto Rico, Costa Rica, Dubai, Cartagena Columbia, Nashville and have never been disappointed! | I tried to contact customer support and our tour guide for 1.5 hours. The tour guide never showed and we received no information from customer support on the app or via email. | When I am promoted to login, viator does not return to the item I was in the middle of booking. | We loved the tours in Mexico City, but the app wasn’t as great. It pushed us to email and web browsers for tickets. | Booked tickets to Catacombs in Paris and Absolutely ridiculous how many hoops I had to jump through on this site that made me download app to prompt me get my tickets- then as soon as I downloaded, logged in with at least 2 email confirmations & a puzzle to solve, my tickets was a voucher to present at the site. Waste of 20 min of my time and highly annoying you have to do anything now days with an app. I’m using this once & deleting it. | Planning our excursions while in Greece was very easy and the customer service was amazing. | The app no longer takes passwords, requires email link which doesn’t work. Works fine in safari but forget using the app if you need to login. | Signed up for a number of experiences using the Viator website. So far so good. But when going to retrieve the tickets got caught in a maddening do-loop of “you must open the app to retrieve your tickets “ but app refuses to log me in once the emailed confirmation is complete. Finally found a way to download a pdf to myself after about an hour of frustration | Booked an overnight transfer from our hotel to the airport for a 7am flight. This was done the day before.
We didn’t have the option to select the pickup time which was worrying, and didn’t get a confirmation or anything. We realized that we needed to add a third person to our reservation so we called the transportation company(since viator doesn’t let you update anything)… and they tried to fix it. While on the phone, I asked them what the pickup time was since I still didn’t have an email and they said they would let me know within 30 minutes, since they hadn’t found a driver yet. The flight was 10 hours out, at this point…

An hour later, I got an email saying that the transport company was canceling the order because they couldn’t pick us up at 4am, and that we needed to book with “overnight transfer”, which was what we had selected to begin with. I believe that if we hadn’t called to add a person, we wouldn’t have heard anything until after the flight.

Viator now says they can’t refund our order because the time already passed. | The app is convenient but you’ll pay a 200% markup or more for tickets! | Fast and accurate. | Jalisa was our knowledgeable private tour guide at the Museums of American History and Natural History Museum.  She helped us enjoy and get up close to many interesting exhibits and brought them to life for us with her stories. We highly recommend this tour. | The authentication process is a loop of an email link to opening the app with tells you to log in which sends you an email which opens the app that tells you to log in. Over and over. | Easy to navigate. But should have deal button to browse quickly and add coupons for customers. | I rarely review apps but not sure how this one is at 5 stars. You can’t see vouchers in their app, there are tours where they won’t tell you the pick up point and sometimes for refunds they will ask you to talk to the tour operator.

Unreal. Better apps out there. Avoid. | I have booked several tours with this organization, and the tours are always great. In addition to great tours, their customer service and responsiveness is amazing. I will always use them. | I have used ViaTour in several different countries, including Australia/NZ, Europe and Asia, and have never been disappointed. On the few occasions I had had to cancel, the process was easy and full refund was received within two days. | Looks like it has some great activities but you can’t sign up as a single person, 2 is the lowest number of people in any of the tours I looked at. | My ticket ended being scheduled for a week after my planned one, not only the operator noticed when I asked for help neither they will refund you or allow you to use the $$ in a different tour. I didn’t even wanted the money but the tickets in a different day | The app itself is super handy, but it’s hobbled by its inability to add events to your calendar unless you let it have full calendar access. There is absolutely no reason this app needs to be able to READ every event on my calendar other than to collect and sell my private data. iOS allows you to set calendar permissions to “Add Events Only,” but the app won’t add events with that option selected. There’s no excuse for that. | In my opinion it is wrong for a company to block reviews they don't like under the excuse of "community standards."
I'm not alone. Read the most recent reviews. Lots of 1 stars. | Poor | Haven't gone wrong yet.  Great guides and always fun.  Have made new friends. | Book through any other travel site, and you will find a better price. Just test it for yourself and see that [Viator] has a huge markup. Further, when you send them quotes from other sites showing the better price, [Viator] will still refuse to match the price, even though it’s in their guarantee. | Having same issues as most recent review from Geoz777. Go into the app and it sends a link to email. Email link opens in browser and the app doesn’t recognize that the link has been opened, making it impossible to actually sign into my account on the app. 

Note to developers - maybe use a 4 digit code sent to the email that can be manually entered into the app for confirmation. The link thing clearly isn’t working as intended. | Got the app. It asks for my email. Then sends a link. I click on the email and it takes me to the browser version of the site. It recognizes me as a past customer. Then there is a link to the app.  Click on that link and it asks for my email. Start all over and can’t get out of the loop. Tried help but no links to customer service. 😵‍💫 | helped me book a fun affordable excursion for my trip ! | It will not work if you try to only allow access to add to calendar. It wants full access to your calendar. This is too invasive. Tours are easy to book and manage though, other than that | If your experience goes well then the app is great. I called support for help with a booking for them only to screw it up and cause additional problems. 

I was charged a different amount then the confirmation email and spoken with multiple people to try to resolve. I have received plenty of emails asking for reviews, which I have left. 
Activity: good
Viator support experience: terrible

I even asked for someone to contact me and have not been contacted. I spoke with someone today who was able to refund the difference of the cost to the correct amount on my confirmation email. 

If your still reading my advice: avoid 3rd party apps like this and book directly from the source | I used the website and app twice in Hawaii and in DC. The recommendations and descriptions have worked out each time. Enjoyed each tour and trip without a mishap. I always recommend it since. | We have always recommended and used Viator. | If you don’t know , this island can be expensive ,  but with this app I found all the amusement i was interested in for a very low exciting price so thank you so much for being so convenient towards my fun factor and my wallet. Also I  earned some dollar rewards towards my next purchases. That’s Awesome  , I’m enjoying this app and taking full advantage for my future adventures. 👍👍👍👍👍 | I booked a hot air balloon ride in Mexico City to see the pyramids in November. The tour company called me the night before to inform me I needed to reschedule. I could not as I was on travel and I requested a refund immediately. 

They didn’t answer for about a month so I disputed the claim on my card. Viator proceeded to fight (and won) my dispute and I’m now stuck with just under $500 in charges for services I didn’t receive. I’m never using this service again. | Major Bug

Cannot sign in on app. 

Steps:
- download app
- login (enter email)
- email sent to you
- click on link
- logged into viator in browser
- w/in browser click on Get Buttons in App
- sends to App Store to download. 
- open app
- process continues in this loop

*** also the download pdf doesn’t download anything

*** trying to add a password to account freezes the browser window. | Unable to move tickets from my email into this app to save my life, have sent email links into and out of 3 different mobile browsers, only to end up back at the same “check email” screen.

Making it extremely difficult to prepare effectively for my upcoming trip | I wanted to book a tour, but they require a date of birth.  How absurd.  Why would they need that.  They lost business of that.

title: Expedia: Hotels, Flights & Car
description:
The Expedia app is an all-in-one travel companion where you can plan, book and manage your whole trip, plus earn rewards, in one place. Members instantly get discounted Member Prices on flights, hotels, cruises, car rentals, and activities. With our new rewards program, One Key™, you can earn, combine and use OneKeyCash™ rewards across Expedia, Hotels.com, and Vrbo. Dreaming of a beach vacation in Florida? Or a romantic getaway in Paris? Get more out of any trip with the Expedia app. 

One Key members save instantly:   
- Instantly save 10%* or more on over 100,000 hotels worldwide with Member Prices.   
- Price Tracking: Get notified if the price of a flight drops. 
- Price Drop Protection: Get refunded if the price of your flight drops after booking.** 
- Earn OneKeyCash in the Expedia app and get rewarded fast. 

In-trip extras as your status rises, like free room upgrades when available. 

Discover your next trip: 
- Search millions of flights, hotels, rental cars, packages, attractions, and more.  
- Add a hotel to your flight to save even more.  
- Choose from over 500,000+ hotels worldwide, including boutique and luxury hotels, airport hotels, hostels, B&Bs, vacation rentals, and resorts.  
- Read verified reviews you can trust. 
- Sort your search by price, free cancellation or no change fees, departure and arrival time, and more.  

Easy, smart trip planning: 
- Chat GPT integration: Get your travel-related questions answered with expert insight and personalized recommendations with the launch of our AI-powered trip planner. 
- Shareable Trips: Collaborate, plan and share trip information with others, all in one place.  
 
 Manage your whole trip in one app:  
- Free cancellation on most hotels.*  
- All your reservations in one place: view upcoming trip details, hotel information, and maps for directions.  
- Trip alerts: for flight delays, gate changes, hotel check-out times, and more. 
- Share itineraries with family and friends via email or text message.  
- Get inspired by our curated travel guides.  
 
Download the Expedia app now and join for free to enjoy One Key member benefits.   
 
 *Member Prices are available on select hotels to logged in members and app users. The discount will be applied to the price of selected hotels (excluding applicable taxes and other fees). Price predictions are not a guarantee. Available to One Key members on select routes.  Expedia’s usual booking Terms and Conditions apply and Reward Terms apply, see site for details. Free cancellation on most hotels. Some hotels require you to cancel at least 24-48 hours before check-in. See property pages on our app for details.   

 
** Available for a fee on select flights and free for Gold and Platinum One Key Members. Refund will be the difference if the price of your flight on Expedia drops. Terms apply. See site for details.  

 
The Expedia app uses information for analytics, personalization, and advertising. By using our app, you agree to our privacy and cookies policies.
releaseNotes: Thanks for exploring the world with Expedia as your on-the-go travel companion. This update contains bug fixes and performance improvements to make your digital experience as smooth as possible. Bon voyage, traveler!
