title: Airbnb
description:
FIND YOUR PERFECT STAY WITH AIRBNB CATEGORIES
Explore our curated collections of homes chosen for their style, location, or nearby activities. Whether you’re looking for a cozy cabin with views or apartments by the beach, Airbnb Categories helps you find places to stay that are right for your trip. 

CUSTOMIZE YOUR SEARCH WITH 100+ FILTERS
Narrow down your choices easily with filters that help you book homes that meet your needs. Search by certain amenities, like pools and fireplaces, or filter for confirmed accessibility features, like step-free bedroom access.

MANAGE ALL YOUR TRAVEL DETAILS EASILY
The Airbnb app keeps all your essential trip info in one convenient place, so you can quickly revisit or share your travel details with others. You’re also able to chat with your Host and receive up-to-the-minute booking updates, making it easier to get there, get inside, and get connected to wifi.

TRY FUN EXPERIENCES LED BY LOCALS
Airbnb Experiences are fun activities led by Hosts. They’re a great way to immerse yourself in a new place with a local expert as your guide. Browse both in-person and online options, whether you want an Experience that gets you out and about or one you can enjoy from the comfort of your couch. Book, save, or share your favorites—all with the Airbnb app.

IT’S NEVER BEEN EASIER TO AIRBNB YOUR HOME
As a new Host, Airbnb Setup matches you with an experienced Superhost in your area who’ll provide one-to-one help from your first question to your first booking—by phone, video call, or chat. You’ll also have one-tap access to Community Support agents to guide you through anything from account issues to billing support.
releaseNotes: Feel at home wherever you travel with Airbnb. We’re always working to better your experience through improvements and updates to the app.
reviews:
There are few if any protections for guests in the booking process. Hosts have the power to set ridiculous rules and choose exploitative policies that hurt guests most. Very difficult to plan group trips when hosts set arbitrary rules about visitors. Additionally, the refund/cancellation policy is nearly hidden until after you book and then you’re stuck in a bad deal. If Airbnb is supposed to be the better alternative to hotels, they need to at least put guests first. | Your support team has been little help and now me and my family don’t have a place to stay this weekend. We are doing some remodeling this weekend and will not have access to our utilities. We decided to go with Airbnb because I have a dog and not many hotels are pet friendly. They won’t let me book a place because of a “safety risk” that we might be having a party due to short notice. Why would I book last minute to book a party. I just want a place got my family while out home gets fixed. ZERO customer support, once I contacted them to try and resolve it the support lady simply read off a script that said summarizes to “to bad so sad” and “we sent it to the right team” . Might as well have AI answer their customer service | The hosting side of the app is terrible. Way too many issues. Booking as a guest is fine though never had any issues on that part | I have been a host for several years.  Generally good experience and the guests have been almost all wonderful.  However I did have one damage claim and got no cooperation or payment from AirBnB.  Very frustrating run around and very contrary to the assurances they give.  So just know you are on your own - they take the fees but do not support. | Trash app!! Don’t even let me book lol. | I love booking with Airbnb, it’s easy and has less fees than other sites! | First time using the Airbnb app.  We reserved an apartment located downtown San Antonio. Had great reviews, pictures looked good and a 4.9 on cleanliness. We arrive to our Airbnb and noticed the floor would creek pretty bad. There was dust everywhere. We found hair also in some places. The sofa was covered in stains & crumbs. There was a towel in the washer (only had a washer) the dishwasher was very dirty also the keurig, the bed sheets seem dirty too. It obviously looked like the place has not been cleaned in a while. We didn’t even stay for an hour there. I let the host know, also taking some pictures for evidence. I didn’t get every single thing because I thought the ones I did take were enough for anyone to tell this place was not cleaned. The host ends up telling it was cleaned that day and to send the pictures. He then told me I had to speak with Airbnb customer services because I asked for a refund. They end up telling me I can not get a refund because it was “minor cleanliness” and only cared if I had a picture of the towel in the washer but not the sofa that had stains all over.  I couldn’t even get a partial refund. Airbnb only cares about the host and will side with them even if they are in the wrong. THEY DELETED BAD REVIEWS ON THEIR APP. | They cared and fixed the issue that we had. | It used to be a good way to book reasonably priced accommodation these days you can book a hotel room for less😂 | Airbnb let Stuart Morley steal $2500 from my 80 year old crippled mom. Don't use this app they're thieves! | The problem with AirBnb can be summed up by saying it could potentially ruin a vacation or save a vacation with many factor built in between. Firstly it’s layered as to who to blame.  First there are AirBnb policies and then there are hosts.  A hotel for example may clearly state the rules and allow rearranging travel because they have many rooms available.  Airbnb just has the one place you booked with a host who has options to rearrange, change, or refund.  Also those hosts aren’t necessarily great when it comes to customer service.  For example if you get sick and need to move a reservation around hotels and airlines are understanding.  Airbnb host might just take your money and run with no recourse other than a bad review.  Which AirBnb favors the host because you cannot sort by good or bad reviews.  It gives the average rating and then you have to sort through to find the bad reviews.  While I have experiences reasonable host who are accommodating.  I have also experienced a host who just took my money for no services rendered. This is the reason why I cease to use AirBnb ever again. | Love this app. If anything happens they take care of you! | This app is amazing I love looking at houses hotels and it is so relaxing to look at  when you are bored | Some of these hosts have the most insane cancellation policies found nowhere on earth - 50% refund if cancelled at any point in time, 100% upfront. Not only that, but you can’t even review the host after interacting with them. I will never use Airbnb again - see ya | Airbnb is the worst they will lock your account for no reason and the customer service doesn’t do anything to help time for them to revamp their company | Watched all the homeowners in my town use this to make more money by letting people stay in homes while the locals moved into hotels and cars. Kinda messed up and total waste of resources. God help us. | Hidden fees not shown until checkout. Other companies like booking.com and vrbo show the actual “price total” upfront on the map view. After cleaning fees, airbnb fees, and taxes, some listing totals double in price (which is insane anyways), so that should all be more visible when viewing map view. | The blocked me from booking at all because a comment I said celebrating me in my spouse alone for peace for his birthday they said it could lead to party’s so I’m not allowed to book any houses so I most definitely deleted this account you guys makes us leave comments then take the account away from your ai that can’t read correctly | Love the interface design. The best design in the industry. Just waiting for them to verify listing to weed out fake listings. It’s not that hard. They have the technology for it. I just don’t know why they don’t do it.

I also don’t like the fact that I cannot see what I made last year. 

I would like for them to show me what dates people like to view the most on my calendar. | This app is a mess. Try to search for a location then click on one…. Who knows where you end up. Date selection is a disaster. Even if you want a destination it always defaults back to “map view”. | Party house . I don’t know who’s renting this out to kids? Over 100
Kids at party in a family neighborhood. Cops
Called,Guns found. 100 kids running from cops at 1:30-2:00 Am .
Helicopter overhead .This in not acceptable in a family neighborhood. This needs to STOP! Please close this bnb | Trust me | You pay with real money, but when you cancel, they give you credits that you can’t even withdraw. It’s really disappointing how the costumer service can’t even solve an issue with the host. | After getting scammed by a host, airbnb sided with the scammer, threatened to cancel  account, and kept my money which is basically stealing. I spent an entire year complaining ti customer service, and they kept promising to fix the problem only to ghost me over and over again. | The app is over 200 MB | Todos los lugares que voy la uso | Price filter in app is nonfunctional. Ridiculous bug for an app like this. | We had one of the worst experiences using AirBnB with an absolutely terrible host and AirBnB was a joke to work with. They do not protect their customers over the hosts which allows the hosts to get away with dirty properties, false listings, etc. and there is nothing you can do about it. We won’t be booking with them again. | I am a superhost of a monthly rental. Unless someone selects monthly rental my house doesn’t pop up at all. There’s a yearly event near my house that lasts 3 weeks. Housing was low and going for very high rates, but unfortunately for me my house is sitting empty because Airbnb won’t show my house unless somebody specifically request a monthly rental or input dates that exceed a month why not homes that are available in the area that are not meeting the criteria so that someone can still click on your house and see why they don’t meet the criteria whether it’s unavailable dates or maybe they would change and add an additional weekend so that they can get housing in an area where housing is extremely limited now there are a bunch of people that need housing that never found my listing and I know I’m not the only one because I’m in real estate and I’ve had people calling me in the area that are having the same problem with Airbnb not showing their listing unless it’s over a monthly rental. Because of this, I’ve listed the house on the local MLS because now it’s sitting empty. Lost revenue for hosts, Airbnb, and also people that need housing won’t find it because it doesn’t show up. | I had a burglary in Walnut, CA while staying with Airbnb. The evidence and police report proved it’s previous tenant broke in with passcode (the Airbnb host never changes password). We have lost our bags and even a car. Although car has been recovered, it has a stolen record on carfax. Airbnb and host started ghosting us since then. Disgusting they couldn’t do anything and let users bear all the losses. | I have been a user of the platform for years. Never encountered a problem (probably my own good luck).  When an issue finally arose, I was met with silence, and then what I can only describe as an automated, generic massage from what seems like a robot. Shame on you the company for allowing customer service to get this way.  Taking my business elsewhere.. | Title: Great Concept, Disappointing Execution

I genuinely love the concept of Airbnb and the unique travel experiences it aims to offer. It's a fantastic idea that has the potential to transform how we experience new places. However, I am deeply disappointed with how the platform operates, particularly when it comes to customer service and its arbitrary process for handling disputes and bans.

During my last experience, I encountered serious issues that highlight these flaws. The customer service for guests was not only abysmal but also completely opaque, leaving me frustrated and without clear answers or support. Even more distressing was the arbitrary nature of how bans are issued. I had an ex who misused the platform to stalk me by pretending to be a neighbor and even escalated to calling the police on me, leading to my undeserved ban from the platform. This situation was handled poorly, with little to no investigation or consideration of context, which was incredibly disheartening.

Adding to the disappointment is Airbnb's lack of a loyalty program, which feels like a missed opportunity to reward frequent travelers. When faced with the choice between an often too-early 10 or 11 AM checkout at an Airbnb and the flexible 4 PM checkout that Marriott offers for Titanium members, the choice becomes increasingly clear. The lack of such benefits, which are standard among hotel loyalty programs, makes Airbnb less attractive in comparison.

While I remain a fan of what Airbnb aspires to be, these significant shortcomings make it difficult to trust and rely on their service. It’s regrettable because I truly appreciate the innovative approach to travel Airbnb promotes, but without improvements in transparency, fairness, and guest benefits, it’s hard to see myself using this service in the future. | I love Airbnb as a traveler and as a super host! The honest reviews and photos assure me especially when I travel alone that I know what to expect. Especially when it comes to other super host properties and the host themselves I know I’m getting the inside of local eats and things to do! | I’ve always used AIRBNB when I travel until recently. I stayed at an Airbnb in downtown LA during a trip. Knowing it was going to be shady finding parking plus the fact that I had rented a Porsche and wanted it garage, I immediately checked the “has parking” option as that was the most important thing to me. 

3 hours before I checked in, the “host” told me that I no longer had parking (I could no longer cancel at this point) he told me I would need to park a block away in an unsupervised lot and pay extra. He told me. Obviously this wasn’t okay, but I tend to let things go with the flow instead of cause a problem so I gave it a chance. Downtown LA is so unsafe and not only did this host lie to me and say it was in West Hollywood, it was a few blocks from skid row full of homeless people. The next day I found that someone had scratched my rented Porsche and was charged for the damage. After taking to I kid you not 10 different employees each asking me to explain my situation when they could have easily keep past conversations in file was sloppy. I spent a lot of money with Airbnb and all of it was a lie. I have no doubt the actual renter of the condo stored his own car in the spot he advertises for and hours before someone checks in, he cancels your spot.
I felt very unsafe walking a block to my Airbnb alone at 1am after meeting with friends when I expected to have a safe garage space. 

AIRBNB sided with their renter and I will never rent you airbnb again. Honestly hotels are now… better at least I know what I’m getting, VRBO is great as well. | This app is incredible but I am no longer getting notifications since the last few updates- which impacts me as a host! I have tried to fix it from the app, from my iPhone setting, uninstall, reinstall- nothing is working. It’s a huge flaw that impacts my experience! | One of my favorite apps ever. I appreciate how many features the host experience has yet still feels lightweight and straightforward. | This app is great if everything goes as planned. But if your place is dirty, with trash in the pool. You only get one day of pool heating even tho you paid for two. They don't help with anything. Our power even went out for an entire day with no explanation. Airbnb have no help. Told me to request my own money back from the host? That's just weird? They also just ended the conversation when I asked to talk to someone higher up and just kept telling me to figure it out on my own. | DO NOT book with Airbnb. If you are trying to save money by staying at an Airbnb instead of a hotel, STAY AT A HOTEL!! It is reliable, safe, and filled with real customer service people.

I have had plenty of good experiences with the platform until recently. After having to leave a booking due to unsafe property conditions, Airbnb did not provide a refund from the host. 

We requested reimbursement for our alternative housing and communicated with Airbnb customer service for 3 weeks straight. We sent them video and photo evidence via email multiple times and they continued to deny that they recieved anything. Every time we sent a message there was a different representative and it was entirely written by AI, with grammatical issues and repeated phrases expressing how "sorry" they were in many different ways. They would also call me at odd hours of the day/night. Lastly, they denied that we reported the concern in time and kept on requesting information that we had already provided. | Airbnb isn’t even worth using anymore due to the insane hidden fees. The cleaning fee basically doubles the price of the stay and there’s no way to see it while searching. | airbnb should understand that their platform became successful because host were using their platform. Travelers would go with the cheapest and most convenience place listed my property on Airbnb after one month customer service is horrible. They’re not trained and all they care about is closing the ticket. | Well, I have been with Airbnb for almost 10 years. But last year I stayed with a woman in Norway who was racist and nasty to my friends and I. She left me a ridiculous review and I tried to explain to Airbnb that I had 24 amazing reviews. And on February 5th, they deleted her comment finally. When I logged onto my account months later, I realized that the comment was miraculously back. I called and asked to speak to a supervisor, I was told no. And even though I asked over and over again why the comment was put back, they just said nothing. So I am done. I have heard from friends about Airbnb leaving them in unsafe circumstances and I should have quit at that point. This is just scary to me and Airbnb needs to change their way of doing business. But someone will need them and that will continue. | I had to cancel a reservation because there’s no elevator and it wasn’t specified on the listing. Airbnb refuses to give me my money back. Blatant violation of the American Disability Act. Nobody cares at customer support. Filing a dispute with my credit card company | Annoying and don’t upgrade. Garbage map loading and if it ever loads. | Booked an AirBnB today and it said reserved, 3 minutes later it said my booking was cancelled and that I have to wait 5-7 days for my refund. Stole my money and now I am unable to pay for a place to stay until I get my refund. | I had a host harass and constantly contact me about nonsense and Airbnb didn’t do anything to help or assist me, insisting I just leave the Airbnb and pay for my own accommodation elsewhere. Not enough checks and balances there | Just google “can’t trust Airbnb reviews” and you’ll see what I mean.

My one and only bad review on this app over years of using it was removed. I had a horrible host and I left a polite but bad review but it was taken down within hours. Once I googled what was going in, it seems like there’s way too many having the same issue. Reviews for locations within the Airbnb app are taylored to help the host. One cannot post a bad review which is why you almost never see negative reviews if any. Do not trust this app, just go get yourself a hotel and save yourself the headache and the host ruining your vacation. Not all host are bad but because of how AirBnb handles reviews, it’s impossible to know if the one you’re getting is a good or bad host. | They charged me for two separate stays at the same exact time and said that they were “accepted” reservations though I never booked either myself. What made the situation weirder was that they were in the same complex for the same exact dates making it look like it was a scheme. I have been trying to get a refund for TWO months to no avail. They have terrible customer service and terrible policies that do not help the consumer. I will never be using this app again and can’t wait until something better comes along. | Imagine if hotel wouldn’t let you rent because you was arrested on the past for non violent crimes. Well Airbnb is now doing that. I get protecting people but they took this too far with me and are gonna lose a lot of business!! I feel like they are discriminating against me because I’ve rented from here and all of a sudden they shut my account down due to non violent crimes when I was younger. I’m 50 years old now and married and can’t rent no longer using this foolish app. | The App is user friendly except I feel there is so much information that at times I do t recall where certain information is stored … such as if you want to Edit cost per night… it’s not easy to find. Other than than that quirk, it so easy. Especially the pay-outs and tax time information. | Airbnb always comes out on the side of their hosts, the people from him they make the most money, against those who are renters. They have kept thousands of dollars of my money for their illegitimate and corrupt “policies.”. Do yourself a favor.go with their competitors.

title: KAYAK: Flights, Hotels & Cars
description:
KAYAK searches hundreds of travel sites at once to find exactly what you need for your trip, from cheap flights to great hotel deals and car rentals. Nonstop flight leaving at 9am? Sure. Pet-friendly vacation rental near the slopes? Yup. SUV rental for under $50/day? We're on it. Because we're travelers too and know that every trip is worth planning.

BOOK FLEXIBLY
Easily search, filter and sort your options to find the right travel offers for you - whether it's flights you can change with no fees, hotels, vacation rentals and car rentals with free cancellation, the cheapest deal, or the most comfortable seat.

SAVE MONEY
Get mobile-only rates and Private Deals on the app. Set Price Alerts to find out when prices drop, and use Explore to discover new destinations within your budget.

EVERYTHING IN ONE PLACE
This is more than just a travel app. Our Trips tool keeps your plans in order. Get alerts for flight and gate changes, access boarding pass on and offline and plan out and share your itinerary, all from one place. Use Guides to create, collect and share daily itineraries, tips and impressions along the way.

COMPARE FLIGHT DEALS FROM 900+ SITES
• Take the stress out of trip planning. Find flexible flight offers with no change fees.
• Search with flexible dates up to +/- 3 days to see when's the best time to fly.
• Filter options based on stops, airlines, departure times, cancellation policies, amenities & more.
• Save your preferences to see your favorite airlines and hotels first (and skip ones you don't like).
• Book at the right time. Price Forecast lets you know whether you should wait or book now.
• We'll even show you Hacker Fares which pair together two one-way tickets for a round-trip flight (and save you $$).

FIND A RENTAL CAR THAT FITS YOUR TRIP
• Search from over 70,000 locations to find the perfect car rental for your trip.
• Filter your rental car search by vehicle type including hybrids and electric vehicles, offers with unlimited mileage, enhanced cleaning and much more.
• Risk-free booking: Find car rentals with a free cancellation policy so if plans change, you can easily rebook.

HOTELS, VACATION RENTALS AND UNIQUE STAYS FROM THOUSANDS OF SITES
• Compare all sorts of accommodation, from five-star resorts to holiday homes and boutique hotels.
• Looking for a staycation? Uncover deals on amazing places to visit right here in the USA.
• Stay flexible by easily filtering for hotel deals and vacation rentals with free cancellation.
• Unlock Private Deals and exclusive mobile-only rates for even more savings.

EXPLORE: Discover new destinations on your budget
• Whether you have $300 or $3,000 to spend, Explore lets you set a budget and shows you where in the world you can go.

TRIPS: All your travel plans in one place.
• Keep all your plans organized in one travel app, regardless of where you booked.
• Forward your booking confirmation emails to trips@kayak.com or sync your Gmail or Outlook account.
• Use our Flight Tracker to stay up-to-date on any flight's progress, with real-time status updates, gate change & baggage claim notifications.
• Check your Trip Stats to see how far you traveled, your top cities, and how many times you've been around the world.
• Your traveler data is safe and secure - meaning you never have to re-enter your booking and credit card info.
• Share your vacation plans with family & friends.
• No signal, no problem. View your itinerary and notes with no internet connection.

MEASURE YOUR BAG
• AR measuring tool lets you know if your carry-on bag complies with the policy of the airline you're flying with.

PRICE ALERTS: Never miss a deal
• Let us do the searching for you. Create a Price Alert and we’ll notify you when the price drops.

Download the KAYAK travel app now and get ready for your next travel adventure!
releaseNotes: We fixed some bugs here and there to make our app even better.

title: TripHugger - Travel Planner
description:
TripHugger provides the best travel planning and coordinating experience. TripHugger is also good for collecting travel ideas, connecting with travel lovers and staying in the know.

TripHugger is the best free app for travel planning with friends and families to
-  Explore the world with latest Google Maps place information
-  Easy to plan with collaborative itinerary editor and map view in 1 screen and a chatroom per plan for discussion
-  Offline itinerary views and management frees you from unstable and disconnected network



KEY FEATURES:

Easy travel planning
• Search the latest place information from Google Maps and add to the itinerary. 
• Adjust the itinerary with the route shown on the map in the same screen.
• Write freely in the note column. Utilize supplemented resources and information tailored to your itinerary.

Invite and plan together
• Open your trip for sign-up or send invitations to others
• Exchange ideas in private chatroom and the itinerary candidate list
• Edit different places and adjust routes simultaneously by multiple people makes planning fun and efficient

Unstable network connection on-road is not a problem
• View your loaded itineraries while offline
• Can create and modify travel plans while offline but cannot search a place. All changes will be automatically shared with others once your TripHugger app is back online.

Social travel platform
• Know where your friends are planning to visit and even request to join their trips.
• Share your wonderful trip with other friends via Facebook, Line or email.
• Get connected with other travelers with similar tastes.

Collection of travel information
• Collect useful trip plans, place information and web pages for future trip planning


GET IN TOUCH WITH US

Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/triphugger/
Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/triphugger
Contact our support team at support@triphugger.com or visit http://www.triphugger.com

If you love our app, please leave a review. It helps other people find the app and motivates us to make TripHugger better. Thank you!
releaseNotes:
Can't find the place which has been added into your itinerary?
Now you can search a place in an itinerary by its name.
reviews:
I’ve been using the app with no problems until I created a second trip. When I try to open the trip is says “loading” but never loads. | I was hunting for an app to help me plan the details of a trip day by day and collaborate with friends during the process. This app provides the functionality I was seeking.
The way it automatically imports details from sites and shows them on the map with their locations and distance from each other (based on your plan) is a really useful feature I wasn’t expecting!

Definitely recommend if you like having a general day by day plan for a trip beforehand! | Keep asking if I want notifications or not
If I want it I can turn it on myself
I don’t need you to keep asking | Love this app! It has a way to include every event on the app. I wish that you could see who voted on candidate events! Would make options events a lot easier to plan. Also wish you could make it so that only selected people could edit the itinerary. Overall really good app. Planning a trip for 12 girls and it’s already getting the job done!! | Really easy to use interface that prioritizes sharing and group planning! | Kinda worrisome

title: inRoute - Intelligent Routing
description:
Plan optimal routes or chart your own course using weather, elevation, curves and more. Then navigate safely with voice-guided, turn-by-turn directions that automatically check your route for severe weather. 

***Featured in Essential Navigation Apps on the US App Store***
***As seen on the TODAY show in the Traveling This Summer segment***
“adding to both the safety of the ride and the pleasure of knowing beforehand what to expect” - Florin Tibu, “autoevolution”
“I used InRoute for planning six world record attempts. No weather app gives you more information, period.” - Carl Reese, Multiple World Record Holder

Key Features (some require inRoute Pro--see below):
• Voice guided navigation of up to 150 locations with automatic severe weather alerts*
• Optimize waypoint order for fastest time, or manually reorder
• Import from XLSX, GPX and KML files
• Create custom routes based on weather, elevation and curviness, or build your own route from available alternates on each leg of a route
• Interactive charts showing route elevation, curviness, weather (temperature, humidity, precipitation, wind speed/direction, severe weather alerts), and sunrise/sunset times*
• Search along a route—the whole route, every x miles/hours, or the next x miles/hours from a place—find gas, hotels, campgrounds or places to eat close to a route
• Enter your RV specs to avoid clearance issues and weight restrictions
• Set Departure and Layover Times—weather forecasts, road conditions (e.g. congestion), and travel times accurately reflect conditions throughout the trip
• Save your favorite routes and places, sync between devices, organize into folders, print via Airprint, and share with family and friends
• Easily add places to the map using a Dropped pin, Search, or Contacts
• Export routes to Apple Maps, Google Maps, Navigon, and Waze. Some apps use inRoute's "Agenda Nav" feature. See the in-app FAQ for more info.
• Export to GPS devices and apps compatible with GPX files
• Routes are stored on your device so you can access them even if you lose connection
*Weather forecasts are available worldwide. Severe weather alerts are currently available in the US, EU, Canada and Israel.

inRoute Pro (for iPhone, iPad, CarPlay & Mac):
- $4.99 monthly, or $39.99 annually. 1 week free trial
- Create routes with up to 150 locations (8 in free version)
- Sync routes and pins between devices
- Weather charts/custom routes
- Severe weather alerts during navigation (US, Canada, EU areas)
- Export/share routes as GPX files
- RV routes based on vehicle description

Price may vary by location. Subscriptions will be charged to your credit card through your iTunes account. Your subscription will automatically renew unless canceled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. Manage your subscriptions in Account Settings after purchase.

Privacy Policy and Terms of Use: http://carobapps.com/privacy-policy

Note: Since continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life, inRoute will automatically shut down if you haven't used it in a while.
releaseNotes:
Bug fixes:
- Fix for inability to start navigation on iOS 17.4 with some CarPlay receivers
- Fix for a progress spinner that may not disappear when iCloud is unavailable
- Importing from GPX files with duplicate routes in different formats is now handled better
reviews:
Inroute is the easiest to use and best navigation app that I have tried . | The only problem I have with this app is when I’m looking for smaller roads to make a waypoint, I enlarge them to try to see what number of road it is and there is no label on the road. I’m doing this on a iPhone. | I love this app! I only discovered it recently because it was rated as great for car play, but it has quickly become essential for me to plan my routes based on the elevation chart. Living near the Rocky Mountains, elevation is often a key factor in route planning. | All works well just wish the map didn’t lag when searching and creating waypoints | There needs to be a way to change the numbers of points entered so that you can put them in order or can add a point that you see is needed later into the middle of the line somewhere and get it in the right order. Also when you are using, the route developed, it would be more desirable if the turns were referenced by road numbers rather than by street names because most of these people using inRoute are using it for commercial purposes and we use road numbers rather than street names. Desperately need the road number as the points description. The local street name does not help a person who is not from that area. The road number is the descriptor that we need. When the points have been positioned where they need to be, I do wish that the line and route would follow the pointsexactly by their number order and not try to route along the shortest route as the crow flies. We put in a specific order for a reason. Permits require exact, turning points and roots of travel. | I have multiple businesses and I use this routing app for multiple purposes I use it for routing out routes for showings, routing out routes to drive on trips. It just really comes in handy it’s worth every penny and it’s very very user-friendly. | I’ve tried at least half a dozen apps and this is the best for our travel. I can adjust the way points according to my mileage and easily find the best route. It’s not the most user friendly app but they are constantly improving | I’ve tried most of them and this is the best gps for me. I make multiple stops a day at regular addresses. This platform provides an excellent solution to gps guidance. It Integrates, imports , and optimizes routes in a not too complex way. I am very thankful for this app. | Can’t see all the road numbers. Tried everything and still nothing. Not very impressed with the app. | The app has the most flexibility in finding stuff every x miles. It is worth reading the tutorial to get the most out of it. | I find some of the user flow confusing in this app. I’m planning an 18 day trip. Its helped order my way points. It’s confusing why every way point can be a start or end stop as well. That’s un-necessarily complex UX. The segments don’t display time. 

In the list view (which is nice) it shows distance and time since origin - I see no immediate value in this. 

What I want is how long is the drive. While it alternates from stops to layovers, there does seem to be a fair amount of confusing / unnecessary text. For example “next step”
Is redundant as the next line has the step name. This makes the readability easier rather than burying these details. Would love for stops to include URLs to camp sites (I can add them). 

Happy to chat more if the devs are around. | Usability must be improved. There is no posted speed limit displayed, it does not seem to understand traffic problems ahead, you start on your smartphone and then on your RV display it says you have to end navigation and start again, and if you start any other app you have to start from scratch. Not what you’d expect for what you pay. | Not sure if I was maybe looking to have the ap do more than it is set up for, but I found this ap to not be very user friendly. It does not seem to give many options past just the mapped route. I couldn’t figure out how to even get roadside information like RV Parks, rest stops, fuel stations, etc. | Wished it had exit numbers | I can’t figure out how to turn toll roads off. | Purchased pro version of app for RV. I could not enter any specifications. App continues to ask to upgrade to pro version. Paid the monthly and cancelled.
Update:  went through the app restore process previous purchase and upgrade to no avail several times. | I work in the oversize, super load industry. Pretty much everybody I know uses this app because it is the best one for what we do. I have had many conversations with the people at inRoute, and they have made many, if not all of the changes I recommended to improve it. They listen. The one thing that still stands out as an annoyance is when you create a route, and then close the app. When you reopen the app and the route you created, it often tries to reroute you a different way than what you had chosen, or tries to get you to loop around or make u-turns. On some roads you have to figure out how to force the app to go the route that you want. 
Now, inRoute will tell you that you have to change your settings when you create the route because it will use current Apple Maps information and reroute you if it thinks it needs to or if you chose the wrong transportation method. This should not happen, but it does quite frequently. When a route is created, it needs to stay that way, under all circumstances. If there is a new road closure or detour along the route you created then they should simply have a pop-up window that tells you what the issue is instead of rerouting you automatically. The user should have the option to reroute, not Apple Maps or the inRoute app by default. Specifically, in my industry, we follow permitted routes. These routes are already determined by DOT to be safe, open, and available to us. And when I share this route with other users in my industry and they open up the app even when they select the “adjust” setting when trying to open it, the route still changes the route on us. This is a big glitch because I have had coworkers running with other oversize crews get on the wrong road because of the app making changes by itself. Yes, they should know the route or be able to read a permit, but the app should not change the route - no matter what! This is a big issue in the oversize industry. 
So, lastly, let me just say inRoute needs to stop this from happening and allow the user to make the changes if necessary, based on what I suggested above, that perhaps a pop-up window would come up and give the app user the opportunity to change the route, if necessary. The app should not do this automatically. It happens more often than you know. I’ve tried to get inRoute to change this before and they always tell me that when you’re sharing it, the other person needs to have the same settings. Well, my answer to that is when they download the map after I’ve shared it there is a selection that they can say “adjust”, and it will adjust the settings on their app to match the settings that the route was created with. And they still have issues. Other than this, I think it’s a great app. I’ve used it for nearly 3 years and they have made many improvements several of which I have suggested because of the industry I’m in.
It’s still the best app out there for planning a route, especially multi-state routes. | Needs to speed the directions while on a phone call instead of just beep. | The GPS map doesn’t spin around and stays North to South no matter what direction you’re driving and makes directions very difficult. | Rated four star because gps or maps need to be updated and the buttons could be a more user friendly. | Only 4 because of Apple Maps. Would be great if I could highlight railroad tracks and crossings when I ask for them. This app is used by a lot of truck drivers who move oversized loads. More information is better. Thank you. | This is my first time writing a review for an app. I enjoy using it as it helps me plan my trip before I leave. I gave it four stars simply because I couldn't find good sound quality, and the road highlights on the map are quite thick when zoomed out. | Worked great until the update. Now it won’t even open. Have uninstalled, reinstalled, restated phone, and everything else I can think of. Emailed company and no response. Would like to receive the service I pay for. | Need to include exit numbers. Also, a possible way to check bridge height while in hybrid mode. Other than that love using the app. Thank You. | I am a Road Captain for our local chapter here in Central Texas. I use this app all the time creating routes. 
My problem is that I can only use this app on my work phone, which is an iPhone. My personal phone is not. I would love to use this on another platform, and so would so many other users. 
Is there a plan to provide this free or paid service to Android users? | This app helps me see exactly how far I have between stops.. | This app is great for drivers like myself that haul tall wide heavy and long 
Very handy , worth every penny | Necesito que sea como antes que la aplicación me deba la oportunidad de enviar las confirmaciones | This could be the perfect app.  
I use this more then Apple map, Google map and Waze.   

InRoute is still much better then the others mentioned here for a family trip or simple deliveries. I love the weather updates and road closure updates as well as toll information, for all this,  I give 5 stars. 

Features I’d like to see added are speed limit notifications while using the app, satellite street view with split screen for over all route view while entering the desired route, these additions would increase the value of InRoute and the need for other apps to create a route in InRoute wouldn’t be needed.  

4 star for my type of work due to other apps needed to run at the same time for all information mentioned above. | Great does everything I need it to thanks for making it | I’ve tried the application for 2 days and found it is useless app. 
I removed my trail subscription , deactivated the service and uninstalled the app. 
Today I noticed that they charged my account for $4.31 while I’m not using your service at all. 
Be careful, don’t try the app until further update in this review.

Update:
The customer service didn't reply.
I was not able to get my money back.
Stay away and don't be fooled by the reviews that seems NOT to be true. | If you like driving past way points multiple times, flipping countless u turns, and backtracking half the time then this is the app for you. If you’re trying to be efficient in your route pass up on this app. But if you like driving around just to waste time then maybe give it a try. | I use this app everyday creating my daily lawn routes. Has saved me a lot of money and most importantly time. | I love the app but I’d like to see exit numbers and highway numbers when I zoom in on an exit to drop a pin. Zooming in reviews the local names of the roads but not the road number. If you could add these it would be closer to perfect. WE NEED EXIT NUMBERS!!! | Dependable - Accurate - User Friendly - Great planning tool | Trying this on my latest RV trip. Overall it’s OK. Could be a lot easier to customize routes but offset by the ability to save specific routes once customized. 

Major issues: 
1. No speed limit information - which is a major flaw
2. No off line maps.

Minor issues
1. User interface is one of the worst. Hard to find specific actions you want - including just saving routes.
2. Really not good for simply monitoring your driving. Really requires a destination to be useful. | Won’t plan route not good for delivery driver if you need to prioritize deliveries | Great app | The app keeps reversing the order of my stops on my route, no matter how many times I change it and/or save it. I’m planning a roughly circular route going south to west to north to east, the app keeps changing it to WSEN. Also, when I try to zoom in to see the number of a highway, the number stays small even though the highway itself enlarges.

I will not be renewing my subscription for the next month. | Motorcyclist and iphone users dream app. The best of the best. migrated from a dedicated Garmin device to this and brought all my routes over no problem. | This app is well thought out and purposefully built for the traveler. I had searched long and hard for an app that would serve me well on my cross country motorcycle treks …. Recommended it to all my friends. Sponsorship ??? | It is a good well thought out system, but if it were going to get better, it would have the exit number on the interstate highways. | Every update keeps this app getting better and better. It’s my go-to route creation tool for all my motorcycle trips. Highly recommended! | Love the app I am an oversize load escort. Even when raining when other apps stopped working enroute kept working. The only complaint I have is it would be great if you added exit numbers. Because sometimes I have to go to google to find exit numbers to stay on routes that we are permitted to go on by the states.it is the best tool that an escort can have in this business because we are not permitted to leave the route the states have given for any reason. | Great product. Needs mile post on the ramps | I really can’t say enough good things about this app. Sure, there are plenty of apps out there that will route you among multiple waypoints, but this one is different. To say it is designed intentionally is an understatement. The app automatically routes you to the next waypoint after reaching the previous one. The best part is little to know interface is required to keep the app running, which cuts down under distractions and ultimately increases productivity. I have found the app works best on an iPad but it’s great on iPhone as well. For five bucks, I think it’s the best money you can spend if you are in the delivery business or just want to efficiently route multiple steps into your day. What a steal- five stars all day. | I wish it would tell me of a turn while I’m on the phone | Be careful- not all routes are public roads. Pulling a fifth wheel is not easy. | Great app but needs a pause route button for when we stop at a waypoint but don’t want to end the route so it will quite giving verbal directions or tell you to return to route while walking around with my phone in my pocket. Otherwise love it!!! Also it would be nice if it also showed the speed limit for the road you are traveling on like the other navigation apps do. | I cannot figure out how to start a new route!!

title: Culture Trip: Travel & Explore
description:
The Culture Trip app is your essential travel companion; wherever you are, wherever you go. Discover nearby recommendations hand-picked by global experts and local insiders, plan unique trips that are right for you, and easily book spot-on places to stay and experiences - all in one app.

Travel with Culture Trip and we help you get it right, before and during every precious trip. Because we are your trusted shortcut to booking travel that’s good, and makes you feel good.
 
THE WORLD’S BEST BITS, HAND-PICKED BY US
Our recommendations are hand-picked by a global community of travel experts and local insiders - we know the best when we see it because we’ve been doing this since 2011.
Our award-winning travel guides, stories, and videos give you an insider perspective on destinations around the world with lesser-known gems and unexpected highlights.

EASILY PLAN TRIPS THAT ARE RIGHT FOR YOU
My Plans: Wave goodbye to stacks of travel books. Collect trip inspiration in one place, and see everything on a handy map. Add your favourite travel guides and itinerary ideas, create wishlists of places to stay, and must-do experiences.
Near Me: The perfect tool to find local recommendations for the best things to do, areas to visit, places to stay, and more - wherever you are. Near me now includes a handy interactive map to help you pinpoint and book amazing places to stay and experiences around you!

BOOK WITH CONFIDENCE
Free cancellation: In these uncertain times, cancel or change for free on select properties and experiences.

Price-match guarantee: Find a better price on your booking and we’ll match it. Simple.
 
Peace of mind: Our friendly team is on hand to help you with booking questions.

Just some of the reasons why the Culture Trip app has a 4.8-star rating and has been downloaded over 2.8 million times:

“Culture Trip is like a crib sheet to the zeitgeist – a whip-smart hybrid of magazine and travel site. You'll never feel out of the loop again.” ‑ App of the Day Feature, Apple“

Check out our reviews and ratings

© 2023 The Culture Trip Ltd.
releaseNotes: Guides content loading bug fixes.

Please bring back the guides and local stories. If I can get the app wouldn’t glitch so much. A simple search won’t upload the content | It crashes every few minutes!!! My saved pages went blank. Do I need to say anymore?  Very sad… | Really sad to see the latest performance. I guess that’s there now Hass to be 3 inches of advertising on every page, however, you could just get the pages to load and I’d It be much happier. I think the app is a great idea and off to a good start but needs some work | There ‘save’ feature is a mess and dies nit work. A waste of time. | This used to be a really cool app where you’d find great articles/suggestions for destinations. Guess it got bought out or something. Seems like it’s more of a booking platform now. Too bad. | Anytime the app actually loads I feel very lucky. Usually I open it and am just made angry as it loads for eternity. Seem every couple of week the app become unusable. The content is good which i would think is the hard part. The app is abysmal. Get it together guys. | I loved this app. I even gave it 5 stars. Recently it has totally stopped working; I cannot save any posts and cannot even log on the app. I tried deleting the app and reinstalling it to see if it would fix the problem but it has not. I can’t access any plans I made previously either. The problem started around the time they took away the section about hotels/hotel booking. That was always a useful way to find out key details about amenities, neighborhoods, etc. Even without hotel information, the app would still be useful to plan dining and activities for travel. Unfortunately, due to its lack of functionality, the app is close to useless now. This has been weeks or months now. | Sign up sign in just don’t work for me | Looks like a good app but I can’t get in | Installed and used for a while, then upgraded an iPhone, all my saved data is gone, can’t log in, can’t use the app, gets stuck after the initial splash screen, can’t create a new account either.

title: trivago: Compare hotel prices
description:
The trivago app is the easy way to search and compare hotel prices from your favorite booking sites so you can find a hotel or accommodation in the location you want, with the amenities you need, and for a deal you’ll feel amazing about.

- Compare accommodation prices from major booking sites with one search
- Get exclusive mobile rates on your phone or tablet
- Get price drop alerts for your favorite hotels
- Save favorite accommodations and compare them side-by-side
- Read aggregated guest reviews from multiple booking sites
- Search over 5 million properties in more than 190 countries and find amazing hotel deals

No matter what type of traveler you are, or what type of budget you have, the trivago app makes your hotel search simpler than ever.

Compare prices from hundreds of booking sites
With trivago, you don’t just search for hotel offers in your dream vacation destinations, you also get to compare prices from the major booking sites like Expedia, Hotels.com, Accor, ZenHotels, Booking.com, Trip.com, Priceline, TravelUp, Orbitz, HotelTonight, and more. With over 5 million hotels and other accommodations to choose from worldwide, finding the right stay at the right price doesn’t get much easier than this.

Mobile rates for deal-hunters on the go
The trivago app features deals on hotels that you can only access on your mobile device — something all you deal-hunters out there won’t want to miss out on. Just search for your hotel like you normally would, and keep an eye out for the “mobile rate” badge to know when you’ve found a special deal.

Get a heads-up when prices drop
Have a trip coming up and want to try and book your stay for cheap? Now you can sign up for price drop alerts on the trivago app to stay on top of price changes for your favorite hotels. Instead of constant searching, you’ll get notified as soon as prices drop so you can act fast and get an awesome deal.

Save favorites and compare them side-by-side
Whether your dream hotel is pet-friendly, has late-checkout, offers free cancellation, or includes a breakfast buffet, the trivago app makes it easy to save your favorite stays. When you feel like booking your trip, you can compare hotels from your favorites list side-by-side to see how they match up before making your decision, so can always be confident you got the right stay at the right price.

Real talk from real guests
Along with always-updating price information, the trivago app aggregates guest ratings from major booking sites to give you the best understanding of real-world experiences at each hotel. The trivago rating index creates a combined score of available ratings so that you can see what other guests have to say, and always be ready to book your room with confidence.

5 million hotel beds and counting
With over over 5 million properties in more than 190 countries, you can find the perfect stay for every trip on the trivago app. Find rooms at boutique hotels, luxury hotels, airport hotels, hostels, bed and breakfasts, lodges, vacation rentals, resorts, and everything in between with one simple search.

Download trivago’s free app today and start searching, comparing, and saving on your next adventure.

Visit trivago.com for more info.
releaseNotes: Ready to find your perfect stay? Well, good thing we’ve updated our app in this latest release. Let’s just say we’ve been busy bees implementing all sorts of bug fixes and performance improvements to give you the best app experience yet.

title: Hopper: Flights, Hotels & Cars
description:
The Hopper app has helped over 100 million travelers find and secure the best price on flights, hotels, homes and car rentals - each and every time they book their trips.

Book Flights, Hotels, Homes & Rental Cars 
Find millions of flights, hotels, homes, rental cars (and cute bunnies) – all in one app. Book your trip safely and securely, in just a couple taps and a swipe. 

Always Get the Best Price 
You can watch a trip right in the app and we’ll send you a notification when it’s the best time to buy — recommending you to book now, or maybe wait just a little longer.

Easily Find The Cheapest Travel Dates 
Simply search your preferred destination and use Hopper’s color-coded deals calendar to easily find the cheapest travel dates for your trip.

Not Ready to Book Right Away?
Hopper lets you freeze the price, so that you never miss a travel deal. For a small fee, take the time you need to finalize your plans, or wait for your next paycheck to come in. If the price goes up, you only pay the price you froze it at. But if the price goes down, you just pay the lower price. 

Travel with Confidence
Avoid fees and frustration! Make any trip flexible with Hopper’s Cancel and Change for Any Reason plans. Get instantly rebooked without extra costs if your flight is delayed or you miss a connection with Hopper’s Flight Disruption Guarantee. Travel stress free with 24/7 access to Hopper’s Customer Support. 

Help the Planet, One Booking at a Time. 
With every booking that occurs on Hopper, we pledge to plant 2 trees to offset the carbon footprint. To date, we’ve planted over 31 million trees. 

Hopper has no ads, no spam, and no stress — just accurate predictions and travel deals.

So what are you waiting for? Start saving money with the bunny today. Download Hopper for free now, and let’s start planning your next trip!

Hopper Love
• “The 10 Best Free Apps for Air Travel Junkies” - TIME
• “The Most Downloaded OTA in the U.S. in 2021” - Apptopia 
• “The app helps travelers find the cheapest flights, hotels and rental cars.” - The Points Guy
• “Compared to exact searches on Expedia, Kayak and Orbitz, we regularly found that the deal quoted on Hopper was the best” - Travel and Leisure
• “Hopper can be a better option than direct booking for those who need more flexibility.” - The Wall Street Journal
• “Find me a hotel on Hopper!” - The Late Late Show with James Corden
• “Travel Unicorn Hopper First Came for Expedia. Airbnb Is Next” - TechCrunch
• “Hopper is committed to offsetting the carbon emissions of every flight and hotel stay it sells.” - Forbes, The Top 100 Most Customer-Centric Companies of 2022

Say Hello to the Bunnies
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hoppertravel
Instagram: @hopper
Twitter: @hopper
Website: http://www.hopper.com

Need support? Head over to https://help.hopper.com to find answers to frequently asked questions. You can also reach us toll-free at +1-833-933-4671 if calling from US or Canada, or at +1 (347)-695-4555 if calling from outside the US or Canada.

title: Go City -Travel Plan & Tickets
description:
New home for The New York Pass® and The London Pass®
- Use your Go City App for your The New York Pass® or The London Pass® purchases and enjoy a richer app experience. 

One pass, all the sights. 

Sightseeing just got easier. With Go City, enjoy the best attractions, experiences and tours a city has to offer, all on one pass. Download the app to explore over 30 destinations, check out our incredible attraction line-up and access your digital pass for easy entry.

Using the Go City app, you can:

Explore attractions
- Read up on all the experiences available on your pass.  
- Find out opening hours, reservation info and how to get there.

Sightsee using Map View
- Use Map View to find nearby attractions when you're on the go.

Smart trip planning
- Simply pick your must-see attractions and let the trip planning tool do the rest.
- Make best use of your time in the city with optimised plans.

Access your pass
- Download your pass to the app and show it at each attraction – it's that easy!
- Available offline – so no more Wi-Fi worries!
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and performance improvements.
reviews:
I wanted to ask a simple question but their “24 hour” line does not appear to be manned. It just blares a continuous message about how to apply for a refund online. Not helpful, as this isn’t what I needed, and leaves me with a sinking feeling as I prepare for the trip, if that’s the only reason why people call. Can’t wait to see if this thing works… | Go City is a waste of time and money. I do not recommend at all. I purchased a 4-pack for myself and my children for a special trip to New York City. The total cost was $400. We were only able to use 2 of 4 passes due to the horrible procedure to exchange this pass for actual tickets. 

If you want to wait in long lines to redeem your Go City pass for an actual ticket and then wait in another long line to see the attractions, then this app is for you. 

If you want to spend your time vacationing, buy the tickets directly from the vendors. | Be wary of purchasing GoCity passes. Purchasing a GoCity pass does not guarantee you entry into the advertised attractions. GoCity website nor app maintain updated information regarding their advertised attractions and reservation requirements. GoCity website, app and confirmation email advertise many attractions as walk up only. GoCity website and app do not permit you to make reservations for attractions that are advertised as walk up only. While GoCity may not require a reservation for an advertise attraction, the attraction itself may actually require a reservation. Before purchasing a GoCity pass, check each attraction website directly for the most updated information on reservations in order to help ensure entry into an advertised attraction. GoCity will not issue a refund once the pass has been activated nor provide any corrective actions for losses incurred due to their deceptive advertising practices. | Signed up for this pass 2 weeks ago and started using it for today and 4 out of the 6 attractions we travelled to get to were no longer operating. 
Fine arts museum, magician Baneck, linq zip lines and Eiffel Tower were all shut down. Pretty terrible. | This was a nine-hour trip. It didn’t live up to the hype. You your his childhood home and see his ranch. Then there are a few stops along the way. The German town of Fredericksburg was the best part, but we only had 90 minutes to eat, walk the town, and visit a WWII museum. Not enough time when you realize it’s nine hours you’ve committed to this tour. | When you pay $1000 you shouldn’t have to read the EXTRA fine print. The ad states that time begins after scanning the the 1st attraction. Our tickets ended at midnight the next day. We were cut off the next day at midnight. Deceitful practices | We did the 2 day pass.. family of 6.. did Universal on day 1.. you have to reserve the morning of the day you plan to visit.. did it, they scanned my phone, no problems.. second day kids wanted to do knotts.. you have to show your passes at both 11/ 12 and they exchange for paper tickets.. same thing, no issues.. highly recommend! Saved so much money! Just pay attention to which attraction you want and follow their admittance rules and you’ll be fine.. will be purchasing again wherever we go!! | This has been nothing but a headache we purchased discounted tickets through Groupon and it was horrible. You can’t reach anybody on Groupon only through a text it took me an hour back-and-forth to get the right confirmation code and then we made reservations for Statue of Liberty and only a couple reservations went through. It has been nothing but a headache. I suggest go straight through Go City, and I actually talk to a human that will help you guide you all this hassle. Just save a couple dollars is not worth it. | The older version can add attraction to a specific date with Morning, Afternoon and evening option. Now, all selected events are unscheduled and cannot do anything else. Need to fix this! | one day only 2 attractions, almost same price for two regular price, but on your own pace and condition, | They have a “savings guarantee” but it’s only if you book 3x a day which is virtually impossible. I used it for 3 days to get premium offers. One of them cancelled on me due to weather. I did the math and I would have saved money if I would have booked everything individually 2 events a day. | Lousy info and customer service | Information on their website is outdated and the customer service is lousy | Don’t even think about using this service. They are overpricing. I bought the tickets for Rome for 3 activities worth $100 and the total entry fee for the very same tickets if bought individually were less than $50. They claim they give you up to 35% which is a flat out lie. | “If it is too good to be true, it probably is”. At first look you would feel they provide better value for money. However, most attractions will treat you like a freeloader. I took a two say pass for miami. And the pass stated “just show up and show the pass”. But Most of the good attractions mentioned they only allow limited people from gocity pass. That means each day, if you go early, you can get one to one good attraction and by the time you finish it all the other ones are sold out. Their customer service is horrible and do not honor the misleading claims stated in the pass. They offered us a partial refund provided we go to multiple attractions and prove that none of them is accepting go city pass. That makes no sense given our valuable time of lost in the process. That said, it is still worth it if you plan to go to multiple attractions. I got a 50% discount on the pass. So covering 4 attractions from the list of 40+ attractions (some are far away from miami and some are not worth your time) will make up for the cost. So plan to book and pay directly for the main attractions like speedboat and if you did end up taking a pass, use it for the less popular attractions. Always call ahead and try to book it as much as possible. | Don’t buy the pass the day you arrive thinking you can use it. It apparently has to go through security checks which takes about 6 hours so now we are here waiting with nothing to do since this was our plan today. I called and they “flagged our order” to be processed sooner but still will take hours. Absolutely ridiculous!!! They don’t advertise this and I’ve been to many other cities using go passes and never had to wait to receive it! | Made accessing attractions quick and easy | The app is glitchy. On initial load- the app looks like it’s struggling to refresh and it’s stuck on a loop doing so. | Everything tells you to make a reservation right? You can only do it same day. Customer service is non existent, I’ve seen 5 year olds with better manners and customer service skills.
Was told no problem as soon as we get confirmation you didn’t go we will redo the tickets. No call, no email. I called back to be told they can not help me. HORRIBLE DO NOT USE! | When you open the map it opens the wrong address. Made us miss a cruise. | We just got 4 go city passes for 3 things to do and in an hour and a half they now say expired and we haven’t even used them once | Title says it all, planned a vacation around a cruise but they had no indication that it was close for the entire weekend we went. Probably won’t use it again. | I saw the promises this app made and was skeptical; it just sounded too good to be true. This app is 100% worth getting. We were able to save $50 with this (we did the 2 day all inclusive). Absolutely get this app if you can | I and my family used the All Inclusive pass and had a blast in Boston!!! We went through sooooooooo many places and there was no hassle of waiting in line or worry about ticket.
The best thing about this was after the whole trip, I calculated the saving of about $1200.
Yeah, next trip to Hawaii!!!!!!!😆😆 | Lowered the review because it asks to rate all the time | I have had nothing but problems using this app! | Tried to purchase from their website, won’t accept payment.  Called the help line, they said use the ap they apparently no longer accept web payments.   Used the ap, get “unknown failure” message with 2 different credit cards.   Guess my money is not worthy of their product. | Could have bought tickets cheaper on my own! | Can’t sync my passes to my email or app. | This pass is useless in Amsterdam. The pass doesn't book tickets so you have to make reservation online with the sites, but you can't pay for the reservations with the pass. Either you chance it and hope that when you arrive you can get in with your pass, or you pay separately and the pass is worthless. DO NOT go without reservations because you will not get in. The sites cost less than the pass in total. And the ferry to the castle was closed entirely so we got stuck 10 miles from the castle without a way back. The Uber cost $70 round trip. Absolutely a waste of money. | A huge portion of the activities were unavailable in general but you don’t find this out till after you purchase and try to make reservations.   Then overnight 1/4 of the remaining options disappeared.  Our premium activity was cancelled by the vendor 10 minutes prior to our reservation and they won’t reschedule or refund, of course on GoCity it shows up as utilized. | Bought this pass as it said I could choose from the San Diego Zoo or Adventure Park (not both). Fine with me as we were only planning to go to the zoo. Once paid for, neither was an option. What a rip off! | The app is easy to use and pretty simple | This has the option to add activities to an itinerary, but I couldn’t figure out how to view that itinerary after adding activities to it. I eventually figured out that if I add activities to my “favorites” instead, I was able to see a list of favorites.

The favorites button is a white button which is displayed on top of an image of the activity. Unfortunately one of the activities I wanted to add to my favorites had an image that was white too in the area where the favorite button was (white on white) so I had no idea whether I was successfully tapping the favorites button. I eventually figured out that I could tap where I thought the favorites button probably was and then go to my favorites list and check if the activity was listed in my favorites…nope, not there. So I tried again…That time it worked.

So after some trial and error I got this to work acceptably to be able to see a list of the activities I plan to do and tap on them to get directions to them. It would be helpful to have these things improved though. | We had a two day pass. We saved $147 each above what we paid for the pass. We used the app and just presented our passes on my phone and in we went. No problems. Probably got to do and see more because we didn’t worry about needing to spend all day at the aquarium to “get our money’s worth”, for example. | Best bang for your buck when it comes to bundling deals AND saves you money in the end. The Inclusive pass is where it’s at. | These passes are great. Saves time having to order at every individual attraction & money… one set price for all depending on the number of attractions. The difference between all inclusive & explorer is… inclusive pass gives you 35 attractions for a set amount of days while explorer pass allows you to experience the number of attractions over several days/weeks. I chose explorer. 😍 | Es mejor comprar por separado tus sitios de interés, no es más económico comprarlo con esta aplicación. Compre 10 atracciones y solo pude disfrutar de 6. Luego no hay forma de tener atención al cliente, no hay quien resuelva tus inconvenientes. | Firstly I like the idea of this app. Rather than scrambling through bunch of different websites to get tickets. You just use this app.

Secondly, I was skeptical about it at first. We went to the edge in Hudson yards. I thought I would have to go back to the ticket counter & get tickets. But it went smoothly. As soon as we went in, the staff was happy to see the QR code and let us in without any questions. I have only used it once. I am actually looking forward to reuse this app. | I bought go-city passes for Barcelona, Paris, and Rome.  In Rome, NONE of the places listed as included (except Big Bus) took our tickets.  In Paris, we got the Museum Pass in addition to Big Buss, but nothing else worked.  We never got the chance to try them in Barcelona, but if you are thinking of traveling outside the US, AVOID THIS COMPANY! | Since you buy passes first, then reserve, you cannot get a pass for what you want to do because everything is already booked. | Processed three different orders and each was cancelled, effectively maxing out my card (at least for 1-2 billing cycles) without a deliverable. WTH. | Seems to difficult to figure it out! | Be aware that this pass is not all inclusive as they say. If you see tours from the same company in this pass, even though it says all inclusive they only let you do one of the tours, not multiple. | It’s a bit confusing on how to add the passes. | The effort to connect the pass to the reservations is unnecessarily complicated and not user friendly. It asks for the code for the passes when you follow the links to make the reservation. It doesn’t tell you you will need the code nor does it automatically provide the code. It should be pretty simple to make this on a secure link. | Very convenient | A COMPLETE NIGHTMARE! Trying to sync tickets purchased at Tickets At Work is taking over a hour. I purchased 2 different kinds of tickets and Go City doesn’t recognize all of the tickets. The rep otp was very pleasant and a little hard to understand. Horrible experience. | Frequency of Hop on Bus can be better | When I bought the pass it was supposed to include a lot of things. When I got to Paris none of the things that were supposed to be included were part of my pass. Almost everything said I had to pay more. I would not buy a pass again from this company since they changed what was included right as I got to the city and started going places.

title: Headout: Travel Experiences
description:
A world of endless adventure awaits. A world that’s yours to explore. Your gateway to happiness? Headout.

Our mission? To unlock this happier world by connecting high-quality live experiences with people all over the globe. Whether you’re about to embark on a wild journey to a new city or are on the lookout for a thrilling escapade in a town you’ve been to many times before — we’ve got a curated collection of experiences that are just for you!
Think of us as your enthusiastic partner in fun. From champagne atop the Eiffel Tower to watching Formula 1 cars whiz by in Singapore, head out now and explore our world like never before.
- Join 20 million+ guests who’ve experienced the world with us
- Get access to over 10,000 experiences in 250+ cities
- Take your pick from exclusive offers & deals on last-minute tickets
- Change in plans? Don’t worry, our experiences offer flexible cancellation
- Book now, go whenever! With the ability to book tickets for later (yes, for real) – all you need to do is tap, tap, and go!

Hear it straight from our guests who’ve lived it:

“Purchasing the tickets to Dream World, on Headout was a fantastic decision. The booking process was smooth and straightforward, and I was able to easily select the date and time that suited me and my family best. At Dream World, not only did we breeze through the crowds, but it meant we we sure of getting entry into the theme park, especially with two children - both under the age of 8 years - eager to start exploring the park without any delay or drama! Buying the Dream World Visa gave us access to (almost) all the rides so with the wrist band on us, we went straight through without having the hassle of looking for change/currency at each ride. All in all, it was a stress-free and wonderful experience!”

“Book and pay a ticket and pay in the app with just a few clicks. Tickets do not have to be printed out and can simply be shown digitally in the app. It couldn’t be easier.
Everything went well on site. Versailles was breathtaking!”

“Through a different provider, I had a trip cancelled last minute the day before and was able to book on to this tour late in the evening the day before. Tickets and confirmation of collection point were clear and the tickets are very easily available on the app. We were picked up at the pick up location on time, and our guide met us and explained what the experience would entail and the time scales. I think our guides make was Raphael, he was very knowledgeable and gave us a very detailed explanation of Krakows history as we were driving through Krakow towards Auschwitz. Showing us all the landmark buildings and their history along the way. Very easy to understand and communicated very well, and very passionate about education us all on Polish history. Very happy with this service and would recommend using them to book tours through.”

We’d love to hear your thoughts, feedback, suggestions, and even your fun adventure stories! Feel free to drop us an email at support@headout.com or tweet us @headout. We’re all ears!

Got queries? We’re here round-the-clock for you! Our 24*7 support centers are just a chat away on www.headout.com.
releaseNotes:
1. Bye bye, clutter: We've split your bookings into neat tabs: Completed and Upcoming. Finding your next adventures is now a breeze.
2. Fulfilled bookings = happier journeys: We're rolling out a smoother booking experience for you. Filling in user fields has never been easier!
3. Not lost in translation: Dates will now speak your language, wherever you are. Currencies have met their match!
4. Bugs don't belong here, so we squashed them.
reviews:
I searched for “skip the line” tickets for Pompeii and came upon Headout. I booked and paid only to get an email telling me to expect lengthy waits to redeem my ticket voucher with no option to download the tickets themselves. The chat feature is just a bot that only responds to canned simple questions. There’s no customer service number to call. They do not reply to email. Stay far away from this useless “service”. | This app is just a google drive wrapper.  Should just be a web app. | Disastrous tour: rude guide and the attraction was closed. But will HeadOut refund us? Nope. They offered credits for future purchases. Get effed, HeadOut. | Horribly-designed app, confusing experience, doesn’t allow getting the ticket scan code without downloading the app (so you’re forced to download the app no matter what).  Bought tickets online beforehand, and still was forced to stand in the long line at the attraction to get ticket scan codes. 
Will delete this app as soon as we leave the country. | They intentionally mislead you about what tickets you’re buying and then refuse any refunds when you find out they deceived you. They’re a scalper but they make websites that make you believe they’re the official site of the attraction. Only use them if you like wasting money. | Scammers!!! Stole my money!!! Don’t buy tickets with them, they are mimicking NASA website and don’t return money back!!! | Terrible. I contacted the web trying to get my tickets modified but they didn’t help at all. When I went to the museum and try to use the tickets the agents mentioned they often receive complaints from lots of tourist with the same issue. Then the pdf they showed was only visible on their app and could not download so they can keep you in the app.  Lastly, after a few weeks I noticed my phone battery was strangely draining fast. This morning I looked at the % used and Headout was 59% even though I have not used it for weeks.  Clearly app has tracking me the whole time, either nefariously or they just have bad developers. Either way, deleting now and never using this service again. | They made a mistake booking my tickets that apparently are now nonrefundable and refuse to give me a refund. Never booking with them again. | This is a scam - they rip you off. | Open app, try to log in, it sends a link to your email.   Click link, that opens Safari which then opens App store which lets you re-open app, but you haven’t made any progress getting logged in.

Confirmation of ticket purchase arrives in email.  Aggregation of getting logged in repeats (even though only a minute or two has passed), as you try to get official ticket.  Finally reach a webpage (having given up on the app) that has a download link for PDF of ticket.   Hit “download” and the PDF is pulled down but not shown in Files (just in Safari recents).   When you realize that, you can show the ticket-taker, but you might have multiple PDFs to search through for the (in our case) 5 that are needed (look at the last bit of the looong file name to distinguish one from another and its duplicates). | Think twice before buying with them.
