Then, we were never provided with the audio guide information we paid for and were treated poorly by the so called “host.”  The presentation of the website as official and the hiding of the fact that it’s a third party service seems sadly a bit common in Rome but that does not make it Ok. I won’t ever use Headout again for any services due to this misleading and ugly experience. On the plus side the visit to Castel Sant Angelo was great but it turns out we never needed anything from Headout to help us enjoy it!! | They are very bad at customer service and dont attend or give you a callback even after requesting a callback. Also the non refund policy is just simply the worst marketing strategy. I lost over 500$ because of a mistake and they dont even consider any unforeseen circumstannce as a valid reason even with genuine cases | beware when using this app, I purchased two orchestra tickets and when I got to the venue I found out they were switched for first mezzanine against my knowledge. I work in support, and I can tell you this has been the absolute WORST experience with a customer support team. This is gross negligence, and it has ruined the last day of my trip to rome. 

PLEASE STAY AWAY!! THEY WILL TAKE YOUR MONEY WITHOUT VERIFYING THE TOUR FIRST, THEN WILL CANCEL SO LATE YOU HAVE NO OTHER OPTIONS.

I’ve been in contact with customer support who have informed us of a no refund policy and now I am screwed out of money. title: AllTrails: Hike, Bike & Run
description:
Find your way outside with the 2023 iPhone App of the Year

Whether you hike, bike, run, or walk, AllTrails is your companion and guide to the outdoors. Find detailed reviews and inspiration from a community of trail-goers like you. We’ll help you plan, live, and share your outdoor adventures.

AllTrails offers more than a running app or fitness activity tracker. It’s built on the idea that the outside isn’t a place to seek, but rather a part of us all. Custom route planning helps you search for dog-friendly, kid-friendly, stroller-friendly, or wheelchair-friendly trails, and more.

◆ Discover trails: Search over 400,000 trails around the world by location, interest, skill level, and more.
◆ Plan your next adventure: Get in-depth trail info, from reviews to conditions to GPS driving directions — and save your favorite trails for later.
◆ Stay on course: Stick to your planned route or chart your own course with confidence when you navigate on the trail.
◆ Grow your community: Celebrate outdoor adventures and find inspiration by connecting with trail-goers like you.
◆ Share your outdoor adventures: Easily post trails and activities on Facebook, Instagram, or WhatsApp.

Discover trails that fit your nature. Trails for workout planners, hikers, walkers, mountain bikers, trail runners, and casual cyclists. Whether you’re pushing your limits or pushing a stroller, there’s something out there for everyone. Let AllTrails help you find it.

► Do more outdoors with AllTrails+ ►
Spend less time figuring out where you want to be, and more time enjoying where you are. With offline maps, wrong-turn alerts, and extra safety and planning features, your annual subscription gives you more tools for more adventures.

◆ Search by distance from you to find the closest trails.
◆ Stay informed with live route planner details like air quality, pollen, and light pollution.
◆ Unplug completely or pack a backup with printed maps.
◆ Download offline maps ahead of time and track your GPS location, even with no cell service.
◆ Keep loved ones in the loop with Live Share.
◆ Prepare for the hills ahead: Follow topo maps and trail maps in 3D.
◆ Focus on the view, not the map, with wrong-turn alerts.
◆ Get satellite weather with real-time map details.
◆ Record your activity with stats and photos of your favorite hiking trails.
◆ Stay on track: Automatically export your records to the Apple Health app.
◆ Give back: AllTrails donates a portion of every subscription to 1% for the Planet.
◆ Explore ad-free: Remove occasional ads by subscribing.

Whether you’re geocaching in a national park, browsing bucket-list mountain bike routes, or planning a trail run to clear your head, AllTrails+ makes the great outdoors even greater.
releaseNotes:
Thanks for using AllTrails! This update includes:
• Minor bug fixes

It’s a good app if you enjoy hiking, but their billing system is a scam. | I feel very uneasy with your recent push to make so much of my experience public. The change to the “public profile” nonsense is the first change ever that makes me want to cancel. I DO NOT want to connect with anyone else nor do I want any of my info shared or searchable. It is not totally clear if I’m public or not public so I have to change my name in the app now to be sure I have anonymity. You lure me to create a review after I use the app (please add a cancel button to the “finish” / “resume” pop up btw that thing is weird) which I’m pretty sure posts publicly. You need a single radio button that lets the users stay 100% private. Many people don’t want a social profile for safety reasons, this obvious push feels invasive. And ditto on the number of pop ups. | It coo, i use it when I travel anywhere because obviously I don’t know the area. So it’s the best app for finding like spots to | 🩷 | I have had this app for years and it has just continued to get more advance and overall user friendly. I have always loved this app and it is a must whether you are a beginner or advanced hiker. | It’d be a great app if developers paid attention to stability and customer feedback instead of rolling out fancy features nobody cares for. | Getting full access to hundreds of trails, camp sites, and other activities is what I call a highlight. There’s so much to see and do so get the most out of it and head up that mountain! | All trails + is 110% worth it!! You can track hikes and other trips, download trail maps, and so much more. Highly recommend | iPads are better for planning than are phones.  If this app is so great, then why is there no widescreen iPad version? | EVER | I’m a hiker in the Pacific Northwest. There are a lot of trails this app simply doesn’t cover. They rely on subscribers to submit them. | Stop the pop ups. Sheesh | Easily the best app for finding new and interesting trails to hike. Support team is also on their A-game when there are hiccups. Highly recommend. However, as a standard practice, any app that has a popup demanding to know how I am enjoying the app only gets one star. Popups are evil, especially for people with ADHD like myself. | It may be a transient bug but I had 5 downloaded maps for use when I was out of cell coverage. No cell coverage and in airplane mode and the app would not open any of the stored maps. My confidence in the reliability of AllTrails is scattered. Hopefully they will explain what happened and why they left one long-term customer in a very bad position. | Great | I used the app this morning and discovered a super cool feature. I had unknowingly taken the wrong turn and after about one or 200 yards the AllTrails app ping me and told me I was not on the right trail. That is a fantastic feature. Plus, it helps you find the right way and gives you, important statistics about your activity. | I don’t think this app as a filter for e-bike friendly trails. Bummer | Good guidance but kills my battery in few hours | It’s price appropriate so don’t raise it anymore. Other than that is 5.0 baby. | We are always finding good hikes to do on this app | I just started my free trial. Apparently I can’t filter results based on distance from me unless I turn on location services. There’s no option to manually input the data. So, my search results based on my hometown net trails an hour+ away from me at the top, but not the ones in my town or surrounding towns (at 500 search results, I’m not digging through them manually). Instead I have to do some funky map zooming. I will be deleting my free trial. | This app stokes the fires of adventure. Vacation starts with AllTrails and planning which trails we can fit in. Filtering by difficulty, activity, suitability, and rating make finding a trail so easy. We have been using it for years and love it. Having a live map makes getting lost almost impossible. | The app worked well on my iPhone until it started sporadically stopping recording during activities.  (I have the "paid" version of the service.)

I did a good amount of troubleshooting, following the online instructions. I went further and deleted/reinstalled the app, deleted cache, etc.

Finally I reached to support, which was a frustrating experience. It took 4 days to get a response. Even though my ticket was filled out completely, the rep asked for the info again, then gave me android instructions, then gave me iPhone instructions that don't align with the app behavior. Then they stopped trying. 

I need an app that's reliable and has good support. That's not Alltrails, unfortunately. | App is amazing overall.  Lost a star as you can’t just leave the map screen on while doing an activity.  It times out and goes to sleep.  Not great when running or cycling in the woods. | I have used AllTrails for several years in several countries. It’s been several months since I last used it and so was pleased to see many great enhancements. Keep up the good work! I LOVE this app and I tell all my active friends about it. | Just love this app. Like having a friend along on my walks! Feel confident and secure in knowing where to go. | AllTrails is the perfect app for outdoor enthusiasts! It’s my go to any time I’m visiting another city as I’m always looking for great routes. Thank you! | The maps around my area are always way off. The trails are sometimes up to a quarter mile away from where they really are. There are even 2 trails that are not real trails, not even pathways, but are shown on the map, which makes it difficult to plan hikes or runs. Just take a screenshot of the trail system you are going to hike from your areas parks and rec website, and use the map the old school way. You will be much better off. | Awesome App! So many trails I would not have found without it! | I do a lot of hiking and I can honestly say I’ve never found a more accurate app that can get you through a trail. I hiked El Yunque in Puerto Rico and took a trail that was paved then straight jungle and this app never steered me wrong once. If you hike this is a must. 10/10 recommend | I got a smart watch to be able to use apps like this . The mobile app is great , but the fact that I have to bust out my phone mid trail to use this  and can’t use my Apple Watch Ultra ,is absurd. | Fabulous resource All Trails. A great buddy in the woods- even w/o reception, download before going and voila!

Sometimes info is not entirely up to date re dogs on trails(multiple off leash places that All Trails state dogs need to be on leash). But it’s a very very handy resource 90% of the time. Thanks. | Love finding unsung trails!! | Awesome app, only thing I could ask is if you could add a feature to log an activity as a skate for those that do longboard or inline skate. | Love the app & how easy it is to use and ses beautiful trails all across the country! | Horrible and non-responsive. Can no longer get into my account at alltrails.com with old password or reset password. No help. | simply the best app ever | It’s great. Just buy it. Use it. Love it. Don’t get lost. Have fun. Very easy to use app with an abundance of information! | Excellent hiking app!  I’ve used it all over North America! | Second year as AllTrails + subscriber. Download maps really helps on trails. title: Packr Travel Packing List
description:
Save time before going on a trip with Packr! Packr will help you pack your suitcase for each trip. The packing list is based on your destination (city, country or region), travel dates and activities.

◆ PACKING CHECKLIST ◆

Packr creates a packing checklist for your suitcase from 24 pre-defined activities.
Based on length of stay, weather and planned activities, your packing list will be ready in no time. This is the perfect tool for your summer vacations, long week-ends, road trips and even camping.

◆ LESS STRESS ◆

Every journey is different, each traveler has his own habits. Packr learns from each of your trips to organize the packing checklist, and adjusts the items based on your previous trips.
You will never forget to pack THAT thing again !

◆ BETTER PREPARED ◆

A quantity can be set for each item, some items' quantity will be automatically adjusted to the length of your stay.
You can also create your own packing lists.

◆ PRACTICAL FEATURES ◆

Premium users can synchronize trips on all devices such as iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch.
You can also share the checklist with your travel companions or print it out.


Packr has already travelled several thousand times around planet Earth packing over a million items in each traveller's suitcase.

Packr has been used for trips to cities like Paris, London, Barcelona, New York City, Montreal, Berlin, Majorca... And countries like France, United Kingdom, Spain, Greece, USA, Italy, Canada, Germany and 1000+ more locations.


Terms of Use:
https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/dev/stdeula/
releaseNotes:
Packr version 2.6 is now available.


◆ New features & enhancements ◆ 

Offline mode is now available.

Faster loading of images on the Home Screen.

10 new activity icons.

Easily add custom items to the default lists with a long press in the packing list.

Icons are now grouped by category when adding a new list.

Renaming default list items is now available for Premium users.


◆ Bug Fixes ◆ 

- Fixed minor issues with offline mode.
- Fixed item count when editing the packing lists.
- Fixed crash when adding/editing a List/Activity.
- Fixed "Laundry" button not displaying its correct active state.
- Fixed duplicating a trip to make an identical copy.
- Fixed Contact Us form not sending the message.
- Fixed crashing on Apple Silicon devices.
- Custom pictures can now be selected from the Photo gallery.
- Fixed renaming items in the packing list.
- Fixed trips not appearing for certain timezones.
- Fixed weather not loading correctly.
- Fixed printing of the packing list.
- Fixed TripIt connection.
- Fixed nearby attractions not showing up.



Love the app? Rate us! Your feedback keeps Packr engine running.
Have a question? Tap "Contact us" in the app or send us an email: hello@packr.app
reviews:
I bought the premium version of this app because of the connect to TripIt feature. Unfortunately it would never connect and kept giving me the connecting circle of death that didn’t go anywhere. I contacted tech support and am still awaiting a response 4 weeks now and counting. | I packed everything more quickly than usual and I didn’t forget anything. Will keep using it | I travel a few times per year so I am not a huge traveler. But I did not find this app user friendly. Maybe it just didn’t suit my needs but I’m not impressed. | It has lists that auto populate based on the length of your stay, weather, etc but I really want to just attach my own things in addition, reservations, activities, restaurants. Maybe I just don’t understand this app. And it has nothing to explain it | Not $3, but $3 a month. Super annoying setup where you can just start making a list, you have to put in dates, destinations, and type of trip. I’m looking for a packing list app that lets me input my own lists. Keep it simple. | I’ve been using this app for many years and I’ve been very happy. I only use it once or twice a year and it was free before. I don’t mind paying to keep the app but now it’s wanting me to pay $20 a year. I would be happy to pay $20 just to have the app forever but there’s no way I’m going to pay that every year.I’m very disappointed because I really liked this app | This app told me to bring a scarf to Disneyland this weekend. It’s not going to be cold enough. You need to change your app and only tell people to bring a scarf when it’s below freezing. | Very basic packing list. It is good to include power adapters, health insurance card, but neglects things like an umbrella, hat and jacket and small scissors. Also …for a long trip it suggested 15 shirts …which is ridiculous. I take no more than 5 shirts even if going for months. Clothes can be washed. 
I don’t see any reason to pay for this app. It’s ok I suppose if you don’t already have a packing list of your own. There are many better packing lists for free on websites. | The way the ads appear and they way the interact (close ads overlap, etc), the app is unusable. | Used to be great. Now it’s just ads. How can an app about packing have so many ads? It’s insane. They also deleted all my old packing lists, so I can’t even reference those. Time to find another app. | I downloaded it and immediately opening the app my phone was overloaded with ads inside the app. Absolutely do not like this app at all | I recommend this app to everyone. I particularly hate packing because it’s so stressful, but the customized activity lists make packing a breeze. | Don’t like being forced to watch an ad to use the app | If dobt get premium sibscriptions doesnt seem like you can do much | Update: After using this for a weekend trip, this may not be the app for me. It is extremely frustrating that every time I open the app, it prompts me for an update. However, the App Store does not have an update.

But then all my lists keep getting put out of alphabetical order. This is annoying to find to check out and try to pack. Then items will be added to a person when creating a trip and it is not on the list that I have so where did it come from?

I will be looking for about her app.

———————————————

I am searching for a good packing list. While this one is okay, it is frustrating. I have spent all day trying to load it up with our trips and it is just not user friendly. It is constantly putting my lists out of alphabetical order. So for me to sort it manually within each list and trip is just annoying. I also wish that I could easily remove a person from a trip and changing from multi-trip to single when duplicating a trip. | Updating my review because now there’s offline mode. Great app! | This app makes it so easy to put together a list for packing. As someone who struggles to stay organized, this app helps so much with providing suggested items per planned activity. SO much better than trying to make sure I think of everything on my own. I undoubtedly will either forget something or overpack planning it on my own. | This app is extremely helpful. It customizes your packing lists for the weather at your destination (and can update this). It also customizes it for your planned activities and duration of stay. It is a great way to make sure that you have what you need and don’t forget anything. it is by far the best list of this sort that I have encountered. The only small improvement I might suggest is for long trips on which you will be washing every few days, it would be helpful if you could specify the number of days between each washing so that the app knew what to recommend for packing. Nevertheless, it does a great job. | I’ve never used another tool, but this one has everything I need — pre-built lists, weather forecast and the ability to customize. Love it! | I have used Packr on iPhone and iPad for years. I did not realize there was a Mac app until recently so I downloaded it.

I have tried different packing list apps and packing list methods over the years including a spreadsheet, Notes, a Word document, and other packing list apps. I even tried Macsparky's Reminders packing list idea. I always come back to Packr. Why have I tried other apps if I like Packr? Because I like to try new apps! But I will not stray again. Packr just works for me. I ike that I can make different lists for different needs for different trips and reuse them over and over. 

Thank you for a great app! | I created my trip, selected the categories and when I submitted to continue, it gave me the option to either pay $3/mo or $20/yr for premium or watch an ad. I opted for the ad, because I hadn’t gotten far enough into the app to know if I like it. The full screen, 10-second ad counted down but then it was done, the ad wouldn’t close! The little “x” was there in the top right corner but it didn’t work. I closed and relaunched the app twice, re-created the trip (because it wasn’t saved), and the same thing happened. I could have written out my entire packing list on paper in the time I wasted trying to make this app work. So disappointed. | This app is great, and it just keeps getting better. It works wonderful for multi city vacations or just quick getaways. One of my favorite features is saving customizable list. title: Groupon - Local Deals Near Me
description:
Download Groupon and save up to 70% on the things you need every day. Find great deals on all the best stuff to eat, see, and do near you and around the world.

Whether you’re craving to try a new restaurant downtown, in need of a relaxing massage, looking for a new gym, or daydreaming about a hotel for a tropical getaway, Groupon has you covered with all the unique local experiences and discounts you could ever wish for. 

Get Access to Incredible Deals Near You 
•  Save up to 70% on 1,000s of local deals
•  Browse outstanding discounts and coupons for your favorite hair or beauty salon, pizza place, yoga studio, and more
•  Discover the hottest spots in your city including top-rated restaurants, spas, and gyms

Get Cash Back at Restaurants
•  Dine and get up to 30% cash back at participating Groupon+ restaurants.

Travel for Cheap
•  Find the fanciest hotels and travel to exotic destinations with Groupon Getaways
•  Always find something fun to do on your next trip by turning on your location settings

With the Groupon app you can:
•  Get promo codes and special savings alerts for deals near you, instantly on your mobile device 
•  Buy and redeem deals directly from your mobile device, no need to print vouchers or clip coupons
•  Read customer reviews and write your own
•  Share deals with friends and family
•  Use Apple Pay to buy deals with a single touch

Put down the coupon book and download Groupon to begin exploring the best that your city has to offer, with savings of up to 70%.

Groupon can provide you with real-time recommendations for great deals near you. As with any functionality of this type, continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life. 

Need help? Contact us at https://www.groupon.com/customer_support

title: Hotels.com: Travel Booking
description:
Find and book your perfect somewhere with the Hotels.com app.  
 
GET REWARDED THROUGH OUR APP  
- Access Member Prices* of 10% or more on over 100,000 hotels worldwide. 
- Join One Key™, our travel program that unlocks a world of instant benefits and perks. 
- Earn OneKeyCash™** and use this whenever you want and instantly save on your next trip on Hotels.com, Expedia and Vrbo when you book eligible hotel stays, flights, vacation rentals, car rentals, and more. 
- One Key Silver, Gold and Platinum members can enjoy extra perks at select VIP Access properties. 
 
FIND THE ONE THAT’S JUST RIGHT FOR YOU 
- Choose from over 500,000 properties worldwide.  
- Whether you’re planning a short hotel stay, last minute weekend getaway, long vacation, business trip, or anything in between, we have a property for every kind of travel. 
- Enjoy the flexibility of free cancellation on most hotels***. 
- Compare hotel prices, ratings and amenities side-by-side using our comparison tool. 
- Use Trip Planner to organize your travel plans in one place. Save your favorite hotels, vacation rentals, resorts and more, and share these with friends and family.    
- See the hotel or vacation rental location on a map and read verified guest reviews. 

FAST, EASY, & SECURE BOOKING ON OUR APP  
- It only takes a few taps to book your hotel. 
- Pay now or later on most hotels. 
- Save your payment details to book future trips even faster. 
- Last minute hotel booking. 
 
OUR APP IS YOUR PERFECT TRAVEL COMPANION  
- Save your confirmation and access your hotel or vacation rental booking details anytime – even offline. 
- Easily manage your hotel or vacation rental booking on the go. 
- Contact us or the hotel or vacation rental owner directly from the app. 
- Opt-in for push notifications and we’ll send you updates about your hotel stay. 
 
*Member Prices are available on select hotels to logged in members and app users. The discount will be applied to the price of selected hotels (excluding applicable taxes and other fees). Subject to terms and conditions, see site for details.  
**OneKeyCash™ is not redeemable for cash and can only be used on Expedia, Hotels.com and Vrbo.  
***Free cancellation on most hotels. Some hotels require you to cancel at least 24-48 hours before check-in. See property pages on our app for details.  
 
The Hotels.com app uses information for analytics, personalization, and advertising. By downloading our hotel app, you agree to our privacy and cookies policies https://hotels.com/customer_care/privacy.html.
releaseNotes: We continue to update our app to help you find your perfect somewhere.

title: Pin Traveler: Travel Tracker
description:
Can’t remember the name of that place you visited last summer? Want to create a wishlist for your future travels? Pin Traveler is here to help you keep track of your trips all around the world and share them with whoever you want!

Keep track of countries, states, and cities on your map, and discover your travel stats. Effortlessly add details to your pins such as your travel dates, favorite restaurants, and points of interest. Share your world with friends and family with a single tap.

With Pin Traveler:
• Search and Pin any city, country, or location, including states
• See fun stats like your farthest or most visited pin
• Share your map with friends and family
• Create a wishlist of your potential future destinations or custom lists by using pin colors
• Save the details of your trips to remember your favorite restaurants, shops, and sights
• Add dates to your locations to view your trips in chronological order
• Associate photos with your visits and locations
• Synchronize your data across your various Apple Devices

Why you’ll love Pin Traveler:
• Specialization: Visiting one city doesn't mean you want to mark the entire country! With Pin Traveler, you have the full flexibility of choosing what you want to mark on your map
• Personalization: Customize your map with options ranging from pin colors, using flags or map styles
• Sharing: You can share an image of your travel map, or a link to our interactive web-map to share your pins with everyone you want
• Privacy-focused: feel free to take your account private anytime restricting all access from outsiders
• Built & Designed by a travel enthusiast, just like you

If you enjoy using Pin Traveler and would show us your support make sure to leave us a 5-star review!

For questions, comments, or support; send us an email at hello@pintravelerapp.com or use the feedback button in the app.

Stickers and in-app artwork created by Lucille Miao.

Instagram, Twitter: @PinTravelerApp
Website: https://pintravelerapp.com

==========================

Introducing Premium Membership
Free users are able to pin up to 50 pins for free and save 10 points of interest (such as restaurants, museums, etc.) per pin. They can also add an unlimited number of travel dates to their pins and change their pin colors/labels without any restrictions. Premium tier users have unlimited usage in all services along with the ability to upload an unlimited number of photos.

Premium tier subscription payments are made through your iTunes Account and automatically renew at the expiration of your membership period, starting at the end of your trial. Cancel at any time by turning off auto-renewal in your Account Settings at least 24 hours before the expiration of your membership period, any unused trial days will be forfeited.

Terms & Conditions: https://pintraveler.net/terms_of_use.pdf

==========================
releaseNotes:
3.12.0 Update - New Trips Page
- Exciting changes are coming to trips! In order to prepare ourselves better for the changes coming we are introducing a brand new Trip Details page that lets you see your photos full screen.
- Trips can now have dedicated cover photos.
- Wishlist transparency has been retired in place of lightly colored pins.
- Small UI tweaks to show more details about your trips and pins!
reviews:
I have used the Pin Traveler app to journal over 100 trips taken over the last 49 years.   The interface is well designed making it easy to quickly add new trips.  I especially like that there are several ways to display my travel history through maps, photos, timelines or through various statistics.   I tried several other travel journaling apps and Pin Traveler by far is the best app for my needs. | Five times | Pin Traveler is an amazing app for anyone who wants to track all of the information on their trips. I was previously using a spreadsheet to track my trips and this app takes it to a new level. Highly recommended for anyone who wants to have a digital record of their trips or plan new trips. | Very little features that are engaging. I paid and then canceled membership before it renewed (months before annual subscription would expire) and was never able to oh back in. It’s an annual subscription and I got about a month of it. | I have been using Pin Traveler for a number of years and it just keeps getting better and better.  I can easily organize my pins into trips with discreet stops and select my own master image for the trip if I choose.  With descriptions for each stop I can incorporate trip journal items.  Trips now show a line connecting all stops in sequence which is so valuable.  I also organize all my trips images across pins.  

I have 279 pins across 67 countries so indeed it is a must for me.

As important, the developers for pin traveler continue to be receptive to suggestions. | This is such a great way to document and journal all of your travel | I love this app!  I have been anle to pin every place I have been  over my lifetime!  With the new categories you can now now customize it for your special places, like my UNESCO Wirld Heritage Sites. | I used to keep a travel map with pins, but it became awkward and outdated.  I looked for a replacement and found Pin Traveler when I'd just begun an island cruise to Greece.  I loved dropping pins for every island and historic site I visited.  I loved it so much that I purchased the Lifetime Membership within days of installing it. 

I gave it only four stars, as I sometimes find navigating the features awkward and non-intuitive.  Reading the help solves some of that, but my biggest hurdle is lumping pins into a single trip.  And once a pin is dropped, it's hard (for me) to add it to a trip.  I'm hoping a new feature including easy to create and edit multi-stop trips will be added.

Additionally, since Apple has made it possible for some iPhone apps to work on Macs as well, I have been trying this out on an M2 MacBook Pro. It seems to work well, is stable, and using the trackpad as a "pinch and drag" device works well. 

I hghly recommend thi app, and I look forward to the updates and improvements coming soon. | What a great app! I really like a record of places I’ve traveled to. Thanks! | Amazing app that lets you track your travels! Customer support is swift and reliable! Highly recommend! | I was looking for an easy way to track the places, states, cities, and countries that I have been to and experienced over my lifetime. Doing it the “old fashioned way” of pinning a world map was no longer working for me. I came upon the Pin Traveler app and quickly discovered that it is a great tool! Full disclosure, I recently needed to extend the app to my iPad and admittedly mistyped my email address. I reached out to the app owner and they were very swift and helpful! I highly recommend this to everyone who enjoys traveling! | Simple and easy to use with room for improvement. | This is a perfect tool to keep track of your travels. It is easy to use, and works as advertised. Fun! | I've been looking for a substitute for TripAdvisor's Travel Map for some time.  This is it. These guys have a simple, clean, and robust platform. Unlike trip advisor they are extremely helpful and the data is yours...not trapped behind some protected server.  I'm moving all my pins over now and they even have offered to help make the switch!  

Thanks guys. Great App. | Excellent, but how would you even be able to obtain the North Korea flag(unless you’re an important person)? | It’s very hard to use. I keep changing the color of the pins…….they are still red. | If you have been to more than 50 places you have to pay! No thanks! Removing app from my device! | The title of my review says it all. You cannot do anything without joining so it was wasted time to download. | This is by far the best travel journal I have!
I tried mutiple ones and this is the only one
 I ended up keeping and loving! Sure you have to pay for a lifetime premium but it's like buying yourself a travel diary and it will store all your memories forever! Every feature that I wanted on a travel diary is on this app! Add as many photos to every country you went too, pin places you've been to in that country and you can even specify which city you went to and also add photos and pins to that specific city!

The developers are very responsive and has good communication when I had problems. They never leave it unresolved!

This app has gotten better with the updates since I started using it back and 2021! Love love love this app! I can't wait to see what it has to offer this year! 
Loving the new Valentines heart pin, btw 🩷 | This is a great way to document your travels. I have been using this app for almost a year and it is my go to travel app. I document all my trips on the app, add tons of pictures and now it even has a route map which is very cool. The two developers are always working on new ideas and are very receptive to suggestions. You can even go back in and put in past trips and countries you have visited. Can’t say enough for this app!! | This program supercharges the old concept of putting pins in a map. The zoom in zoom out feature on the world maps gives a fantastic ability to see an overview or detail of places visited. The number of countries visited or the percentage of countries in the world visited allows a clear picture of how far your travels have taken you. Truly outstanding for a visualization of your travel history. | I have wanted and easy way to keep track of all the places I have been and this is sooooo it! I searched through so many apps like it but they were all way too complicated and not as easy to use as pin traveler! Totally recommend for any traveler. The only thing that I don’t like is that premium is expensive. I would totally get it because I love the app but I’m a broke student traveler who is spending all my money on new trips soooo I can’t spend the money but maybe one day! Love this app though! Totally recommend! | Best travel destination tracking app ever. | Premium kinda dumb, too expensive but nothing is that much better, it is worth it for the memories | The first explore I got for a place had as #1 a restaurant across a river from the neighborhood I chose. It also listed a place that has been closed for three years. | Une superbe application pour suivre nos voyages et se rappeler des chemins parcourus ! | Such a user friendly way to keep all your travel locations (and possibly memories) in one place. Every time I open the app I get a big picture of where I want to go next. | You will be limited to 50 pins if you don’t pay for some version. | Was so great until they put all of the features that used to be free behind a pay wall. You barely get any access without paying $25/year. Don’t download it. | Gives you a max of 50 pins then wants money. Really? $2.99 a week??  Other options and all over priced. Deleting after posting review | I am a frequent International traveler. Pin traveler has been a joy to use to keep track of countries and cities I have visited. 

I recently had to resolve a question about my subscription and the guys at Pin Traveler were a pleasure to deal with, very quick responses, and everything was straightened out immediately. 

Great app with excellent customer service. I highly recommend it to anyone who travels and would like to easily keep a log of their journeys. | I like it, it works as advertised
I really use it just for the pin feature to see almost the exact places I’ve been but it’s pretty cool 👍 | I’m addicted to this app. It’s exactly what I’ve been looking for to document my travels! This app would be perfect if you could list the places costed such as restaurants etc like you can fit the cities costed instead of having to tap into a city pin. | By far the best "places traveled" app. I use it very simply (just pin places I've been and then wishlist places I want to go to) but it's perfect and elegant and doesn't pressure you too spend money. And the nifty extra features are very cool. Thank you for making this!!! | 50 free pins, then $40 to continue. Would have been nice to know in the beginning. Delete. | Finally after years of looking for a travel diary, and over 10 travel diary apps downloaded and removed, I finally found what I’m looking for. This has everything I have searched for, all the features I looked for, finally found in this one app. This app should be renamed “Pin Travel Journal Diary. For years I would search apps with search keywords “travel diary” or “travel Journal” in the apple App Store and unfortunately this app never popped up. I believe its due to the keyword “pin”. This app is amazing! It has the capability of so much! These features include, jotting down your travel experiences like you would in a travel journey, you adding photos, Pinning locations on world map, display country flags that you visited, notates the number of places visited, provides a wishlist of places you want to visit, there is so much more! The one thing that I believe this app should try to include in the future is the ability to create a photo book. This would be another benefit or option to be available for users. I love this app. Thank you developers! | Only allows 50 destinations for free version.. pretend users to pay iver $20/year for full service | I found this app a couple of years ago and I love it! It is such a great way to keep track of all our travels around the world. | Can’t type in national parks or smaller towns. Only allows pins of major cities. Rather useless. | I use this to document each new city that I send an order to with my business. I love keeping track on how far my designs have reached around the world. Thank you!! 🧡 | Limiting free users to only 50 destinations is a waste of my time. | They want annual subscription for you to map more than 50 pins.   Very disappointed. | Don’t appreciate being told about about costs associated with this app after you register into an account | This app is good but they can improve you should be able to type In a address.and you should be able to put pictures on the address 
For free. | I have a job role that allows me to travel, plus I have always liked to get out and see the world. Using Pin Traveler is a great way to keep track, I would recommend it to anyone. | I like the app and especially the potential of the app as they make improvements. Using this as our trip journal. Can just click on a stay and see note Anne’s photos related specifically to that stay. You can also just see your total status across many trips. Very responsive to my email. | Been looking for an app like this for years. Really happy to have found it. Great place to memorialize trips and to add places to visit in the future.  Support was really helpful too. Love this app!!! | This is such a great app but it’s very confusing to use in order to get stats on your various trips. | Limits you to 50 places then tries to rip you off for their subscription nonsense what a scam | While I’ll go for in app purchases but when the download immediately demands purchase without providing any service I call it a scam.

title: IHG Hotels & Rewards
description:
Guest how you guest when you book one of our 6,000+ hotels — and earn rewards.  

IHG Hotels & Resorts: 6,000+ destinations. 19 hotel brands. 1 app.
Earn rewards when you book with any of our hotel brands from our IHG One Rewards app. From family-friendly stays at Holiday Inn hotels, to business-ready accommodations at Crowne Plaza hotels, to luxury getaways at Iberostar Beachfront Resorts, we have a brand designed for however you like to stay.

We make booking simple
When you download the IHG One Rewards app, travel becomes a breeze! The app makes everything simple at every point of your journey — from booking to check-in and checkout. Quickly book and re-book a hotel in seconds, then add hotels to your Wishlists for future visits. Whenever you’re ready to find your next destination, you can easily filter hotels by rates, distance, and amenities.

There’s more! With Wi-Fi Auto Connect, you can automatically connect to free Wi-Fi upon arrival at our hotels. Speaking of arrival, our app allows you to digitally check in (or out) at your hotel, saving you some time in your travels. Want to get a better view of the area around your hotel? Our app can be your guide, where you can see what restaurants, streets, and shops are nearby.

Access everything you need
With the IHG One Rewards app, you can access all your trip details, get trip reminders, modify or cancel your reservations, and view expenses from your current stay. Need directions, parking info, or a list of hotel amenities? The app has you covered.

Get rewarded 
Access exclusive member rates and offers, earn points to use for free nights, and rack up Milestone Rewards like Food & Beverage Rewards and Confirmable Suite Upgrades. With our free and secure app, you can easily keep track of your points and benefits, pay now or later with Points & Cash, and discover more ways to earn and redeem. Not a member yet? Sign up for free in the app to access more perks and exclusive offers.

Travel with ease
Enjoy flexible booking options with free cancellation on most rates. Rest easy with world-class cleaning processes and get notified on the latest travel news. Need help? Chat with us in the app or speak directly with one of our customer care representatives. Whenever, wherever, and however you travel, we’re here for you.

Connect with us 
Website: https://www.ihg.com 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ihghotels/ and https://www.instagram.com/ihgonerewards/?hl=en 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/IHGOneRewards/ 
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@ihghotels

Our brands 

Holiday Inn®
Holiday Inn Express®
Holiday Inn Club Vacations®
Holiday Inn Resort®
InterContinental® Hotels & Resorts
Six Senses® Hotels, Resorts & Spas
Regent® Hotels & Resorts
Kimpton® Hotels & Restaurants
voco® Hotels
Hotel Indigo®
EVEN® Hotels
HUALUXE® Hotels & Resorts
Crowne Plaza® Hotels & Resorts
Iberostar Beachfront Resorts
Garner ™
Avid® Hotels
Staybridge Suites®
Atwell Suites™
VignetteTM Collection
Candlewood Suites®

title: Packing List Checklist
description:
"All in all, this is exactly what I needed for traveling, and if you travel a lot, something like this is essential." - The Common Ryan

Packing List Checklist is an easy to use app that provides you with a checklist of all the important things to consider and pack before traveling.

——— PICK SUGGESTED ITEMS ———
 
Get up and running with very little effort by using our Pick Suggested Items feature.

You will be able to pick items from these categories: Essentials, Accessories, Baby, Backpack / Carry On, Beach, Camping, Clothing, Electronics, Food, Healthcare, Makeup, Shoes, Toiletries and many more!

That's it: your list will be ready without any typing involved!

——— SYNC YOUR LISTS ———
 
Created your list on your iPad but want to check it on your iPhone? Got a new iOS device and want to see your lists there?

With iCloud sync we've got you covered: your lists will be with you on all your iOS devices as long as you are using the same Apple ID in them.

——— SET REMINDERS ———

Want to make sure that you are not leaving anything behind? Just set up a reminder, get a notification at the right time and relax!

——— MANAGE ITEM QUANTITIES ———
 
Set the quantities for your Packing List items.
 
——— TO DO & TO PACK ———
 
After a lot of research we reached the conclusion that the best way to go through your travel preparation is to distinguish the actions that you need to take before and during travel from the things that you need to pack.
 
That’s why each list has two sections: To-Do & To Pack.
 
——— CREATE YOUR OWN CATEGORIES ———
 
Organize your items by grouping them into different categories.
You will be able to create as many categories as you need, and you can pick an emoji to better differentiate them.
 
——— REUSE YOUR EXISTING LISTS ———
 
This is one of the best kept secrets of every seasoned traveller. Keep refining your list, and reach sorcerer-level packing skills. You’ll soon forget why you ever packed for your travels differently in the past!
 
——— QUESTIONS OR FEEDBACK? ———
 
We love hearing from you and we read every single email you send us!
Have suggestions? Please, feel free to reach us at info@packingli.st
releaseNotes:
• Bug fixes

Your opinion matters a lot to us! If you have any feedback please send us an email to info@packingli.st.

Don’t see any instructions. | Purchasing the new Apple 15 Pro Max made a number of my purchased apps not work any longer; especially my list for packing with Triplist. It also allowed the weather app to work with it so I know what type of clothing to bring. They didn’t keep it up but I at least had my dates of my trips and my list of items needed for each trip. I would like to be able to personalize this app a little bit like put in background picture of each trip and add the weather even if it’s in Europe, etc. But I’m happy I found some thing that works so I don’t forget important items. | I absolutely love this app and have used it for years now. Favorite features include being able to duplicate checklists and/or pick items from other ones; customize to-do’s; add emojis to categories and easily make changes to categories; uncheck all items if using the same list. It’s super user-friendly and flexible. | I’ve been using it for a few years and love the ability to copy from one trip to another to create a new list, the ability to share lists with someone else who’s on the pro version, and overall its versatility. Highly recommend. | I really love this app. Definitely worth upgrading. It’s easy to use and syncs across iOS devices. We have different packing lists for different types of trips. And for backpacking we breakdown what goes where in our packs. Wish list: web or max interface. List sharing with your packing partner. | I was ashen when this app started collapsing at start. Not even working. | Got a new iPhone and now the app will not open at all | Getting ready for trip and tired of forgetting something so looked for a packing list app. Downloaded a bunch, paid and free. Some too confusing, some way to basic. I didn’t want to spend a lot, or do a subscription. This had a very reasonable one-time fee. Installed on both iPad & iPhone. You can either have one primary list for every trip and just check off the things you won’t need and go from there, or you can create separate lists for the different kinds of trips you take and who you have going with you, if you need to pack for them. Pack is the best reminder app of all. | App used to open and now it doesnt | Used to love this but now it doesn’t even open any more. Sad to see. | There’s no way to create an account. I honestly don’t know what I did before. It’s super easy to use and works great! | The developer responded to my email about retrieving info from the cloud. I haven’t tried it because I ended up starting over. But I did appreciate the response and the effort to address my problem! Still love the app!
********

If you’re looking for a tool that, as one example, allows you to sync lists with your spouse, family, friends, the native Reminders app meets the need, whereas this app does not. A let down. Worst of all, developer is nowhere to be found. | Helps me stay so organized and I never forget anything

title: Roadie: Road Trip Planner & RV
description:
Plan epic road trips with Roadie. It's a clean and simple route planner for roadtrippers and campers like you - no matter if you map out your annual cross-country road trip or you live the #vanlife dream and explore the world in your campervan. Nothing beats the freedom of the open road.

PLAN MULTI-STOP ROUTES

Plan your trip itinerary on an interactive map and pin as many locations on the map as you need. Search locations of attractions, trails, or national parks and save points of interest in a list. You can now add your personal notes to every stop.

SEE DISTANCES & DRIVING TIMES

See distances connecting the road trip waypoints and know the driving times between multiple stops. Easily plan your time on the road and your gas and fuel consumption.

SHARE YOUR TRIP (like Google My Maps)

Share your trip and collaborate with friends on finding the most interesting sights and the best places to stay the night.

FIND PLACES ALONG THE ROUTE (like Roadtrippers)

Use search shortcuts to quickly find good restaurants, interesting sights or good value campsites. Type "pizza" or "burger" in the search to display these places on the map. Or just click on any place or POI in the map and add it to your list of stops or starred places.

MARK FAVORITE PLACES

Star places to visit and save them for later on the interactive map. You can add a note to be reminded of why you want to visit this place. Once you are on the highway or you map out your next road trip it is easy for you to see if one of your saved places is nearby and you can add it to your route.

USE OFFLINE & NAVIGATE

Change the order of places to visit with an easy-to-use drag-and-drop. Use the app offline while you drive on the highway and never miss out on attractions and sights along your route. Start the navigation with one click in your preferred navigation app and get driving directions in Apple Maps, Google Maps or Waze.

EXPORT & IMPORT YOUR ROUTES

You can make a backup of all of your routes by exporting them in GPX format. You can import them into Google My Maps or share them with friends.

MORE FEATURES COMING SOON

We're constantly updating and improving the app and its functionality. If you think something is missing or if you have any other feedback please share your idea with us. Just write an email to support@getroadie.app

———

You can use the Roadie Road Trip Planner app free of charge forever. There are some restrictions in the free version, though. For example, you can only add up to 30 stops to your routes.

All restrictions can be removed by purchasing the “Premium Membership”. You can buy the lifetime membership ($35.99) and pay only once or buy a monthly/yearly membership subscription. Prices may vary by location. Subscriptions will be charged to your credit card through your App Store account. Subscriptions are offered for either 1-month ($2.49) or 1-year ($17.99) periods. They will automatically renew unless canceled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. You can turn off auto-renew at any time from your App Store account settings. Free trials may only be used once. Any unused portion of a free trial will be forfeited if you purchase a subscription.

———

Terms of Service: https://getroadie.app/terms

Privacy Policy: https://getroadie.app/privacy_policy
releaseNotes: We've improved the search for places on the map and added more search categories.
reviews:
Just wanted to say what a great app this is!  So pleased to have everything at our fingertips vs having to use 4 different apps for things like gas stations, rest stops and offbeat attractions.  

Well done | I’ve used Roadie twice to take a long road trip, and loved it both times. it’s extremely easy to use simply plug in your destinations and add them to your route. it offers a way to kind of schedule/rearrange your itinerary, which is extremely helpful. You can use the itinerary to plan out how long each day will be or what you plan on doing each day of your trip. I did what seem to be bugs in certain areas. For example I was planning a trip that was going on the “Going to The Sun” road and for some reason it kept calculating the route going around the whole park to the other side. | I can’t fully commit to paying for premium if I can’t see what I am paying for.  I need an app I can commit to for my trips. There’s not enough with the free version to make an informed decision.  So I will go with the competitor RoadTripper. With that I can see what I am paying for. Too bad. I was open to trying something different from the usual. 

Unfortunately they lost me as a customer from the beginning.  Maybe in the future they’ll change this and I can consider them for my next series of trips. 

Roadie if your reading this, please consider. | Free version is worthless. Maybe it’s better if you pay. | I would use this app over Google maps but they make you pay just to invite your friends to your map which is kinda stupid considering that majority of the times you are going to want to share with friends | Love the idea, but tons of little issues that make it super annoying to try and use. Definitely not subscribing for another month but I appreciate their efforts. Maybe in another few iterations it'll get to a product that feels pleasant to use. | What is the point of this app VS just going straight to Apple Maps?  This still just takes you to Apple Maps and in fact makes it a lot less seem-less. Bugged I wasted my money because I forgot to cancel before trail was up and was charged for a full year. Not sure where they got all their good reviews. | The app was everything I wanted while planning my road trip from Kentucky to Utah and California!  Super easy to use and works great, and I like that I was able to name stops and split it up into sections so it made it easy to keep track of what day I was planning each stop! | I’ve spent 15 minutes playing and find it way to lacking on everything. I cannot even find the way to read the step by step instructions for a route.

Very minimal web site also. Not discussion that I see about the Premium at all.

Not enough reviews to be rated after 3 years.

I feel they need a macOS app as I prefer using a real keyboard and a larger screen display to plan my trips. Yes, the iPad app will run on an M1 Mac albiet in a tiny screen window.

I'll stick with the great Road Trip Planner - far more features. | After easily installing, I had issues with the app. Mainly text and print not lining-up correctly. Deleted and will stick with Waze. | Used the app for road-tripping all over the West. Convenient and effective. The developers are accessible and ultra responsive. Totally worth the upgrade! | I thought I would be able to put in multiple stops and build a itinerary but, I don’t think it allows and the app is not user friendly. | ဆက်မသုံးတော့ဘူး | This is the app I would have made - super fast, clean, simple, but still has everything you need to plan a trip. Extremely well done, I bought the lifetime immediately (thank you for having that as an option and not forcing me into a subscription plan). | Just getting started. So far, simple & easy to read. | Not paying for an app that you can't try first. | I was hoping to import a trip into this app hoping to use some of its features, but all I get is an error. Tried several different trip files and restarting ect, but nothing has worked. Wish I could get the $30 bucks back. | Very disappointed the the paid version of this app. I was hoping to use the app to plan ahead and see stops to add along the way. We are going from texas to Florida, I mapped the route, clicked hotels and it showed a group of hotels in north Arkansas (a state we are not even entering). The companies soliton is too zoom in, piece by piece rather being able to conclusively plan the trip, we have too basically look 4-5 times but by bit. There is not way better than any free app such as Google Maps to plan a route. In fact google maps actually shows things “along the route”. | Easy to use and share plans.
Wish I could plan day of driving or have app auto plan days. Seeing upcoming weather and better ‘attractions’ highlights would make it a killer app. | Hard to navigate, adds stops out of order and you can’t change them. It’s impossible to sort out. Canceling | Can’t find and add stops, can’t get alternative routes for entire trip. | Love this app.. work better than road warriors | We downloaded the app to find scenic routes, and interesting things along the way. Attractions, Gas Stations, Campsites, Hotels, Parks, etc. are all behind the paywall. Without purchasing the premium subscription, it’s a less useful map app. | This app is paid app when most are free | I love the interface. Very easy to use and can search for just about anything I type into the map search. The smart insert feature is also great when adding a new point to your route in the middle. It gives you estimated miles and times between your points so you know how long/far you will be traveling any leg. Your can save trip routes for planning more than one trip at a time (2 in free version, infinite in purchased version). 
As I pull a travel trailer (RV) for my trips, there are a few things I would like to see added and be able to test in the free version before I purchase the upgrade.
1- allow specs of my travel trailer (length, height, weight, propane on board) to be entered so the app can map around any low clearance bridges, weight limited roads, propane limited tunnels, hairpin turns, etc. to be sure the road mapped is safe for travel with my RV.
2- ability to identify specified miles and/or time travel down a route so that a campground/stay search can be done in that area. Currently, I take a guess by sight, add a random stay point to the route and see how long/far it takes to get there. If wrong, remove point, guess further up or back and repeat until my miles/time is close to what I want to travel in a leg. It’s functional but could be made much easier if the app can just pin a point in the route at how far/long you want to travel as an option.

With these 2 functionality adds, this app would be worth purchasing for me. | I hate that so many apps these days say they’re free but once you start trying to maneuver around the app, you find out you can’t do much of anything without paying some monthly or annual fee. | After paying for the app, as the free version would not allow me to complete my trip, I found it kept rerouting me to roads I did not want to travel on. Would not allow me to select the road I wanted. It is like a section of the road did not exist even though it shows the road on the map. I attempted to use the Contact Us (send an email) and it does not work. Fortunately they only got one months worth of payment out of me. The trip I am planning is on the Blue Ridge Parkway. Once you purchase the app they provide a sample trip of the Blue Ridge Parkway and it is jacked up too.

Update:  after contacting the developer they did a great job of explaining the issue and provide a resolution. Response from developer was fast and professional. I will continue to use the app for my upcoming trips. | When I opened the app, it grabbed a location near me from GPS and made it my home location. When I attempted to change it to my actual address, I was prompted to upgrade to the full version to be able to do so. Really? How are you supposed to plan a trip without setting a starting point?

Failure to be able to change even the most basic information without paying for the full version renders the app unusable to me. I can understand that adding locations, or notes, would require an update to the full version, but preventing a user from setting up a basic profile is pretty unforgivable. Deleting this app immediately! | This is not a very good user friendly app and I wish I had never purchased it!!!! Sad :-( | So easy to use. Can’t wait to plan more trips | Was trying to plan a road trip from Illinois - Oregon - California - Oregon - Illinois and this app was just perfect for giving us the ability to plan out stops for fuel, find great rest stops along the way and even some crazy attractions.
I would recommend this app to anyone who is wanting to plan any kind of road trip. On my trip back to Illinois, I was able to follow Rte 66 and see all of the attractions that I have been wanting to go see. 
The only thing that I had to watch out for was when finding the next stop on my route was that the ‘Smart Add’ feature sometimes inserted the stop in the wrong place so it had me going backwards at a couple of points. But other than that, this is a great app. Thanks for making it happen. | Downloaded the free version, worthless, doesn’t make me want to pay for upgrade, put locations in bizarre order, making the trip twice as long as needed, says you can tap and drag to change order of places? How? Guess you have to pay?
Useless! | This app would be a 10/10 if it had landscape mode!!!

Update: landscape mode added! It’s awesome now. | Love the concept. It started basic but getting better and it appears the developers listened to feedback and have since updated the app to make it even better. | The app says it works on iPad and iPhone.  I downloaded it on my iPad.  It wouldn’t orient itself with the iPad.  It only works when the iPad is held vertically.  My case prevents that.  I then tried it on my iPhone X.  I was able to creat an account.with no trouble.  However, when I tried to actually use the app, it would send me to location services in settings.  This continued even after I enabled everything for the app.  I’ve defeated the app and will look for one that I can actually plan trips on. | Handles multiple stops very elegantly, love that collaboration is now possible. Overall very intuitive to use. Would love to see a smart order feature that orders all stops in a route and/or section, and would also be a nice to have to calculate the price of fuel for the trip. 

Once you’re on the road I could also see a good feature being what is easily accessible for the next 5 or so exits. Often we’re looking for a bathroom or something to eat and by the time we figure out whether it’s on our side of the freeway we’ve passed the exit 😂

Glad to have this app, and have had a lovely experience with any communication with the development team. | This is a great simple app for planning a road trip. Love the design and simplicity, and the developer is very responsive to feedback. | It’s an app that just draws a line from one place to another, and you can add stops along the way. Not much else. If it does any of the other things- I can’t find out how because there’s like 6 buttons and the ui is bad. | This is a great app. Would like just a couple more options but a really great app. Thank you!!

title: CheckMyTrip – Travel Itinerary
description:
CheckMyTrip is your digital travel assistant, bringing you flight information and alerts, travel services and extras to get you smoothly from door to door. And it’s free.  

Ideal for both business and leisure travelers, CheckMyTrip will help you travel smooth, reduce stress and stay on top of your travel plans.

SMART TRIP ITINERARIES
- Real-time updates of your flight bookings for FREE, including delays, cancellations and terminal changes plus layover times  
- View your trip in a master itinerary with all your bookings, including flight and accommodation, both online and off  

ADDING TRIPS IS EASY  
3 simple ways to add and organize your itinerary details.  
- Forward booking confirmation e-mails to trips@checkmytrip.com  
- Ask your assistant to import the trip automatically by using your booking reference number  
- Send the trip details to your assistant to create the trip for you  

DIGITAL ASSISTANT  
Your personal travel assistant to help you at every step of your trip.  
- Flight delay, cancellation, boarding gate notifications  
- Check-in reminders 
- 5-day weather forecast  
- Search and reserve airport transfer and lounge  
- Recommendations for local activities  

**IMPORTANT REMINDER**  
CHECKMYTRIP IS NOT A TRAVEL BOOKING AGENCY  
We only display information related to the trip details you add to your CheckMyTrip account. To modify, cancel or source additional information about your air, hotel, car, rail, taxi, parking, tour and activity booking, contact the provider directly for assistance.

We respect your privacy. Check our privacy policy. https://checkmytrip.com/privacy-policy  

By downloading the app, you accept the Terms & Conditions of use. https://checkmytrip.com/terms-and-conditions/  

If you have any questions, please contact us by e-mail at feedback@checkmytrip.com
releaseNotes:
In this release, we've added two exciting features to enhance your travel experience:
- Easily sync your travel plans with any calendar app, keeping essential details at your fingertips for a smooth journey.
- Your feedback matters! Share your thoughts by rating CheckMyTrip directly through the app, guiding us to continually improve and tailor the experience to your needs.

title: My Travel Planner App
description:
With My Travel Planner App, your vacation just got easier! Now all the details of your trip are conveniently stored in your pocket. Don’t waste time searching your email inbox for your flight times, or scrolling through text messages for the name of the company you are going jet skiing with. This app will hold all the details of your adventure - whether you are connected to WiFi or off the grid.

BOOK AND GO!

Have you booked with your vacation specialist? Are you excited for your next getaway? Now keep all of your vacation plans together with Travel Planner! From your cruise itinerary details to your land tours, track the details of your trip!

PLANS IN YOUR HANDS

After planning your dream getaway with your vacation specialist, they will send you an itinerary for each trip they book you on complete with all relevant details and their contact information. You will have a record for all travel plans including: shore excursions, tour details, dining reservations, accommodations, departures, arrivals and anything else you and your vacation specialist have planned for your amazing getaway. Your vacation specialist will provide the information on hotels, flights, cruises, restaurants, landmarks and more! Itineraries get synced into this app so you can make sure you are on time to have a great time every time.

CONNECT EVEN IF YOU AREN’T CONNECTED

Don’t rely on a WiFi connection to get you to where you need to go. Our app has offline access so no matter what corner of the globe you are at, you will have information at your fingertips to let you know the next adventure.

MANAGE MULTIPLE TRIPS

Frequent traveler? Fantastic! Your vacation specialist can include multiple trips within this app, so you have all your vacation details on your one mobile device. This way, you can sit back and relax on your current vacation, without having to worry about the details for your next one!
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and improvements
reviews: The only flaw in this app is the lack of notification for the message feature. When clients aren’t notified of a conversation it’s hard to keep everyone in the loop when you need them to be. This main feature is the only reason I haven’t given up Facebook completely for communication.

title: Klook: Travel, Hotels, Leisure
description:
Download Klook to find deals for the best things to do for anytime, anywhere.

A World of Possibilities
There are nearly half a million travel activities across the world waiting for you on Klook. From sightseeing trips and hotel bookings to immersive cultural experiences, we're here to guide you to your world of joy.

Trusted & Top-rated Activities
Explore handpicked experiences and get local insights for hundreds of destinations. Museums in Singapore? Tour packages in South Korea? Or some family attractions nearby? When you're on Klook, you're seeing the best of every place in your hands.

Experiences Made Easy
We make e-booking fast with instant confirmation and skip-the-line tickets on selected attractions. Whether it’s chasing waves on a Phuket vacation package, tasting wine in Melbourne or finding out what’s fun for the weekend in your area, you're just a few taps away from booking whatever makes you happy.

Unlock Gold on Klook Rewards for Exclusive Perks 
- Earn up to 3x more Klook credits
- Get up to US$95 in promo codes 
- Skip the line for premium customer support 
- Early access to top deals
- Special Gold-only prices
You can elevate your Klook experience to Gold when you spend US$380 or make 5 purchases of at least US$30 per year.

And a Whole Lot More
- Budgeting when travelling? Use Klook-exclusive promo codes to save on the best deals 
- Redeem your tickets and e-vouchers or download them for easy offline access
- Save your bucket-list holiday ideas to your wishlist and book later
- Choose from trains, buses, cars and even ferries to get around
- Get movie and event ticket discounts and bundles

Find us and say hello!
- Official website: www.klook.com
- Facebook: @klookglobal
- Twitter: @klooktravel
- Instagram: @klooktravel

Got ideas for us? Let us know at appfeedback@klook.com. Thanks bestie.
releaseNotes:
What small thing brought you joy today? For us, it's you reading this! 

Not much to update this round - just some bug fixes and performance updates.

Got ideas for us? Let us know at appfeedback@klook.com. Thanks bestie.
reviews:
Do not use this app for travel. They thrive on people panic booking and booking travel/events too soon with no cancellation policy. They will just take your money and run. No forgiveness or flexibility is given to rebook and even if they say they “will look into it” you will never hear from them again. I even offered to take “credits” to rebook the same travel and still nothing. | This app will show you results for hotels in Tokyo with what seems like very good prices but every hotel that I wanted to book, the app would say that there was 1 room left but then when you go to book, it would show no more rooms available. Repeat the search and the same hotels come up again. The app is a complete waste of time for booking hotels in Japan. Use booking.com or Agoda. Much better apps that only show you hotels that are available at time of search. | Easy to buy and quick to redeem. | We are very excited and happy | I’ve booked 3 different experiences around Thailand and the Philippines- amazing 🤩 | Klook is an excellent app to have while traveling in Asia. | great app | Never ever go with Klook. I had a really bad experience with KLOOK. I purchased ticket for Langkawi Cable Car. But the ticket could not be printed and I tried to reach Klook but they did not response. The receptionist leaves to the back and never comes back out so we can’t even talk to anyone.
