title: Lyft
description:
Get where you’re going with Lyft.

Whether you’re catching a flight, going out for the night, commuting to the office, or running errands in a rush, the Lyft app offers you multiple ways to get there.

EASY TO USE
Enter your destination. See your route and ride cost up front. Choose Priority Pickup to get going quick. Boom. Done. Simple

CHOOSE YOUR WHEELS
Choose from Wait & Save, Priority Pickup, Bikes & Scooters, Lyft XL, Lyft Lux, Transit, or even Rentals.

AFFORDABLE RIDES
Our Wait & Save option helps you get around for less. And you can find the fastest public transit routes, too.

* Lyft ride types may vary by region. Check the app to see what is available in your city.
—
Prices vary based on market condition.

By downloading the app, you agree to allow Lyft to collect your device's language settings.
releaseNotes: Thanks for using Lyft! We update our app regularly to make your rides even better. Every update of our Lyft app includes improvements in speed and reliability, as well as bug fixes and performance improvements. As new features are released, we’ll highlight those for you in the app.
reviews:
Great driver. Car was clean and driver was very nice and made sure the temperature in car was good for us. Helped loading and unloading luggage. | Best driver ever! Her driving was safe and conversation pleasant. | Very good driver | This feedback is for Lyft’s development team, and probably not for users. I tried to submit this issue via the ‘support’ and ‘contact us’ sections of both the app and the website, but neither would let me submit app feedback. They both funneled me only into specific feedback categories for ride/driver feedback, and then dead-ended me there, even when I clicked “not helpful/unresolved.”

So an inability to even submit feedback is a bonus issue. 

The actual issue that prompted this was the app’s inability to add more than one extra stop. 

I needed to be picked up at my home, driven to a location where I would pick up a key, taken to another location where I would pick up a second key, and then taken home. Each stop was maybe a minute, just grabbing a key. 

Because the app wouldn’t allow myself or the driver to extend the trip, my driver sped off as soon as he dropped me. It’s not his fault, as he of course was pinged by his next ride. So I hailed another Lyft. 

My 2nd Lyft picked me up at my 2nd stop. The driver was taking me home when I realized I needed to loop back to the 2nd location because I had forgotten something with the whole key juggling mess. This would have been simple if the driver or myself were able to edit the ride, but since he weren’t, he had to simply end the ride back at my 2nd location and each of us confirmed our safety when the app noticed the ride didn’t go as plotted. He of course sped away to catch his next ride, unable to add an option to simply wait for me. (Again, not his fault, but rather the app’s shortcoming.) 

So once I had picked up the last item of my errand at the 2nd location, I then had to summon a 3rd Lyft. The whole mess took much more time and cost much more than necessary. 

I used to drive for Uber years ago. Changing destinations or adding stops was not difficult. This was such an annoying experience that I’m back to considering Uber as a regular option. | We have absolutely enjoyed our drivers and the prompt attendance.  
We were told to take a Taxi from Airport,  I suggest don’t listen to them take a lyft. | The driver was friendly and very safe driver. Thank you! | He was so sweet and kind ❤️ | Very friendly | The app did not let me choose the pick up area desired and it also gave the driver bad directions for pick up. | It’s shocking honestly- regardless of the time of day, can never get a ride. | ME ESTAN COBRANDO POR UNA CARRERA QUE JAMÁS TOME!! ME CARGARON 17 DOLARES EXTRAS Y NO ENTIENDO COMO SU APLICACIÓN NO TIENE NINGUN AREA DE RECLAMO, SOLO MANDAN OPCIONES TONTAS QUE NO SIRVEN PARA NADA, SON LA PEOR APLICACIÓN DE TAXI NO PIENSO SEGUIR USANDO SU SERVICIO | What an experience!! It is my first time taking Lyft since I drive my car always. But the driver was a wonderful person and very friendly. | For 10 years I had a 5 star rating. A driver refuses to take a toll road and leaves me on the side of the road in the rain on my way to an event. The problem is that Lyft refused to take care of me in this situation or even cover the ride I had to rebook at a higher price due to the rain and running late for the event. In their words Lyft doesn’t “monetize on customer safety”. So in this regard Lyft won’t monetize me as a customer any more. | Consistently drivers will accept a ride request and then cancel after you have waited for 10+ minutes. Super unreliable, and when you do get a ride the car typically wreaks of air freshener to mask cigarette smells. Usually my last option when i need a ride. | Too many cancellations by drivers being unprofessional to look at address and only go by location with Lyft sends them and is not always accurate... then they do not respond to text or call in order to get paid for nothing and to charge us for No Service.... too many unprofessional drivers and Lyft is loosing credibility... not good feedback either. ;-( I would also highly recommend drivers to learn English | “I had a fantastic experience with my Lyft driver! They were punctual, friendly, and drove safely. The car was clean and comfortable, and they even offered some great conversation during the ride. Overall, a top-notch experience. Would definitely ride with them again!” | Flawless | Well pleased! | What can I say? Lyft is the big Mac of transportation!! | Went from 9.99 to 25 in a matter of an hour. Highway robbery. | The ride info screen shows ads. 

I don’t pay to see ads, I pay for a ride. I need *ride details* in the app, not ads. | I love it I love it ! | Thank you my driver was very nice person good driving make my morning | I use Lyft about 4 times/year. They have earned my trust to get me to my destination on time even when I only give them 15-30 min to pick me up. Thank you, Lyft drivers! | There’s no way to contact customer service so I’m leaving it here I’m so frustrated with Lyft. Every time I take a ride I’m charged for the ride and still hit with a temporary hold on my account. It is taking a while for the money to come back so now I have limited funds to get to work due to this issue. And I don’t know what to do now I have 4 temporary holds now of unaccounted money. | Siempre que necesito llegar a un sitio rápido y a un buen costo los contrato | Their Maps is ridiculous. Either the programming personal are idiots but the app  will purposely make the driver go longer because they charge you more in your cost. | My Drivers name was Joe. He was an amazing person. Kept Me in the loop and great conversation. Thanks Joe for the smooth ride in. | thank you for a comfortable and safe trip | Friendly and punctual. Thanks. | I love this app drivers are the best cheap rides always on time | Lyft is great for when I’m too drive to drunk! | Cool driver clean car and smelled good inside friendly and respectful went above and beyond with service… keep this driver on the team | When I do ride Lyft they’re always convenient  and on time. | She was a a very safe and friendly driver. Took a nice route back to our hotel and she was the first driver to enter the hotel at the right side. Very thankful for her driving | Good service and good for getting to places you need to or want to go. | She was warm and kind to us. Extremely polite and thoughtful person! | Everything was perfect! | I’m a convert. Uber was $126 to hotel from DC airport- Lyft was $76.   First time Lyft rider- it was so much better than Uber.   I will always price compare from now on- plus my driver -Asif was the absolute best! Had water, iced coffee, calm environment. Perfect. | I LOVEEEEEEEE LYFT!!!!! | Lyft has great prices that are very affordable unlike Uber that has there prices jacked up so high but the rides are good I booked my best friend ride and she loved it as well | You hired someone who was unprofessional and rather keep someone belongings then return them. | Wilga was my driver and he was great! His car was spotless inside and out, he was very nice, and he waited patiently while I had to stop at my hotel before heading to the airport. I had pulled up both LYFT (my preference by far) and UBER and the LYFT was more than $6 cheaper. Win-win, thank you! | I’ve used Uber for Years… today things went sideways with the Uber App. I was frustrated & just downloaded the Lyft App. What a great decision! Effortless & Great Driver!  I know many drivers work both apps, but I’m grateful I tried Lyft!! | I couldn’t get ahold of my husband to come get me from work. Lyft was easy to download, it’s inexpensive & arrived quickly. | Thanks u young lady | Ms. Tia is a 5 star driver. She was very friendly and made my ride relaxed. | Not right. Bumped over 50% from the price promised at pick up. Back to Uber. | I typically only use Lyft when my car is being serviced, if I’m going out drinking or it’s an unfamiliar place I don’t want to drive. Lyft never fails to let me down, such a convenience and I  feel comfortable and safe but most importantly I feel like I’m getting to my destination in one route. | It was a long trip home & my driver was wonderful the entire way.  After being in the hospital door a month  it was a very pleasant ride.

title: Miles - Travel, Shop, Get Cash
description:
Miles is a universal rewards app that gives anyone the ability to earn miles automatically for all modes of transportation. The Miles app goes beyond airline miles, credit card points, or regular reward programs. We reward you with miles, our version of points, for any way you get from point A to point B. Whether you drive, walk, bike, or ride the train, we'll reward you miles for each mile traveled. For greener forms of travel, or healthier forms. you will be rewarded even further. 

You have the flexibility to redeem the miles you've earned for exclusive rewards, gift cards, top deals, credit, discounts, and savings from amazing brands such as HP, Garmin, Pandora, Chewy, Home Chef, Buffalo Wild Wings, Wayfair, Sam's Club, Booking.com, and many more. Get rewarded with the best deals and savings from our popular brand partners that can't be found anywhere else.

Additionally, your miles can be used to enter gift card and product raffles from exciting brands, or you can donate them to charities to help feed the hungry, contribute to cancer foundations, and more.

We've created a frequent flyer program for all transportation encompassing your daily commute and travel. Miles delivers value and savings for every mile traveled, across every mode of travel, anywhere in the world. Whether by car (as a driver or passenger), train, subway, bus, boat, bicycle, or by walking, the Miles app effortlessly rewards your travel - regardless of where your journey takes you.

Miles rewards you for your daily travel by offering various activity challenges that include walking, running, or biking to earn special Amazon.com gift cards. Make every mile traveled count and get rewarded for taking more sustainable modes of transportation. Download Miles today to start getting rewarded and save money!

Here's how it works:

1. Download the app
2. Register an account
3. Set Location Services to Always

After that, just log in occasionally to claim your miles. 

There are also plenty of ways to earn bonus miles in the app!
2x miles for greener travel
3x miles for healthier travel
Special promo codes

Redeem your miles for rewards, gift cards, raffles:
The Miles app will keep track of all your miles and you can redeem exclusive rewards using those miles in the app. You can use the rewards instantly or at a later date. You will find rewards that can be used online or at a physical location from merchants using exclusive promo codes, coupon codes, links, QR codes, or barcodes across the following categories:

• Retail
• Shopping
• Dining
• Groceries
• Household
• Health and Beauty
• Electronics
• Travel
• Kids
• Auto
• Other

Buzz about Miles:
"Finally there's a way to get recognized for all the travel you do — even if it's just a walk around the corner. It adds up." - Mashable

"Miles gives you reward miles for almost everything" - TechCrunch

"It's a great way of adding value to the travel you otherwise wouldn't be rewarded for." - The Points Guy

Why users love the Miles app:
"I spend nothing to earn miles and redeem them for products I love. Simple and easy to use." - Paula T.

"Miles is for everyone - doesn't matter if you take a transit, drive, use rideshare, bike or simply walk." - Bank P.

Thanks for being a Miles user! Need help? Reach us at support@getmiles.com.

App Privacy Policy:
https://www.getmiles.com/mobile-privacy

App Terms of Use: 
https://www.getmiles.com/mobile-tos
releaseNotes:
In this version:
• We've moved everything around a bit to make it easier to find. We hope you like it!

In other recent releases:
• Fixes and enhancements

Let us know your feedback! Love the improvements and love the app? Rate us! Your feedback helps us go the extra Mile(s). Happy Earning and Redeeming!
reviews:
the app is ridiculously bloated, taking up 30+ GB of space. it takes forever to open the app, if it opens at all, and it freezes constantly. the gift cards are sold out 90% of the time, and there are way too many restrictions on the miles you can claim, how often you can redeem points, etc. sure, they offer a paid version to get past all that, but why would i pay for something so buggy? | nOW we can’t even ENTER the sweepstakes if we don’t have 5000 miles!! I’ve had it, I’m done with this app!!!! I def don’t wanna get my money took from my account again from their buddies audiobooks!!! I bet this all won’t even be around in another year! Bye audiobook thieves and Nikes just as bad for letting them do it!!! You can find this post everywhere with screenshots | It used to have multiple options for redeeming the gift cards, and they are available all the time. Now it only has the $5 gift cards, which means you need to accumulate a lot of miles, I’m fine with it, the problem is that these $5 gift cards are never available, it tells you “the card will be available in 2/5 hours “, but it doesn’t, no one will be checking this app all the time to see if the gift cards are available.

Edit on 04/22/2024:
Now more gift cards are available, but they just stopped adding miles you earned. I drove to San Diego and earned zero miles, I guess they just don’t want to give out gift cards. | This app somehow became the #1 storage space consumer on my iPhone, taking up OVER 45 GIGS of space. There is ZERO need for this that I can see and I could not find a way to clear a cache or something similar that would reduce its memory usage. As others have said, the benefits we now get/have available in the app are not worth this kind of usage. I am deleting Miles, as I have other apps that give me far more benefit/return vs my time spent. | The rewards are too high now, the app freezes a lot, and now you need to claim every trip, unless you choose to pay for a premium membership, which costs more than you’d make. Clown shoes app. | It won’t let me sign in it says “number of attempts exceeded please try again later” and it has said that for months | This app takes up a tremendous amount of resources. I understand apps using some resources, but this app was taking up so much that it was preventing most of my other apps from working properly. It was to the point where I contacted Apple because I thought it was my phone. It was not the phone. It was this app. I saw how much it was using and I deleted it, and immediately after I removed it, my phone and all my apps worked just fine. There’s no reason why an app like this really needs to take up nearly 40 gigs of space. I was at 207 GB before deleting it, and now that it’s gone, I have 168 GB used. So sorry to say, but the five bucks a month I may get from accumulated miles that I have to check in myself is not worth a $700 phone improperly working. Best of luck with your app, but I will not be using it anymore. | its so useless and you have to get so many miles to do anything. I don’t know why i downloaded the app and kept it for as long as i did. | At the beginning of getting this app, I was still suspicious of it so when it asked for my health app connection I said no. Now seeing that it works i want to connect them together, so i downloaded the app. I don’t know what to do now because I’m not sure if they connected? | The app keeps freezing, and getting stuck loading, it doesn’t matter where I am at. The app is definitely a resource hog, I have tried it on multiple devices, all with the same results. | The app is not well optimized. Often crashes and does not work well on a iPhone 14 Pro Max. For selling your location data, this app avoids giving payouts and the countdown to available timer just keeps resetting. | I’m just gonna drop to one now since I received an email from the CEO stating they listened to us and I don’t see any changes and it’s still pay to win. | This app just simply is not worth the trouble I’ve had it for a long while and none of the stuff u can “buy” (if you can say that) is worth it and on top of that they are constantly taking all my saved up miles and it’s just not worth it | I put my location services on & yet I’m not earning miles; this app only works when it wants to or the updates don’t work!!!
 My Husband & I just went to Indy on Monday, April 8th for the solar eclipse & no miles…I can only earn by doing the trivia questions!! | Hi this is a great app maybe add more charity’s weekly for people who want to donate to the causes.  I would like to see once in a while a different charity. Plus the three that you have. 

Thank you. | No it doesn’t , the app is full of ads and basically tells you you’re not going to earn anything unless you sign up for monthly plan of $50 💀 | It wont let me put in my phone number, idk if im doing it right or not but pls tell me the way to do it | My friend referred me to this app through a text message link that claimed to give each of us 4,000 miles I used the referral code and it gave me 200 and preceded to give my friend none. DONT DOWNLOAD THIS ITS A LIAR IT ONLY LIES ITS FAKE FAKE FAKE DONT DOWNLOAD ⚠️ | It’s hard to enough to earn enough miles for just redeeming a $1 Amazon gift card…
& I have received an email saying because I haven’t get on the app for the past 2 months, they took 20,000 miles off as “maintenance fee”, super ridiculous, don’t waste your time on this app. | I mean it works fine but it used background activity a lot, i was on a road trip and couldn’t figure out why i was losing so much battery even while i wasnt on it by the minute, turned out it was this app. | I earn miles but i really don’t know how to cash out i specially wanna cash out with Apple Cash. Now they want to charge $50 annually for that. And they now also charge a “maintenance fee” by wiping out all your miles if you don’t log in for two months. Simply not worth it. | This app used to b much better before it started charging to get the full benefits. I usually always just rack miles up til I have enuf to enter in a raffle or 2. (With at least 250-300 entries) and  I've entered probably bout 300 or more an only one 1. I'll probably delete soon if I keep not winning a raffle after so many I have other apps like this anyway. | I just downloaded this app from an and I was on TikTok (people saying they were either sceptical or earning 100’s of dollars. ) seeing this app now, it’s just not worth it at all. Don’t waste your time unless you want a 3 dollar Amazon gift card for driving 7000 miles. NOT WORTH IT!!!! ☹️ | This app used to be good. And then the rewards got less, and less….. and less. And now it costs double your points to even get a reward. Was a good app. Not worth it anymore. | It’s the number one battery drain, even when tracking is turned off. It’s payout requires at least 10k miles for $5. That’s almost a year of tracking for that. 

It used to just automatically give you the miles which is not horrible. But now with the update you need to go to the app and claim each trip so the miles are recorded. 

And also, now when you redeem for gift cards, its not straight forward, there’s one per hour, so you’re competing against others. You can redeem only 20k miles per month, that’s the limit. | I enjoy useing it getting miles for every trip I take I cash out few times with it getting gift cards that’s pretty much my miles points go to | This app used to be easy to navigate and earn miles.  I was always a Diamond user throughout the month.  Now it’s more difficult, limiting and just not as rewarding.  I get the ads but having to manually claim miles and only being able to claim a portion unless I upgrade is frustrating.  I’ll keep for now, but not in my daily app rotation as it used to be.  Fingers crossed they’ll roll back some changes and make the users happy… | You have made it much harder to earn miles thru surveys, the points are much lower.  You keep changing the rules.  I paid to upgrade and now considering trashing the app.  You are probably a communist funded organization. | I’m getting tired of the teir requirements changing. I feel like they’ve changed a lot here lately. Honestly, I don’t drive enough to make much off this app most of the time so realistically for me to stay diamond tier this month I’m going to have to travel out of town a lot or just give it up. I work two jobs with a roughly 13 mile commute from home to job #1, 5 miles to job #2 and then another 13 miles home and that’s 6 days out of the week. They added your miles, all could get gift cards and you could get really good deals. (I did have an incident they rectified when I won a bid and they actually gave my code to someone else…I should have known it was going downhill then) Now this app is trash. If you don’t choose to pay for their premium membership you’re treated like a 2nd class citizen. You have to manually add your miles or just lose them. You never have enough miles for gift cards and the offers are garbage. It’s just boring and terrible. Don’t waste your time and money on this app it’s not worth it. title: CLEAR - Travel & Experiences
description:
Meet CLEAR, an identity company that powers safer, easier entry through airport security and arenas across the country. With identity verification technology that confirms you are you, CLEAR unlocks a world of joyful experiences by removing friction from your everyday life.

Think of this app as CLEAR in your pocket: Take control of airport travel and get to your gate on time—every time—with Home-to-Gate. Easily find CLEAR locations to skip long lines and get into your favorite games and events faster. Plus, build your verified CLEAR identity, which keeps your personal records in one secure place.

No matter the journey or the destination, CLEAR keeps you moving.

Your Privacy is Our Priority:
Using CLEAR is completely opt-in: we keep your data secure and protect your privacy. Transparency and security are at the center of everything we do—that means keeping you in control of your own personal information. You will know when CLEAR is asking for your information, what information we’re asking for, and how it will be used. 

Have a question or feedback about the CLEAR app? Send us a note at CSLeadership@clearme.com.

Follow @CLEAR on Twitter and Instagram for exciting updates, news, and more.
releaseNotes:
We’re always working to improve your experience with updates to the app. This release includes the ability to share your upcoming flights with family and friends. Find the new share icon on any flight detail screen to copy a link that you can send through your favorite messaging apps.

No matter the journey or the destination, CLEAR keeps you moving. Smooth travels!
reviews:
Clear has gotten worse and not because of the new ID system they are going through. I live in Orlando and this past Saturday flew out to Dallas. When I arrived at MCO which I remind everyone is the home airport to Disney and one of the busiest airports there is, I arrived at the Clear lane to a huge line. The person at the entry said they had 1 frikin person working the lane and we were better off going directly through TSA. This has happened more than once. Clear has become worthless, and has nothing to do with Next Gen setups when they are struggling to get people in to work at these lanes during the busiest periods, along with their recent raise in rates, it's a sign of a company struggling badly. | Literally the worst app ever. Tried it multiple times for linkedIn verification. It doesn’t work at all | Gotta say clear agent and customer service aren’t that helpful but I just decided to cancel and was able to get  what I was hoping for | The service was great when it started but it’s consistently slower than pre-check. What a waste of time and money. | This app is terrible! It couldn’t read a foreign passport, couldn’t verify my identity. Even when I tried to add a California State ID. When I tried to delete the account and start afresh without the foreign passport (as this seems to be the issue), it said it couldn’t verify my identity and therefore would not delete the account. | I got a new drivers license and the app won’t let me update my ID. Now they require an ID check every time I use Clear at the airport. It’s not just me. My wife has the same problem with the app in her account. | They use your hairstyle to identify and verify your account, not safe to use | I used to love Clear. Since up
5 years ago I have been a subscriber and I used to use it everywhere it was available when I travelled.

Now, I go through TSA Pre instead of Clear almost every trip the past year. The reasons are several. 1. At LAX it’s often now faster to just go through TSA Pre. 2. At least the past half dozen times I tried to use here there is this new ID update verification. And every time it has failed, with the agent at security fussing around trying to fix it, and can never fix it, which has added 10 minutes of delay while I repeatedly explain that nobody at Clear has ever been able to fix it. It’s some profile name vs name on ID mismatch. Fixing it in profile has never fixed it and like I said the fussing around by agents in person has been useless. The last time I tried I got so frustrated I turned around walked back and went through TSA Pre. So I just gave up even trying to use Clear anymore. And since the membership fees have gone up, I won’t renew again. Somehow Clear has really dropped the ball when they had a really great thing going. | They are really terrible now. Oversubscribed. Longer & slower lines than tsa pre ant many airports. | This app doesn’t work at all! No matter how many selfies you take or how many times you upload your ID it never takes the picture properly no matter where you are or how the lighting is. It just fails constantly. Unlike one of their competitors, they offer no video call to have a live person manually verify anything. They rely exclusively on technology that just never anything but fails. | Such a waste of time. Repeatedly trying to add my ID. Tried multiple lighting, never takes. Went in for help chat. When I get bar to type my response or question, doesn’t allow my response to populate up in chat! On top, many airports have extremely rude checkin staff | Adding your id to this app is one of the most hideous experiences that you will ever have. One star just because they’ve failed to fix that one feature that is incredibly easy to fix. | After paying for the service and signing up, I couldn’t actually verify any of my physical documents in the app. This led to issues at the gate, and the personnel could not sufficiently assist in this regard. Very disappointing experience! | I am not sure why they have an app.. It does not tell you to update your profile… You have to do that at the Airport and if you do not update your profile at that time.. you can not use the Clear service you paid for and ask to get out of the line and go to regular TSA.  So even if you paid for this service do not count on that you will be able to use it… If you ask to call customer support you can not as the number they lost always says they are closed and the online Chat (Kayle) has no way to help you use something you paid for while you are at the airport | This used to be great but now it takes longer than regular security. The NextGen+ upgrade doesn’t work and their staff are incredibly rude. Save your money, and if you are in a hurry just get TSA pre-check. | Agent at LAX airport never explained or introduced himself. Just said he will help me get to the front of the line and took me to the Clear machine. Said he will get it for free then started asking to input info. By this point, too late for me to back out because I initially thought he would get me to the front of the line out of good grace. Ended up spending longer signing up than waiting at security itself. He should have explained everything before hand instead of using pressure in the scheme of “helping cut line” . Had to get the app and cancel membership because it isn’t free. | Lady at the airport said we can cancel after a week of trial . It was supposed to be a free week but we got charged $288 dollars . And now I had to cancel my credit card and get a new one . IF YOU Don’t TRAVEL A-LOT DO NOT GET THIS ! | This will trick you in enrolling for free and notoriously will lead you to think that once you cancel your membership, thats it! Wrong! They will auto renew your membership and charge you card! | Helped us greatly! Last week we were running late for our plane to LA. We would not have made it if we had to stand in that long security line! I asked about the TSA PRE CHECK, the agent helped us sign up and be on our way around the line, straight to the front! Definitely felt like VIP, I recommend to anyone that travels a lot! | This useless app just can’t verify my selfie for LinkedIn verification. | International airports still don’t work even after they said they were added (and should have been years ago). Try SYD and others. Nothing.

Updated: works now after comment from dev they were rolling it out. Advise don’t put it in release notes if it’s not available. | The vast majority of reviewers left a one star rating; how does that add up to 4.7?? | Clear lines longer than TSA Pre. Instead they wait till you queue up in the airport, give them your fingerprints and then they tell. Resulting in having to queue again.

Deleting. | It used to be a “skip the line” service but it’s not any more.  Every time I try to use it, it’s broken.  The agents tell me how it’s a “software update” and you have to reregister. Every single time I have used clear on the last 3 years, clear SLOWED me down at the airport. Awful awful awful.  Save your money and do not get clear. | Tried it about five times in the last 2 months and I think I think it would have been faster off going through the regular PreTSA at DCA. Also, they always seem to have technical issues. Will definitely not renew. | Why would I pay more to get screwed at the airport and have regular security passengers get checked in way before I did. This is a rip off - clear is essentially regular security at this point and is false advertising. I would give this app 0 stars if I could. Once a month is even more than enough. Huge battery life drain downloading and installing this with auto update every few days. | I have attempted over 50 times to take a picture of my ID and passport and it keeps saying it won’t read. I have followed all of the instructions and it keeps saying it won’t read. | Poor customer service. App not fully functioning. | More than half of the airports I try to use Clear on don’t even have Clear so why are you selling it like every airport does this is kind of been a waste of my money. The other features like flight tracking is extremely buggy and doesn’t work correctly.  When I tried to get support, either it was an AI just as buggy or an illiterate person.  Either way, I question if my information is safe or could it be compromised. | In the last year of 40 flights clear has failed to once be easier or faster than precheck, save your money | I landed in Detroit airport and the Clear line was longer (a lot longer) then the regular TSA Pre-Check line.  This has happened quite a bit lately, so just keep that in mind when go to the airport and in your justification for purchasing clear. | Like the title says, the app seems to work okay, but for no reason should anyone waste money on a Clear membership, as you end up paying more just to wait longer. title: My Disney Experience
description:
The official Walt Disney World® app! Now it’s easier than ever to plan & share your vacation details—at home & on the go.
-Maximize your park time by taking advantage of our new Disney Genie service, which generates a personalized itinerary that guides you through our theme parks with tips that can help you reduce time in lines & take the guesswork out of “what’s next.”
-Quickly access real-time wait times, park hours, Character Greetings, showtimes & more.
-Use the interactive, GPS-enabled map to explore the Resort & easily see the dining options, attractions & more nearest to you.
-Find your way around with step-by-step directions.
-Browse restaurant menus, make dining reservations, modify existing ones & even mobile order meals from select locations.
-Download, edit & share your Disney PhotoPass® photos & videos throughout your vacation once you’ve purchased Memory Maker.
-Search & filter activities to find exactly what you’re looking for.
-Keep select Disney Resort hotel reservations, dining plans & activities organized—all in one spot with My Day & Plans.
-Save time by starting your Disney Resort hotel check-in process right from the app.
-Link a MagicBand+ to your Disney account on the app & unlock enchanting touches of magic.
-Save your parking information at select parking locations with car locator.
-Manage your Disney Resort reservations, tickets, MagicBands & cards & share plans with others.
-Discover official content for Walt Disney World Resort, including our 4 theme parks (Magic Kingdom® park, Epcot®, Disney’s Hollywood Studios® & Disney’s Animal Kingdom® park), 2 water parks (Disney’s Typhoon Lagoon & Disney’s Blizzard Beach water parks), Disney Springs®, select Walt Disney World Resort hotels & ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex.
Have questions, problems, comments or suggestions? Reach out to us at app.support@disneyworld.com.
Connecting to the Internet in the parks: Without a strong Internet signal, wait times, park hours & schedules may not update accurately. You can see if your device is connected properly by checking under Settings.
Note: Some features in this app will require your full name, country, birthdate & email address, as well as access to your location data. If Bluetooth is enabled on your device, this app will also collect your precise location information through beacon technology in order to improve your in-park experience, such as wait times. To facilitate the sign-in process, the app will also require access to your email address, stored within Account Manager.
This app may request access to your camera to capture media & scan barcodes. Some Disney PhotoPass Lenses may use information on your device to detect face & hand coordinates. The app may request access to your external storage to cache certain data for offline browsing.
Optional planning tools may also ask you to provide details about your travel party. Some features in this app include the ability to make purchases & will require a Wi-Fi or mobile carrier data connection. Message, data and roaming rates may apply. Availability subject to handset limitations and features may vary by handset or service provider. Coverage and app stores not available everywhere. Guests must be 18 years or older to make purchases.
Before downloading, please consider that this app contains in-app purchases that cost real money. The app provides you with the option to receive push notifications for information relating to your visit to a Park or a Disney Resort hotel.
Terms of Use: http://disneytermsofuse.com
Privacy Policy: https://disneyprivacycenter.com
Your US State Privacy Rights:  https://privacy.thewaltdisneycompany.com/en/current-privacy-policy/your-us-state-privacy-rights/
Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information: https://privacy.twdc.com/dnssmpi
Important Info About Disney PhotoPass Lenses: https://disneyworld.disney.go.com/photopass-terms-conditions/#important-notice-about-attribute-lenses
releaseNotes:
With this release, Tip Board can tell you if you are eligible to:
-Move between Walt Disney World Resort theme parks on the same day.
-Choose a Lightning Lane arrival window for select attractions.
-Make individual Lightning Lane purchases.
We also fixed bugs and improved overall app performance.
reviews:
Every screen it’s requiring enter my password, once I do, it texts me a passcode and reminds me to update my password in account settings. When I try to do update my password it tells me the texted passcode is expired but doesn’t send a new one. It’s making it quite difficult to use the app on the phone to make any kind of reservation. | Absolutely the most horrible system ever. I spent three hours today trying to get help. I still have not been able to register. Disney cannot claim the are inclusive and then make the process so difficult! | For some reason in my phone, the das pass option just kept disappearing. Luckily my wife’s did work, but she was often across the park with her parents. (Making it difficult to coordinate.) Das is awesome, and an enabler for my son… the app was very frustrating. | Not so happy trip for our kids | Es lenta | I love disney | To complicated. | Stood in line for a ride. Ride broke made us leave. Then couldn’t use genie plus. Mow k
We at a stupid ride we have at our home town and the wait is 30 minutes. Really disappointed. Our first and of 4 and I want to leave. Flew 5 hrs and paid a ton of money for nothing. | App makes me keep refreshing and will not load hotel | Phone code has been requested 4 times to update my account and after 10 minutes I have received nothing | Constant scrolling, scrolling, scrolling…. More scrolling and the in-app menu isn’t in simplified bubbles or square icons for ease of use. Plus when it comes to making dining-reservations, (especially under “Plan My Day” the app doesn’t provide the restaurant options within the exact park you’ve selected. The assumption here is that you’re booking a reservation at the displayed eating areas within that park but in reality, it’s a mix of diners from Every park; not just the one you’re currently at. Thats where you have the mistakes that are propagated when the user realizes the dining reservations they’ve booked aren't even in the park that they’ve selected for “Plan my Day.”

Colors aren’t really used here for memory/organization to help with purposeful intent with the app. They’re kind of all over the place making it difficult to keep proper track of plans & navigate. 

This is not an app that you can “simply use” while walking amidst and immense crowd in one of the parks. You have to “do your homework” with this app and sift through the concept of the app to better understand what everything is and what they do. 

It’s 80% there, just the confusing layout needs simplifying…

Apps are supposed to make life easier. Plus there’s no GPS directions for your device to guide you to the locations you want to visit within the park. (?) We spend a lot of time just roaming around looking for specific attractions we already had in mind/on our personal itinerary. 

Less is more and better than scrolling to find where you’re at or what you want to plan with it. 
Respectfully, I’d almost rather not even use the app if I’m going to be wandering around aimlessly anyways. 

Using the app gives me anxiety, it’s supposed to be an app for everybody, not for just highly-coordinated people 😒 | If I go on a trip that someone else planned, why do I need to call the help desk to add my pass to the app? I get that this is a theft/loss prevention measure, but you could just send them a notification to confirm my identity. Even better if you could prompt them to send the members in their party the app and pass before the trip so that you don’t have to print the card, streamlining the admissions process.

This could eventually evolve into a locator feature where groups can see where each member is, roughly. Please include dual party consent. | Be cooler if it worked. title: Couchsurfing Travel App
description:
You have friends around the world, you just haven’t met them yet. 

Couchsurfing is the best way to stay with amazing locals, make lifelong travel friends, or host travelers coming to your hometown. Over 12 million travel enthusiasts use Couchsurfing in more than 230,000 cities around the world.

Use the Couchsurfing app to plan and manage your trip itinerary.

Find hosts in your next destination
• Browse the millions of local hosts offering a place to stay in thousands of cities and towns
• Stay with and meet locals and have an authentic travel experience
• Explore accommodations options near where you are right now, or near your future destination

Make New Friends
• Discover thousands of fun events planned by other Couchsurfers in your hometown or in your next travel destination
• Use Couchsurfing Hangouts to show you who’s nearby your current location and available to meet up right now 

Meet Travellers Without Traveling
• Host or meet up with incoming travellers coming to your city
• Can’t travel right now? Let new cultures and friends come to you 

And More
• Easily create and manage a Couchsurfing profile 
• Manage your incoming or outgoing requests, messages, and more
• Add pictures to document your travel adventures
• See which of your Facebook friends also have a Couchsurfing account
releaseNotes: Hey Couchsurfers! In this release, you'll find a few bug fixes and usability improvements.
reviews:
I got 20 emails telling me thank you for hosting and then i got so excited… now i dont have to pay the yearly fee because my membership keeps on extending for forever !…. This is great!…. Nope.. total lies… paid my $15 a year … i guess i should just charge people to stay with me so then it will cover the fee? That’s not allowed … my point is BE HONEST! If you say something then DO IT | I have used this app for 11 months now. I have hosted more than 35 Couchsurfers in this period. Out of nowhere yesterday, I got a notification saying my account is temporarily suspended. I have not shared my number or social media in my profile publicly. I have never used profanity in any interactions. I have only provided my contact number to Couchsurfers whom I was hosting or shared it in comments of the events that I host.

After building a profile for this long, I think all my effort might be in vain. I have seen many users with their social media info and links in their bio and somehow that is fine in this very platform.

I am government ID and phone number verified but have not paid the fee to use the app. I am not sure if random occasional temporary suspension is a perk to becoming a free user. If any such bias exists, it should be mentioned in the terms of use. Pretty disheartened to have this experience without doing anything wrong. I am sure many others might have had the same experience so just wanted to write a review. | The app is literally full of old 40 year old men who are treating it like a dating app to pry on young female travelers. The other half is 60 year old gay men who want little boys to be naked in their house. Wouldn’t recommend just book an air bnb or something | Not free | This app is just a  scam, they don’t provide any refund even if you’re not planning using this app | Really good app ☺️ | They only reason why this app exists is the people still have a faith in this wonder land.  Really sad things are most hosts rejected you without any reply…Some of  them only like host females, it seems like hangout dating app….. so rude and disgusting…  DO NOT PAY FOR IT….. | Great | Siempre tengo buenas experiencias con Couchsurfing. Tengo amigos que conocí alojando y viajando por aquí que duran hasta hoy. Gracias | I had used this app on all my travels before the pandemic started. Mostly I used the hangout feature and was fortunate to meet some great people to explore. I am venturing again and so I downloaded the app. I understand adding a fee but why not make it through the App Store? I read several reviews (most are negative) and I don’t feel comfortable giving my credit card information directly. Sad regarding this. Hangouts was a great way to meet people, travelers and locals. | I started using Couchsurfing 2018 and paid for the lifetime verification. I was under the impression that the point of this would be to never have to make another payment. This was not the case. My account is now locked unless I make additional payments. Because of this decision the community on Couchsurfing has died and it is pretty much useless now. Couchsurfing after it changed owners has engaged in extremely dishonest business practices and I don’t plan on continuing to use the app. There are many other good free alternatives online. | Meeting new friends by CS app is the best. | It is stunning that you've managed to bungle the latest update quite so badly. The sort by last login date function does not actually sort all the results, and the ability to filter by people who are accepting guests is now completely unusable (it just doesn't do anything). It seems as thought it will be difficult to make it any less useful than it currently is, but somehow I am confident you will manage it. We, the users, watch your progress with bated breath. | With this app you can go any where you want and find new friends thanks Couchsurfing | First off, this used to be about community and was a free app. Then they introduced a pay wall of 1.99/month, justifying it by saying ‘Covid was really hard.’ Now they’re charging 2.99/month, and this number will almost certainly go up. Whoever bought the app is now using the community for profit… 2ndly I have had fewer and fewer ‘good’ encounters, which has led to me no longer using the app… about 1 out of every 10 people I meet on here is someone who’s like me, and I’m happy to meet. About 7/10 encounters are men who are using this app for hookups… and then 2/10 people on here are just plain weird and ask you to join their nudist household… this app is not what it used to be, shame to say it, but Couchsurfing died years ago. | I had a Couchsurfing subscription for 1 year.  Before my account was set to renew, I cancelled it. However, they charged me anyway. The kicker is my account still says I have a free account and says that I shouldn’t have been charged. I was charged and don’t even have access to the service. To make matters worse, I reached out to the company thinking they could provide me with some clarity on why they charged me. They can’t even find the charge in their system. They keep telling me to reach out to PayPal and Apple. The charge was on my CREDIT CARD, not via PayPal or Apple. They don’t even know how their own system works. Extremely disappointed in Couchsurfing and I’ve lost all faith in their company and app. Whatever you do, do NOT give them any credit card information. This company steals money from the people it claims to “help.” | Couchsurfing, once hailed as the ultimate platform for travelers seeking free lodging and cultural exchange, has seen significant changes that have stirred mixed feelings within its community. The app, renowned for connecting like-minded adventurers and hosts around the globe, has transitioned from a completely free service to a model that now requires payment, a shift that has left many users disenchanted.

Historically, Couchsurfing stood out for its emphasis on cultural exchange and hospitality, fostering a sense of global camaraderie. It was a unique platform where the currency was kindness and the sharing of experiences, rather than money. Hosts opened their homes without any expectation of financial compensation, offering travelers a place to stay and local insights that enriched their journey.

However, the introduction of a payment requirement to use the platform fundamentally alters its original ethos. Users now must pay to verify their accounts or subscribe to access full features, including hosting or staying with others. This move, while understandable from a business sustainability perspective, has sparked a debate on the core values of Couchsurfing.

For long-time users, this shift feels like a departure from the community-first philosophy that made Couchsurfing special. The requirement to pay can be seen as a barrier that might deter new members and diminish the pool of available hosts and surfers, potentially impacting the rich diversity and vibrancy of the community.

Despite these changes, it's important to acknowledge the positives that remain. Couchsurfing continues to be a platform that can offer unparalleled opportunities for cultural exchange and making global connections. The app's functionality, user interface, and the breadth of its community still stand as strong points, providing users with the tools to explore the world in a more personal and profound way than traditional tourism allows.

In conclusion, while the transition to a paid model marks a significant shift in Couchsurfing's journey, the core appeal of connecting with locals and travelers worldwide persists. Users who are willing to pay may still find the app a valuable resource for authentic travel experiences. However, the platform may need to find a balance between financial sustainability and maintaining the spirit of community and openness that defined its early years to retain its place in the hearts of the global travel community. | If you express any kind of boundaries up front, you’ll be met with nothing or aggression. Without boundaries expressed outright, you’ll be flooded with hosts requests. Really shows the intentions of most hosts on the app. Have yet to meet another woman on it. | It functions ok on my iPhone but several things are strange, text fields overlapping, simply aesthetically off. I travel for a living and couch surfing has helped me to save money on hotels. I wish I there was a trip-routing feature on the app. | This app has given me wings to fly to Japan, Sweden, Germany, Kenya, Singapore, India and so many more places. 

I am eternally grateful to couchsurfing and the many wonderful people I met while on the journey. Live long and prosper, CS! | Excelente app para conocer, asistir y ayudar a amigos de todo el mundo. Los invito a conocer La Habana Vieja. Un abrazo desde Cuba. | It’s a great app for meeting friends and traveling new places. title: Visited: Travel Map With Lists
description:
Beat your own travel stats. Get inspired to visit exotic new destinations. Track your experiences around the world as you tick off your bucket list.

MAP YOUR TRAVELS
-Design your personal travel map by displaying countries, states / provinces / regions and cities of where you have been or want to visit.

GET INSPIRED
-Visualize your future travels by swiping through beautiful photos and adding them to your wishlist.

TRAVEL ITINERARY

- Wondering where to travel next? We got you covered. Select different destinations and places based on travel lists, experiences and inspirational photos. We'll show you which countries have the highest numbers of places you wish to visit. So you can go down the list and optimize your travel plans. 
- Picking your next travel destination just got a lot easier with the Visited App!

TRAVEL BUCKET LIST
-Keep up with your travel life goals by selecting all the countries of the world that you want to visit.
-Add travel journal notes by country of your travel dates, points of interest or personal memories.

KEEP TRACK OF YOUR TRAVEL JOURNEY
-Share your personalized stats with others! You can share your travel ranking, percentage of the world seen and countries you’ve visited.
-See your top 5 most frequently visited countries.
-Create regional maps for over 20 countries, including United States, Canada, Australia, Germany, UK, Russia, France and others.

TRAVEL EXPERIENCES
-Want to see how many of the worlds’ capital cities you have been to? Or how about how many art museums you’ve visited? Using the list feature, check off places you have been to or want to visit by category. Lists include: African Safaris, Capitals of the World, Wonders of the World, Pyramids, Culinary Experiences, Ancient Sites, Churches, Greek & Roman Ruins, Cruise Ports, Beer Destinations, Palaces, US national parks, Ski Slops, World's Top Beaches, Shopping Destinations, LGBTQ+ Destinations, Popular Hiking Trails, Lakes, Bridges, Snorkelling/Diving Locations, Chocolate Destinations, Castles, Wine Regions, Kids Attractions, Temples, Mountain Ranges, Rock Climbing Locations, Monasteries, Opera Houses, Funicular Railways, Waterfalls, Volcanos, Mosques, US National Monuments, Hot Springs, Tunnels, US Memorial, Dance Shows, Deserts, Famous Prisons, Canal Cruises, Formula One Circuits, Top Surf Spots, Underground Cities, Whale Watching Spots, Synagogues, Caves, US National Historic Site, Tennis Destinations, Film Festivals, US National Battlefields and Scotch Distillery Regions. 
 
-Track your experiences by country such as where you’ve gone golfing, snorkelling/diving, skiing, wine tours and others.

FULLY CUSTOMIZABLE
-Select different colors or design your own based on your travel type
-Pick fully accessible, high contrast colors for your map.
-Dark mode is supported to make the app easier to use while taking a red eye flight
-Adjust the sovereignty for disputed territories

SEE HOW YOU COMPARE TO OTHER TRAVELERS:
- Compare your travel stats with other global travellers or friends
- See the top 10 most popular countries to visit from your home city
- Share your travel map, stats and bucket list with your family and friends

Have you ever had a problem where you can’t actually remember all the countries you’ve been to? That’s why we created Visited – a simple and fun travel tracker. With Visited, you will be able to not only keep a log of all the countries, regions, and cities you’ve been to, but you’ll also be able to see your accomplishments beautifully rendered on a world map that you can share proudly. A digital scratch map if you will! You can also use Visited to plan your upcoming adventures by being inspired by breathtaking travel photos and building up your bucket list.
