title: Japan Travel - Route,Map,Guide
description:
Japan Travel by NAVITIME will help you travel around like a local!

App Overview:
-Explore (Travel guides/articles)
-Route Search
-Map / Offline Spot Search
-Plan

About the Features:
[Explore]
-We provide you with basic guides and informative articles about traveling in Japan, written by foreign autohrs residing in Japan.
-Topics include transportation, money, internet connection, food, art&culture, nightlife, shopping, etc.
-Recommended itineraries are also provided for areas throughout the country.

[Route Search]
-The app navigates you from your preferred point of departure to your destination.
-Search covers all modes of public transport (trains including JR and subway lines, airplanes, taxis, and ferries).
-Provides useful information such as the platform number, station lists, and timetables. 
-Search directly from a zoomable interactive map of the Tokyo area.
-Allows you to save up to 50 recently searched routes. You can also see them while offline.
-The Japan Rail Pass mode will show the most efficient route for pass holders.

[Map / Offline Spot Search]
-Search offline for the following spots: Free Wi-Fi hotspots (NTT FREE Wi-Fi, FREESPOT, Starbucks, etc.), currency exchange spots, ATMs, TICs, and train stations.
-Book hotels, rental cars, and activities nearby you or your destination.

[Plan]
-While reading articles or searching on the map, add spots to your favorites that sounds attractive. 
-Create your own travel plan with your favorite spots by adding them in a timeline. Your plan can be also viewed on a map.
-Comfirm the transportation information directly from your plan. You can select modes of transportation like train, taxi, walking, local buses, etc. 
-Start your planning from our recommended itineraries, and coordinate it by adding spots from your interests.

[Itinerary] (New!) 
- Search, create, and share travel itineraries. Search from +200 itineraries created by our Editorial Team, as well as by other users. 

[PAID Features]
-Search alternative routes in case of a disruption to your searched route.
-Voice navigation will show you directions and landmarks.
-Check the rankings of articles to know the hot topics.
-Make more collections and sort out your favorite spots.
-Rain & snow radar will show the forecast up to 6 hours ahead.

*Notice:
-This app uses GPS in the background for the purpose of enhancing user experience. You can turn the GPS off from Settings on your device.
-Continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life.
-At the time of your initial access, we ask users to participate in a survey for the Japan Tourism Agency, which is aimed to enhance tourism experience in Japan. This survey is optional, and you will be able to use the app without answering them.
releaseNotes:
Ver5.7.9
- Point release
reviews:
This has to be the most overrated app ever. Even after paying the ridiculous upgrade fee, the app is burdened with irrelevant and irritating ads that take up half of the screen. Just use Google Maps—free and much better. | Useless without platform info. Hundreds of trains and options. There is no way you could get to where you’re going without platform info. Don’t bother with this app. | This app is fine but when it came down to it I just ended up using Google maps to navigate in Japan instead. The app would freeze up for me a lot and I just ended up uninstalling. | Highly recommend for anybody traveling to Japan. Particularly anyone taking either the metro, Subway, or even Shinkansen. You just need to type in your starting point and destination, you can now only the quickest route, but also the fare you need to pay at the station. Worth getting the paid version since you get to see the list of stations and you have to travel. | Too many ads and limited navigation. Google Maps has better navigation info | I just downloaded the app on iPhone 14-  I signed up and registered and also verified my email info and clicked yes for location access on my phone-  then I got a blank screen- I tried turning my phone off- the app just gives me a blank screen when I open it on my iPhone-  frustrating- made me feel like this was a potential scam to give access to my phone | Anything worth using cost money. Might as well use Google Maps for free. | This could have been a good app if it focused on its rail timetable and planning strengths.  Instead, it is cluttered with distracting and irrelevant offers and information for things one can search and find in a dozen other better content sites.  This obscures and undermines the rail planning function which could have made the app uniquely worthwhile.  It is not a question of paying for ad-free premium, it’s a question of app focus to do one thing well instead of ten things poorly. | I can get it to login perfectly on an iPad, but it keeps saying that the password or email is incorrect when I try to login via my phone. | Despite having an expensive subscription service, it is LOADED with ads. The home page of the app is a landing page for advertisements. It will constantly send you push notification ads. The directions are marginally better than Google/Apple maps, it’s 100% not worth it. | We had our own passes purchased direct from JR Rail so it was not very useful. Seemed “marketing heavy” to encourage purchases for other tours. | Does not show route maps! Even for paid version. Don't waste your money. Travel instructions lack clarity. One good feature: it *will* tell you when to leave Point A to arrive at Point B, at a specific time. Other than that, Google maps is far easier to use, plan, & view your route while you're traveling. | We had some events pre planned and I can’t add them. They only show you booking through them. I can find the routes etc, but definitely not worth the money if you just need help with some stops. | Great app when it was free | Latency is bad. Itinerary function is confusing and useless. | This app is great, but…..  it always deletes my saved train routes. I live and work in japan, and it’s very annoying when I look to see what train I can take, and it deletes ALL my saved routes. To the point I have to save them all over again. This has happened multiple times. | I’ve never been to Japan before, don’t speak Japanese. Planned my whole trip using this, paid for premium, it’s worth it!! Would not have been able to get around the subways without it. | Haven’t been able to get it to work from day one!  Deleted it and found something else. | I’m trying to use the Osaka subway route map and it “can’t find” any station I’m trying to search for.  Useless! | 乱扣费 | I used to love this app, but they’ve made some very questionable changes lately. Seeing the station list used to be free, now they’re making you pay for premium to look at it. I’ve also seen a bunch more popups bothering me to upgrade. I’ll be using a different app from now on. | We traveled most of Japan and found google to be better. Navigation seemed hard and it didn’t seem to come up with interesting things to do. 
I struggled to find the right trains to get on and just gave up as it was easier in google. I found the app a waste of money. Shame I had high hopes. 
Third visit to Japan with rail pass and three kids. | Just the free portions of this are worth 5 stars. The routing system is a must when traveling. The platforms, changes, and times were spot-on. This made a 2 week trek around Japan by rail east. | Fails immediately. Continues to fail as you struggle to use it. Paid for upgrade but no upgrade was applied. Use google maps. It’s better and it’s free. | This is a great rail app for free. I was using the other japan official app but it wasn’t showing my JR trains effectively, so i switch to this one and gets my planned and reserved trains. You can use both if you need to but if you want a one and done than this app is it. | I’m unable to pick other bullet trains it just defaults to one | I have been using this app for years now, and it has been very helpful as a resident in Japan. With one of the more recent updates, they started to really push the paid plans. This took features that were free and monetized them. The station list for my route is no longer viewable which was great for tracking my time. 
In addition, they hide the cost of the premium plan to get you to buy it easier. Very sad.
I will be looking for a new app to use. | Have been using the app all over Japan for the past two weeks and it has performed flawlessly. The information is accurate, detailed and reliable. It is easy to use and has lots of great features, like letting you create a menu of your hotel names and addresses so you can quickly search for the best route to or from wherever you’re staying. You can also easily filter searches by whatever pass you may have and/or type of transportation you prefer to use. If you’re traveling around Japan on your own itinerary, you’ll want to have this app. | Great info on train times and routes but I wanted the navigation feature. Even with my pocket wifi it never worked. No turn by turn, no voice prompts, and it was very laggy. Wish I could get my $20 back. We ended up using Google maps. Not only was it more up to date but it tells you which entrance and exit to use. It even suggests which car to use for the fastest exit! | This shows the proper routes with Japan Rail Pass.  Google Maps won't work since it's always showing non-pass routes.  Great app. | The routing is okay but misses several available trains which is a big nono (didn’t get the thunderbird JR booked for me and which Google maps happily suggested), the interface is clunky, but most annoyingly despite having paid $14.49 for a (30 days!) premium I still got ads in route planning. What the heck Navitime?!? | This is a great app for someone visiting Japan as well for people living here. You get all the shopping information from electronics to clothing shops and their discount and taxes save. I haven’t try the Navi drive yet. I hope it will save me a lot of time from using google map which usually take me to all the alleys in Japan before my destination. I like the train directions of this app. | This app was a godsend during our trip to Japan! We used it constantly, so helpful to find the right route, especially with it telling me if the route would be covered by my JR Pass. HIGHLY recommend downloading if traveling to Japan. | I would love the app but it will not let me but a subscription no matter how much I try, which severely limits my ability to plan my trip. | This app is absolutely indispensable for travel within Japan on the rail, subway and bus systems. The search results are clearly laid out with station numbers and your particular track information. Apps like Hyperdia are GROTESQUELY complicated in comparison. 

Couple this app with a WiFi hotspot ( I used Japan Wireless) and you will never be lost. I’d give it 10 Stars if I could. | Best app among all the navigating apps I downloaded and tried out while in Japan. The most helpful feature was that it would tell you which train to take (on a JR Pass), which station to catch it, what time it would leave, and the track that it leaves from. Now if only someone would develop an app to guide you through the
maze of underground tunnels and shopping corridors to find the right exit close to your hotel. | Tried finding train route from Tokyo to my resident city, Tsukuba, Japan, but the app gave me wrong information. I have taken this route dozens of time using the excellent Hyperdia website. But this app not only gave me a bad route, it could not even find the Tsukuba train station. Tsukuba is the Japan Science City and the second biggest city in Ibaraki Prefecture, so this is shameful. Do not get this app. instead, use the Hyperdia website. | If you need a navigation, how to get around japan, guidance on how to take the train this is it for you. I love this app. | One of the best applications I’ve ever used. It always works with no issues. I’m planning my trip and this app gives me ideas where to go and what to see. Definitely will use it in Japan. Absolutely love it! | The amount of information given in this app is wonderful. Location of a.t.m’s, money exchange, free WiFi, and closest stations is great. Travel route are better than the app that my native japanese friend has, with multiple routes to choose from and distinct JR pass routes. Estimation on how much non JR trains cost and taxi travel is spot on. I’ve been to Japan several times and this app made this trip even easier. I utilized all its features on a daily basis. I thank the developers for a well thought out and very usable application. | If you love to travel your going to like this a lot 😂🎁♥️ | I rarely write reviews but felt compelled to do it here. It must be the best app there’s to travel using your JR pass. Has good routes, can optimize for JR pass, and even shows the platform numbers which is super useful. | Very smooth great for trains ferries even busses. I wish that there’d be English characters for busses so you can search for bus stops, also to be able to look up nearby busses, maybe add/incorporate stops. Also maybe even a biking route option. 

Finds places google maps doesn’t have. And is much easier to see all times that bus stop leaves as compared to google maps.

I use google maps just to get the name of the bus stop I need sometimes and plug that into this app or use the location of the bus stop. And I’m have reach my destination.

These would all be very cool extras. As it stands, this is a fantastic app. | Definitely your GO TO app for finding your train options. I used this over HYPERDIA app that others recommended. The app helped me in booking and planning my trips on the Shinkansen using JR rail pass. | It’s very accurate. It gives you the exact time and information of where to go. Now, I am an expert with trains! | Place I call, “the HOME of my SOUL”.

I was born near by town of Tomonoura.
A long long time ago! 
Went to the U.S.A. to explore my curiosities. Then found the freedom!!!!! Decided to stay! Got married. Two kids! Every trip I, we, made to my native land, Japan, our trip included Tomonoura!!!! Now my kids want to visit there as their pilgrimage! I feel so warm inside of the core of my heart when I get greeted by the sign saying “WELCOME HOME”. In Japanese!

There must be so many beautiful places to visit in Japan but Tomonoura will be one of the places you can enjoy Japan’s ONCE UPON A TIME! | Don’t buy the full feature. Navigation very difficult to follow and slow to update. Google maps worked better. This was only useful in finding train stations and platform. | I gave this app 3 stars because numerous times, the stores I wanted to find/shop at came up with no information. This is disappointing because they immediately appeared when I googled the same store name with all the information including a map and directions. 
While other portions of the app are fine, for me if I want to go somewhere and this app can’t even tell me it exists I’m sorry to say it’s usefulness is closer to a 1 star... especially considering I had to pay $7.95!!! | I used this for my week in Tokyo and it was amazing for getting you where you want to go. Would recommend. | ...I used an app called Japan Transit.

Notice the verb tense above. Japan Transit got deleted after I used this app for all of 5 minutes. Much more info available with this new app, so I am still learning, but it is still much better.

title: StudentUniverse: Cheap Travel
description:
The ultimate travel & flight booking app for students & youth—save up to 30% off flights! Search, compare and book cheap flights and hotels and get exclusive student discounts with a free student or youth (18-25) membership. Our members saved $3.9 million dollars on flights with us—just last year!

Millions of students are already booking cheap flights and saving money with StudentUniverse—so what are you waiting for?

StudentUniverse allows you to search and compare flights from 220+ major airlines, such as American Airlines, United Airlines, Jetblue, Alaskan Airlines, Delta Air Lines, Air Canada, British Airways, Qatar Airways, Air China, China Eastern, Air Canada, Westjet, Lufthansa, KLM and more. Compare all of these airlines and more on a single search to easily find the best itineraries and cheap flight deals, plus get student discounts across all of your favorite airlines.

Why StudentUniverse?

Student Discounts
We’re the only flights and hotels app that offers exclusive travel deals for students and young travelers.

Book Flights & Hotels
Search and compare hundreds of airlines, hotels and itineraries to find the best travel deals or last minute flights, all in one place.

Flexible Searches
Flexible schedule? Use our flexible search feature to find the cheapest flights available near the dates you want.

Stay in-the-know
Book in-app
Book your travel straight from your phone.

Need more convincing?
Easily filter your search results by time, price, airline, length of itinerary or other options to make sure you find the best fit.
Sort hotel searches by price, amenities, accommodation type or TripAdvisor rating.
Get access to hidden student flights discounts with a free membership.
Keep track of your plans with your itineraries available in the app anytime you need them.
Enable push notifications for app-only sales and exclusive promo codes to save even more on your next trip.
Easily add travel insurance to protect your trip.
Get the option to fly greener by offsetting your flight’s carbon emissions with renewable energy certifications.
Save your traveler information to speed up the checkout process.
Find all of our contact information in the app in case you need support or want to make a change to your reservation.

Whether you’re studying abroad, planning a weekend trip, gearing up for spring break, need a last minute flight or just heading home for the holidays, StudentUniverse gets you cheap flights whenever and wherever you need.

Say hello:
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/studentuniverse
Instagram: @studentuniverse
releaseNotes:
This newest update comes with baggage. Like, literal baggage. Now you can purchase your bags for your trip at the same time as you book your flight ticket. No more waiting to the last minute.
Got some feedback or see a glitch? We’re here for it! Please send any suggestions you may have on how we can improve our app to appfeedback@studentuniverse.com and we’ll be happy to consider it.
reviews:
Whenever I want to see my trips and the details in it, the app crashes and I am unable to find my details. | Terrible. | I love Student Universe! Cheapest flights available, which is so helpful for a college student like myself! 10/10 do recommend. | Their customer service team is full of liars. Do not try the general English line | Great website and super cheap prices, but the app is constantly crashing and is nearly unusable. | It’s showing high prices compare with other Apps | I booked a flight one night for $344, which was then cancelled because “The price went up as I was purchasing the ticket”. I checked the next day and it was the same price. I called and asked why I’m not able to book the next day after checking and they said “It’s unavailable” so I asked “why is it still in the website” and the lady kept putting the blame on me and avoiding the question and told me “You can pay over the phone the higher price and a $10 manual payment fee”. Absolutely ridiculous. You’re better off using Expedia | I love this app I got best rates | Every time I try to view my trips, it bugs and just closes the app. | Since downloading the app back in November of 2023, I have not been able to see any information regarding my trip abroad after logging in. I instead received the message saying “Something went wrong try again later”. Please fix | Doesn’t give you any more of a discount on flights than any other site and often makes you flights non-refundable. I don’t see the point of the site and would not recommend using it. | My flight was canceled due to the 737 groundings and the airline texted me to notify me of this and said I would receive an email with more information about next steps. I never received such an email from the airline. 4hrs later I received an email from student universe notifying me of this change, asking if I wanted to accept the absurd new flight they booked me on. This was after I had already tried to call the airline about the absurd new flight (2days after my original departure date and an 18hr layover), and called student universe to try and get a better flight. I thought this issue was handled after I spoke to the second student universe representative - the first one had no idea what he was doing. I rebooked a flight on a new airline, as I was told I was getting a refund, only to learn when I landed, that they still had not contacted the airline for a refund, but had instead booked me on yet another absurd alternative flight. Just absolutely horrible experience. I thought student universe was a great company for the prices, but their customer service is not worth the lack of price. They will not be in any way helpful if any thing happens to your flight. You can tell them what you want to happen, that you cannot add 2 days to your trip, that you want to decline the offered alternative flights and just get a refund, but no. They don’t listen and don’t fight for you as the customer | difficult to use it. no live chat. | Run if you plan to use it! | I am trying to look for a ticket and it’s showing me prices but then it says the discounted ones aren’t available unless I verify my status and when I upload the document it just keeps saying uploaded and never actually finishes and I waited for over 10 minutes | This app charged me $30 extra for the flight when compared to other airline sites and to cancel it within 24 hr booking they are charging $40. | I recently had a frustrating experience with an airline and Student Universe. I opted not to take the initial leg of my flight and used alternative means to reach my destination. However, to my dismay, the airline cancelled my return flight without offering any compensation. This left me with no choice but to purchase a new return ticket at additional cost.

When I reached out to Student Universe for assistance, they were unhelpful, citing a clause in their contract which states that if a passenger does not use the first leg of their journey, they forfeit the entire trip. This policy feels quite unfair and was not adequately highlighted at the time of booking. The lack of flexibility and support in this situation was disappointing, and it’s important for potential customers to be aware of such policies and the implications they might have on their travel plans. | I can’t even look at available flights without the app crashing. I had this installed for about 2 hours before trashing it. | They charge you higher than just booking on a regular site | The site not even work when you try selecting from where u want fly it’s not even give you option don’t waste time for this app…. | Wasn’t able to print out itinerary, or save to My Wallet. I can’t find my ticket in the app at all, don’t like this app. | This app is so slow to load, regardless of what kind of connection I’m using. I can’t even load the hotel page because it takes 5+ minutes. | Super easy to use and amazing student discounts. With all my school loans, I will take any student perks I can get! Thanks StudentUniverse! :) | This was a waste of time and false advertising! The prices are the same on any other website. Don’t waste your time or phone storage downloading the app!! | Amazing | This app is deceitful and manipulative | It says I need to update the app but there is no update to offer on apple and I cannot use the app. | It promts me to update but I don’t see the update in appstore. Can even use the app. | If you download and open the app, it will tell you to upgrade to the newest update, then take you back to the app store ….. but there is no update . | i heard about this app and decided to compare air fares from google flights. i was able to locate the same exact flight on google and compared it to the one on this app. i found that google flights’ fare was 6 dollars cheaper than this app. 
if you want to verify this, just pick a random flight on google flights and look it up on this app and compare to see. | Because I book tickets for my mom
And I request for wheelchair but 
She can not get any wheelchair 
Tickets is India Ahm to Washington DC
Any airport | Student Universe is my go to app for flight bookings. | Oh wow, did not really touch food ever in this place | Worst platform to book the flight. If we want to postpone or prepone the flight they are charging more when compared with other platforms. Better to book a flight in direct airline sites. I don’t want to give rating. | I had a horrible experience from airport staff and contacted studentuniverse but they were unresponsive. I tried contacting them multiple times. I contacted my bank and the airlines directly who gave me the refund for $1700 for the inconvenience. But these crazy people, not only did they rebilled my account after4 MONTHS with $1700 again, even after telling all the details what happened, they as a merchant straightaway lied to the airlines to finally rebilling the amount from my card again. This is the worst website you could choose for getting $10 bucks of discount and then you’re going to suffer later and you could never expect any help from them. Studentuniverse are very active only when it comes to sucking money out of your pocket. They told the airlines I cancelled the ticket, but in reality I was talking about the one way ticket where i experienced this whole situation, not during the return ticket which I cancelled later. (For which I never received the refund btw) I would never ever recommend anybody to book from this website it’s a total scam they don’t care about the passengers at all!!! | Won’t save nothing, plus very difficult to communicate with and customer executives aren’t supportive | It’s cheaper if you go through the website of the air line | I’ve been using this app for about a year and a half without any issues. However, since the last update, it’s been crashing while searching for flights and it’s now impossible to use. | Just there was an easy way to add trip details to my calendar. I have to do it manually. And when I share my trip info with my gf, she says she has to enter in my email address and confirmation number to view the itinerary—so many unnecessary steps.

Product owner needs to ask themself why they chose to implement the ability to explore next trip based on user’s zodiac sign over the ability to add to calendar. Bad choice IMO. | A friend of mine told me that this was a good app to find good prices as a college student. Unfortunately, I haven’t been able to see if it’s as great as she told me because it wouldn’t let me confirm my student status, and I’m scare of but the tickets without doing that first because what if they raise my prices last minute because of that? What if they end up charging me more claiming that it’s because I never confirmed my student status? If anyone can help me with that I’ll be more than thankful and happy to change my review | I fly a lot, a lot a lot, I flew booking with student universe too, gave them second chances at thought maybe it’ll save money. NO. Please listen it’ll save you so many headaches, they won’t and can’t save you anything. Absolute scam, their whole MO is making customers think they’re paying less, but they NEVER BOOK YOU WHAT THEY SAY THEY WILL. They always say “economy” when you book BUT ITS ACTUALLY ECONOMY LIGHT AT BEST. Not even light, the ones with absolute no carry-on/baggage at all, last second tickets that other companies toss away. If they tell you that going in, whatever, but be prepared to pay an extra $300 USD for every international flight (the whole flight is only $400). There’s no way to know what flight they’re booking for you since they lie and say “don’t know baggage allowance” and you don’t know until a few days before when you can check in to your airline… It’s so fuqed up who would book an international flight without even a CARRY ON??? The whole thing is so shady, so deceitful, zero transparency. They know what they’re doing, ridiculous company that scams “students” without being upfront on what kind of flights are being booked. Their profit margins must be huge but they have zero ethical values. Hopefully they get sued someday, this happens for every. flight. I’ve. Booked. Basically booking.com with less transparency and false assurance of “helping poor students.”🤦‍♂️ a lot of you might be like me, false hope it’ll save you something, please I beg you just avoid, you have enough stress on your plate as is. | Way to expensive | I’ve always had a lot of years of student universe. Their stuff are super helpful and quick to rearrange flight plans. Their app is easy to use and I love their prices. | I haven’t found any relevant deals for me and decided to delete the app because I also didn’t feel comfortable giving any ID information, but the app simply won’t give you the option to delete your account! | Love it. Short, Sweet & to the Point. | Easy to sign up but I did not see anywhere to confirm a flight or check-in.  Rates are ridiculously inexpensive! | ^^ | There literally just isn’t a reason to use StudentUniverse. They add fees with no clear benefit to using their services and terrible assistance. They’re trying to charge +$700 for a flight change. Save yourself the headache and just book straight through an airline, I’m not even sure why this company exists. | Twice my booking was cancelled for stupid reason. Won’t recommend it to anyone. | i’m looking for newark, nj airport flights and keep showing me La Guardia, NY information why???

title: Priceline - Hotel, Car, Flight
description:
Get exclusive app-only hotel deals, discounts on rental cars, and cheap flights all in one place, with the Priceline app.

Join millions of happy travelers who book great deals with us every day - download now!
 
NEW - Stay more, save more! Unlock Priceline VIP when you book and get our best prices on great hotels.

Still need a reason to download the app? Here’s 3:
 
1. Access to exclusive hotel deals found only on the app.
2. Everything you need in one place - low-priced hotels, cheap rental cars and discounted flights.
3. Personalized, relevant hotel recommendations - we have the travel deals that matter to you.

Our app is rated as Best App for Travelers by Travel + Leisure!

SERIOUS SAVINGS
You’ll save up to 60% off with Express Deals®. Seriously. Plus, you save up to 50% off hotels when you unlock Priceline VIP.

SEARCH, FIND, BOOK
Finding the perfect one is easy as pie. Search by city, address or point of interest to book the most conveniently located hotels and rental cars. As you search more, we uncover even more deals just for you.

QUICK & EASY
Want to book in a matter of seconds? Our app features super-quick travel booking, especially when you’re signed in! We do fast well.

RENTAL CAR DEALS
Hit the road with rental car deals on 22 brands in 28,000+ locations. That’s how we roll.

CHEAP FLIGHTS
Travel across the globe with super deals on thousands of domestic and international flights across the globe. Pace yourself.

TRAVEL BUDDY
Easily access and make changes to your trip wherever you are with our My Trips feature. Need to check your booking on the go? Get all of your reservation and travel info right on your phone, even if you booked on your computer and even if you don't have service! My Trips works offline, too. Like magic.

Our app has your back. And it’s watching your wallet, too. Download now!

Priceline is part of Booking Holdings, which includes leading online travel brands such as Booking.com, Agoda, Kayak & OpenTable.
releaseNotes:
We're dedicated to offering you unbeatable prices consistently! Explore the enhancements we've implemented to enrich your booking journey.

Need some guidance or looking for travel ideas? Talk to Penny- your GenAI-powered travel assistant!

You can now search for up to two locations at once when looking for flights.

Set up flight price alerts, and we'll inform you promptly of any price adjustments, ensuring you never overlook a bargain!

We've addressed glitches and implemented updates to boost the app's overall performance.
reviews:
Daily ad emails continue after unsubscribing multiple times on email link. Contacted customer service who said I can only unsubscribe from my profile on the app. I see no options for email preferences on the app. Spam continues. Done with priceline. | I can always count on Priceline to come through for me with a great rate! | I just love this app! I find great deals and so easy to use! I highly recommend it | Have several travel Apps that I've used in the past . After a a Quick Look , it's been a very long time since any have beaten Priceline . On limited service in the smaller markets , I stopped looking at the others . With the Patels competing with themselves , limited service seems more limited wherever it can be applied . 

But the Quality Inn I booked is a very nice place to stay . Great value , nice people too . | I love using this app. It provides great suggestions and express deals. | I travel often for business. Three weeks ago, I decided to utilize the 5 top travel apps to ensure the best deal. I just finished deleting all travel apps except for the app which rendered the best deal EVERY TIME….Priceline!!!!  
Over 3 weeks I booked 18 nights and saved an average of $18 per night booking through Priceline. The app encompasses ease of use, fast booking, and the lowest price. | Conviene , great selection and reasonable pricing! | I have used Priceline and a number of occasions. Most recently I flew to Austin. I had to wait an hour for a rental car. And was rushed through the line. Was charged for the rental car again and had to argue with Fox rental car. Went to the hotel and the hotel told me it wasn't paid for as well. I told the hotel it was paid through Priceline. I thought all is well until after I checked out and they tried to charge my credit card for the room. Welcome to the new version! 

With our latest update, you can now view real-time flight status directly on the flight details screen. No more endless refreshing or switching between screens.

We are always available to assist you!
If you have any feedback, comments, or ideas, please don't hesitate to contact us at support@impalastudios.com. 

Thank you for traveling with us, 
The Flight Tracker Team

Ads run each time after a flight is added to be tracked, which is fine and assumed on the free version. The problem comes when the ads  are obvious scams. As of at least yesterday, 1/21/2024, every search for an an Alaska Airlines flight results in “No Flights Found.” I uninstalled and reinstalled the app, with no change. Like much of the nation, we’re under very nasty weather conditions, so I was hoping this app would keep me advised of flight status. However, before the app will ADD a flight to my calendar, it wants full access to my calendar. title: Planes Live - Flight Tracker
description:
Planes Live Free is a simple yet powerful flight tracking tool that lets you watch the planes online all over the world and get up-to-date information on flights instantly! Track the flights of your family members or beloved ones as if you were traveling with them and find the best time to pick them up at the airport. 

Whether you are a professional pilot or an aviation enthusiast, you'll definitely appreciate our flight tracker - the simple, clean and informative interface coupled with powerful functionality!

FEATURES

* Track planes and biplanes online all over the world
* Get notified about the flight schedule changes with handy alerts: be aware of the flight status, canceled flights, new departure and arrival time and more
* Search for particular flights, airports, ​and locations
* Get detailed information on flights: from aircraft characteristics and picture to its route and schedule
* Find up-to-date airport information that covers accurate departures and arrivals schedule, airport timezone and local time, its location and weather forecast
* Add airports and locations to "My Places" to access them instantly!
* Check weather forecast for a particular location or airport
* Spot planes and airports near you: select the desirable distance and enjoy the show!
* Apply smart filters to track a particular airplane model or an airline company, watch the planes of selected altitude, speed or airport.

PREMIUM FEATURES
* Weather Overlays
* Unlimited number of alerts
* 2x faster data update
* Terminal, Check In, Gate and Baggage info
* No Ads

* Subscriptions will automatically renew and payment will be charged to your iTunes account unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. The cost of the renewal depends on your Subscription Plan. Our standard Subscription Plans are:
- 1 week subscription with 3-day free trial ($4.99 USD)
- 1 year subscription ($39.99 USD)
For other currencies, the price corresponds to the same price tier on the App Store Pricing Matrix. 

Subscription payments will be charged to your App Store account at confirmation of your purchase. Subscriptions will automatically renew and you will be charged unless auto-renew is turned off or unless you cancel at least 24 hours prior to the end of the current subscription or trial period. Any unused portion of a free trial period will be forfeited when you purchase a premium subscription during the free trial period. The cost of renewal depends on the Subscription Plan you choose. 
Subscriptions and auto-renewal may be managed by going to Account Settings after purchase or by contacting Customer Support.

Сoverage zone:
- Europe: up to 95% of the continent.
- South America: up to 90% of ADS-B coverage for airplanes.
- North America: close to 100% coverage of transmitter-enabled airplanes; 100% of data delivered with a delay of up to 5 minutes.
- Africa: major coverage of South Africa; partial coverage of the rest of the continent.
- Australia: 100% coverage.
- Asia: coverage of mainly densely populated areas.
- Oceania: 100% coverage.

Together with our partners, we are constantly working on improving the coverage.

Important Notice:
The airline tracker app uses data from several providers, which is collected from aircraft, equipped with ADS-B transmitters. ADS-B is not used by all airlines or aircraft. Due to technical limitations on how flight data is collected, ​it might be incomplete in some cases. We are working to improve this situation.

Privacy Policy: https://planeslive.com/privacyPolicy
Terms: https://planeslive.com/terms

title: FlightAware Flight Tracker
description:
Where’s that plane headed? Whether you’re an aviation enthusiast, a frequent traveler, a pilot, or part of a flight crew, FlightAware is a must-have app. Track planes in real-time above your head, or all over the world. Easily track the status of your flight, check for any delays on the inbound aircraft, see weather radar, and set up alerts to be notified of any changes – all for free!

Free features:

▶ Track any plane around the world in real-time
▶ Get free flight status alerts: Departure, Arrival, Cancellations, Gate changes, Delays, Diversions
▶ See weather radar
▶ Save your favorite aircraft and airports
▶ Check for flight delays (with “Where is my plane?”)

FlightAware is the leader in providing advanced, accurate, actionable intelligence and insights that inform every aviation decision. We believe that flying opens up the world around you. It makes distances shorter, the world more accessible and satisfies one of the core aspirations of mankind.
 
Upgrade options:
▶ Ad Remove - Removes all advertisements from the app
▶ FlightAware Aviator - Register and enable advanced features for your piston-engine GA aircraft

Terms: https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/dev/stdeula/

If you can fix it please reach out to me. | Doesn't work.. can't do alot of things promised.. my biggie... can not put in a date | Can’t get the alerts to work n now app isn’t working | And won’t go back up. | Love the tracking from start to finish. Well done. Thanks | While it lagged in time I still enjoyed using it to follow my family across the skies to their destination. 
Love it!!!! ❤️✈️ | More info was available before recent update. Previously could see boarding time and whether boarding had started but now the emphasis seems to be on showing other flights going in or out of airports on both ends of flight which is only useful for cancellations | I found this app to be at Times very confusing. I keep on going back to the other app I have, FlightView. | This is the most difficult app—it’s absolutely horrible! I have to go to google to find anything. | Downloaded the app during my flight when I realized that United uses Flightaware in their app. But it won’t run, just a spinning wheel. Deleted and reinstalled, same thing! I give up… | Not user friendly. Difficult to navigate the site. Confusing! Not worth the money at all! | I’ve used Flight Aware before on google and I finally got the app. But then the app would not work it just kept loading and loading over and over again. Someone please fix this. Flight Aware more like flight nowhere. | Way better than a reader board in an airport!
Accurate up to date info that will keep you moving! | Very very exemplary every moment trucker | The app doesn’t alert you when you set the notification bell for reminders. What is the point? Isn’t that the entire reason to use it? I don’t get it. It was set to alert me 45 min before landing, now it’s 22 min before landing and no alert… delete. | Your app is as accurate as can be. | I have marveled at the technology, design power,  grace and travels of airlines along with the skills, training and dedication of crews who carry many souls or sometimes precious cargo.  The daily activity in the skies using Flight Aware  allows me to imagine the crews, passengers, and cargo that show we are a people engaged in the world and it’s people. | When family travels peace of mind! | Thank you FlightAware for putting the flight data back to the old style! Much better | Fast, accurate & clean. | Unfortunately, your ADS readings concerning speed, climb and altitude are all wrong. I suggest you do two things. The first is that you correct whatever errors are in your software program that's corrupting the information we're getting and the second is to report speed in knots, not miles per hour. Right now, I could not give your app a really good rating like I would like to. | It literally blows the average person’s mind when I point at an aircraft flying overhead and inform them of the flight’s details! lol | I love the app and the fact that I can track my loved ones while on a flight, so I know when to pick them up. However the app doesn’t send out notifications like it says. I have them set for the “45 minute out” alert,  it not one alert has come through. I have checked the settings and everything is set to allow it to send notifications, but I have never gotten one. 🫤 so yay for tracking, but nay for notifications. | Not only does this app. serve as my defacto RADAR but is also used in conjunction with othe apps to provide radio communications (receive only) and weather radar apps provide airport diagrams, frequencies and real time weather. I can pinpoint storms arrivals to within five minutes of arrival at my location. The ADS-B this app depicts, is useful often all the way through the turn off the runway after landing. Fabulous ! | There is no way to remove that box with altitude etc and it blocks the flight path. Pleeeeease remove that box. I’m talking about the pop up box that follows the plane. I love this app! | Undo last update. Can’t find airport on map. Total waste of time. Looking for different app for my needs | Starts up, no aircraft appear. 

I need to change views, then return to the start up view to see aircraft. But then the map displays the South Pacific…!! 

The display is lagging way behind real time. 

There is a control to view my flight feeder (I have one from the company) but when I select the control I’m taken to a web page, not my flight feeder’s data…!!! 

There are many other intermittent anomalies; there are spurious failures, crashes and hangs. 

Disappointing. And I have the enterprise version and use the app while logged in to my account. | As MANY others have said the latest update is trash. Missing features that we enjoyed just a month ago. Lame. Bring back the old version and ALL the features or after SEVERAL YEARS I’ll be switching | Really like this app.  It’s good to track friends when meeting up at a fly-in.  I can also look up my plane and check out all the different perimeters of the flight.  Great job guys, you knocked it out of the park with this one. | I use the app to understand what is happening with the police helicopters. The big gray box obscures the flight path.  Please remove it! | When using classic background especially, nearby flights are muted ,hard to see | We are at the airport waiting for a flight but the app won’t let me check todays flight. Only tomorrow. Will delete app asap. | The update that now has a large box with flight info often obscures the flight path and other important map information. Please go back to the old way or at least give us an option to toggle it on/off.

App is fine otherwise. | The iPad version doesn’t seem to work at all on the Apple Vision Pro | Sometimes a new software update is a step backwards. The latest version occasionally freezes. Sometimes it freezes for a couple of minutes and occasionally the app must be closed and restarted.

When you tap on an airport like SFO all the other flights in the area disappear for a while.  The previous version of the software worked better.   

Can we roll back to the previous software version.    Don’t fix the software if it ain’t broken | Latest “update” took away the “where is my jet now” feature. The single most important feature to track whether or not your flight will be on time or not. Borderline useless now | Interesting to monitor progress of families flights. | Ever since the last update, helicopters don't show up at all anymore.  Very strange and disappointing.

title: Citymapper: All Live Transit
description:
Instantly compare your travel options in real-time across all transport modes globally! 

Easily navigate your city with turn-by-turn directions for all your public transportation, walking, cycling and scooter trips.

THOUSANDS OF 5 STAR REVIEWS

* "This is my favorite transit app. Full-featured and a breeze to use. I really appreciate the Uber integration."

* "Only way to get around NYC and Chicago. Easy and accurate. Download this one NOW"

* "I love it. It’s the best thing since zippers, peanut and jelly and 1 TB thumb drives"

* "Support for the SF Bay Area is particularly impressive because it aggregates all transit systems imaginable (BART, Caltrain, MUNI, VTA, etc.) into one seamless app"

FIND THE BEST ROUTE ► Simple trip planning combining all transport modes: bus, subway, train, ferry, cabs, ride share, car share, bike share, e-scooters and walking. Discover routes you never knew existed

HIT THE GO BUTTON FOR STEP-BY-STEP DIRECTIONS ► Turn-by-turn navigation for all your transit, walking, personal cycling, bike shares and scooter trips. Choose between 3 different map views, see the charge levels of e-scooters and e-bikes around you, we even help you avoid no-parking zones. We take care of the logistical thinking so you are free to enjoy the ride

EXPERIENCE ONE-STOP-SHOP MOBILITY ► Compare cab fares, hail a ride, hop on a shared bike or find the nearest e-scooter all from within the app. Our partners include: Uber, Lyft, JUMP, Lime, Bird, Spin, Skip, Scoot, Citi Bike, JerseryBike, Bluebikes, Indego, CaBi, Divvy, Metro Bike, Breeze, Bay Wheels, Healthy Ride, Relay, BCycle, SA Bike Share, GREENbike, Grid, RTC Bike, BIKETOWN, Biki 

BEAT THE RUSH HOUR CROWD ► Live wait times and ETA so you'll never miss a bus, train or ferry again. Follow your bus / train as it's approaching on a real-time map, see the best train car to board, get alerted when it's time to get off, and get in and out from the best exit at any subway / train station 

PERSONALIZE YOUR CITY ► Save Home, Work and your go-to stops or stations for lightning fast trip planning. Subscribe to your favorite subway, train, bus or ferry line for automatic disruption, delay, and status alerts

GET SOCIAL ► Share your live trip: let friends follow your live trip to know when you'll arrive. Share any location or address: one tap for others to get directions

TRAVEL OFFLINE ► Access offline the official NYC subway map, Manhattan bus map, Brooklyn bus map, Queens bus map, DC metro map, Muni Metro map, and more

CITY COVERAGE ► New York City | Chicago | Los Angeles | San Francisco | Washington DC | Boston | Philadelphia | Seattle | Miami | Atlanta | Portland | Denver | Baltimore | San Diego | Minneapolis | Houston | Phoenix | Dallas | Las Vegas | Pittsburgh | Honolulu | Salt Lake City | San Antonio | St. Louis |  Cleveland | Austin   

+ Many more worldwide! See the full list and vote for the next one in the app or at https://citymapper.com/cities

TRANSIT AGENCIES ► We use open data from transit agencies in the cities we cover, including: MTA | CTA | LA Metro | MBTA | WMATA | SEPTA | NJ Transit | Muni | BART | King Bus | MARTA | LIRR | RTD | TriMet | Metro-North Railroad | PATH | Houston METRO | San Diego MTS | Miami-Dade Transit | Metro Transit | METRA | RTC Bus | TheBus | Port Authority | DART | AC Transit | Sound Transit | UTA | OCTA | VIA | PTD | Metro Transit | RTA | Capital Metro | Broward County Transit Division | NY Waterway Ferries | Washington State Ferries | LBT | Nassau Inter County Express (NICE)| Valley Metro | Metrolink | Santa Monica Big Blue Bus (BBB)

KEEP IN TOUCH ► If you have questions or feedback or something we may have missed in your city email us at support@citymapper.com


Follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/Citymapper

Privacy Policy: https://citymapper.com/privacy
Terms of Service: https://citymapper.com/terms
releaseNotes: This one fixes a few things.
reviews:
Loving it as it helps us get around Paris. Wish it could have landmarks/points of interest highlighted on the map. | By far the most accurate app for navigation that I’ve used both in London and New York. | Do not trust! Apple Maps is better | Works. No Dark Mode. Still?? | I didn’t know what to expect, but this app is essential for getting around in London | First time overseas and was recommended this app through multiple YouTube channels and they were right.  Public transport was my biggest worry and this app made it simple. | This app saved my life and made me feel confident in traveling around town. I would recommend this to everyone | There used to be an active compass widget that you could add. This was so useful! Please bring it back 🙏 | Love it!!!! | My favorite thing about this app is that it has an option to select a quieter biking path! Love that. My biggest concern is that it automatically tells you how many calories that would be burned by walking or biking a certain route. I tried to turn this off in settings, but I don’t see that as an option.

The calorie count should be removed. It is…
- Misleading. Calorie burning is different for everybody, and these numbers are more inaccurate than anything else.
- Harmful. A lot of people in modern-day culture have a very fraught relationship with the concept of calories in food, a concept which has largely been used for fear-mongering and marketing. It is harmful to be confronted with this rhetoric in a transportation app.
- Not physically meaningful. The number of calories in a food is how much energy will be released if you set it on fire. That is not what is happening in a body during metabolism. | Used the app a few years ago when in Tokyo and it was fantastic. This recent trip, not so much. Relied on Google maps for transit directions with excellent results. Citymapper routes took long with more connections and lots more walking compared to Google maps. Some lines missing completely on Citymapper. Not sure what has happened. | City mapper needs to figure out why their app doesn’t stop when the user repeatedly closes the application at the destination. Very annoying. Otherwise the app is perfect. | I just downloaded the app and I’m trying to figure out navigation in a different part of the country. When I type in the address of my final destination, before I can even enter in my starting address- the app seems to be taking my current location (which is on the opposite side of the country from the final destination), and it keeps crashing and exiting me out. I’m unable to use this app. Please fix this, thanks! | Thank you for not getting us loss. 

We were impressed! | This is what the Parisians use because it is better and more reliable. Americans use Google Maps and it is less accurate. It didn’t note a major closure for months. Use this one. | Wrong bus times the whole day…. C’mon now | I just started using this app for the NYC subway and I have to give it to the developers, the use of the Dynamic Island is amazing. It shows me the time for the next train I need to take at the top of the screen and even a handy feature where you can see the best place of the train to board so that you will be near your exit. Not only this the app also gives detailed directions for walking and I find it extremely easy to use. | Changed my whole trip. So easy to use. London, Paris, any city. | In summary, Citymapper is an excellent choice for urban navigation, especially if you rely heavily on public transport or need detailed walking directions. Give it a try and see if it suits your needs. I suggest everyone should download it | This is an essential app or anyone visiting London or any other well known city. Lots of different cities mapped out in app. | App is good and accurate with timing of the trains. My only gripe is that it doesn’t always let you know if the train is an express or local. It just defaults to local trains. Can be stressful if you need to catch an express train but end up on a local train. Besides that it’s good. | I use this app all the time. It's better than the MTA app. | App shows you various routes, cost and time.  While using a selected route, even has real time updates and reminds you to get off trains at stops etc. | Dark mode. It’s been out for years idk why it’s not native. | Easy to use and clear information on how many stations left to to your destination | I used to use this app all the time when I was living in NYC, it was the best. But I’ve since moved to Florence, Italy, and it’s been very disappointing. It seems to rely on the scheduled bus times instead of the live ones. In this town, the bus schedules are completely meaningless and only the live times are reliable. If the app is using live times, then they’re not using the right ones - it’s always wrong, while the official bus app has reliable live times. Also, buses here are very frequently diverted and that’s never noted in the app. Even worse, the app has quite a few of the bus routes completely wrong, even when there are no diversions. It’s a shame, because I love the app… but all this adds up to it being completely unusable here. Unfortunately, I’m deleting it. | So much better than using google maps. If you get stressed about which platform, which train, which exit...then this is the app. | I live in NYC and this is my main form of transit help. It’s easy to use. You add your home address, work, and favorite place to find a route with a click of a button.

The only issue is that sometimes it gets train arrival times incorrect. In my case, the 7 train never has correct arrival times. For some reason, around midday (mostly around 1:40) at least, it says that the 7 train is going to arrive at my designated station starting 3 pm. 

I have to google maps so I can get on the 7 train, which is twice a week I have to do this. 

Pls fix! | Sometimes the location on what part of the train to enter be inaccurate | Ok Wow this app puts google maps to absolute shame. I’m a New Yorker who prefers to take the bus when I can (sunlight + cell service!) but NYC bus schedules can be notoriously unreliable depending on traffic, weather, politics of the week. This app has VERY impressive real-time tracking of trains and busses. I haven’t waited 15 minutes for a train or bus in months now because I check this long before I do google maps. THANK YOU | App no longer works— won’t let me change departure location. When I try the screen goes black and the app crashes. I updated it and the same thing happens. | So baffled… did anybody ask for this??? | Can’t believe what a wonderful and efficient APP this is!👍😊
It works perfect and took me all around the city I was in. | Love Citymapper especially the “best doors” features. I can stay out of everyone’s way, deal with public transit snafus with ease, and get where I want to go without unnecessary hassle. | App works great for getting around the city. Only thing that would make it better is allowing me to out multiple stops in and the solving for the best way to do them all. | It was priceless. Helped with the, bus, walking and biking. | Used to be Moovit // I even coined the tagline // CityMapper FTW | I was on a trip to England and I was lost and I relented my you guide recommended me this app. And I haven’t not used for since then | Great App | I live and travel all over the place, and Citymapper has been the most reliable navigation app I’ve used. Others are fine as well, but I really like their interface, the clean layout showing all the options (walking, transit, cars, etc), and - living mostly in Paris - especially the alerts re service outages in various transit lines. It’s reliable, works in most major cities (I have used it extensively in Paris, London, and LA personally), and even the free version (with minor footer ads, not obtrusive to the usability) is great. Big fan. | I wish there was a widget or a live activity for a specific station without the entire transit navigation to keep an eye on a specific bus in a specific bus stop. If one is missed the other is shown. This would really help in catching the next bus. | I downloaded this app after coming across a recommendation, but it’s been a letdown. The app crashes every time I try to start a trip, despite my software being up-to-date and attempting a restart. Unfortunately, Citymapper is unusable at worst and unreliable and buggy at best. | I downloaded and tried Citymapper on a recent trip to Spain. Incredible experience! I quickly found myself preferring Citymapper over other major map apps. I even found it more reliable walking, but the transit options were terrific. Fantastic experience! | Works great in NYC, train times are accurate and offers far more routing choices than google/apple. Goes above and beyond with info about subway exits and Citi bike stations. Unbelievably, it’s free. Not for place search, but Citymapper is in a class of its own for getting from point to point. | Wow! Incremental updates but it’s looking so good 👏 | And the best part is, it’s free | Works great but hate the new update. | If you’ve any issues whatsoever with the app, rest assure that NO CUSTOMER SERVICE exists at all! I’ve sent multiple emails (cause that’s the ONLY way from within the app) and waited forever and NOTHING. I’m just gonna delete the app and be done with it. 
Advice: Stay away from this service | Trust me when i say that you will definitely need this app when travelling to singapore specially for those who are new to the lion city 🤍 | Google maps is sometimes better.

title: Tube Map - London Underground
description:
Tube Map is the award-winning navigation app that includes the official TfL (Transport for London) Tube Map. Tube Map - London Underground works both on and offline and is the #1 Tube Map with over 22 million downloads!


Key features:


Uses the official TfL iconic Harry Beck London Underground map design.
Includes additional map views for the TfL Night Tube and Rail Network. Plus a bonus map that we have created that is more geographical. 
An easy to use journey planner that works with and without an internet connection.
Check line status for delays, closures and service changes.
See what time the next Tube is due with live departures from TfL.
National Rail arrivals and departures.
Journey planning made easy with real-time routing around closures and delays.
Use step-by-step directions in the journey planner to find your way around London.
Save your favourite routes for quick selection when on the go.
Save your Home and Work stations for up to date station, line and route information.
Find your closest Tube station wherever you are in London.
Tube Map – London Underground Apple Watch app available.
Line status widget
Travel Guide
Exclusive features also available; First & Last Tube Times, Tube Exits, Premium Line status widget and Priority Support.
NEW - Remove advertising subscription


With over 60 million downloads worldwide, there's a Mapway app for many of the busiest transport systems in the world including New York Subway, Paris Metro, Bus Times London and Berlin Subway.


Plan. Route. Relax.


Please note: whilst we endeavour to ensure that Line Status notifications are delivered in a timely manner we can’t guarantee this 100% of the time. There may be occasions when the functionality isn’t available due to technical reasons outside of our control. Continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life.


Tube Map Premium available as an in-app subscription: 99p weekly, £3.99 monthly or £9.99 annually, or as a one-off purchase of £24.99. Prices may vary by location. Cancel at any time, for any reason. Payment will be charged to your iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase. Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period. Your account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, at the cost of your chosen price tier. Subscriptions can be managed and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to Account Settings in your iTunes Account. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when a subscription to that publication is purchased, where applicable. Read our terms in full at https://www.mapway.com/terms-conditions/
releaseNotes:
Thank you for downloading the app. We regularly update the app to make it better for you. 


This release includes an updated map and some bug fixes and improvements for you.


To make sure you don’t miss a thing, just keep your updates turned on.



Got a question? Tap Support in the About section in the app.
reviews:
This App is helpful and I’ve used it for years, but the new Elizabeth line hasn’t been added. I’m surprised as it has been opened for almost 2 years now. | I found myself coming back to this app again and again despite also having the TfL app. This one is much more intuitive and I love the clean interface. It gives multiple options for connecting which is helpful if one line requires you to wait, or you need a specific line with multiple stops for different people. The offline options are especially helpful when on the underground as there’s no cell service. | Soon as I opened the app an ad popped up! Nope deleted right away | I would honestly pay to buy this app if the ads weren’t as obnoxious as they are in the free version.   I mean, lock out some features to make people want to upgrade, don’t bombard them  with obnoxious ads every 20 seconds. | The amount of ads is awful in case you don’t pay for their fee. Terrible user experience | I went to London for a trip and this was a life saver | Love it and sharing with stepdaughter - on her way to London | Used the free version on a recent visit to London.  The Tube moves a lot of busy people and is often crowded. Just when you need it to decide which lines to get you where you want to be, and trying not to impede polite but busy people, you’ll get an ad. And not just a quick ad you can x out of, but one that forces you to endure for way too long.  If you want to plan in advance, use CitiMapper, which includes more options to get you around by foot, train or bus. If you just need to navigate the Tube, you will find wall maps through out the stations, and they also provide free paper overviews of the entire system.  I understand ads support free apps, but these make the app unusable on the fly. | This is useless. Every tap redirects to ads which have  a fake x button. Rubish | I am getting a pestering array of Ads every so many times I use the free version.  These adds are not a typical banner at the bottom but are quite intrusive and disruptive. I used in 2019 to visit London in the same fashion but didn’t experience this Ads onslaught.  I get the impression the developer is wants users so annoyed to buy the premium service. I am only visiting for 5 days!!  Com’on developer, be a little nicer!!!! | This app surreptitiously installs a Safari extension called “ Shop & Save” that can read and alter webpages and browsing history — this is listed nowhere in the app description or during installation or during runtime. | I used this app six years ago and found it invaluable. Unlike many apps, this let you plan the route long before arrival in London. Many apps require you to already be there. However, to use the app now requires the user to submit to very annoying game ads. The ads run for a long time and even then the user can’t get off the ad and back to the app. TOTALLY USELESS!!! So after six years, I am deleting this app. What a relief! | I tried this APP on my  recent trip to London. What a waste of timeline. This App is confusing and counterintuitive. It is also REDUNDANT, because the regular maps app on your phone already does a far superior job. Just put in where you want to go in London, select “Transit”, and it does a 50x job. It will guide you through what platforms and stops you need and even keeps you apprised o mr arrival times.

Don’t bother with this garbage app. | If you like looking at ads and missing your train this is the app for you | Used this last week. If you can deal with the continuous ads it’s a good app. Missed some connections because we had to wait for all the ads to stop running. Never had an app that showed so many ads. Here is an idea to the developers, come up with a short term pricing plan like a week or two so we can get these stupid f-ing ads turned off and can make our connections!!!!! | Great app. Really made my trip to London easy to use the tube. Love that I can plan a route and save it. | Lots of ads, unclear map, and wants you to subscribe to a yearly service. Get real. | For a casual traveler, not wanting the paid version, there are just too many 30 second adds. Citymapper is much better. | This is just adware, it doesn’t show the map long enough to use it. Why would anyone use this when there is literally a free official app. | Terrible app—one of the worst metro map apps of any city in the world.  Absolutely choked with ads rendering it basically useless. | Just got back from our first trip to London and using this app made getting around London to see the sights via the tube so much easier. 
It can show you the nearest tube station to your location and all you do it put in the location of the station you will be starting from and where you want to go and it does the rest. Gives you what t train to take and tells you what stop to get off. If you have to switch trains, it tells you the stop you get off ti switch the train and the next train to take and what stop for your final destination. 
This was great and the tube is so nice to use to travel around London. Highly recommended to anyone going there and planning ti use the tube. Much, much less expensive than a taxi. | Every time I try to use this app it takes me to some new advertisement. Practically unusable. | 30 second ads every 30 seconds makes app unusable. Use the National Rail Enquiry app. That’s the app the rail workers use. | Used it for many years but recently it became unusable as ads are non stop and take forever! On top all of them trick you when you try closing them. Deleting now. Enough is enough | I loaded this app on my phone prior to a trip to London. And trying to search out various routes pop up ads come up right and left and make it impossible to even use the application. Would not recommend this at all. Looking for another alternative. | Live thevtube | I can’t get rid of it | Pop up adds are horrible. This used to be a good app. | My dreamy London and its comfortable …. | If you don’t subscribe to the ad free version, once an ad loads you can’t get back to the map. Extremely annoying | I’ve used this app for years.  I paid for no ads and extra features. Now the developer is wanting users to pay for an annual subscription. It offers me a “one time offer” for $9.99/year. I feel like if I’ve already paid for the app, I shouldn’t be held up for a subscription, and I have no intention of paying more. TFL has a great journey planner for free. | Unless you purchase the app don’t waste your time. It’s nearly impossible to use it before the screen is replaced by an ad probably every 15 seconds max. | I’ve been using the free version of this app while I’ve been here in London for the past week and can say without reservation that it has worked well without issues. It’s well worth your time and effort to install if you need a guide for the London tube system. | Everyone was very helpful and it was smooth sailing!! | Inaccurate for trip planning. Example: West Hampstead has three stations: Jubilee Line, Thameslink and Overground. Only the Jubilee Line is on this map. The Elizabeth Line isn’t shown either, although if you search on it, there’s a very detailed description. | Don’t like the pop up ads for diapers | The ads pop up just as you are starting to find what you are looking for and are incredibly intrusive. They also freeze the app. | The Elizabeth Line opened today after years (and years) of postponement. It’s not as if this app didn’t have sufficient notice. And yet, this line is nowhere to be found in their map or their line statuses. But there are various update history over the last several weeks with the app patting itself on the back for trying hard to be better. I have two words of wisdom for them: try harder. | As a tourist, I find the app difficult to use. The trip planner is great because it helps you figure out what lines to use. It does not however give you enough information to figure out if you were going north south east west, nor does it help you figure out The final destination which is how all of the trains are labeled. So it’s not quick and easy it requires you to try to find a map try to understand what the final destination is then try to find the train then try to find the list so you understand if you hit the final destination all of which you could do without the app which makes the app almost useless. | Sometimes Google Maps is better for route planning. Sometimes this app is better. I use both and compare. | Easy to use. Study it before you go and you’re a pro. Mind the gap! | Have been using this app on and off for ages, was brilliant. Now, it has so many pop up ads, it's unusable. 

No, I'm not paying a ridiculous annual price when there are free options available. 

Uninstalled. | The map of the London Underground is the best I have seen. Well worth getting. | Great app | Too many ads, especially back to back to back ads. Very annoying | Used to be a great App. I don’t mind paying the fee, but yearly?! Ads are horrendous | The free version has awful full screen ads that work disappear. | Works well. Can’t complain. | As soon as you bring up the app, ads display with no way to delete them.  You are better off bringing a paper TFL map when in London. | So many adverts keep popping up. Terrible user experience.

title: Turo - Find your drive
description:
Turo is the world’s largest peer-to-peer car sharing marketplace where you can book any car you want, from a vibrant community of local hosts across the US, UK, Canada, France, and Australia. Whether you're flying in from afar or looking for a car down the street, searching for a rugged truck or something smooth and swanky, guests can take the wheel of the perfect car for any occasion, while hosts can take the wheel of their futures by building an accessible, flexible, and scalable car sharing business from the ground up.

Whether it’s a truck to help on moving day, a swanky exotic for a luxurious weekend away, or a classic cruiser for a picture-perfect road trip, with thousands of vehicles listed worldwide, Turo lets you find the perfect vehicle for your next adventure.

Upgrade your travel plans
• Choose from a totally unique selection of cars and drive the perfect one for your trip
• Book cars directly from local hosts
• Safely access cars through a variety of contactless check-in options
• Get the car delivered, and book trips on the go with a quick tap

Start your own car sharing business
• Share your car and build a car sharing business with Turo
• Start with a car you already own or buy one to share — any car owner can start exercising their entrepreneurial muscles
• Choose how many cars to share, scale your business up or down however you want, and decide how to reinvest your earnings
• Whether you want to commit a lot of time or a little, you can earn at home or on the go, on your schedule, and divest any time
• Rest easy with liability insurance from Travelers Excess and Surplus Lines Company backing each trip

Note: Continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life.
releaseNotes: Updates and fixes to make booking trips and managing listings on Turo easier.
