title: OOO - Trusted Travel Tips
description:
Out Of Office (OOO) is a recommendation app that allows you to see travel ideas and inspiration from people you know and trust.

PERSONALIZED RECOMMENDATIONS: Answer a short quiz and help us give you personalized travel recommendations. 

CONNECT WITH FRIENDS: Find friends in the app and invite your contacts to join your inner circle.

ADD YOUR RECOMMENDATIONS: Add any recommendation from your travels to our platform so your followers can see where you went and what you liked

SAVE FUTURE TRAVEL INSPO: Wishlist any places and recommendations that you want to remember to inspire future travel.
releaseNotes: Performance improvements and bug fixes.
reviews:
This has been such an incredible app to find the best new and delicious restaurants in cities. We go to NYC often and love trying new hot spots and OOO always has the best options. 5 stars!! | I’m struggling to find places in the app. Things like local restaurants and even museums are “not found”. | Cool app and an upgrade from Yelp, specifically geared to travelers. Ability to find community through recommendations and get a real time look in at what people are doing across the world. | Explain for the life of me why Philadelphia is not listed. I see South Philadelphia and Philadelphia county and someplace called new Philadelphia. I don’t see Center City Philadelphia or just simply Philadelphia in general I don’t understand. | This app has a great concept for planning trips, however is very slow when searching destinations to add. | Very glitchy - takes a long time to load. Shows all results of things to do, after you put in the location, to places in completely different countries!! | The map feature only shows you the most recent 10 recommendations. To see them all I have to scroll and load each recommendation which takes FOREVER. And when I click into any recommendation, I lose my place and have to start over. So it’s virtually impossible for me to actually see all my recommendations laid out. So disappointing, I’ll have to just use google maps | Before you begin there is a short questionnaire which asks who you are traveling with. I put family and children, yet when I inserted my travel destination and had an itinerary generated, it recommended things that were not kid friendly.

Additionally, the questionnaire asks what your budget looks like. Although I chose the lowest bracket, it recommended five star restaurants that were completely unaffordable for me. 

There were a couple hidden gems in the recommendations, but overall it isn’t worth the space it would take up on my phone unless some more moms joined the community to beef up the kid and budget friendly recommendations. | Looking for a great planning tool that allows you to share with others in your group. This is the one, nice layout and many recommendations for your area of stay. | I could not for the life of me figure out how to see any reviews for places in a city. Whoever designed the ui for this app should be fired. | I want to live this app but it’s certainly glitching on me. I’m clicking on what I know is a restaurant I have saved in San Fran and it’s saying it’s a beach. | Great to find people who like what you like, so you can get a better idea of what you may like in new places.

I’ve added a bunch, and the location are off. For example, upstate NY is occasionally included in NYC and 2 of my Japanese restaurants in NYC are being listed as a cathedral location. | I love the concept of the app, but some features don’t work or don’t have a real purpose. It’s really hard to just search an area without looking at someone else’s list. When you search something and add it to a list, the UI just throws you back to a random place and you have to start your search over again. Needs some work on user experience, but I’ll keep using and hope bugs get fixed! | People use Apple Maps for the same use as an app like this. This is just a places finder. So no point and not recommended. | So excited to use this app! Look me up and share your travel tips! @bohemianspirit | I love this app—so helpful for planning trips! If I have one suggestions, it’s that I wish you could add comments/reminders to yourself when you add a place to a trip (e.g., what dish everyone loves at a restaurant). I think you can’t add notes like that when you’re planning, only once you’ve marked it as a recommendation. | I use OOO both for finding new restaurants and as a quasi-travel diary so when I go back to a city I can remember my own favorites! 

With fake reviews / AI seeming to be on the rise on other sites, it’s fantastic that OOO allows you to filter by reviews of people you know. | I love this app, but I think it’s going to take some updates and improvement before this app becomes trendy. Users should be able to categorize places manually because some of them are incorrect—e.g., it lists one of my hotels as something to “do” instead of as a place to stay—and there is no way to change it. I also saved a recommendation in Utah and it is showing up as a location in Michigan. But I would love to see this app grow and for more people to start using it, it has such awesome potential!! | You’re only able to make itineraries with limited items. I work really hard to find hidden gems so it doesn’t really make sense that I can make an itinerary using only the most popular spots | The best way to make the perfect itinerary for all your stops & trips 😍 | Love all the features so far, but how can I make a reservation as I don’t see how you do it using open table. Is a booking feature coming soon? | Not only is the brand name perfect. I love how the app is designed and it’s features. I can definitely see this app being a must have for travellers with a few extra features. 
I use it to plan my trips and save my must go to places. It’s been super handy! 

I would love to see a option on the trips section to share the itinerary via PDF. I can imagine it would look perfect to share with friends who don’t use the app or if you are planning a trip for a family member. 

Keep up the great work! I’m a super fan! Finally an app that not only is pretty but also super useful 🫶🏼 | I love this app. Just starting to use it and I am in love with the My trips part of it. Love being able to add places of interest with times for each day! The only thing is that some of the places I rec show incorrect info on my page. I recommended a place in Utah Wyoming and the final place on my place is showing Ann Arbor, MI. Another is showing incorrect town with a picture that had nothing to do with my review.  Also the feedback does not work on the app. Unable to send any feedback. | EDITS:
Would also love to see the ability to add a “manual” item- for example: hop-on, hop-off bus tours. Would be super helpful to leave a review and just save my pictures and notes from the experience for keepsakes.

This could easily be the next big social media craze, especially with travel coming back! I love the concept: plan and document all my trips in one place, with ability to recap them in the perfect mix of photos and written descriptions, WITH A SCHEDULE :) so I can easily pass down detailed plans. Amazing. BUT, there are definitely features missing before it can go viral… I’d love to see: - The ability to add photos to a place just for you/even if you don’t “rec” a place, so I don’t have to post personal pictures to the internet if I want to use it like a social network with a cute recap of me and my partner on a trips’ pictures for our friends and family. This would go along great with better privacy/sharing settings, so I can share my trips and photos and comments/notes with people, allow others to add comments who are tripmates and maybe a “view only” tier with public/private comments for what I want a friend to be able to see (if someone from work asks for trip recs, but maybe I don’t want them to see my reservation notes on a place but do want them to see my review). | As a travel agent, I LOVE using this app to build trips for my clients. Once all of your activities/hotels/restaurants are loaded, my clients are able to click on the itinerary and everything shows up on the map in their app, which saves them  TONS of time from having to Google everything individually outside the app. Super trendy, modern, and unique recs from all the users. Such a fun travel space to be in! | Amazing for travels recs and finding new places.  I’ve been sending lists of my recs for years and now this makes it so much easier to share with friends! | I hope more people use it, such a cool idea | A really awesome function that should be incorporated in to this beautiful app would be a visually appealing countdown feature for “My Trips”. A bonus would be the ability to create a Home Screen widget for your countdown as well! | So much potential. I got so excited for this app and to use it but has a few problems. This is my first ever review on here because guess what? Your feedback option does not work. You click on submit and does nothing. Do you guys not test your app after updates?
Also, does anybody who works for this app ever use it at all? If so, you can easily catch the glitches and what needs to be fixed. For example, when you click the “back” button, it doesn’t really go back to the previous page you’re on. When i am checking out another person’s profile, clicks on their recs, and then tries to go to back to their page, it doesn’t. It leads me back to my profile! It is so annoying. Please fix this. The app is way too focused on “aesthetic” but has no quality. Way too many problems. | I love this ap!! I love having lists for all my trips in one place, love the aesthetic, & the map feature ! 

I would LOVE to be able to make my own notes for businesses that only I can see. That way any research I’ve done on the place can be there too. For example- a place that doesn’t take reservations for breakfast, I’d like to note that :) | Love the look and design of this app, and the concept and information you get for trips is amazing!! Really helpful to create your own trip folders or wishlists all in one place with pictures, location etc etc. convenient and helpful to get you to all the places you’re wanting! 

The docked star is due to some interface annoyances through using the app. When clicking into someone’s recommendation from a trip and clicking the back arrow it brings you all the way back to the search page rather than that person’s trip to continue looking through their reccos. So you have to find your way back to where you were if you want to continue browsing. | Love this concept and the ease of use of the app. As a business owner, I wish there was a way we could edit information that isn’t correct, such as hours of operation. I understand the concept is for this to be different than Yelp, just wish we could provide accurate information. | This app is a beautiful way to plan trips and to remember past trips. | So helpful to see hometown recommendations! Love love love this app and can’t wait to see all the new features that get added 🙌🏽 | As someone who loves traveling and giving recs, this is perfect. Still needs some things worked out,   Like my profile picture and background photo do not load or show? probably a bug issue. Also I would love it if you were able to have a tab with a grid of all the photos you’ve took at locations, similar to Instagram, and the ability to change the main photo on your profile of trip locations. Otherwise great app can would love to see this grow | While I’m pretty proud of the state of my travel spreadsheets, this app blows them away. The social aspect, easily saving and sharing ideas with friends, make planning so much easier. | Pros:
+ GPS enabled search
+ Clean, intuitive functions
+ Collaborative space

Cons:
- does not map from location to location
- there’s no default view of a trip to show the entire itinerary, you have you click day by day 
- you can’t share trips to Instagram stories, there should be an attractive easy display for sharing on social media 
- there is no FAQ or feedback section in the app to suggest changes 
- you cannot make notes about a location or place you select for your trip, therefore I still prefer using notes over this app until it adds features

I am happy to use this app for an upcoming trip and will provide an updated review if the app features are updated. | I love this concept! The app is super easy to navigate and fun to use. I love logging all of the places I’ve been to, because it both helps give people I know recommendations, and it gives me a nice memory bank of where I’ve been. I used this to plan a recent trip, and it was such a neat way to keep track of where I wanted to go and what I wanted to do. Love the map feature to see where in a city my friend’s recommendations are, and to find where my next stop is on vacation! | Love all the features so far. Genius idea!! When I’m planning trips, especially international trips, I use google maps to organize the itinerary based on location and proximity. I’m def gonna start inviting friends to join to make our lives easier. 
 For more effective itinerary planning, I would suggest adding the following:
1. Times
2. Option to add attachments, videos or images because some of the images don’t do these places justice)
3. Finally notes within scheduled places (as shown in the previews) and also notes to add activities that are not listed. 

I also love how the map shows the proximity of places to each other but is it possible to add a feature where we can see the actual distance from one place to another and perhaps driving directions? Currently, google maps only opens for directions to one place. | truly changes the game | Really great concept and I love the user friendliness. However, each time I try to see a list of someone’s recs on their page (or even my own), the recs do not load. The only way I can see recs is by searching a city right now. Needs an update probably

UPDATE: it works fine. This ^ was only happening for a few hours the first day. Really cool app! | Great for planning trips and sharing recommendations with friends! | It’s so awesome that you can put locations on the day you plan to visit but why not add time? It’s not a full function collaboration or trip planing tool if you can’t plan times in your day. | Cool app. Will definitely be using in future travels. Just wish there was an option to add your own photos and notes. Could possibly make this option private or public for others to see. | There are many things I love about this app. I just started using “plan my trip”.  
Not only am I adding all the places/ things I want to do as I prepare but this will also serve as a record for me for future,  Have u ever tried to remember that little restaurant you had stumbled across but couldn’t. Just park it here. | Love the app, such a great concept, very user friendly, and very great aesthetically. Just one thing- please make an update where you can make folders within each city of recommendations so that we can distinguish between food recs/activities/shopping, etc. Right now they are all in one category under each city and I’m afraid my recommendations will get lost in the sauce and get confusing if I keep adding to it! Would love a bit of organization and categories within each city. Thank you! | I’m already obsessed with the app as-is. It’s been. A very practical, helpful tool for trip research & planning - especially for group trips with friends or family. I don’t have a ton of friends on the app yet, so my planning process is still to go to Pinterest or travel blogs for ideas and then I save my wishlist things to do in Out of Office. If they keep building out additional features that make it more useful, building a user base I want to follow, and create more opportunities for engagement across users, this app will be an absolutely must have for anyone who enjoys a trip! | I love to see what friends and influencers that I follow are doing when they travel. Places to stay, eat, sights to see! I sometimes DM people and ask but this makes it so much easier especially when planning a trip and giving others recommendations. 10/10 recommend! | This is hands down one of the most beneficial travel apps I have ever used. For someone who loves to travel the reviews and recommendations have been spot on! Can’t wait to use the app on my next trip! | A user friendly interface that’s so easy to use! And because I trust my friends (and some influencers), it makes picking my hotel or restaurant so simple! Why didn’t someone think of this sooner? (Love the name, btw)

title: Steller: Plan & Book Trips
description:
Steller is a travel planning app that makes finding the best things to do easy and planning your next trip stress fee. 


PLAN YOUR NEXT TRIP
Our trip builder combines AI and the power of the human experience to help you create the perfect trip. Hidden gems, the hottest spots on Instagram, the must sees – you can find, explore, and book them all in the Steller app. 

SEARCH ANY DESTINATION ON EARTH
Search and find travel videos and recommendations for any destination. Whether you’re looking for travel recommendations you can trust in San Diego or Kathmandu — you’ll find them on Steller. 

BE INSPIRED BY A GLOBAL COMMUNITY OF TRAVELERS
Want to explore a new destination, but don’t know anyone who has been there? Each destination on Steller has videos from real travelers allowing you to see it from different perspectives.


BOOK UNIQUE EXPERIENCES & FAVORITES 
Whether you’re looking for a unique experience or the most popular attractions you can book it in minutes on Steller.

FIND YOUR TRAVEL FAM
Connect with people like you who love to travel and explore the way you do. 


THE MAP YOU’VE BEEN WAITING FOR
Zoom in on the Steller map to find something to do nearby. Map locations are infused with videos from real travelers giving you a sneak peek before you go. 


SWIPE UP FOR DETAILS
Wondering where a travel video is located? Swipe up to find the location, Google directions, and details about a place right inside Steller.


SAVE YOUR FAVORITES
Have a trip coming up? Save all your favorite recommendations, videos, places to stay, and things to eat to a trip. 

SHARE YOUR OWN VIDEOS
Took a trip and want to share about it? Ate at a restaurant that slaps? Had an experience you can’t keep to yourself? Upload a quick video and show the community.


BOOK A STAY
Places to stay at every price point. You may even discover some unique stays you won’t see anywhere else.


TRAVEL WITH CONFIDENCE
Reviews you can trust combined with videos from other travelers and the creators you love, means you’ll know what to expect before you go. Steller gives you all the information you need to feel confident in your travel choices.


USE THE MAP
If you’re looking for somewhere to eat or something to do right where you’re at — use the map on Steller to find something close by.


Terms of service — https://steller.co/terms


Privacy Policy — https://steller.co/privacy


Have feedback? Contact us at https://steller.co/contact
releaseNotes: Introducing Trips, our new trip planner to help you find the best places for your next trip. Explore thousands of trip recommendations shared by real travelers.
reviews:
Best travel site ever! | I like the idea of tracking travel locations but it seems to miss most cities so our multi city trip is hard to implement.  I didn’t see it but having a map incorporated into the app for the visual reference would be nice.  Thanks. | I created a stellar account years ago. Didn't use it much but I remember thinking it was cool. I came back to try after seeing an ad online that made it look different. But I can't login using my old login (fb) without it saying my email is already associated. I'm clicking login, not create account. 

So I guess it just isn't meant to be. Sad. I had high hopes. | Love sharing all my fav travel moments in one place. The new trips feature is cool for planning trips or sharing trip itineraries with friends. | Hello. There is a bug with the current (11.2.1) version of the Stellar app for iOS. The app provides an option to use a Twitter/X login to create an account.

If the user backs out (cancels out) of the Twitter authorization login, the user will is sent back to an unresponsive Stellar app. The app freezes until it is manually restarted or deleted and then re-downloaded. This is very odd, as I have never seem this happen with any other iOS app. Canceling out of the Twitter authorization prompt is usually the first thing I do. I have never seen an iOS freeze the way the Steller app does.

My Twitter account of @RandomiOSBugs tagged the @StellerStories account online. Please investigate this issue, thanks.

P.S. the Steller app’s Privacy Policy and Terms and Conditions links are not working on the Twitter authorization page either. | I used to love this app, I still do ….

Except for the inability to create stories, with more than one page.

The format was far better when first created .
It was much easier to use. 
Maybe it’s just me , but the changes make it harder to compose stories that allow for multiple pages as it used to.

Also . I was locked out of my original story page ,  for which support was never able to help , making it u organized and harder  
to create. | After falling out of love with so many social platforms, Steller give the experience feel without the pretentious vibes of some *cough* other platforms | This app was so easy to join and will definitely inspire you | Great for finding beautiful places to travel! | I'm
So disappointed that this app was so much better and easy to share to download plus easy to make stories before.  Now I'm confused again it's like the 3rd time changing your app. I can't share it on my social media etc. I'm very disappointed and sad about it. | Love the app. You see travelers’ perspectives organized around locations that are hard to get elsewhere. Like the simple nav too! | One of the better apps for creatives, it incorporates text, photo & video to allow anyone with a creative eye to present their work and/or their life in the most beautiful way possible as “Stories” or “Moments.” | I’ve been on this app for many moons.  I’ve seen all the changes.  Some I love, some irk me to no end!

The best thing about this app is that you can explore the world from your phone.  You can plan vacations, workaround and add to your bucket list without the hassle of talking to a travel agent or scrolling for hours on other social media networks.  

O probably should also mention that  it’s simple to use and easy to share content to other platforms.

Download it today! | So cool to see how this app has changed over the years. I remember this before search was even added. Keep up the great work :-) | I just started using the Stellar app this week and cannot put it down! I love adding stories and seeing the cool new places I want to visit. And soooo easy to use. I’ve been looking for an authentic travel app and THIS.IS.IT! | I’ve had major issues with this app from trying to create an account to trying to post my first post. It seems either something is wrong with their servers or with the app. The only way I have been able to get in was by using a VPN. Even then the functionality still isn’t there. Considering who built this app I find that very odd. | Screw the algorithms, ads, and noise of your other social apps. Steller is a simple and beautiful way to discover and create stories. Turn the camera roll on your phone into beautiful stories to share with families and friends. I use this for trip recaps, building my travel hit list, and discovering hidden gems and adventure ideas. I can’t recommend this app enough. It’s so fun and easy to use. | I love Steller for finding travel recommendations and keeping up with friends travels. The new feature, Moments, makes it even easier to share things on the go! Great way to connect with fellow creators 😍 | This app was so great but I still can’t figure out why they had to make every page auto advancing. I’m having to pause every page and it makes the entire experience feel rushed. There are other apps for that. This should be for well told stories that deserve more than 2 seconds per page. | I started using Steller recently and I love it! It’s such a great way to share travel stories and it is also perfect for sourcing inspo and tips for upcoming trips. It works well, has all of the necessary features, and the user base is full of like minded individuals who love to travel, get outside, and explore. | Been on the App for les than thirty minutes and my mind is blown. Incredible content from real travelers. Bravo Steller. | I used to love this app when it launched but this has become hard to use and needlessly complicated to create. | App is wonderful but I really need to be able to turn the sound off. I have the sound turned off on my phone most of the time so I’m not disturbing anyone else nearby. But the music plays on every story with no way to turn it off. Have to turn the volume all the way down, then hope I remember to turn it back up later. Really a miss in an otherwise great app and platform. | I cant reset my password knowing my username. I haven't logged in for about a year and yet my account is viewable. 

None of possible emails (of 3) received any reset email. | This app is honestly amazing, all I want to figure out is how to move the frame around so the photo i want to post i can center the subject in the frame but I’m sure that’s coming. Love this app so far! | I have been searching for an app that I could switch to from IG, since IG has so many ads these days. Steller is stunning! It’s not as active as Instagram, but I love that there are no ads and I can choose who to follow without algorithm suggestions. | I love this app, but is there anyway to pay for the service so there will no longer be a watermark on the page if I repost to other social media accounts? It ruins the clean layout of the page, and that is why I use this app in the first place. | When I first stumbled on this app, I was a love! A beautiful story book play this year short simple stories through photos and an economy of words would be ideal for sharing. Unfortunately, it has a ludicrous Instacrap format to it that you cannot control the speed in which to consume it. If I wanted IG, I would’ve just gone with the real thing, but since I am not 14, there’s no reason to go with it. Bring back the old storybook format! | I love Steller because I can tell stories and write through a social media app. I’ve only done one post but I already love the app! So much fun, and very simple. It isn’t confusing at all. (That sounded sarcastic but it wasn’t, I’m serious) 100000% recommend. | I really wanted to use and love this app.... I created a story but was unable to upload it I reached out to stellar via Twitter. Someone reached out to me and tried to help but then dropped off the face of the earth it’s been over a month and I’ve yet to hear from anyone. I’m close to deleting it at this point there’s just no point in having an app I can’t use. What’s worse your story doesn’t save on their sever so if I delete and reinstall the app I’ll loose my story ..... so wish I could have enjoyed it but oh well it is what it is | This is all that you need. One app for all your Instagram stories need! | Para mi es la mejor aplicación que he encontrado para escribir mis historias con fotografías. Las herramientas son fácil de utilizar y quedan muy bonitas una vez finalizado el trabajo. Saludos desde Costa Rica | Update: Since recent updates to app,
Some of the best previous features are gone. It is not as easy to format and select styles, captions, and even to import photos. 
A wonderful medium for sharing stories - art, photography, recipes - easy to use. Highly recommend for creatives and appreciation. | Love how Steller has some beautiful and simple templates to help share photos of my travels and add tips and notes about the destinations. The new map feature is helpful for finding unique spots to explore. I also love that the stories can be downloaded and shared easily to IG, making story creation useful for multiple platforms. | Minimalist visual storytelling. It's perfect, easy, and across multiple channels. Done. | I love this app... it’s clean, it’s classy very easy to maneuver. We all have A story to tell. Make it Stellar. | I just started doing this and I just read a review and I feel like the person had some very good points; it would be great to do little family skits and save them together and eventually combine all these skits to become a movie night actual mo a movie type bigger one you can include” just to have them in one place and all of the projects saved. I love checking out the stye 
This is not an option yet.  I also would like to change the theme for new videos etc.  Nonetheless, I will be using this one specifically probably more than a few Thera I’m will to train myself to use. Thanks overall. Looking forward to many acquaintances I love and we support each other. If you would like to pitch in too, show posts to others and get help when stumped, it’s all good. You’ll belong. Children are encouraged to have interest in family stories. Not like is new grannies, and considered more than me and my family adventures aka best comedy to pee your pants from low bladder function.  Overall:    Thanks for all this! My new scrapbook project/ video family scrapbooking new is waiting to start. Too happy to form memories in an updated. | User experience is great with this app. Everything is where I expect I'm going to find it when navigating through it. I find that really important because apps that are easy to use keep me coming back. I'm really loving it! | It’s pretty cool! Lol helped me step my story and post game up a bit lol | Title ^

Otherwise great app, simple and not bloated. Minimalistic yet functional.
Love it. | One app I’ve kept around on my iPhone but the iPad version is less than desired! Like half the apps available it does this weird non-full screen thing that has a black border that takes up 1” of of the screen on both sides! Until that’s fixed I’m iPhone only :( | Nice clean design layouts, and it’s perfect for me to get my artwork out there! Easy user interface. | This app is simple and straight to the point more articles should be like this versus beating around the bush | I’d been working on a post for stellar for quite some time, putting in hours of effort. 
Months later I went back to add other thoughts and pictures to this draft and it’s gone... 

I’m sooo upset. So much work done that I will never get back. 

Hoping Stellar will reach out with a solution. Hopefully they can recover it. | Love this app so much!!! | I can see how this could be a great way to share photos in a story format. I might be overlooking it but I feel there needs to be an option to change the background color. Not just by purchasing blush, but custom color, or even a photo from album. Also I think the option to rearrange the photo spots to where I want would be fantastic. Other than that simple to use and nice designs. | Just downloaded and it’s great so far | I hate this app. Bought several fonts and now they’re all gone. And it doesn’t do a square format for Instagram. Also, the choices in the purchased fonts are really lame. Meh!!!! | Occasionally I wish I could better place my picture in the frame, though.  But still, I have been having a blast using this app and have told everybody I know who takes pics about it! | I am completely in love with this app. You can explore truly beautiful photography and true stories. The app is not full of people that are just posting random stuff. I am truly hoping that it stays as amazing as this.

title: FindPenguins: Travel Tracker
description:
PLAN, TRACK, AND BLOG YOUR TRIPS

Automatically track your travels in a beautiful way. FindPenguins creates your travel journal, simply with your phone in the pocket.


PLAN YOUR TRIP

FindPenguins lets you easily plan your travels. Put your itinerary together, upload your travel documents, and have it all at your fingertips.


AUTOMATIC TRAVEL TRACKING

Turn on our travel tracker and your phone automatically follows your itinerary. Our tracker is battery-saving, works offline, detects flights and much more!


YOUR TRAVELS IN A BOOK

Order a beautiful photo book of your FindPenguins travels into your home, with your stories, maps, photos, statistics and if you like, even the comments of your friends.


INTERNET IST NOT REQUIRED

Track your route in the wilderness, in the desert or on the ocean! The FindPenguins travel app doesn't need internet, it works completely offline. Simply upload your posts and travel route whenever you are online.


FULLY AUTOMATED

Travel route, world map, photo albums, statistics? Blog your “Footprints”, all the rest of your travel journal comes entirely automated.


FOLLOW YOUR FRIENDS

Did you ever wonder, what your friends or fellow backpackers do during their travels? Which cities, bars, national parks, beaches – places in general they visit? Follow travel blogs of like-minded and let others follow you.


PREMIUM MEMBERSHIP

If you decide to subscribe for a Premium Membership, payment will be charged to your iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase. Your monthly subscription is $4.99 per month, while the yearly subscription is $29.99 per year (price may vary by location). Subscriptions automatically renew and your account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable. Auto-renewal may be turned off in your account settings in iTunes any time after purchase.

Terms and conditions of use: https://findpenguins.com/terms
Data privacy statement: https://findpenguins.com/privacy

JUST THE RIGHT APP FOR YOUR TRIP!
releaseNotes: With this version we made FindPenguins a little bit better. We're always listening at support@findpenguins.com.
reviews:
Brand new to this, I hope it does what it says!! | I love this travel app!   I have NEVER done social media before.  No FB, InstaGram, etc.  I’m old school.   But my trip to Spain to walk the Camino de Santiago demanded that I post (socially) my travel adventures.  First for my wife and secondly for my mom!  So I hunted and searched for the best-simple-way to post daily pics, videos -and comments. And what I heard from multiple sources was “FindPenguins”!   So here I am.  It is user friendly.  Today is my very first day on my Camino and also beginning to use this app.  And I have already successfully entered 4 “foot prints”.   Join the app and you’ll see what I mean. | On my fifth trip with FindPenguins and absolutely love the app. Don’t really like sharing my traction FaceBook and other social.This lets me pick who I share with and encourages me to write a little each day while traveling. 

The best book is the book you can print once you finish, they are very well designed and printed. | This travel blog is so simple to use, add pictures, write notes, and caption photos. Love it! | This is the first app I’ve used of this kind. I’m using the free version. 
I like being able to load pictures but do wish I could add more than 20. Also, I need to learn more about how things work- like if I can add maps and such. 
It’s one of hard for me to keep up with doing it every travel day but it’s the best I’ve ever done before so I’m really happy with it for that reason | I spent considerable time trying to find a travel app that would create a breadcrumb map, allow me post pictures and text and share with friends and on social media. FindingPenguins is it. I tested it for a few days and it seemed user friendly. I just started my real trip and am really enjoying it. My only recommendation is to adding boating as a travel type (I’m not on a cruise or sailing but I am traveling on a boat). | A fan and user of FindPenguins on my phone and ipad, I really hope for a native Mac version which will be stable and less buggy.  Trying to use this version on a Mac is fraught with incompatiabilities. 

My two main complaints:
1. As soon as you try to reorder photos, the app partially crashes with a thumbnail on the screen of the photo you tried to move until you force-quit the app.

2. The spelling and grammer check constantly rewrites perfectly correct and normal words, or cuts you off in the middle of typing.  Its horrid.  If you try to turn off Spelling and Grammer correction in the menu, for some inexplicable reason it will return within just a few minutes on its on, and will continue screwing with your text.  

The app is so annoying that using the browser version is often better, but also fails in that it can't read from the photo library.

Overall a dissapointing offering and much less usable than the mobile versions. | So far I am liking the app.  Am still getting used to using it and using its features. It is easy to post to Facebook and also easy to do an entry. I am hoping a photo book at the end of our trip will be easy too. | Loving it | This app has taken the drudgery out of kee a scrapbook of trips and events; I love how simple it is! | We have posted several days and our friends appear to be following us. Time will tell how successful we have been. So far it’s been easy to use and my 80 year old parents figured out how to follow us. | I have used this app for 5 years.  I first used the free app but upgraded so I could add more photos to an entry.  
The things I love about the app - I can look back on trips and remember where we stayed or an activity we did.  I like that I can share my travels with only those who I want to see them.   
I like that I can make a travel book easily after a trip. 
Things I didn’t like
I find it can be glitchy.  It has closed the app on me when I load photos.  Something it just goes black when I am typing.   Usually it saves what I’ve been working on by not always.  I’ll give it 5 stars when the app doesn’t have the glitches. | This app helps us keep in touch with family and friends when we travel. Very easy to use and lots of fun. | Just started to use it but quite impressed | I'm late to the tracking game and this app makes it so easy to add your old stuff by using your photo's metadata. I'm specifically comparing it to Polar Steps, I don't think it had that capability or if it did, it was difficult to figure out. Antarctica was particularly difficult since I didn't have internet and there aren't really any "landmarks" so being able to use metadata and automatically is such a treat. | Great way to keep in touch with friends and family- especially when traveling through areas with spotty internet! | If you have the discipline to do an entry every day or so, your friends and you have a documented trip in more or less real time. Hard to beat. My only issue has been sometimes trouble editing once I posted. | I went on Camino with this app and I am amazed at how well it tracked my trip! not to say my battery was not drained even after full day of use. Highly recommend, and I will use this for all my future trips | The app I find is hard to operate and if you don’t have internet can’t download | It’s too hard to navigate this website. It doesn't allow for enough photos or narration, so I stop using it | So easy to write a travelogue. | Easy to use. | Fun and easy to use. Great way to connect with family back home. | I love this app! Allows my friends and family to follow my adventures 💗 | Spent an incredible adventure and took Find Penguins along on the journey.  Oh my…what a beautiful way to keep family back home up to date about what we were experiencing while keeping off the social media platforms which inform everyone ‘I’m away on vacation’.  May I say how much I love Find Penguins and am recommending it to my people when they travel! | I’d give this 5 stars but I have the hardest time finding footprints that I put in the “upload later” because I haven’t finished with that post. It’s always hunting around & then it just shows up somehow! | We have friends in Switzerland that turned us onto this app. Great alternative to Facebook. | I have used other systems for creating blogs. However, I absolutely love this app. The eloquence and simplicity in creating text, photos and mapping is wonderful. Everything is so logically set up and organized. I love how I can easily add 20 photos and even 2 videos to my text. Great job. It is wonderful for travel blogs. At the end of the day I can polish off my text, photos and video in 15 minutes. | I used this app for the first time on an around the world cruise of 4 months. I wanted a record for us and for our grandchildren. The electronic version of the app was wonderful to share as we traveled, but the BOOK absolutely knocked us out. Will be using this app for all future travels!!! | I love this app - I traveled on a cruise and used this to keep family and friends updated on our travels. It was very easy to use and I liked how it tracked my travels. I like that there are limits on what you can post and I think it’s just enough.  I would highly recommend this app.  Actually, did recommend it to fellow travelers. | I have been using this to chronicle our sailing adventures from Michigan  to the Bahamas and I love using it daily. I can easily write a post, add my photos and videos from the day, and upload at night for friends and family who are following (sharing the app is also easy). When I’m done with a “chapter” of our journey, I can edit a little and then easily prepare a book for printing- seeing a preview before I print. By ordering a book I get a free ebook to share. It’s easy to use and edit, tracks our journey, records our stats, and creates a beautiful book in the end. Easy Peasy! | And hard to navigate. Ought to be more intuitive. | If you want to capture tour traveling memories and stimulate your creativity in photo,  video and ruminations, then take a little time to learn this app. It’s intuitively built and easy to use on the fly. Keep your device charged so you may track your footprints. You will create a path whenever you make a footprint. Even if you footprint your trips to the bathroom! 😛 | I’m not sure how this app isn’t more popular than it is! Fantastic, easy-to-use, and perfect to keep family and friends updated on your travels. The map feature is particularly impressive. | Find Penguins is a well developed and stable platform that delivers exactly as it promises-
A user friendly way to memorialize travels and actually enjoy the digital
Photos we all store on our phones. 
I have now used it for two trips, a world cruise and a trip to Ireland. It’s fun to create wonderful memories using the app and I highly recommend you give it a try. About one hour reviewing the articles in the FAQ’s and you’ll be all set to go! | We’ve used this app for multiple trips. It’s easy to use and has great functionality. | The app is great, especially for those of us that are non-Facebookers. One area that needs improvement is the set up for people following others. A comment to me from people I invited to follow us is that it was not easy to just follow us, i.e, down the app then get to my trip. That's all. Otherwise I love it | I love how easy it is to add photos from any photo folder on my iPhone and the interactive map. We haven’t tried the printed books yet, but it sounds amazing. 

Our family and friends have found it hard to see our travel log and the settings can be a little confusing so we only have one family follower who has been able to figure it out, so we keep a separate shared iCloud folder for everyone else.  We also had a friend who was added to someone else’s trip (mistakenly) and  because we followed her there was no way to unfollow that particular random person’s trip to Germany 🤪… so that was frustrating for a bit.  Otherwise it’s great! 

I especially like that I can add photos as a draft even when we have a poor signal and add text and upload them later. ❤️ | First time user. Very intuitive. I liked I could start a footprint to get the location and finish later even if I had left the location. Making adjustments to my moves from place to place was messy and I gave up on it. I look forward to printing a book and seeing how it comes out. 😀 | Cool, I’m getting better at using the app! | It’s a great idea. I found it hard to navigate the options and got confused with my sharing privacy options. Nobody could see my posts & it was frustrating to me. I love the idea it was difficult. | I wish it had a few more features like notes you could add to photos. | Wonderful way yo stay in touch with friends and doucument as well. | Although this is our first trip using it, it’s been super easy to use so you’re not wasting time pressing lots of buttons. So far, I love it. | So far; I haven’t been able to upload photos from google or external hard drive to create past trips. I’m disappointed by that. Hopefully someone has advice or help. Without that feature, I wouldn’t see upgrading to pay for premium. I have photos from a camera I would like to use. 😕 
Making a photo album was simple and editing process was also easy. | Love it easy to use | I am a first time user of the Find Penguins app, using it to document my transatlantic crossing. This app does a great job of helping you time-stamp and memorialize waypoints along your journey. I wish I could post more than six pictures at each “footprint”, but the premium product does that (and more) for a cost. The standard version has a position tracker, which automatically geolocates you! I have not found this to be the big power-drain others have complained about. It would be really great if it allowed me to post my footprints on Instagram (hint hint) as it does for Twitter and Facebook users. This app is very intuitive and easy to use, I think you might like it too. | I used Find Penguins to record a recent trip to Central America. It excels at capturing details from photos and allowing you to quickly capture “footprints” along your journey.

I shared the link with family and friends and they were able to keep up with our journey.

It is supposed to capture waypoints along the way so that you can look back and recall places you’ve visited on a map. For the most part this works really well, but still seems a little buggy.

When I returned home, I was prompted to turn off automatic waypoint recording, which I did. About a week later I opened the app and realized it had continued running and my map now included a lot of extra waypoints.

I also noticed the map drew my return flight home as though I flew directly home, rather than through a connecting airport. 

Those points aside, this is a really great way to quickly capture details about your trip. | Super easy and fun to use this app! I do private posts for friends and fam back home on our travels through europe and beyond. | Perfect app to log pics and blog of my travels. Just what I was looking for. Easy to use!

title: Day One Journal: Private Diary
description:
Apple’s App of the Year with over 15 million downloads and 200,000 5-star ratings globally, Day One has reinvented journaling, letting you record your life as you live it. Securely save audio, video, photos, notes, and more wherever you are, whenever you want. 

“Day One creates something so rare it feels almost sacred: A completely private digital space.” – New York Times

“Day One makes keeping a journal delightfully easy.” – Wired

WHY DAY ONE?

Day One is the original digital journal app. A decade of updates and feature additions make it the most private, trusted, and easiest-to-use journaling app in the world. 

SIMPLE TO USE, EASY TO LOVE
• Beautiful, award-winning design
• Unlimited text entries 
• Powerful rich text formatting with markdown
• Different journals for every aspect of your life*

PRIVATE AND SECURE 
• Automatic backups keep your journal entries safe
• End-to-end encryption, which is a fancy way of saying your entries are 100% private
• Journal entries stay secure with passcode, TouchID, or FaceID
• Export options (pdf, plain text, etc.) ensure your entries always stay yours

FORM A HABIT & STAY CONSISTENT 
• Streaks and calendar view help keep your momentum going 
• Programmable reminders through text message or phone notifications
• Unique, daily journal prompts help eliminate writer’s cramp 
• Customizable templates save time and add organization to entries
• Today view provides a summary of where you’ve been and what you’ve done
• Integrates with the Health app to track mindfulness minutes


MORE THAN WORDS
• Unlimited photos and video*
• Auto-importer for your Instagram posts*
• Handwritten entries or drawings*
• Voice recording and transcription*

JOURNAL FROM WHEREVER, WHENEVER
• Cross-platform apps available on iPhone, Apple Watch, iPad, and Mac 
• The ability to text or email entries straight to your journal

BUILT FOR REMINISCING
• On This Day feature allows you to revisit past memories
• Tags, favorites, and search filters make it easy to find what you’re looking for
• Map view quickly shows all the places you’ve journaled from
• Print capabilities turn your digital journal into a premium physical book 

TYPE LESS, PRESERVE MORE
• Time, date, weather, moon phase, and more are automatically added to every entry
• IFTTT applets allow importing data from Spotify, YouTube, Strava, Fitbit, Facebook, Twitter, and more
• Siri Shortcuts provides a powerful way to automate more of your journaling
• Share sheet allows you to add content from other apps, like Apple Photos and Safari

*Day One is FREE to use forever with unlimited entries. Additional features, including unlimited photos, videos, and audio recordings are available with a Day One Premium membership. 
Start a free trial today. 

Privacy Policy: https://dayoneapp.com/privacy-policy/

Terms of Use: https://dayoneapp.com/terms-of-use/

For technical assistance or other inquiries: https://dayoneapp.com/contact/
releaseNotes:
Updated
• Auto-apply Point of Interest is available to everyone and is enabled by default. To disable it, visit Settings > Location History and switch the “Auto-apply Point of Interest” toggle to off.
• Behind-the-scenes: we’ve improved performance when uploading a lot of media at once.
• Behind-the-scenes: we’ve changed how often we save data to improve performance.

Fixed
• For users with lots of media, scrolling in the timeline would frequently lag. Fixed the performance issue.
• Fixed audio transcription issue occurring while using third-party keyboards.
reviews:
Selectable font/size. Auto sort by date. I *sorely* wish it had auto-save: I lost good stuff due to Apple’s system glitch today 😢. Easy typing, *most* markdown support. Sometimes unexplained request for login: WT? | The app helps to put my thoughts in focus.
It’s a good planning tool and a quiet way to express myself.
I don’t do it everyday but it’s there when I’m ready.
I like revisiting the memories too. | Life time pay price on the app or no buy from me. I not subing to an app in the videogame era end of story. Greedy are we 99$ i would pay and for end all be all for life.

Ty good bye...!!! | Does the widget streak don’t work any more? | I was hoping that I finally found the journal app I was looking for, unfortunately that isn’t so. Before even reading the specifics with the app I thought it was finally a completely free app with multiple capabilities. As I was customizing my app to my liking, I was promoted to subscribe to a $35 yearly service. Honestly, it’s a NO for me. I’m so tired of these money hungry developers who take away the experience for others. Unfortunately I will have to delete this app, because I’m unable to utilize it the way I desire. Everything is a cost nowadays. | I’ve never written an app review before but this app is just absolutely perfect for my needs. I wanted a way to capture my days and add photos that will resurface in a meaningful way and this app is exactly what I was looking for. | I have tried a number of apps/systems to record my daily thoughts, experiences, and reflections. I always return to Day One. It is the perfect platform for me, and has all the features I need. Added to this is ny ability to access it across all my devices. I do not expect to stray from Day One anymore. | ANITHER UPDATE: April 2024. Syncing is now a disaster. I’ve been down on multiple devices and despite half a dozen emails and tons of log files, support has no idea. What happened to you, Day One ?!?! Curse you, Automatic Inc, for the decline of what was once a shining example of a customer focused app with rock solid support. You are hastening people’s move off the platform. I WANT to use the app but every month there’s a new issue. Bugs are popping up all over. UPDATED AFTER DEVELOPER RESPONSE, 8/16/23: Nope, they're actually wrong. I'm a developer myself - you have a bug in your app. The exact commands referenced puts you in the same looped workflow of documentation and never opens the email client. And the revamped timeline still looks awful. I'm looking at alternative journal solutions - like Apple Journal or Bear Notes. Day One has gone backwards. UPDATED 8/1/23: They are making changes, and not for the better. Dropped from 3 stars to 2. They totally borked the time line view now - increasing the front size and adding useless data, so now you can only see like 3-4 entries at a time with lots of wasted space. Journal apps don't need constant UI changes. In fact - it's a problem. Journaling is a routine oriented task - and millions have adopted the Day One workflow. Changing it for no tangible benefit is crazy, and has me looking at Bear Notes and other alternatives. Who is driving these feature changes over there? It's getting worse... Oh - and despite being a premium user - you actually cannot contact support anymore! Their own documentation directs you to an area of the app that seems changed - it just redirects to old, outdated documentation instead of directing to an email message client. Yikes. If you are considering Day One as a newbie, consider something else. This app is not the clear winner it used to be. Fixes no one asked for, while user-favorite features (cough cough web app) are in perpetual Beta. OLD Review: The iOS app is great, but the application itself is severely lacking due to the recent, quiet, abandonment of their web browser app. They were working on it, and there was a highly anticipated beta - but it’s been shutdown and abandoned (they say temporarily, but it doesn’t look like it - they wouldn’t shut access down entirely if really temporary). There is currently no way to access any part of your journal on a windows desktop browser. So - the app is good, but it’s tedious in daily life as you can’t easily get items from your desktop into your journal. | I’ve been using it for years. Love it! | Paid full price for versions on ever device (iPad iOS and iMac) and now just pushing subscription model even though we were promised.  

Charging a subscription monthly to add media to posts seems an odd line to draw.  I use iCloud for storage and hosting.  So what why ?   

This subscription madness must end. | Used for 5 days and was very excited about it. Day 6 it's frozen and I can't log my entry. Bummer. It's annoying, but I guess I can just use the apple journal that comes on the iPhone. | Was so excited to try this app as it has such great reviews, but it is so glitchy I cannot even write an entry! The minute I hit plus to type a new entry, the entire app freezes. I’ve tried restarting my phone, opening the entry from a different path, and no matter what when I get to the page to type my entry, the app freezes. I hope there is a fix so that I can actually give this app a try. | Almost everything I would want from a digital journal is here.
It would be great to see some design updates and modernizations though. 
And please bring the macOS icon to mobile soon! The one on macOS matches the native app styles better. | Simple, beatiful and effective | Wanted to like it but the app is too frustrating if you don’t want it to use your soon ID username and password.  Too many options on the market ti deal with one poorly done. | Best journaling app available. I've tried several and they all fall short of Day One. Keep up the good work, devs.

EDIT:  ten years on with Day One and the app just keeps getting better and better | Whether you are new to journaling or a seasoned pro, this app has something for everyone.  Some of the things that I love about the app include pre-populated templates to begin your journaling.  If you have never journaled, this makes it easy to get started because you don’t have to think about what to write about.  If you are more seasoned and/or you know how and what you want to write about each day, you can easily build a custom template and begin with the same template each day.  
I love being able to add pictures to the journal as well.  There are several ways you can use this, but I prefer to add any pictures from the to day to my daily journal entry.  Some of the other features include being able to add or include other types of media to your entry.  Although I personally do not use this feature, it is cool to know its there. I also appreciate the timeline feature of the app.  This allows you to go back and see previous days, months and years.  It also allow a streak building for your journaling habit.  Highly recommend.  This and the Bible app are two apps that I use every day without fail. | I never review apps, but this app is exceptional. Probably my first written review of an app, but it goes above and beyond to make journaling from a phone so easy and intuitive. Many thanks to the creators 🙏 | Super frustrated with this app. I wanted to print a book for my son’s birthday and they payment will not go through. Also no real support is available. All these daily note that can’t be printed. So disappointed. | I’ve only had the app for a couple of days and I love it already. I haven’t had time to try the extra features but I will in the next few days. If this app measures up to its ratings and reviews It is going to be just the app I’ve been looking for. I will update this writing after using it for a month or so. | Love this app! | The features are awesome, and the best part is that it’s FREE! You get lots of features for free and never get ads or bugged to upgrade. Best journaling app ever! | Been using this app for years and I love it and recommend it to everyone — however , my one big complaint is that I can’t get it to work with Apple’s new “journaling suggestions” feature and can’t get an answer from the app’s support…. Frustrating not to be able to use this Apple feature and the lack of response is bothersome | It decided to just start crashing, even after updating. Not gonna use Day One anymore for this reason, if they can do it to the old users, they can do whatever they like to anyone to maximise their profits any time later. | Been using Day One for a few years. It’s simple and reliable. Everything works smoothly. Love that they have desktop and mobile app. | I have used some form of diary for a long time. This is the best one I have ever used. Even if you don’t do everything on it you think you should…it will be still be more than if you did nothing! | So convenient, I use it all the time. Love the user interface. Great enhancements. Keep it up! | I use DayOne every day. I have been using it for over a decade and think it’s the best on the market. In fact I live in fear it might someday go away! I used to love this app. I used it every single solitary day for almost a year and now I can’t log back in. And now I get a THIRD response and STILL NO ONE ANSWERS!! I have been in the same death loop of help. I get no email yet that’s the email I’m using. | I purchased the Day One Premium on January 7, 2024, through the Apple Store along with another app called ‘Me+’. The total was $59.52 ($34.99 for Day One with a promotion, $19.99 for Me+, plus tax). I attempted to cancel and get a refund for ‘Me+’, but since it was purchased together with Day One, I couldn’t receive a partial refund. I got fully refunded $59.52 on January 18.

However, I recently discovered that I was rebilled by Apple on January 29, but I cannot access the Premium since it shows as cancelled. I can provide my bank transactions and the receipt from Apple.

Please help! I’ve tried reaching out to customer service, but there’s been no response. I haven’t been able to use the Premium features for the past three months. Can you please check?

I love this app. I will fix my rate once my concern is resolved. | I’ve been using Day One for seven years now. In the beginning I tried some other options but nothing worked for me as well as Day One. It’s really good at what it is and fits all my needs just right. 
Thank you for making a great app and thank you for continuing to maintain and improve it!! | Love Day One! Began writing daily on a challenge a few yrs back, have since grown to love my daily pondering, and especially seeing my pics from my phone for REAL when I send it to print 3x a yr! | I don’t know that this review is worth much as I have never used any other digital journal but for my many purposes, Day One is perfect.  I liked it so much I purchased another subscription for my spouse but she still prefers a paper journal with her fountain pen.  And here’s where the huge differences between the two forms really shows up.  When she wants to find the date when something happened, it’s a laborious search.  I just type the event or name or place into the search feature and I get all the hits, the most recent entry first.  With Day One I can add photos, video links, emails, texts, or even parts of daily newsletters I get as instantly as a 72 year old man can do anything instantly.  I have separate journals for books bought, borrowed, and read, for projects I’m working on, and for travelogues.  For my spouse to do any of those things is nye impossible in a paper journal just from a space standpoint.  And if I too want the feel and flow of ink on paper, which I often do, I do just that and take a photo to enter on my digital journal.
	But it’s when you’ve been at Day One for awhile that some of it’s marvelous features begin to show up.  The “On This Day” feature is a treat.  For instance, today it shows that I have four entries for today.  To click on that and discover anew what I was doing three, four, five years ago today is, in addition to being fun and informative, a daily jolt regarding the passage of time.
	Two other features I love about Day One is that it syncs my journal across all my devices.  I can jot down an entry on my phone when I’m waiting in line at the car wash or having lunch in a diner.  I can check on an entry from last year when I’m on the go.  The other thing I prize is the privacy.  My Day One is password protected which allows me to be a little more free with personal details than I otherwise would be.
	Does Day One have some warts.  I’ve yet to meet an app that doesn’t but, again, for my needs this things I would like different are so few that I haven’t even bothered mentioning them to management.  I hope I’ve made it clear why I think this app deserves five stars. | Love this journal and look at it everyday.  I’ve been writing in it for 12 years now. I go look at what I was doing this day for the last 12 years. I don’t even remember some of the thing I wrote and I’m so glad for each and every memory. Thanks Day One for a quality product. | One of the features I love, having used Day One for several years, is that it lets me know I have previous entries from same date in years past and of  gives me access to read entries from same dates in years past. 
 Day One also has a search feature that easily helps me to find topics that I wrote about last week or last year. | I bought Day One for iOS and OSX but didn’t feel the need to purchase a subscription. I would have if it offered features I couldn’t live without, but it doesn’t, so why spend the money unnecessarily? I’ve rated this app two stars because the journal is good, even if buggy at times. I couldn’t go more than two stars because I don’t think it’s right that they reserve live support for subscriptions only. I paid money for your apps and should be able to get support when needed. I can see giving subscription members priority support and making others wait longer, but to not offer live support to those that have supported and purchased your products before subscriptions were even a thing is just wrong. If a subscription offered me something I needed, I’d buy it, but I don’t need to add more than ten photos or videos to my entries. And I certainly won’t pay just to get support. In fact, that alone is reason enough to never buy the subscription. You might as well call your subscription a support plan, not a subscription. | I have a brain injury, so I have very very poor penmanship... but I have always love love LOVED the idea of journaling so so much though, so I started to journal first on Microsoft Word on that app on my phone, but the very annoying thing about doing that was that I had to keep scrolling down down down alllllll the way until I found where I left off! 👎🏼 I first got so annoyed that I started to reverse my order of journal entries so that the first thing I could do when I opened Word was write my newest journal entry! It eventually got so messy and long though, so then I thought, “there’s GOT to be something else out there!!! This is the 21st century for Christ’s sake!!!” Then, I opened the App Store and found Day One, and my life was literally changed forever, and I could not be more thankful for this app!!! 🤩🤩🤩 I’m currently using Day One’s free premium trial, and it’s so great that I wish so so badly I could make my own money bc if I did, I would TOTALLY pay for a subscription immediately!!! Too bad I only have so long until my trial ends... 😔 | The recording of your life will become invaluable later in life. This app’s feature makes it easy to do that. The ability to sync between devices is a win over apples basic journal app. | This is the best digital journal app I’ve found I love being able to see what days I’ve journaled and it’s a great way to try to journal every day! | Emailed DayOne Journal to cancel as I’m not getting anywhere w/ Apple to cancel through the App Store … and DayOne is the ONLY app I have that has not responded because all I go was a bot.  They gave me an email (through the app) but the automatic generated email, send you back to App Store or the bot.  You will get NO WHERE trying to stop this subscription.  If you purchase this, and lose your appleid and apple can’t seem to help you w/ that either (that’s another story) …  be prepared to pay for this app for the rest of your life or until your cc expires. | Features of the Journal program can’t be beat. Have used it for years and have never had a problem. When I’ve had questions customer support can’t be beat. | Been using several years and it’s been great for me. | Ggggg | Every day, I think about the things I am grateful for and it reminds me of the good in my life. No matter what I try to do (write a new entry, look at historical entries etc) or where I try to do it (iPhone vs iPad), the app freezes, and the only way to fix the issue is to close the app and go back in. Further, even when I am typing on the new app, there is a big lag in the words. Please please please fix this. This app would be perfect if only it didn't freeze all the time! | Best journaling app ever!!! | I’ve been using DayOne for years.
I love it!
It is easy to keep track of my life and look back over the years to see how far I’ve come.
10/10 recommend and I often give a subscription of this as a gift to family and friends.

title: Nomad eSIM: Prepaid Data Plan
description:
Travel like a local with Nomad!
Get high speed, flexible, no-contract eSIM data and SMS at unbeatable prices. No more switching out SIM cards - get connected in 5 minutes! Install and activate eSIMs in 165+ countries and 8 regions. Get international eSIM data plans from as low as $1.5 / GB across Europe, North America, Asia and many more. Regional and country-specific plans are also available to suit your travel needs.
Share your Nomad referral code to your friends, you’ll get 300 points (equivalent to $3) for your future purchases for each successful referral. Your friends will also get $3 off for their first purchase.

What is an eSIM?
eSIM stands for embedded SIM and allows you to get connected anywhere, anytime, on (most) flagship devices, without ever having to visit a shop or buy a physical SIM card. As long as your phone is compatible, you’re good to go.
Check compatible devices here: https://www.getnomad.app/shop/support_device

Nomad major features include:
*eSIM Data plans for 165+ countries and 8 regions.
*SMS packs for US, UK and Canada at this moment.
*Loyalty points, add-on purchases (top-up),  multi-currency payments, multi-languages and data usage monitoring.
*Get recommendations and find inspiration for things to do and eat while on your trip and much more coming up!

Why Nomad: The Easiest Way to Get Connected
Near-local Prices: No contract, no hidden fees, no unexpected roaming charges.
Connect instantly: No more waiting in line, get your eSIM contactlessly within 5 mins. Easy installation via QR code.
Convenient & Flexible: Keep your primary SIM for call & text, no more swapping SIMs at the airport.
Find Travel Inspirations: Select the descriptors of what you are looking for and get recommendations! Pin or save it if you want to shortlist the place, or swipe left to reject it and see more recommendations.

How Nomad Works:
*Buy an eSIM Data Plan: Search for your destination and pick any data pack - from 1 GB to Unlimited data plans
*Install the eSIM: Easy one-click installation or install via QR code. QR code will be sent to your email and Nomad App.
*Activate your plan: Only activate when ready to use, please make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi or have stable data connection.
*Buy a SMS plan: Choose a plan from US, UK or Canada - from 100 texts to 500 texts, and you’re all set! Anyone can receive and send texts to/from you. Your SMS plan is also good for both local and international texting at the same great rate!

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to contact us at https://getnomad.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new or send us email through hello@getnomad.app

Visit www.getnomad.app to find out more about Nomad.

But imagine being in a taxi in a foreign country where you don’t know the language and can’t see where the driver is taking you. 

I’d contacted support one or two days before my flight to avoid issues like this, explaining that I’ll be in a new country and asking how to ensure the installation goes smoothly.

I also reached out from both the departure airport and the arrival airport. Still, I was left with no connection because the app wasn’t working properly.

I could send and receive support messages on the app but nothing else worked, it kept freezing up.

Use my referral code if you want to save on your first use TEAC55AJ | You download the app and start using your phone with the number that was given to you. It is that easy. Compared to another app I bought, NOMAD is much friendlier. Highly recommend this without any hesitation. I used this for my Italy trip and had no problem at all. So what are you waiting for? Go get this. Morie A.

title: Road Trip Planner Viewer
description:
RTP Viewer allows you to view Road Trip Planner files on your Apple device.  Create and edit your files with Road Trip Planner for iOS or OS X, and then anyone can view the files with this app. 

Road Trip Planner Viewer is free, does not require any subscription and respects your privacy by not collecting any of your data.

While you can edit the files with this app, you cannot save your edits.  Our iOS app Road Trip Planner at the App Store is virtually identical to this app and allows you to save your edits.  

Contact us for more information or bug reports.

Multiple sample files are available, including an informative Route 66 sample file.

For more info on Road Trip Planner tap or click the Support URL.
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and interface enhancements.

title: Sygic Travel Maps Trip Planner
description:
Discover things to do anywhere you go. Plan detailed trip itineraries. Get around with useful travel guides. An ultimate all-in-one app for every traveler.

ADVANCED TRIP PLANNER
Build a complete day-to-day itinerary for your trip with an easy-to-use trip planner. See estimated travel times and walking distances and keep realistic plans. Invite your friends to collaborate on your trips.

WORLDWIDE OFFLINE MAPS
Buy Sygic Travel Premium to use the app without any internet connection, including unlimited offline maps download and walking navigation.

50 MILLION PLACES
Sights, museums, parks, cafés, restaurants, hotels, beaches, waterfalls, caves or even bird observatories. Whether you're a tourist up to sightseeing, out on a shopping trip or a romantic weekend getaway, we've got you covered.

PHOTOS, DESCRIPTIONS, WIKIPEDIA
Popular places come with descriptions, photos, opening hours, admission fees, links and additional data written by professional travel editors or sourced from Wikipedia and other databases.

CITY GUIDES
Get all sorts of useful information about a destination on this new screen. Collections make it easy to discover interesting and popular places, such as "Best Beaches" or "Modern Architecture". Read up on local history, get useful tips on getting around, understand local culture and learn about the dos and don'ts. Insightful guides are available for thousands of cities including London, Paris, New York City, Rome, Barcelona, San Francisco, Las Vegas and other popular destinations.

360° VIDEOS
Take a look around top sights in exclusive 360° videos. Over 500 professional videos from Prague, Barcelona, Valencia, Madrid, Granada, Seville, Marrakech, Gran Canaria, Porto, Lisbon, Athens, Istanbul, Cairo, Tel Aviv, Jerusalem, Bethlehem and Vienna. 360° videos also support Cardboard.

POWERFUL SEARCH AND FILTERS
Find any place by name or address. Use filters to show attractions, museums, shopping malls, restaurants, bars down to art galleries featuring Van Gogh paintings.

TOURS AND ACTIVITIES
Find the best sightseeing tours, cruises, or even local cuisine cooking classes. Buy skip-the-line tickets to top attractions straight from the app.

ACCOMMODATION
Find a hotel, hostel, apartment or b&b. Add it to your trip and see it in your daily itinerary including travel times. Book your accommodation with booking.com straight from the app.

USE ON ALL DEVICES
Your trips will sync automatically between all your devices and our web planner available at https://maps.sygic.com

Using Google Trips? Beware that the trip planning app will be retired on August 5, 2019. Sygic Travel is a great alternative to consider.

SYGIC TRAVEL PREMIUM
Unlock all the features of Sygic Travel on all devices signed in with the same account. You can choose from the following subscription options:

Sygic Travel Premium Monthly Subscription for $3.99*
Sygic Travel Premium Yearly Subscription for $14.99*

You can subscribe and pay through your iTunes account. Payment will be charged to iTunes account at confirmation of purchase. Your subscription will automatically renew unless cancelled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. Your account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renew may be turned off after purchase by going to the 'Manage Subscription' page in settings.

*The price might differ in your local currency due to different taxes and exchange rates.

GET IN TOUCH WITH US
Check out our online travel maps at https://maps.sygic.com
Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/SygicTravel
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SygicTravel/
Contact our support team: team@travel.sygic.com
Privacy policy: https://www.sygic.com/company/privacy-policy
Terms of use: https://travel.sygic.com/lp/terms/
releaseNotes:
Performance and stability improvements, including:
- Support for new devices and capabilities (iPhone 14 Pro, Apple Watch Ultra, Stage Manager)
- Map reworked with new rendering library
- Map markers load faster

I am unable to mark 2 locations in Edinburgh so that I can see clearly how to get from my hotel to the location where a tour I am taking originated.  So I logged into my account online and all that comes up on the screen is a page called “Account overview” .  It tells me that I have no active subscriptions even though I purchased Sygic Travel Premium.  There is a help page on the website which tells me that with Sygic Travel Premium, using the mobile app on my phone I can unlock full place details, get walking directions and access itineraries, maps and guides offline.

I have none of that functionality with the mobile app.  They have online chat so I explained my problem and received a reply in chat that I would receive a response in five business days.  Appalling service. You do get transferred to the actual Sygic navigation app for GPS navigation but again that is inconvenient. 2) Even if it was just a summary I’d like to see my whole trips itinerary instead of just being able to see a single day. 3) I was going to send this note as feedback to them but their feedback email doesn’t allow you to actually SEND the email. 4) Finally, there have been no updates for over a year, which implies they don’t really care too much about it.  Maybe I don’t understand the app well enough but it’s looking like it was a waste of money. | This app is wonderful. One question. I know Sygic gps navigation does not require Wi-Fi of cellular.      That was the start of my appreciation of the extraordinary value and features of Sygic! It continues to get better with more features  since 2016. You get trip planning suggestions, tour suggestions and their cost, navigation help and instructions, all the information you need to plan your trip and a lot more! Honestly, this app is a gem and the developers really outdid the features and actually carefully selected what one user NEEDS and can get lots of advantage for. I cannot stress enough how awesome of an app this is. I applaud for the effort and thoughtfulness of making this app the most convenient one for trip planning I have seen in the app store. Thank you and I really hope you continue making it as awesome as it is and seamless to navigate. Two suggestions as an iPad user would be a calendar view to visualize trips in a calendar format (or calendar integration, which I am still exploring in the app) and an apple pencil/ draw format for note taking as it is easier for me to use but those two suggestions are just that, the app is awesome as is and has a lot of room for growth. | If you are not a premium user you are done this app will not provide any information for free. | I just downloaded the app and planned for my trips, the app is amazing (free version) however, for me as a traveller, I would like to know the admissions/fee of the attractions. We usually start off with reading various attractions both in app and online.
