thanks | Who is giving this thing good reviews??? It just freezes up. Totally unusable. But they got their $4 out of me and thats all that matters. | You have to pay to see anything | I was hoping it will work but it is complex and not worth the money.  I consider myself a tech savvy but got lost in the complexity.  Wish I could get the money back. | What good are the offline maps if the software is going to insist on attempting to provide a preview of the route using online data when sufficient data connection is not available. | This makes it so easy to find places to see, it lets you pick bubbles on the map and dig into reviews and other valuable information right there. Then adding an item to your itinerary is simple and you can start managing the days on the trip so you aren't doing too much or too little. | I used to plan to my trips using trip advisor, however they took away the ability to schedule items within each day of the trip. I tried using Google Trips, Tripline, and any other app that was recommended for trip planning. Sygic is the only one I have tried which had all the options I needed. Some of the features I appreciate include: being able to select multiple types of transportation for each day. If I am trying to plan a route on google maps for a day it won’t let me switch between using a car and using public transportation. Sygic let’s me decide for each destination whether I want to drive, take public, transportation, etc. The app also estimates based on the activities and routes how long of a day it will be. I used to manually estimate how long I would spend at each place I wanted to visit based on googles average for how long people spend there. Sygic automatically has an estimate for each travel site already. Also those times can be adjusted if needed.

title: Polarsteps - Travel Tracker
description:
Plan, track, and relive your travels. Record your route automatically, keeping your phone in your pocket and eyes on the world.

Over 5 million explorers have chosen Polarsteps to create and capture their adventures. This all-in-one travel app shows you the world’s most enticing travel destinations, gives you insider tips and plots your route, locations and photos when the journey is underway. The result? A beautiful digital world map that is unique to you! As well as the chance to turn it all into a hardback Travel Book when you’re done. And it doesn’t stop there...

Doesn’t drain your battery, works offline and you have full privacy control.

PLAN

■ Polarsteps Guides, created by our travel-loving editors and other explorers like you, show you the best of the world (as well as giving you top tips for once you get there).
■ Itinerary Planner to build your dream (editable) itinerary.
■ Transport Planner helping you get from A to B with clear transport options between destinations.

TRACK

■ Automatically track and plot your path on a digital world map (that grows fuller as your passport does).
■ Add photos, video, and thoughts to your steps along the way making your memories all the more vivid.
■ Save spots that you love so that you can always find your way back.

SHARE

■ Leave tips for the traveling community on where to go and what to see.
■ Share your journey with friends and family if you want to. Or keep it to yourself. You have full privacy controls.
■ Follow others and share in their adventures.

RELIVE

■ Retrace your steps – scrolling through places, photos, and your travel stats.
■ Create a unique Travel Book filled with your pictures and stories with the touch of a button.

WHAT THE PRESS ARE SAYING ABOUT POLARSTEPS

"The Polarsteps app replaces your travel journal, making it easier and more beautiful." - National Geographic

"Polarsteps helps you track and share your journeys in an easy and visually appealing way." - The Next Web

"Polarsteps' resulting travel log is impressive, and is the source of a severe case of itchy feet in your correspondent." - TechCrunch

FEEDBACK

Questions, thoughts, or feedback? We'd love to hear what you think about Polarsteps. Get in touch via support@polarsteps.com.
releaseNotes: Hey travelers, we updated the app and squashed some bugs you were reporting. Thanks for the feedback! We're always listening on support@polarsteps.com
reviews:
Polar steps is simple to use and would get a five star review from me, but the one feature I would love to use I can not get to work - making a book from everything I add to a trip! | I like the UI and visualization, but it is such a pain having to fight the app in order to add locations (which it renames to the county—who ever cares about the county? Just name the step the location you searched, like Grand Canyon should not be renamed to the county), then when you add photos the suggestions are always off and you have to manually look through photos. 

What it should do is look at your photos and suggest all the ones on that same date, even if they don’t have the geo location tag (DSLR photos). Entering in dates is also a pain, new step button for some reason always assumes you do it on a new day, so I have to go back and manually change that too. I’m sure if you use it to actively track new trips it works okay, but I’m frustrated with the experience of filling it in manually. It captured some of the trips I did in the past by analyzing my photos, but again renames all the locations to stuff nobody knows (it calls Muir Woods national monument by its county name) and will split trips into two sometimes, with no easy way to combine them. 

Features seem to be there but usability is lacking IMO, not really worth the effort (I did try a few other competitor apps and this is more features but still a pain). | Our daughter is traveling alone in SE Asia and this has been such a wonderful way for her to regularly update all close family and friends with photos, commentary, and maps all in one spot. | Can’t believe how well put together this is. I put in all my trips and it shows the pattern and rolls up all the statistics in a nice clean dashboard. It really is a marvel to behold. Best app I’ve come across in quite some time. | Let me drag and drop steps wherever I want, make the location search better by allowing actual addresses. And I can’t seem to change whether a distance is set to a flight or driving. Do better! | Useless app just collecting all the pictures from your gallery and pretending it to be a trip. Not user friendly at all | It so easy to journal your trip and keep all the love ones up to date. | I love the app but the UX is kinda not good for example I can’t search for a specific location in the guide section  i have to go back and forth google maps to see where it is located on the map , also in the search bar it says search people & place when it shows up it turns to trip , this is UX disaster. Overall make locations searchable | So fun to follow friends on their two-year adventure from Oregon to Antarctica and back - in their custom van! | Recently downloaded the app and was really happy with how it tracked my trip to remote areas in Antarctica.  However, as a whole, this app is frustrating and disappointing to me as a lifetime traveler.  To see it reflecting the sum total of my travels as 2% of the world is not only inaccurate but insulting.  The app should add a means to record lifetime travel or its usefulness is only in the moment during travel or as a means to look back only at recent travel.  

Adding a checklist of countries, cities or the like to capture a user’s full travel history would make it a more fulfilling experience as a user.  I do like how it uses location data from photos in the phone, that too is limited to relatively recent history. | Great app for allowing new puppy owners to track the travels of their new puppy in real time! | This app is simply brilliant! It’s a real journal of your travels, step by step. | I love this app. It’s so fun to see my journey develop over 4 years of travel and beyond | Since joining it has kept me current with my brother’s journey | I always enjoy traveling yet keeping up on these travels can be a bit challenging.  With Polorsteps, I can revisit my specific trip, exact places, comments and photos.  Additionally, I appreciate the ability to track all travel experiences across the globe.  Highly recommend | This is the number 1 app for travel. I can used for free, #1 #1. | I love polar steps and use it to keep a personal record of my overseas and at home travels. It’s easy to use and I really like the map feature. Highly recommend. | I absolutely love this app, I have been using it to track my travels for years now and it’s my favorite! It is so cool to go back and look at the maps it makes! | I absolutely love this app.  I have been tracking my trips - I don’t forget things and my friends can see my adventures! | I have been using polarsteps for about 7 weeks now to track my travels. I loved it at first and had no issues, however in the last few weeks I CONSTANTLY have issues uploading videos. I've tried uploading videos on wifi & data, it still comes up with an error though. Not sure I'll continue using it if this bug persits. | I use Polarsteps for all my travels - it's not just great to share your trip with friends and families, but also to keep your trip documented for later. It's an amazing memory and I love going back to past trips and see what we've been doing. But most importantly, the photobook which you can create is absolutely fantastic. The quality and the design are just perfect. I've ordered about 5 photobooks already and love them all! It is so easy and fast to create that you actually do it. Would 100% recommend!! | I’ve been traveling for a month and found out about this from a fellow traveler. It’s brilliant in concept but I cannot get it to track my current trip. It synced all of my trips from 7 years ago from my photos with all gps location details, and attached photos to those locations. But the point of me using it is for my current trip and it is just a blank slat. Does not import my photos, location, or dates at all. I’ve done everything I can think of, went into a deep dive in my iOS settings, went through the trip settings, my account settings, read through pretty much the ENTIRE help center, scoured Reddit, updated my phone, deleted my account and reinstalled it, restarted my phone etc and NOTHING WORKS!! It wants me to add everything manually down to the date I flew and the location I flew into and then the next place I stayed etc but at no point does it ever finally pick up in syncing to fill the info in. I ended the trips, restarted the trip, every thing I can possibly think of and NOTHING works. What is the point in using this for your friends and family to track your travels if it only syncs trip details after you arrive back home?!?! The only trips it syncs are ones where I’ve ended AND flown back to my home location. Otherwise this stupid thing is WORTHLESS and you might as well just post on social media because it will be endlessly less frustrating!!! | I documented a month long trip through Scotland after I returned home and the result was impressive. It would have been even better had I known about and used the app during the trip. The browser interface for sharing & viewing the trip works well; navigation would be aided if trip steps could be collapsed to a single line showing just the step name. A native iPad UI for the app would also be great as would a built-in airplay option. I could go on with feature requests but for a free app with no advertising Polarsteps shines as is. | we be to arrive where we started and know the place for the first time. | I have been using Polarsteps since its Beta phase and I love it. I like that my trip posts can be private or public. The app is easy to use. The book editing can be a little time consuming but the final product is of first rate quality. | Polarsteps is awesome!   I have used both the app & website versions for years and can’t say enough good things about them.  It just keeps getting better all the time.  

The team behind PolarSteps is committed to providing a seamless experience for everyone.  I recently encountered an issue, contacted them, and the problem was corrected quickly & perfectly.  

If you are considering PolarSteps, don’t hesitate to try it…..you won’t be disappointed! | Absolutely the best travel tracker app I’ve found. Best way to save all of the memories from your journeys and even convert them into a high quality photo book. | I have three trips that were taken years ago that still show I am traveling. I have tried numerous times to go in and change the end date. I have deleted the app. I am only working on my iPhone. I can’t understand why I can’t get it to end the trip. | Amazing app if you’re into traveling really easy to use. | We are | Great app which is intuitive, easy and highly functional, however the photo book process and options needs work…merger with Shutterfly or Mixbook(?) | I love this app and the concept of documenting your travel. I also love the idea of being able to make a book at the end. But the app is insanely glitchy!!! There have been several instances where I added all my photos and wrote out paragraphs of text, just for Polarsteps to delete parts of it after posting. For example, I just wrote out many paragraphs detailing a day of my trip, and polar steps deleted everything but the first couple sentences. There is no archive and no way of retrieving the lost text. Another time, I uploaded many photos and the app only actually uploaded one. I had to delete the step entirely and try again. 
Love this concept, PLEASE fix this app!!!!!! | I learned about Polarsteps from a fellow American I just happened to meet in Izmir, Turkey, and he told me he was using the app as his  travel blog, so I downloaded it and followed him. Actually, now that I think about it, I started using it that same day in 2018! And I never stopped. How do I remember such details? Because my experience is forever recorded in the app, complete with pictures, maps, and real time experiences. Polarsteps is so easy and intuitive, I have used it for every trip i’ve taken since then. At least 20-30 trips, many them abroad. It is so fun to go back through my past adventures and relive the details. Travel is something so special to me, and I want to remember everything I did, as well as keep my friends and family informed in real time. Polarsteps helps me so that. I highly recommend it. | I gotta tell you, PolarSteps is the bomb-diggity of travel apps! 🌍✈️ Seriously, it’s like having your personal travel guru right in your pocket. I’ve been on the app since the beginning and I’ve happily carried PolarSteps around the globe with me.

One thing that totally rocks about PolarSteps is their overall travel statistics. It’s like looking at your own travel résumé - you can see how many countries you’ve conquered, how many miles you’ve trekked, and even the time you’ve spent in transit (Jetsetter badge, anyone?). It’s perfect for impressing your friends with your travel street cred.

But wait, there’s more! The interactive global map is where the real magic happens. You can zoom in on the exact spots you’ve been, and it’s like reliving your adventures all over again. It’s like having a digital scrapbook that you can share with your peeps, complete with photos and notes.

Plus, the app is super user-friendly. You don’t have to be a tech whiz to navigate it. Whether you’re a seasoned globetrotter or just planning your first big trip, PolarSteps has got you covered. It’s the ultimate travel sidekick, and it’s all about making your journeys cooler than a polar bear’s toenails. 🐧❄️

So, if you’re into tracking your adventures and reliving the good times, PolarSteps is the way to go. It’s the app that turns your travels into epic stories. Happy adventuring, my fellow wanderlusters! 🌟🌏🌟 | Love this App! Wonderful to make a book of your trip! They do an awesome job making your book! | There is a bug where I cannot follow the trips that have been shared with me. When I click a friend’s link, it takes me to the app homepage. Even when I search for that person, it says they have no trips. It works fine on the web version so it must be an app issue. No way to contact support either. | Nice to see friends on their trips | Splendid app to track friends from all over the world as they travel! | I’d like to start off by saying that I absolutely love the step tracking features in this app. It’s like the perfect digital journal for my trips. There are just a few features that irk me when trying to use the newer features. I don’t understand why, if you can load predicted routes using roam to rio, we can’t just use the predicted route as an actual one in step tracking. I hate having to use the steps suggested when tracking is on, but the straight lines look sooo bad in the finished trip map. Why can’t I just say, “yes I took the exact route suggested by roam to rio, use that for the map”? The tracked steps are always random and sometimes skip major sections so it doesn’t follow our route.

 And I want to buy one of the travel books so badly because I spent so much time documenting my trip in this app that there’s no way I’m creating a book in another one, but the features to edit the layout are extremely limited. Only getting to fit 4 photos on a page with a 400 page limit is so hard! If I have a long trip or I want a more photos I’m unable to fit everything I want to show. I took a 2 month trip and was so excited to print the book only to realize that I’d have to pick like 4 photos for each step and they don’t fit onto the page very efficiently. I would gladly drop the $200 for a large travel book if I could actually control the page layouts.

Finally, is there any plan to incorporate the 3D globe that androids have for the iPhone app. I love being able to look at all the steps on the globe on my friends phones but it’s just a flat, non-interactive map on the iPhone. Again, I love the app and I use it all the time, I just wish it had a few more features to make documentation easier. | This is a wonderful app because it allows us as travelers to keep our family and friends abreast of our travels. It’s almost like they’re being there with us I would highly recommend it. | My family and I followed my daughter and her friends on PolarSteps as they traveled through Europe after college graduation. The graduates loved posting multiple photos on PolarSteps and journaling about their journey. They also felt more comfortable posting multiple photos on PolarSteps than on Instagram. | What a great way to record a trip. I tend to take a lot of pictures and I appreciate that I am not limited in what I post, nor am I limited in how much I choose to write. Unfortunately I cannot provide captions for specific pictures. 
Combining a live map of where we are at any specific time is fantastic.
I hope I can make their work worthwhile with picture books ordered after the trip. Great business model idea - I hope it pans out! | I have been using Polar Steps for more than 5 years and my Italy Trip on the app was ruined. The location services are always active and there has been internet access during the whole trip but my steps were not recorded. So basically day one and day 8, no exact routes or anything.

Thanks for that. | Whenever my friend goes on a trip I have the worst time signing in to follow. Get stuck in loop of new password not recognized. | been loving this app. makes keeping my friends and family so easy and fun. I do wish there was a feature where i could turn off the live location without going private or followers only just for safety reasons. | This app is something I have imagined before and wished existed. With a few UI thibgs and some other flow improvements this app could be near perfect in what it does and delivers. 

My only wish is that users were more in control of the privacy settings, and that there were more ways you could manage the way the data is stored and used. | The application give me the feeling to travel from my house in the USA with my family in Europe.  I can follow them through the countries and beautiful photos they take. Thank you | Love keeping up with my granddaughter🙃 | We just came back from a one month trip. We used Polarsteps and shared with our friends. They all said it’s fantastic. They read every what we wrote at every stop and the pictures we posted from different places. It’s a good thing to remain for us as a fond memory and a travel log. We may review those pleasant experiences at any time. Will recommend all my friends to try it. | Great App. Communication with the teachers and pictures of places they were visiting was Fantastic.🏆
Thank you very much!!!
The Dittrich Family

title: TripSource
description:
TripSource by BCD Travel is designed exclusively for our clients and their travelers. 

* To register for TripSource, you must have booked a trip with BCD Travel in the past six months.

Your ultimate travel companion, TripSource keeps you organized, informed, and in control of your business travel. No more paper. No more organizing multiple emails. Everything you need, all in one place. After you book your trip, just log in with your corporate email address – your trip details will be there waiting for you. 


• Access your trip details in a simplified timeline view – even reservations booked outside of BCD Travel.
• Book your trip using TripSource for the best rates, the best selection and the best experience.
• Receive real-time flight notifications and risk alerts.
• Available in English, French, German, Spanish, and Brazilian Portuguese in key markets across Europe, North America, Latin America, and Asia Pacific.
releaseNotes: We’re working behind the scenes to improve your TripSource experience.
reviews:
No chance this is a well-rated app. The chat doesn’t work, they seldom answer calls unless you can wait 25-30mns on the line, and their app is a portal to your business’s interface. Just unbelievably wasteful | We need an iPad version | Reservation showed up a day later in the app, baggage claim info showed up 3 hours after the flight has arrived.

Whether it’s airlines, hotels, or rental car companies, they all have their own mobile app that allows me to contact them directly, not sure why I need this app… | Not sure is this is an app problem, or an iPhone problem. But when I fill an address to select a car rental agency, clicking “Select location” button on the app does nothing. It could even be an SAP concur issue. I don’t know. But this is a massive pain | My previous issue was resolved with help from support. Leaving at 4 stars due to the initial occurrence. | Why do I need an App if I have to log in using my computer!! Feels ridiculous | Waisted an hour of my life trying to get logged into the app. If I can’t reliably access the app, I will never be able to rely on it during travel. | Unfortunately my company partners with BCD for travel arrangements. The app is just laughably bad and has been that way for YEARS. It resets the search whenever you cycle between apps, so you’d better have all your details straight before you try to book a trip. It requires you to select a time of day for your flight, but no matter what you select it shows every single option anyway. There are many other examples. Who at BCD uses this app and thinks it’s a good experience? Incredibly frustrating. | App no longer works.  Always reports that its unconnected and can’t retrieve data.   Been a problem for several weeks.   Uninstalled and installed again.  No fix. | Registered the app and validated that credentials work with website, but app won’t get past the login screen on both my iPad and iPhone. Contacted support, who noted my website login and ignored that the ticket clearly stated that the app didn’t work. Buggy app and poor support. Website looked useful, however. | It does nothing???  Really? | This app isn’t all that great when poop hits the fan and you need quick access to your travel info. I keep having to sign in to be able to see anything. It’s quicker just to use disparate apps at this point. | Being interrupted during normal sleeping hours is inappropriate, especially for a flight two days out. No one likes to be woken up at 2200 hours, especially when one is sleeping or trying to fall asleep!!! | Now the the app Forces me to ‘update’ at the airport-right when I need my information the most. When I open the app I want it to work. An Update should be at my request! I don’t expect TripSource to be like the DMV by imparting policy. I never had a problem the past w/o updating, but I guess the developers showed me. | My company (Network Television) started using this app for us to book our air travel. It is so frustrating to use. You would think it was designed by someone who builds government apps. I had to use a stylus, a lot of the buttons (time of departure) etc don’t work and since u have to constantly zoom in to input data it’s always asking if you want to leave the app. None of my co workers like it either.  
The real problem with it is they ported a website to an IOS app. It would be fine if you could use it on a laptop (which we can’t) but doing it on a phone is brutal. If the developer would ever use it to book a flight on their phone they would rebuild it immediately | It’s been many months now since my job switched to this app. Since then it’s worked exactly 1 time for me. If I’m able to even browse hotels and get as far as picking one, whenever I try to book I get a “it’s not you it’s us” message and to try again. I’ve rebooted, uninstalled and reinstalled, cleared app data and everything else I could think of. I’ve even changed phones but it still acts the same. Garbage. | Your FAQ indicates that you can add your flight itinerary to iCal using the app. No you can’t. You removed that option in this version. | With the latest update, I don’t see any flights or hotels.  It says nothing is there.  ? | This app’s previous version worked great but this new version has issues updating information during a trip. It doesn’t terminal, gate and baggage claim information correctly like it used to before in previous version. Importing externally booked trip details has now become cumbersome. It adds imported trips into existing or previous trips book through BCD travel. It does not recognize logical dates of booking when year details in booking is not provided. For example, when trip commences in Dec 2019 and ends in Jan 2020 and the year details are not given booking, it would show the booking as starting on Jan 2019 and ending in Dec 2019. I don’t think I can use this apps anymore. I wish you could go back to the previous version that worked correctly. | App functions ok but the new UX is a major step backward.  I’m sure it looks good on screen shots but harder to navigate. | Redesign makes this very hard to follow, and disorganized. No idea why they took the clear cards, and make it a mess of dots and giant titles and confusing layout | Latest update took this app back in time.  No apparent way to set up and data and use Touch ID, which just came to last version of app recently. | I never get worked up enough to write a review, but the latest update has ruined this app. It is buggy and unusable to the point that I stopped and booked a hotel room through my company travel website instead for the first time ever since getting this app. 

Someone probably needs to get on that. | It no longer seems to have this feature. It’s recent update makes this nearly worthless. | Great agents and excellent customer service always.
Thank you for being helpful and assisting with all my flights | I find the new update very confusing. I used to use the app for preferred seating upgrades and I can’t find that anymore! | Received notification to download newest update. Now app won’t open. Keep getting server is down message. | Super intuitive and easy to use! This app is a life saver on my work trips! Thankful for the great look, feel, & functionality. | Very resilient and reliable. Enjoying using this application. Ruslan | It is so frustrating that a business app doesn’t have a saved login - or if it does, isn’t working correctly. Viewing trips should be quick and seamless. 

There’s a lot to be desired of this app. It doesn’t handle multiple legs of trips very well. If part of a journey is complete but not another portion, it shows the trip as in the past. 

For one of my hotels, the pin on the map was wrong and showed it in a city an hour away from where I booked it, nearly causing a panic. The address booked was correct though. 

When it comes time to check into a flight, or at any point you want to review/edit a flight, there’s no way to click through from an itinerary to an airline site which is quite frustrating. | Very difficult to add information, screens are not user friendly
Can not navigate between screens to add information | The app has all of my travel info needs integrated nicely with my IPhone. | Very slow app | Clean interface, integrated hotel booking...which is incredibly convenient.  I receive messages from TripSource before I get them from the carriers.

Well done. | I use this app and love having my trip info organized in one folder. It makes it easy to find locator numbers to check in ... except when it doesn’t download the Locator number, flight, or gate info. For some reason when I travel on Southwest the folder will show trip and cities but not all the details you need to know. It’s really a pain to go through having to go find your locator number; especially if your company makes your travel plans for you. Most of the time I can then load my Mobil boarding pass in my Apple wallet but today it wouldn’t do that. Just sometimes not reliable . If they fix this I would give a very strong 5 stars. | TripSource keeps all my reservations in one spot, which is great! I wish it could help me select a motel based on the proximity of my destination. I’d love to be able to enter an address and have it show me motels, distances, and reservation costs. | App is not very good.  Tried to load loyalty programs and unable to load any airline programs. | Where is outlook invitation capability?  You would not let me submit with 3 stars so try 4 | I wish our actual electronic tickets were part of the itinerary.  That would save from having to use multiple apps.  Also, when emailing the itinerary to others, we should be able to write a note with it. | This was a great app until a recent update changed the login policy. Now I have to type a password after 30 mins of inactivity. That’s nuts when my MDM solution forces a complex password for the phone and allows for remote wipe. Very disappointed. | Password, security getting too intense and making app unwieldy | Trip Source AP was very useful and accurate while traveling. My bags were late coming into my destination due to an airline error and Trip Source sent me notification long before the airline. 
Very impressed!! | The app is generally good, but the new login screen no longer allows pasting in the password field, nor does it have any password manager integration. This is quite frustrating for users that use password managers and are unable to paste in their long, complex passwords. | Please make the app so it rotates for an iPad | All of my trips say ‘Your trip to Bloomington, IN is ready to view.’ None of my trips have been there. Just kind of annoying. | Would be a great app IF I could remove past trips.  The app is helpful on alerting others, keeping you updated on travel updates however when the trip is done, I want to remove the trip from my iPhone-so far I haven’t heard back from the app help desk.  

I’ve deleted the app. | Need to login each time you open the app now. While I expect that level of security for a banking app, it’s unusual for a travel app. TripIt doesn’t do this. What’s worse is their customer service - customer care and tact certainly aren’t high priorities for them. | I love(d) this app but this new forced log on “feature” every 30 minutes might just force me to remove it. It’s ridiculous to type in a password so often while on travel..
Please make this an option. | I’m finding the info concerning my trips is lacking. For example, I cannot find my flight confirmation number anywhere in the app. That info is literally the one piece of info you need to fly, why would you not include in the flight info? | The hotel reservations in the app has not been working. Frustrating as I needed it to work after having a flight canceled.

title: AirAsia MOVE: Flights & Hotels
description:
Introducing the AirAsia MOVE app - Your Ultimate Travel and Lifestyle Companion!

Get ready to go all the way with the AirAsia MOVE app, previously known as the airasia Superapp. Whether you're searching for the best deals, cheap flights, or exploring new horizons in Asia or around the world, this all-in-one app has got you covered.

Elevate your trips and your way of living with a wide range of products and services, along with great deals and promotions now!
 
Key Features:
Flight booking:
- Find your flights and cheap tickets at your fingertips.
- Flight finder and booking made easy with our user-friendly interface.
- Find cheap flight tickets at affordable prices from AirAsia and over 700 other airlines, such as Scoot, Cebu Pacific, Thai Airways, Bangkok Airways, and more.
- Unlock exclusive airplane ticket deals and flight promos for your dream destinations.
- Book flights and access your e-ticket and boarding pass hassle-free.

Hotel rooms:
- Book affordable hotel rooms at your preferred destinations with airasia hotels.
- Choose from a variety of options, including budget hotels, city hotels, beach resorts, luxury stays, and more!
- Whether it's for your vacation, honeymoon, or business trip, you'll discover the ideal room at a cheap hotel price.
- Enjoy the best hotel deals and accommodations for a comfortable stay from over 900,000 hotels worldwide.

SNAP, your best hotel + flight deals:
- Enjoy ultimate convenience with SNAP deals, the best travel combo package offered in the app.
- Book affordable AirAsia flight and hotel packages and travel with ease.
- Choose from a variety of budget-friendly hotel + flight combos or flight + hotel packages for your greatest vacation!
- Ideal for families, solo adventurers or luxury seekers.
- Discover the best hotel + flight promos tailored to your preferences.

*Ride your way: 
- Book a ride with airasia ride, our e-hailing and taxi app, at your most convenient time.
- Customize your ride schedule to match your convenience.
- Pre-book your airport rides up to 3 days in advance for peace of mind during your airport transfers.
- Choose from a variety of ride options to suit your preferences, including taxis, private cars, minivans, and more.
- Explore affordable taxi fares and other ride prices for your local trip or an intercity journey. 
- Arrive safely at your destination and enjoy your comfortable ride with our professional drivers.
- Share your ride details with your friends and family through a tracking link to assure them of your safety.
- Enjoy a seamless ride booking experience anytime, anywhere, with just a few taps!

Spend and save more:
- Earn airasia points with airasia rewards from every transaction made on the AirAsia MOVE app.
- Collect points to redeem products and services within the app. The more you spend, the more you can save!
- Redeem points for your discounts and exclusive offers like flight tickets, hotels, taxi, and more.

Last but not least, do note that some features and promotions are only available in specific countries. 

Download the AirAsia MOVE app now to experience a better way of travel and lifestyle and start your next adventure!

*Only available in specific countries.
releaseNotes:
How do you get ahead in life as a developer? You app-ly yourself! 
Check out the latest version of the AirAsia MOVE app, complete with bug fixes and quality of life improvements galore! Update now for a smoother, more bug-free experience!
reviews:
Good online for booking flights. Many options in terms of time | So upon creating the account, I put in the phone number. It is a US number with an area code of 919. However, when I need the OTP(One Time Passcode) to confirm, the number is changed to 99. So I can’t confirm. Being an Application developer, I question the integrity of the application, this is a basic coding error. This is something not caught in a test environment, this process is overall question. | There is no customer service, the chat bot Bo is completely useless. | Booked a flight from CRK to TAC 3 months early, then 1 day I got an email that my flight is canceled and they give me an option to refund or fly early from MNL(6am ish). So I choose to refund my flight. They said that it will be refunded to the CC I used. Unfortunately, 2 months after, no refund happened, I tried to connect with them, but I’m only chatting with Bo, which is not a great help. I hope they will not forget about my refund. And I hope they have a great customer service that can help deal with the issues they have. | I do not know 4.4 of 5 come from where. Luckily i can buy ticket and book hotel. U can not check in, manage ticket, messy app. Never use again. | STAY AWAY FROM THIS APP AT ALL COSTS!!!!!! I WOULD GIVE THIS 0 STARS IF I COULFD! THEY HAVE NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! FLIGHT DELAYS/CANCELLATIONS WILL NEVER BE REFUNDED!!!! I’VE BEEN WAITING 6 MONTHS FOR A REFUND THAT WAS PROMISED AND STILL NOTHING!!! CANNOT GET IN TOUCH WITH ANYONE EXCEPT THE ABSOLUTELY USELESS ROBOT BO!!!!! | MY ACCOUNT GOT LOCKED. BUT NO CLEAR INSTRUCTIONS ON HOW TO GET UNLOCKED. JUST REDIRECTS TO A “SUPPORT” PAGE WITH A BUNCH OF ARTICLES BUT NONE ABOUT HOW TO GET YOUR ACCOUNT UNLOCKED. | Manage booking not work.  Check-in not work at the app. Why you make it? | Cannot complete booking. Incorrect pricing. Use Agoda instead | There is no way to communicate with this airline as the chat option is worthless and no ability to call. | Logged into my account. Received the 6 digit email verification that I entered on the site. Great! Time to book… a pop up appears asking to verify my telephone number. What? No probs, the telephone that is displayed is right….. waited for my text message. Never received it. 

I now can’t enter my account without the second OTP code.

I’ll try my PC but this leaves a bad taste in my mouth. | I tried to sing up for an account and the app keeps deleting the last digit of my number.. pathetic app | After multiple attempts over three days, a supremely negative review is warranted. After logging in to attempt a seat assignment thru this app, the best I get is a blank white screen. 
Trying VietJet’s app for “other airline” compounds the frustration since no reference number supplied by either airline will retrieve my online booking . 
Instead of AirAsiaMove, I’ll choose Bangkok Air henceforth. | I am totally disappointed with ur Mobile app. I have filed the complaint many times and it’s over a month and still it’s not fixed. I was told by the “support staff” that the only way to modify the booking is to actually travel all the way to the airport of departure and talk to sales staff who couldn’t care less. I was told to talk to the “chat box”. Absolute rubbish. | The worse app I ever downloaded by for! Can’t check in online because the app can’t find my reservation even a the reservation code and name was correct! Open the app it says I have to download the app update, so I updated. When to flight search screen, and where I type in where I am flying “from” and “to” I cannot type anything because there is no keypad to type anything. It is not possible to fill in the blank 😆 so I am canceling my membership and deleting the app altogether. | App crashed continuously while I’m trying to go through passport and ticket check. Very poor performance, slow and buggy. | I created a profile with my USA phone number but the app deleted a digit so I am unable to verify my telephone through text. Please fix. I am trying to buy a flight.  Thank you. | Most features don’t work, or don’t load any information. Why even bother with an app if you can make it work. Seems mostly focused on up-selling primarily useless products and promotions. | I tried to book this flight yesterday for $165 and could not get it to go in could not receive SMS so today it cost $188 for the same flight and I spent two hours. I had to re-enter data credit card several times not happy. | Really really useless app. The website instructs to download the app to get live chat support but the app use the same chat bot as the website. The bot couldn’t understand most commands and request for human, live agent, people, customer support all return the same “I can help you faster” message. Exactly the level of poor service you expect from a Malay airline | This app is so bad that I must leave a review. They don’t even have real humans. I wish their chat bot ‘Bo’ didn’t exist, it is actually the most infuriating thing I’ve ever seen. Hopefully this company goes bankrupt. | So I am leaving in a week from the United States to the Philippines and I got a text today that said I should download the app and login there for my flight information. I downloaded the app and upon signing in and creating the login with my iPhone, it asks for date of birth and country dialing code as well as your mobile number. The mobile number is seven digits plus the area code for a total of 10 but every time I go in and try to register my cell phone to get a code sent to me. It says invalid number, because it leaves the sixth digit out after clicking next. I have tried it 100 different times and downloaded the app all over again after deleting it, and even restarted my phone, but nothing I do helps. This app is unusable for me and I don’t know who to contact to even get support. | New review:

New update reminded me that I still have this app on my phone 4 years later. Still a terrible app. Not formatted for an iPhone 13 Pro. No dark mode. Don’t need it and won’t be using it any time soon. Will be deleting it.

Old review:

Soon after entering my phone number into profile , I started getting group texts from random emails. Email texts contained links to scam sites. Their data bank is hacked. | The OTP system does not send the numbers to my email and I am unable to log into my account. The system is not upgraded but flawed. | Just downloaded the new app….the site froze as I was updating my telephone number. Check my WiFi, all good. Tried numerous times to input the
number. No chance to make a reservation. 😡 | Moving away from company branding is not smart move. I almost deleted this app as I did not recognise when I ever downloaded the app. Not to mention that functionality is just bloated. I never expect to use this app other than booking a flight. For hotel and other services I would have looked elsewhere. All I need is just flight detail and checkin. Please deliver only that. Do not force feed your customers. | So frustrating!
Force you to sign up but the app does not accept any phone number | Worst airline customer service on earth. In the history of earth. I’ve been locked out of my account for 3 months and all they can tell me is why. I know why but only they can fix it. And it goes on and on and on. | It would not take my password or accept a new one either. I spent 2 hours screwing with it on my phone and on the computer. Their tech has gotten much worse!!! | Any time I try to create an account or login with my existing one, I’m required to verify my phone number - an expensive requirement when traveling outside one’s home country - but the verification prompt for some reason deletes the third digit of my phone number every time (at least displays as such) and, perhaps consequently, I’ve never successfully received the OTP text | Worst App Ive had to deal with! | Apparently airasia is able to aver charge you in any flight once you change from booking details to payment method with the app/page (my case was 4 min to fill out both).
They haven’t disclosed any details about the extra amount deducted from my account after booking my flight, on the ticket (receipt) received by airasia indicates a different amount than the one charged to my card.
The costumer service assured that they are able to do that due the time difference in between booking details and payment method. They have also mentioned that I can check on the breakdown of the price to know extra fees, which I have but I doesn’t mention anywhere the excess charged to me, and I either received a email to clarify this. | I don’t like this airline becauseee:
- they charge for every bag they can
- they force you to check in at baggage drop counter instead of online 
- not that polite 
- slow line | Keeps messing up my phone # and won’t let me change to verify. Won’t let me change my flight and doesn’t save my flight. Too many pop ups. Not gonna use this airline again | good ride | When I buy tickets by app , I can’t  transfer k plus bank | It’s a great idea to create competition but 9.5/10 times I try to book a car (Penang) they cannot find a driver. Believe it or not sometimes I even stupidly wait to find a car even after 30-40 minutes. | I tried to leave feedback on the app. But the submit button doesn’t work! Which is infuriating because I have a big complaint. Also, when I tried to contact customer support I get sent to “Bo” a really bad AI program. | I have tried to complete my profile to use the app but cannot get past the first hurdle due to a glitch in the app. When I fill in my phone number, it has a 1 in the 3rd to last number of a 10 number string. When try to verify the number using an OTP, the OTP request screen which captures your number from your profile doesn’t register the 1. I have tried inserting other numbers in the space and it works. Only 1 doesn’t but it means I cannot verify my number and this cannot get into the app at all. Incredibly frustrating. | The service was good and good price. In Malaysia we used the ride and the service was really good and good price. | Cannot verify a USA phone number in the App.  the app drops a digit out of the phone number, so the OTP cannot be sent.  This is a BUG.  The Website is able to send the OTP | - I have booked SNAP but when I went to hotel, they said no booking.
- Customer service difficult to contact and reply to late. Waste time to wait them.
- CS just said ‘Sorry’ this cost only flight.
SNAP showed me so clearly, I will have flight+hotel. 
And finally they have no responsibility.

- Every time opened the application have to update but Nothing improve in the application.

Should be improve your service first, no need for application. 😡💀 | The form truncates your phone number so you never receive the OTP | Booked flight online and never received ticket. No, Customer Service responded!! I tried for 24 hours to contact customer service multiple ways. Never receive response never was told if I need to re-purchase ticket or if the ticket was available at airport. Very frustrating!
Does not provide the information needed
No way to contact Customer Service!
Bookings do not show up under “my bookings”… Customer Service does not know how to fix for me. | This does not let me sign in and put my phone number | When i use app, it comes up with a mandatory screen to update my profile.  The phone number is valid.  When i click to verify phone number it drops the last digit and then says its an invalid number.  I cant get out of this loop to actually use app to check flight status. Not good. | I’ve had to enter my details into the app several times. I also wanna warn you that if you’re catching your flight at DMK, the line is so long to check in and drop your bag and then you’ve got about 1 km to get through security to gate 12. It takes 30 minutes and all the way you’re trave there though threatening to close the door on you | I filled out my profile too quickly, and didn’t switch the gender from male to female. Now I can’t edit it. Even if I open my profile on their website and change it to female, the save button is greyed out and I can’t save my changes. Their chat bot Bo won’t help me with it, and there’s no way to contact anyone for help.

title: Mapstr, save & share places
description:
Mapstr lets you keep track of all your favorite places around the world, tag them, and share them with who you want!
To remember your best spots (restaurants, bars, museums...), your friends recommendations, and to plan your next trip, download Mapstr and build the map of YOUR world!

• Works everywhere in the world
• Create you own places, even in the middle of the sea ;)
• Add tags, notes, and pictures to your places
• Discover your friends' best spots
• Access the places opening hours, pictures, website, phone number, etc.
• Compare route options by Uber, Lift, Citymapper, Waze, etc.
• FOR FREE, NO ADS!

At Mapstr, we believe your places are precious and private: for each of them, you can choose if you want to share it with your friends or not.

Get rid of all the restaurant business cards, notebooks, articles extracts... and join the hundreds of thousands of users of Mapstr, the best rated map-meets-notes app, loved by GQ, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Elle, etc. 

• Directly import all your Foursquare or Swarm checkins, your contacts, or your old excel files...
• Steal your friends favorite places
• 3D Touch & Apple Watch
• And a lot more to come :)

We've built Mapstr to enhance you every day life, so please, tell us how you use it!
-> hello@mapstr.com

And if you like it and want to support us, please, give us a 5 stars review, you'll make us more than happy :)

For those who wants to read our terms of use, here they are: https://mapstr.com/terms.html, and our privacy policy is: https://mapstr.com/privacy.html
releaseNotes:
NEW: Everything is now grouped on the map!! Find directly on your map your favorite addresses, those from the maps you follow, and mapstr Matching suggestions based on our artificial intelligence algorithm!

Tell us what you think :)
reviews:
Terrible user experience. Couldn’t navigate back to the Home Screen after signing up. Lost me 2 minutes  ✌🏻 | It asks me what city I am in, so I type it, London, and it doesn’t work (no results). So I type several cities in America, still nothing. I type in Dubai, Tokyo, Rome, Paris and more and still “no results.” It’s sad because this looks like a good app | At first I thought I was imagining things, but I tested it with a few specific restaurants and monitored whether or not they disappeared over time. A bunch of my restaurants are gone from my map, which defeats the entire purpose of the app. switching to Beli. | Love the app but even after several exchanges with developer still cannot edit locations that do not have an address which are the majority of my 1k locations (waterfalls, trailheads, kayaking river access points) … | I found the interface very confusing when I tried to skip entering my phone number. After a bad review and multiple developer follow ups, I finally found how to skip it. I still think it should be more clear. Update: My one star review is because of the interface regarding entering my phone number which I found to be confusing. The screen has a blue circle with a white phone at the top and a big empty field which says “What’s your phone number?” and way down at the bottom of the screen it says “Show My Friends” This interface is bad because in the previous screens I was asked for my preferences, and I was asked to share my contacts, which I declined. These screens had a very helpful “Later” button which gave me a clear way to skip. But this last screen that asks for phone number did NOT have a “Later” button. So it switched interface paradigms near the end of the process after setting up my expectation that I could skip with a “Later” button. So I assumed if I tapped “Show My Friends” it would tell me the phone number field was required. I am the user. I found it confusing. I am entitled to give a one star review for an app that I found hard to use. If I could give it ZERO stars, I would. I might reconsider if they make the screen more clear and add a “Later” or a “Skip” button to that phone number screen. Otherwise, my review is one star and I gave it because in my opinion the interface of the app was confusing to me when I wanted to skip entering my phone number. Also, since I did not share my contacts or enter my phone number, it makes no sense to have a button labeled “Show My Friends.” My intention was to use this app as a way to bookmark cool places I have been. Nothing to do with friends. Which again, think about how confusing the interface is: I did not share contacts or enter a number, and now the only button I was given was “Show My Friends.” It makes no sense. Especially as a new user, I am expecting a “Show the Map” button or something like that. As I said: I found this interface to be confusing. | I absolutely love the idea of this app, I’ve had it for awhile but every time I try to open it I have to “reconnect” it to my Facebook account and 75% of the time it just won’t reconnect and I can’t pull up my maps. 

So many bugs that need to be fixed that have been occurring over the last 5+ months. | Perfect way to organize all my favorite spots without cluttering my driving maps.  Can’t recommend enough!! | I absolutely love mapstr whenever I have a day off I love to go explore news places right in my own backyard! Or if I am coincidentally in the area of a place I’ve marked I always try to make a stop, thanks to alerts that you can set. I could rave Al day about the customization of this app truly but, I did come here to say 2 things, one, that I wish there was a function where you could pin something and it would recommend you others like it or things others near that location have pinned! I think it would be a great addition because sometimes place really are hidden. Two maybe having a toggle function where you could see reviews for the place you’ve pinned if you wanted. I love having my own personal map but sometimes for places I haven’t been a review would be helpful. I understand that’s what the internet is for but having it streamlined into one place is just a little more convenient. I love this app with all my heart and regardless of what I think I will continue to use it forever :) | The app logs me off and tries to get me to establish a new account every time I open it.  No one has the time for that, no matter how useful a new app may be and even if they love the concept… | I just want to say that you guys did a great job with this app. For several years now I’ve been keeping everything in my notes, but this is clearly superior. I have one improvement that can be made since I saw another app do it. I like the tags feature, but you can make it so that we can modify the order that they are shown in on our list? I think it would be nice for aesthetic purposes. Because that way my tags can all be in the same order down the list without me having to delete and re add them in order every time. | I’ve been using Mapster for a number of years. I travel a lot for business and I would store restaurants and other places for reference for when I’m on a trip and seek a restaurant or tourist spot I have saved in the area. 
It is probably user error but as the app has evolved, my ability to find saved items where I’m at, or search for places I’ve stored, but don’t recall exactly what they are called, has become an exercise in frustration for me. I really liked it as a reference library of my places, I’m not really interested in the social media aspects. | I just wish the app was more offline/offgrid friendly. Or at least have the ability to toggle a button to turn on/save for offline use. The app will not open if I have no signal/wifi. And sometimes I can get it to work offline if I stick my phone in airplane mode (50-50 chance). Other than that, it’s a pretty swell app. | I have used this app on several trips. The ability to map sites of interest is such an excellent idea and tool for travel. However, you cannot retain or add maps. If there is an ability to add additional maps then I could not determine how. | When I first found Mapstr about three years ago I recommended it to many of my friends out of my excitement with what it was then and hopes for its future. Unfortunately, the app seems to me to have been on a fairly constant trajectory towards feature bloat that has made the core experience harder to use and appears to have degraded performance.

I wish the tremendous effort that it must have taken to convert this app to a social network would have been instead directed to making improvements to the UX of the core experience of adding and viewing places. Specifically the biggest issue to me is content density: there is lots of whitespace in the UI, there is much less information displayed about a place than in other map apps (so that I have never been able to meaningfully rely on Mapstr for this info), and many touch targets are too small by modern standards. Also important to me is performance, especially on app launch, which is unfortunately much slower than other apps (and often banners appear which further distract from accessing the map quickly).

On the social side, I would have been quite happy with the simple ability to share lists/categories/map via link, and no concept of “friends” whatsoever.

HOWEVER, I have a lot of respect for the developer, which seems to be a really small team, possibly just one engineer. Persevering with a project like this, where your competition is all massive companies, for as long as you have (without selling out!) is impressive and commendable. I still think Mapstr has potential if the development focus can be returned to the core experience. | Mapstr is by far my favorite utility app. I love recommending others use it because if they don’t have mapstr then they aren’t able to remember all of the cool places they hear about to visit, especially in our home city, Chicago. | The app is nice itself, just wish they didn’t sell your data. Now I get random creepy emails from the CEO of this app asking me to verify my email address over and over again and junk emails addressed to my burner handle (which I created especially for this app), so I know it was them who sold it to the scammers. So annoying. | This app is a great for keeping track of all the places you want to save. However, I would really like the option to use it on an iPad. Developers: can you please update this app so it can fit on a larger full screen display? | This app used to be fantastic but the recent changes to it have been fairly detrimental 
Firstly when I open the app I don’t want/care about a news page, everyone is clearly only using it for the map section 
Secondly the performance has taken a hit recently, I used to be able to speed through different saved places but now there is a second lag when selecting/deselecting places
The centre arrow button… hitting that should always just centre on your location, move the ‘centre elsewhere’ button somewhere separate 
Basically I used to love this app and recommend to everyone because it was so smooth and easy to use and had such a clean interface, it’s not the same anymore | Good luck mapstr | I’ve been using this app for years as my way to keep track of bars and restaurants and I think it’s the best way to do it. But it keeps getting more and more bloated every time they add “features” that distract from its main purpose which is a map app. I don’t need prompts, recommendations, and lists. I just want to have a directory of my favorite places. | No matter what I do it won’t let me get past the sign up or sign in process, it asks me if I want to follow a list of people and then it starts to load the map and then crashes. I have not been able to use the app. | Hey guys, love the app but if I can make a suggestion, it would be so useful to see the names of the places we added on the map without having to click on the tiles which can be slow and inefficient. Would be great to be able to eyeball all the names.

Thank you!
Matthieu | Used this app throughout Spain and France and it was great to keep track of all the placed we wanted to go and learn from others what to check out.  Hate using it on the phone though.  When will the tablet format come out? | Just got the app and the first place I added shows the correct address on the listing, but shows up in the wrong place (a few miles away) in the map. I added a couple more that seemed to be accurate. But by the 7th one, the opposite error, is shows up in the right place on the map, but has the wrong address (completely different state this time) and even name of the restaurant wrong.

Seems like a cool idea for an app, but I haven’t even added 10 things yet and I’ve already run into two big errors with their database. I reported the errors to Mapstr through their app, so we’ll see if they get fixed, but that many problems right off the bat doesn’t bode well. | I have iPhone 12 Pro Max with latest iOS and am currently in Singapore. I love this app a lot and it’s exactly what I want except the gps doesn’t work. The precise location doesn’t work either and doesn’t notify me when I’m nearby even though I enabled it. The support couldn’t resolve this. Such a pity because this would be great in singapore and Asia but I can’t recommend it if the main feature doesn’t work here. The company should really look into it. | I’ve tried several apps that were meant to serve the same purpose, but each was always lacking something. THIS ONE IS PERFECT! They cover all the bases. | Great interface, but EXTREMELY buggy. Expect the app to freeze about twice for every one time that it works properly. | Another app that forces you to create an account so they can get your email or facebook info, as well as your travel wants and history. All I want to do is make sense of the hundreds of places Ive been. Simple. An account should be a choice. | Crashes when opening the app | Love the app! Please please just add the following 
1. Ability to rate each location 
2. Ability to add dollar signs of cost | Please explain why my account that I have used for years, was erased. | I love this app! I’ve been using it to keep track of places I want to visit all over the world. It’s awesome. Super easy to use and fully functional. Great dev as well. I have two suggestions: a colorblind mode and a tip option. The tags get very difficult to read if you’re colorblind. And, for people that really don’t need premium features, it’s be nice to be able to support the development with a tip now and again. | Use it all the time for recommendations, places I see and want to try, and places I want to remember in NYC | The map and places tracking tool is way better than any other app out there now for simplicity and ease of use. 
EXCEPT. That no matter what I do, restart, update software, delete, redownload, it always slows down all apps on my phone. Not just this app, its not only warping time in its own world, but it slows down everything on my entire phone until I close it several times.
These bugs are going to ruin it for me! So disappointed, I even emailed about it and never got a response. | I’m so glad my boyfriend introduced me to this app. I love being able to look back at places I’ve all visited, notes about what we ate, and to see other places nearby. | I love this app - I especially like the way it allows me to track locations that I want to remember to visit the next time I am traveling to a location, or even to keep track of cool spots and highly-rated restaurants in my hometown, with tags and/or “you are nearby alerts” to help me find them when I finally get around to checking them out. Highly recommend! | I have been searching for years of a way to keep track of the fabulous food scene of Chicago.  Mapstr is the best app to do that. Tagging by neighborhood, cuisine, chef, great rooftop etc etc has been super helpful for me to be able to easily pull up great options that meet my criteria. Many friends and family contact me because they know I’ll have great recommendations on where they should go because of mapstr. I love how there’s now more room for a restaurant description. More detail has helped so much! I also love that I can include links to online articles about the place so I can easily find more info. Super excited to continue to add more locations to my mapstr!! | I know there is a social aspect to this app, but I really use it to keep track of places I want to go in cities I’m exploring. For that, it’s perfect. The only thing I don’t like is that you have to tag everything, but that’s not a big deal because it forced me to be a little more organized in my locations. | Mapstr is the second app I use the most, right after Instagram. I use it in my hometown or when I travel, I store my own spots or look for new ones to discover. Couldn’t recommend it more!! | It’s just perfect. A clean, simple way to track and remember places I want to visit or have already been and loved. | I love Mapstr, it is so useful in my everyday life! Very easy to use and so practical! Being able to add tags to every places you save on the app makes it super customizable and practical. I no longer have 100 notes on my phone with restaurants ideas my friends talked to me about or that I saw a month ago in a magazine: all these places are on my Mapstr, ready to be tried! Also, being able to take inspos on my friend’s maps is what makes it much better than any other app! 
Really love it! Recommend ++ | Great app to save all your best places in one place. I’ve been using it daily for more than one year and the app works very well! | My only regret is not having this app 10 years to keep and share my favorites addresses | I love Mapstr and have been using it for a few years now. Maps are important to me when I travel and having this app suits my way of organizing the things I read or hear about that I want to visit. It’s also handy in LA where I live, since there are cool things to see and eat in many neighborhoods that may be off my beaten path. In Paris last fall I was able to easily see places that I had been plugging in rather than going thru a folder full of old clippings and then not knowing where they were, my previous method of saving good ideas. Very useful! | I love this app, it’s how I keep track of all the restaurants I have visited and want to try. I highly recommend it! | Love this app! Using it all the time! How to get reviews from people you trust instead of strangers... | For anyone serious about exploring (read: people who are both curious and organized), you can do no better than Mapstr. | I love Mapstr. I love to travel and use a map to help me plan and navigate trips. Mapstr allows me to save the places that I’ve been and reference them as I go. You can share your map with friends or keep it to yourself as you travel over time. Very simple to use and easy to understand. | When I find a new venue to visit or get a recommendation, Mapstr is the way I keep track. My favorite is going to a neighborhood I’m not typically in and looking at the spots I’ve marked. Easiest way to keep the adventures flowing. | This app was recommended to me by a French friend a few years ago. I love it!

1. It’s great for those times you walk past restaurants and think I’d like to try that but then you always forget. This way you can just save straight into the app

2. You can save places you’ve been so you don’t forget them. Especially for holiday destinations 

3. You can share with friends who ask you for recommendations and the tagging system helps localize their preferences

It works perfectly

title: Lambus | Travel Planner
description:
Lambus - Your all-in-one travel companion!

Conquer the world with ease and plan your next adventure with Lambus - the ultimate travel app that has everything you need for your trip! From trip planning to organizing your documents to managing expenses, we've got it all under control so you can focus on your adventure! Whether you're traveling solo or on a group adventure, Lambus is your reliable companion on every trip.

# Simply plan, experience more!
So much world, so little time! That's why we've made itinerary planning as easy as possible. Mark your destinations as stops and add interesting places effortlessly. Want to change something? No problem! Move or delete your stops in a snap. Planning your trip has never been so easy!

# Import itineraries made easy
Whether you're planning a bike tour, motorcycle tour or hiking adventure - with Lambus you can easily import .gpx files from popular manufacturers like Garmin and all participants of your trip will have instant access to the itineraries. Or you can simply create a new route directly in our route planner.

# Everything in one place - No more chaos in your documents
No more confusing lists and lost emails! With Lambus, you collect all your travel documents in one safe place. So you (and your travel companions) can access them at any time, even offline!

# Keep travel expenses under control
Lambus makes it easy to keep track of your travel expenses. You're on a group trip and want to split the expenses? No problem! We'll even do the math for you! Just fill in the form, calculate your debts and pay directly.

# Manage practical notes
Whether you want to share your Airbnb PIN code with the group, create a packing list, or just jot down your passport number, Lambus helps you manage notes easily and securely.

# Get inspired!
Still no idea where to go next? Browse through our Discover feature and get inspired by the many destinations. Whether it's an exciting road trip through the USA, a city break in a European metropolis or a relaxing beach vacation - you'll find it here. Every day we publish exciting trips with stops and travel tips!

# Book your tickets
With our transportation feature, you can not only plan routes between stops, but also easily deposit or book your transportation. Once you book your tickets, they are automatically added to your travel documents!

Visiting more than one place? Lambus is the ultimate travel app for backpackers, road trippers and world travelers! Plan your next adventure effortlessly with our innovative travel planner. What are you waiting for? Download Lambus and start your next adventure with us!
releaseNotes: Thank you for using Lambus! This update contains bug fixes and improvements :-)
reviews:
I really like the UI, it’s easy to navigate and has the right things that you need for planning. 

A few improvements though. First, when you search for places for your plan, the result doesn’t narrow down to your destination. Instead, it will display all the places with similar names in the entire world. When I plan for my trip to Paris, why would I want to see places in Australia and Canada?

Second, management of sub groups within a trip would be great. For example, allow creating trip to Paris and Berlin and Rome under a larger plan called Trip to Europe. And then allow forwarding of reservation emails to the Trip to Europe plan for automatic imports. Thanks. | Would love to see the document section incorporate actual word and excel documents...odd that it doesn’t support that.

Notifications could be more specific...pretty generic at the moment.

Would love to see hiking/camping trips incorporated, to include camp sites.

Great App! Keep building it and improving! | Great idea. But everything is based on where you’re going rather than the chronological order in which you seeing/doing everything. You can list places by date but not specific times in a day. And the main title is the waypoint, not what you’re doing. App is simple & clean but not very useful for me

title: Oxford Bus and Thames Travel
description:
Our new app has everything you need to get around Oxford with Oxford Bus. It’s packed full of everything you’ll need to get mobile on the bus.

Mobile Tickets: Purchase mobile tickets securely with Apple Pay or a debit/credit card and show the driver when boarding - no more searching for cash!

Live Departures: Browse and view bus stops on the map, explore upcoming departures, or check out the routes from a stop to see where you could travel next. 

Journey Planning: Plan your commute, trip to the shops or night out with friends. It’s now even easier to plan ahead with Oxford Bus.

Timetables: We’ve squeezed all of our routes and timetables into the palm of your hand.

Contactless Journeys: View the journeys you have made using your contactless cards and a breakdown of charges and savings.

Favourites: You can quickly save your favourite Departure Boards, Timetables and Journeys, with quick access from one convenient menu.

Disruptions: You’ll be able to keep up to date with service changes directly from our disruption feeds inside the app. 

As always, we welcome your feedback. You can send it to us via the app.
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and performance improvements
reviews:
This use of this app lead to a disastrous experience trying to get from Heathrow to Oxford. The only option it showed for pick up was several miles from the airport, near a business parking lot. We took an airport shuttle there, only to learn the bus stop was a decent walk away, through a weird industrial park. After finally finding our bus stop, the bus drove right by and didn’t stop! We tried to flag it down with no luck. At that point we were stranded several miles away from the airport and out the 5 pounds I paid for a day pass. Overall, using this app wasted 2 hours and resulted in a $140 Uber. Just go to the bus station at the airport and ignore the app completely. | Do not use this app if you are traveling from LHR. It listed the only available route from LHR to Oxford as departing from a bus stop outside of the airport. After spending a long time finding the bus stop (which is basically in an industrial park) we figured we would wait and see if the bus came. While the bus did come, it sped right past us, even though we were waiting at the stop this app told us it would stop at. We sprinted after the bus and waived it down but it would not stop. 

This app will lead you astray, stranded, and with blisters from walking around so long just looking for information. 

If you are coming from LHR- Go to the central bus station at the airport and get on a bus there instead. Don’t follow this app unless you want to waste 2 hours and £150 on an Uber. | Will definitely use this again next time I visit Oxford. | I only saw stagecoach buses but I could not board on them.

title: Funliday - Travel Planner
description:
Funliday is a trip planning app that makes your trip easier!!
-- Featured on the 「App store home page」
-- Featured in 「Best New Apps」

Fun + Holiday = Funliday
The best trip planning App in the world!!!

Funliday is a trip planning app that makes your trip easier, helps you and your travel companions to manage your trips, find local attractions, get directions, collaborate with travel companions. Funliday provides thousands of destinations, you can easily explore all of the places you are interested in and simply add them to the itinerary. You can also organize schedules and routes, as well as co-editing with travel companions.

------Key Features-------
* Edit together with others in the same trip. 
* Explore attractions all over the world.
* Organize your trip with ease.
* Offers offline trips (except maps).
* Provides driving/walking/public transit directions.
* Add attractions to Funliday in iOS Safari with share extension.
* Share your trip itinerary by email , WhatsApp and Line.

Like it, love it? Leave us feedback and a rating to let us know! We're all ears for your suggestions on how to improve, so if you've got any (or even if you just want to say hi!), drop us a message at willie@funliday.com. Have fun on your holiday!
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and performance improvements
reviews:
This app works very well especially considering that it is free. Most of the shortcomings I see are minor opportunities for enhancement:

* Notify and correct for time zones
* warn of dirt roads
* more sophisticated meta data like confirmation code and budget 

The journal option (capture photos that correspond to date, time, and waypoint location) is an amazing capability. | Always happy with the user interface, very handy with estimated driving time and easy to share itinerary with friends. I tried google trip and I’m just not as impressed. I recently ran into problems not being able to add scenic spots to my itinerary, sent them a user feedback with details, they responded quickly and resolved it within 2 days. I rarely see app that attentive to user feedbacks. Great job Funliday! | Love how I can share and others get to be able to input to the itinerary such an awesome app. | This is truly the best trip planning app. I’ve been using this for a few years now for every trip. Back then I literally tried 10 or so apps and none of them did what I needed. This one had a couple glitches, but it was so close to great and was still the best so I stuck with it. Customer service also fixed/enhanced some items quickly at my request. Now, the app works perfectly and does exactly what I need it to do. I tell everyone about it! Thank you for making this app! Also, I looove that you can share it with friends/family and they can make real-time updates to it as well! | This app used to work really well and was amazing for planning trips.  I used to be able to look up places and attractions easily and add them to my plans for each day but now adding attractions takes a long time to load.  Also, the app used to quickly determine transportation time based on whatever transportation mode I selected, and now it never figures it out.  Finally, I used to be able to easily move and rearrange the order of places to visit but now everything gets messed up when I try to do that.  When I first started using it I would have given it 5 stars but now I would give it zero if I could.  This app used to be perfect and now it is basically useless. | This app is great as everyone traveling in the group can see the plans on a given day. However, it’s difficult to have more than one activity in a day because it doesn’t let you set a start time for anything but the first activity. After that it assumes you are going directly to the next place. A little annoying as trips frequently have down time in between. | This is the first time using the app and am planning two trips simultaneously. I like it for the most part, once I figured it out it got easier. I am not able to edit the days, my travel partner imputed the wrong start date so that’s something I have to work around. Overall a pretty cool way for everyone to add to the itinerary and make the most of the trip!! | If I’m planning a trip to multiple cities it would be super useful to search and select a city vs a specific attraction. I thought at first this is what would happen when I selected a day and a map came up. Nothing happens when you do that. You can roam around in the map, but there is no ability to simply select a city as a way point. | I typically like using this app over TripIt. I like that it routes my activities on the maps and gives me allotted times of days depending on my duration. I like that it’s color coded by day. I like that it shows the drive time from one place to another. However....I would LOVE this app if it could Integrate our flights and hotel information and information of attractions, like tripit does.
