All I get is a list of “recommended” and I can click on each one, open it, zoom out the map and then be like “good grief that’s far!” I know that there are beautiful hikes around Seattle, but I don’t want to drive for 90+ minutes to get to a hike. I want to know what’s nearby. 

I already spent my 90+ minutes trying to figure out this app. If I do locate a hike, perhaps I’ll be back. | So many features, lots of great technical tools. I’ve been using Gaia for years and love it! | Doubled price without adding any useful new features. This was my go to trail app but I am done. | Really great app - very easy to use, especially if you’ve used a hiking GPS in the past.  You just have to start your track by hitting “record” and then click the Map button and zoom in.  Excellent! | The latest version brings single tap to build a route which is much better than before. But I need to make routes where I can add points to streets or paths that already are added to the route. Think of a route that goes to a peninsula and I then need to return the same path I came from. I can’t add points to the route that already has a path there.

EDIT: They fixed the route planning :) | It was such a good and dependable app. After update now it crashes everytime I open it. | Great app. | I love this program I have been using it for years now and with the price increase I would like to see some improvements. (Which is why I have a lower review, not the cost but the continuation of long term minor issues) 

1 the map layers show duplicated in the folder for map layers 
2 there are no controls to increase text size for map layers, there interactive as they adjust there size the closer you get but well using the app on mobile the text is not a reasonable size to read easily. 

If those two things get resolved this program is 5/5 top notch | Desktop and mobile don’t see each other. Whatever you upload on desktop doesn’t show on mobile and vice versa. Can’t upload pics to either. Waste of $$$ Update: even worse. Have been on with their “support” for almost a week. It’s like pulling teeth with no anesthesia - they know nothing and can’t fix anything. At least for a refund.

Another update: they have simply abandoned my issues. If you want to stay alive in the wilderness, don’t use this app! | I thought this app was great at first and I've been using it the last 7 months, but it was barely worth the price before, now it's not worth it at all. On several instances, we would be out on forest roads and trails and no matter which layers I'd select, the app wouldn't show the roads we were on or would show that they end. But then my wife would bring up google maps and, it would display an accurate depiction of the roads. And now on the new interface, you have to record before your pace is shown. I don't record most of my adventures,  but I like to use the app's display to see my pace. Also, the new interface is bulky. The old one was way more streamlined. Anyways, I've cancelled my subscription and will be looking at OnX and others. | Bumping your price by 50% is totally unacceptable to me. Gaia is one of the few apps I’ve been willing to pay a significant amount for, due to its functionality. That being said, $59.90/year is unacceptable. Looks like corporate mergers have destroyed another valuable thing. After years of using Gaia, I’m really sad to have to use something else, but it looks like that’s where we’re at. Bye. PS: developer responses like “write to our support team” in response to this sort of complaint, is telling. | I was trying to figure out why my pre-plotted hike gave me literally 2x more elevation gain than my recorded hike of the exact same route. I started moving the dots around and realized how inaccurate it is. In one flat area I moved the dot perhaps 50 feet down the road and my elevation changed 100 feet. Again this was in a flat area. The result is that using this app I l it really have no idea which of the many conflicting numbers it is spit to go out are accurate. I gave it two stars because at least it opens and the clock works. | A great app but I honestly feel a bit hurt that theyve made such a steep subscription price hike for their loyal customers. Going outside shouldn't cost an arm and a leg and neither should access to maps. Im out for now gaia. ✌🏽 | Great app on the iPhone but no labels show on Apple Watch when tracking. It would be nice to see what all the data is representing like health, elevation, etc. also Can’t create waypoints. Hopefully it’s just a simple fix. Has to be a bug. | And now.   lol.  Start a new track and hike several miles.  Each time you turn your screen off and come back to the application or switch apps and come back the map re-centers on the starting spot.  :-(. They also at these new prices need to have faster download servers. Crazy slow. Still the bat hiking application. But still they had feature in there watch application that made it useful for real backpackers. They added features but still feel the need to remove the ability to spy on a phone based track from the watch. I don’t even install the watch application. How is that battery going to track its own separate track with gps and last for days or weeks? You know one cannot charge the Apple Watch without removing it? But the old app allowed me to run the real track on my phone and just check progress on the watch. It was perfect. Instead they kill that feature raise the price to the point where a year costs as much as five years did a couple years ago. Sigh. I mean really if I want a non-intergrated Apple Watch hiking application then I will just use the one built in from Apple. The old application allowed for a real backpacking experience that I get grated the longer and renewable battery life of the phone with the ability to quickly check progress on the watch. Now if you have a trip longer than a handful of hours then the Watch application is worthless. | I found the interface on this app to be clunky and not at all intuitive. I really miss the old Motionx GPS.  Sadly this one doesn’t measure up. | I cannot login or reset my passpord!
I've tried millions times and sent tons of emails,received nothing yet.
NO ONE response to my request but the BILL OF THE SUBSCRIPTIONS COMES ON TIME! | Good app. I like it better than other competitors like OnX or Avenza. Three stars because they raised the price so much—even for longtime subscribers. Not cool. | The app was barely worth $40, developers upped the price to $60 without adding any useful features or fixing bugs. I’m out, downloading CalTopo | No need to expound on all the great features of this app. Some warts this far: 1) Elevations are hit or miss. Routes that you add typically don’t have consistently meaningful elevations—you have to create the route then edit -> “look up elevations”. And even then the elevations aren’t the same between the phone app and browser app. 2) App auto-routes and shows trails in areas that are definitely not open to the public (as in you’d need to climb over a clearly marked “no tresspassing” fence to use that path; this situation has arisen twice in 2 weeks). I ended up pairing this app with Strava’s global heatmap to make sure I wasn’t heading the wrong way. Why can’t Gaia GPS partner with, say, Strava or Garmin to crowd-source viable routes for hiking? Or at least clearly identify private property? | I rely on Gaia for backcountry navigation. It has become unusable. I open the app and it freezes within a minute. Now its crashing within seconds of opening it. I’ve reach out to support and have received no help. I’m going to start using CalTopo since that app has yet to crash on me. I really wish Gaia could get back to me with what is wrong because I like the app. It’s just downright unsafe to use the way I need it. | I loved Gaia maps, but a 50% increase? No thanks! | Got out for the first real hike in awhile.  Wanted to find some waypoints I saved years ago.  My position on the map floats all over the place and is very inaccurate.  I can stand still and the cursor floats all over the map.  Running up to date software in an iPhone 14 Pro Max. | I literally just entered a local major street in a major city and it didn’t even come up as an option on the list of places! | I’ve been using Gaia for years and have recommended it to dozens of people. Unfortunately it has really started going downhill and is often unbearably slow. Map layers take forever to load, and downloads typically stall out and never finish, particular for satellite layers. Unless this is resolved, I’ll be switching to OnX or CalTopo after my subscription ends (also they doubled the price, which if the app worked well would be tolerable, but it doesn’t…) | I thoroughly dislike the new Gaia UI. The record button is on the map page and I often find my track paused or deleted entirely, likely from having my phone back and forth from my pocket. 
The record button doesn’t need to be on this page. Users don’t frequently stop and start tracks. I do check the map often when off trail, the worst time to have my track disappear.
I preferred having three options for my hike data, now only allowed 2 because record permanently takes one slot. | I was excited to use this app on my Apple Watch for guidance while hiking.  Created my first map, and I attempted to load it on my Apple Watch. Runs up to 100%, but no map shows up. Bey disappointed for the cost of this app. | Don’t know what happened with the latest update but it now takes 30-60 seconds to load app and it keeps freezing while tracking in the record mode. This use to be my go to map program but this latest update seems to move app backwards. Horrible update. Why do you keep taking something that works and ruin it. Going to another app. | I’ve had this app for over a decade and this bug has persisted. It keeps launching in the background which drains my phone’s battery. The dev team seems to be unable to patch this. Very disappointing! | Great app for hiking! I float / canoe many rivers and it would be great to have a gps overlay that shows specific river data and mileage markers to plan a multi-day canoe trip.  Also the ability to create a route and select a mode “canoe”. 
Do the developers have any plans to include this ability or information?  Thanks! | It’s useful but they just doubled the price without adding features. I cancelled my subscription and am using All Trails. | I’ve been using Gaia GPS for years, and I’ve recommended it to everyone I know- friends, family, random people I meet on the trail.  The app has been buggy at times, but overall, I’ve enjoyed using it. 

All those glowing words of praise are about to come to a screeching halt.

I just received notification that Gaia is so proud of themselves that they have decided to give themselves a 66% raise!!!!  That’s right.  They are jacking up the annual subscription fee from $39.99 to $59.90!   I can see a 5% or even a 10% increase to keep up with inflation, but really???  SIXTY SIX PERCENT???

Pretty ridiculous move guys.  I hate to break it to you, but you’re delusional.

Peace out. | What good is it to create waypoints that you can’t use to create a route?

title: Google Translate
description:
Translate between up to 133 languages. Feature support varies by language:
• Text: Translate between languages by typing
• Offline: Translate with no internet connection
• Instant camera translation: Translate text in images instantly by just pointing your camera
• Photos: Translate text in taken or imported photos
• Conversations: Translate bilingual conversations on the fly
• Handwriting: Draw text characters instead of typing
• Phrasebook: Star and save translated words and phrases for future reference

Permissions notice:
• Microphone for speech translation
• Camera for translating text via the camera
• Photos for importing photos from your library

Translations between the following languages are supported:
Afrikaans, Albanian, Amharic, Arabic, Armenian, Assamese, Aymara, Azerbaijani, Bambara, Basque, Belarusian, Bengali, Bhojpuri, Bosnian, Bulgarian, Catalan, Cebuano, Chichewa, Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Traditional), Corsican, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dhivehi, Dogri, Dutch, English, Esperanto, Estonian, Ewe, Filipino, Finnish, French, Frisian, Galician, Georgian, German, Greek, Guarani, Gujarati, Haitian Creole, Hausa, Hawaiian, Hebrew, Hindi, Hmong, Hungarian, Icelandic, Igbo, Ilocano, Indonesian, Irish, Italian, Japanese, Javanese, Kannada, Kazakh, Khmer, Kinyarwanda, Konkani, Korean, Krio, Kurdish (Kurmanji), Kurdish (Sorani), Kyrgyz, Lao, Latin, Latvian, Lingala, Lithuanian, Luganda, Luxembourgish, Macedonian, Maithili, Malagasy, Malay, Malayalam, Maltese, Maori, Marathi, Meiteilon (Manipuri), Mizo, Mongolian, Myanmar (Burmese), Nepali, Norwegian, Odia (Oriya), Oromo, Pashto, Persian, Polish, Portuguese, Punjabi, Quechua, Romanian, Russian, Samoan, Sanskrit, Scots Gaelic, Sepedi, Serbian, Sesotho, Shona, Sindhi, Sinhala, Slovak, Slovenian, Somali, Spanish, Sundanese, Swahili, Swedish, Tajik, Tamil, Tatar, Telugu, Thai, Tigrinya, Tsonga, Turkish, Turkmen, Twi, Ukrainian, Urdu, Uyghur, Uzbek, Vietnamese, Welsh, Xhosa, Yiddish, Yoruba, Zulu
releaseNotes: • Several bug fixes and usability improvements
reviews:

If left unchallenged, Apple will only continue to strengthen its smartphone monopoly. The Justice Department will vigorously enforce antitrust laws that protect consumers from higher prices and fewer choices. That is the Justice Department’s legal obligation and what the American people expect and deserve.” | الترجمه عن طريق الكاميرا بطيئه لا تجيد ترجمة النصوص المتغيره | Bring back the old UI (user interface) its so much better and simple to use, the app went from like a lambo to a prius | Great translation app, a lot of languages available for download. | I live learning phrases etc but id love to speak and it audibly translates to spanish if im missing something Please tell me | I don’t know if you change the software or what, but I swear it was this app that offered the Central American Spanish as well as the Spain Spanish. Thank You All. | Google translated is the best app it has almost every single language on the planet and translates every single word | The newest update is the worst thing google ever did. They really asked themselves how this could be the least user friendly app on the market, and succeeded with flying colors. | Strange issue.Hindi& sanskrit translations dont work | لماذا لا يوجد السريانية والاشورية ؟؟ ܬܘܕܝ ܣܓܝ | Great app but no safari extension unfortunately | Recent changes where we can no longer coax the system to force the informal ‘tu’ or the formal ‘vous’ - we used to be able to put tu/vous directly into the English version in place of “you” to force the translation…now it completely ignores this and just randomly gives us tu or vous forms as it sees fit - which has nothing to do with our desired translation. 

Also with the part tense we used to be able to add “it rained” to translate to the passé composé and then “it was raining” to translate to the imperfect. But now it also ignores our input and decides on its own. This defeats the purpose of its not translating what I’m telling it I want. 

Huge ongoing glitch! They don’t specify the gender on French nouns that begin with vowels. Most words you can see le for masculine or la for feminine. But for nouns the begin with vowels it’s contracted to l’ so we can’t tell the gender. I’ve send several pieces of feedback to correct this glitch by using the indefinite article un or une instead, which is never contracted or just by identifying the noun as masc or fem. It’s been years of me among suggestions and Google refuses to fix this design flaw. | I’ve had this app for years, but on a recent update every time I look at the translation, I have to go back to the homepage to click on another translation in the same language! I didn’t used to have to do this. I have no idea why they chose to make it much more complicated, but I don’t like it! | Such as different voices instead we are not able to choose male or female, accent or no-accent, etc…. | I thought this was a free app, why was I charged. Also don’t even see how I can cancel so I won’t be charged again that’s typical of Google and I’m such a fan of Google. | Title: The Inadequacies of Google Translate: An Assessment from Omar's PerspectiveIntroduction: Google Translate, a widely used machine translation service, has undoubtedly revolutionized global communication by breaking down language barriers. However, despite its widespread popularity, Google Translate is not without its flaws. In this essay, we will explore the limitations of Google Translate from the perspective of an individual named Omar, highlighting its inadequacies and the challenges it poses in accurately conveying meaning across languages.Paragraph 1: One of the primary criticisms of Google Translate stems from its inability to capture the nuances and complexities of human language. Languages are rich with cultural references, idiomatic expressions, and contextual meanings that are often lost in translation. As a result, Google Translate frequently produces inaccurate or nonsensical translations that fail to effectively communicate the intended message.Paragraph 2: Moreover, Google Translate struggles with grammatical accuracy and syntax, leading to awkward and confusing translations. Languages vary significantly in their sentence structures and grammatical rules, making it challenging for a machine translation system to generate coherent and grammatically correct output consistently. Omar often finds himself frustrated by the jumbled and disjointed translations provided by Google Translate, which hinder effective communication with others.Paragraph 3: Furthermore, Google Translate's reliance on statistical algorithms and machine learning models means that its translations are susceptible to errors and inaccuracies, particularly with less commonly spoken languages or dialects. Omar, who speaks a minority language, often encounters mistranslations and misinterpretations when using Google Translate, highlighting the limitations of the service in capturing the nuances of diverse linguistic contexts.Paragraph 4: Another significant drawback of Google Translate is its lack of context awareness. Language is inherently contextual, with meanings often dependent on the surrounding words, phrases, or cultural references. However, Google Translate operates in isolation, devoid of the contextual understanding that humans possess, resulting in translations that lack depth and accuracy. Omar frequently encounters misunderstandings and misinterpretations due to Google Translate's inability to grasp the context of his communications.Paragraph 5: Furthermore, Google Translate's reliance on user-generated content and crowd-sourced translations introduces a risk of inaccuracies and inconsistencies. While user contributions can enhance the coverage and quality of translations, they also open the door to errors, biases, and misinformation. Omar has encountered numerous instances where translations provided by Google Translate were misleading or incorrect, leading to confusion and frustration.Paragraph 6: In addition to its linguistic shortcomings, Google Translate has been criticized for its limited support for minority languages and dialects. While the service covers a wide range of languages, it often prioritizes widely spoken languages at the expense of lesser-known ones. Omar, whose native language is not supported by Google Translate, faces significant barriers in accessing accurate translations, highlighting the service's neglect of linguistic diversity.Paragraph 7: Moreover, Google Translate's lack of transparency regarding its translation methodologies and algorithms raises concerns about the reliability and accuracy of its output. Users like Omar are left in the dark about how translations are generated and the factors that influence their quality, making it difficult to assess the trustworthiness of the service. Without transparency, Google Translate's credibility is called into question, undermining its utility as a translation tool.Paragraph 8: Additionally, Google Translate's performance varies widely across different languages and language pairs, with some translations being more accurate than others. Omar, who communicates in multiple languages, often finds inconsistencies in the quality of translations provided by Google Translate, further diminishing his confidence in the service. The lack of consistency adds another layer of uncertainty to the already challenging task of cross-linguistic communication.Paragraph 9: Furthermore, Google Translate's translations are often characterized by a lack of fluency and naturalness, making them sound stilted and artificial. Languages are not merely systems of symbols; they are living, dynamic entities shaped by culture, history, and social interactions. Google Translate's mechanical approach to translation fails to capture the nuances of language usage, resulting in translations that feel robotic and devoid of human touch.Paragraph 10: In conclusion, while Google Translate has undoubtedly facilitated communication and connected people across linguistic boundaries, its limitations cannot be overlooked. From inaccuracies and inconsistencies to a lack of context awareness and transparency, Google Translate falls short in meeting the diverse and complex needs of its users, including individuals like Omar. As technology continues to evolve, it is imperative that we recognize the shortcomings of machine translation systems like Google Translate and work towards developing more sophisticated and reliable solutions that truly bridge the gap between languages and cultures. | This app constantly freezes and doesn’t work. title: MGM Rewards
description:
Get to the fun. Faster!
The official app from MGM Resorts is your digital concierge – make & manage hotel, dining, and show reservations.

The MGM Rewards App Lets You: 

•  Check your MGM Rewards Progress - Look up all your MGM Rewards details with ease.  
•  Plan your Trip - Use the new “Trips Tab” to plan your visit to any MGM Resorts destination.   
•  Start Your Stay the Easy Way - MGM Rewards members can check in 24-hours before they arrive, and when it’s time to leave, they can simply skip the front desk and check out in a few clicks.   
•  Use a Digital Key - Use your smartphone as a Digital Key to access your room.   
•  Make Dining Reservations - Use our intuitive search filters to find the perfect restaurant.   
•  Book Entertainment Anytime - Comedy shows. Cirque du Soleil® spectacles. Concerts. Sporting events. Whatever entertainment you’re looking for, you’ll find it whenever, wherever. You can even buy tickets with a couple of taps! 


About MGM Resorts International
MGM Resorts International is a global entertainment company with national and international locations featuring best-in-class hotels and casinos, state-of-the-art meetings and conference spaces, incredible live and theatrical entertainment experiences, and an extensive array of restaurant, nightlife and retail offerings. The MGM Resorts portfolio encompasses unique hotel offerings including some of the most recognizable resort brands in the industry.

The MGM Rewards app lets you search and book the lowest hotel rates, dining reservations, and show tickets for events within all of our world-class brands: Bellagio, ARIA, Vdara, MGM Grand Las Vegas, The Signature at MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay, Delano Las Vegas, Park MGM Las Vegas, NoMad Las Vegas, New York-New York, Luxor, Excalibur, MGM National Harbor, MGM Springfield, MGM Grand Detroit, Beau Rivage, and MGM Northfield Park.

*MGM Rewards membership (must be 21 years or older) required to use mobile check-in and/or digital via MGM Rewards Mobile App. Use of digital key subject to ID verification requirements. To receive room ready push notifications as part of the mobile check-in process, you must opt-in to receive push notification on your mobile device. If Location Services are enabled, we will prioritize assigning you an available room, and recommend dining options nearby. Availability of mobile app features may vary by property. Subject to Mobile App Terms of Use, Digital Key Terms of Use, and Privacy Policy.
releaseNotes: Get the most out of every stay with the official MGM Resorts app. Check in, unlock your room (at supported properties), and discover breathtaking shows, amazing restaurants and great nightclubs, all at your fingertips.

title: Drive Safe & Save™
description:
Welcome to Drive Safe & Save, a safety app that can help you save on your State Farm® auto insurance and improve your driving habits.

You’ll get a 10% discount for signing up and completing the setup steps! After the initial participation period, how you drive will determine how much you save—up to 30%.*

The Drive Safe & Save app automatically records your trips and helps you understand your driving habits—what you’re doing well and what could be improved.**

Along your recent trip routes, the app shows you opportunities for safer driving by flagging these events: acceleration, braking, cornering, phone distraction and speed. (Events are opportunities to improve your driving.)

• Check the app often to see:
• Your safety scores
• How much you’re saving per enrolled vehicle
• Your trip routes from the last 30 days
• Number of recorded trips from the last 14 days
• Opportunities to improve your driving habits
• Number of recorded miles from the last 14 days
• Any vehicles on your policy that are eligible or enrolled in Drive Safe & Save Connected Car

State Farm cares about your privacy and won’t sell your information. Collected data is used to help you create safer driving habits and may be used to calculate the amount of your discount. Learn more about State Farm privacy practices on statefarm.com®.

*Discounts may exceed 30% and vary state-to-state (NY capped at 30%). Not available in CA, MA, RI. A discount may not be available in NC depending on individual facts and circumstances. Setup required.

**After you enroll, we’ll mail you a beacon to place in your vehicle as part of the required setup steps. The beacon works together with the Drive Safe & Save app to accurately record your trips.
releaseNotes: We have fixed a few things in the background to make your experience better
developer: State Farm Mutual Automobile Insurance Company
reviews:
I get it.  State Farm is needs an excuse to raise your rates.  Instead of incurring an event by slamming on your brakes to avoid the jerk that cut you off just go ahead and hit him and let State Farm deal with the claim.  Coming up on a stale yellow?  Don't hit the brakes, take your chances and run the red light.  The app is stupid.  It makes sense to track when people use their phone when driving or when they are speeding.  But I get dinged a lot for defensive driving incidents. I'm doing State Farm and myself a favor by avoiding an accident. But they want to use it to raise rates. | This app is very sensitive! If you go around a corner at or slightly below the post speed it dings you for to fast. The same is true for braking.  To avoid a lower score you have to go well below the speed limit on a curve often resulting in getting honked at. Seems ridiculous to me! | Broken, useless app | The cornering is way to sensitive! | This application is wrong because it always says that I go 10 or more miles of what I actually I go. | In normal city driving where the yellow light duration is pretty short expect to get dinged on your score often.

This app seems to encourage users to run yellow lights in order not to get dinged on their score.

The braking algorithm sensitivity needs to be changed to be more realistic with normal city traffic light timing. | I’m one week in and I do not like it. It’s saying accelerating and covering. I’m I need to accelerate after I start my turn so the people behind me don’t hit me. I also don’t understand why I’m paying the same as my sister, yet she doesn’t have to deal with this. Lastly, it accessed my phone 31 times in an hour that I had it set at always. I was not in my vehicle, so why does it need to access my phone? I would rather pay more than have this device in my vehicle.

I’m months in, it keeps kicking me out making me reset my password, but doesn’t tell me that, just won’t aspire me to reset without calling the help desk. 

It accesses my location when I’m not using the app or driving. Too personal. | I would give it 5 stars if it would record ALL my driving. It's way to sensitive on the braking. | The discount is great and the feedback informative. 

The addition of some simple code to allow setting the default phone for a vehicle is needed. 

It is very cumbersome having to reclassify who the driver is. Since I always help my wife into any car, she becomes the designated person. The process for reclassifying is not simple.  Code could be added to allow designating a default phone for each vehicle. Then only in unique cases would there need to be a change. The option to change drivers by a simple button should also be made through interacting with a summary list of trips.

The app also is highly sensitive in small cars (little weight) resulting in acceleration and braking events. The heavier vehicles seldom identify events. 

Speed is set to trigger at 8 miles over. This margin is minimal on the interstate based on traffic and situations. 

But…the discount is great and the information interesting. | I get downgraded just for having the gps on while I’m driving.  Pulling out into traffic at a normal speed dings acceleration and stopping without getting the finger behind me dings my braking | Many times braking is not reasonable as you must stop quickly to avoid accident or injury to a pedestrian. | Breaking is not realistic too sensitive | The speed limits are VERY inaccurate. I keep getting dinged for do 73 miles per hour in a posted 75 zone, the app says it’s a 55 mile per hour area. The hard braking is also very unrealistic. Other than that it’s  ok. | If I have to spend any more time trying to get this ridiculous app to work I’m gunna switch insurance companies. What a stupid waste of time! | Whenever I get on this app it takes forever. I have been on it now for 45 minutes trying to update my odometer reading | Way too sensitive on cornering. | It marked me for hard braking 9 times just leaving my driveway at 5 mph. 
It marks me for sharp turning if I turn faster than like 7 mph. I’m not just gonna stop dead in the road and wait 10 seconds to turn, that’s how you get in wrecks.
I DONT BELIEVE ANYONE HAS A PERFECT SCORE BECAUSE THE APP IS BUILT FOR YOU TO FAIL. | My iPhone alerts me frequently that this app is tracking my every movement. Even if I’m no where near the beacon. It’s always tracking. What does State Farm do with all my personal data that doesn’t involve me driving? | The discount is good but I shouldn’t have to leave my location on all the time or the Bluetooth. I sometimes go days without driving my vehicle so I keep my Bluetooth off. Then it’s annoying pop up after pop up from the app saying to turn on Bluetooth. There’s a better way. | It is an invasion of privacy to select always in a location app. | There’s a role that I drive on that says I’m speeding every time I go on it and the speed limit is 55 and I drove 45 on it and it said I was speeding | I don’t think my trips are being recorded.  I called the phone number on the app and the rep said there were problems with the app.  I thought he fixed it but I still can’t see any information about my trips | The app is okay but I have an electric vehicle. The app/device is calibrated for a gas car. My electric car accelerates much faster than a gas car so I get events for my acceleration every time I drive. And I am a pretty conservative driver so I hate getting dinged for it every time.  So my acceleration score is in the 70’s. | Yes in 2024 this is apparently still a challenge.  No, can scan the back of my license to register.  No, wont accept manual entry of license number.  Out of luck. | My awareness and driving has not changed I see that I am being reviewed I guess that’s apart of being retired. I don’t get in any hurry for I know I have all day to get where I am going, I am so glad our insurance went down in price as it should be for the elderly. | It comes with a Jake brake which saves me gas and brakes wear. But every time I use it, I get hit for excessive braking . | I still haven’t figured out the cornering requirements. I have to make a U-turn when leaving home. Most of the time it dings me whether I crawl through the turn or go at a normal speed.  

As for braking, I’ve learned it requires you to ride your brakes a lot. The money I may end up saving will probably be used for new brakes. I was taught not to ride the brakes, go figure. I too have gone through yellow lights to not get dinged. Not the best idea. 

Speeding and Accelerating. I now drive like one of those people who used to drive me crazy because they would take forever to get moving. Oh, I set my car to beep at me if I am speeding so I will immediately let off the gas pedal. I don’t hit my brakes because it will ding me, of course. 

Phone… don’t touch your phone unless you are at a complete stop. I have now memorized a couple of phone number so I can have my car dial the numbers. Remember when we actually knew phone numbers??  Lol

It will be interesting to see if I actually get a discount. Hmmmm???  With the cornering in the high 70s and the braking in the high 80s, I’m thinking they will bring down the others that I’ve managed to get to 10O.  Not sure yet if I’ll keep the app. | I’m currently on my third Beacon. Nobody at State Farm can explain why occasionally my reports contain only half of a trip. Actually, sometimes I report two different halves. Sometimes they don’t record one way at all. Other times they start in the middle of the trip.

Nobody at State Farm can adequately explain what they do with the data nor can they explain how my discount is calculated. | It dings you for hard breaking so much and I do not break hard. That’s very frustrating. I can’t use my phone for music or anything else because it dings you for that too. It’s unfair that those things drop your score. | I don’t understand why it Hass to detect when your phone is being used, when the passenger either be changing the music or checking the phone or using it for something not the driver that’s stupid. | Runs phone battery down. Dings you for braking on a hill when light changes to yellow. Dings for accelerating on turning left from a stop. | System does not always capture my driving. Sometimes it picks parts of my trips and at times none at all. | Sometimes when you drive people like to cut right in front of you, or come out out of nowhere so you have to break out of safety. It happens so often that even breaking from miles apart, it will still deduct point for breaking. How can you control other drivers from not cutting right into your lane at last minute? Literally only my breaking points are low even though I always drive at speed limit or slower to stay a good faaar distance from drivers ahead. Ridiculous. | Should not take away points as I use phone for navigation and music other than that I good | Latest update made the app unusable to open and review anything at all & just drains my battery. | All 100s! It took a while to modify my driving but now I’m a better driver. Yes, the braking component is harsh but I don’t see how it can be anything but consistent in its evaluation. Score high points in other areas and you’ll still save serious amounts on your premium! | If you come to a complete stop at a stop sign, especially if you were going slightly downhill, hard braking is triggered. All of my “scores” are around 100 except for the ridiculously sensitive hard braking measure. Apparently one should just roll through a stop sign so you don’t get dinged for hard braking. | The app misidentified the driver 50% of the time. The app shows a discount for my safe driving, but I see nothing on my bill showing this discount. I’m about ready to delete it. | The idea is good, the functionality is poor at best. You are penalized if you brake hard to avoid an accident, it perceives you are cornering to fast, in a mini van, really? Or it penalizes you for accelerating to fast to avoid a hazard or to get around a truck that blocks your vision of possible hazards. In theory a good idea, terrible functionality.
The only plus is that it has made me more aware of speed limit changes. | The app reports 'braking' incorrectly!
Not once have I braked because I was 'following too closely'!  I brake to avoid drivers that change lanes on a whim and those entering highways without checking traffic, dodging pedestrians, potholes and debris, etc. 
I repeat:  I do not follow too closely!
Acceleration:  occasionally one has to accelerate to avoid being hit!
If it weren't for the insurance discount, I would have removed the app because of the annoyance!  
On a positive note:  I've become adamant about not answering my cellphone while driving. 
If the app is sensitive to other factors, one would assume that the distance between the driver's car and the bumper of the car in front could be measured before the braking incident!
App developers: you asked for a review. I'm assuming that you want serious feedback and will address the issues. I'm sending a copy of my review to my insurance agent. 
I've been driving legally for 70 years and have not been in nor caused an accident. Am I not a careful driver? | It would be useful to have preferred driver for a specific car.   We have four drivers in our family and it will consistent choose the wrong driver by just connecting arbitrarily when two or more of us are in the car | I am typically the passenger in my car.  I want to open the app to record that I’m not the driver and the app doesn’t open | This app isn’t correct in driving info. It doesn’t take into account that a passenger using cell phone but app says driver is | While I appreciate any potential savings, so far it has not been worth the aggravation.  The app drains my phone battery, and don’t believe that it takes real life driving conditions into consideration. 

There are times when you have to speed up to avoid a accident, or likewise brake and swerve to avoid someone who cuts in front of you.  You will certainly get bad marks for taking any evasive action necessary to avoid an accident.

I’m constantly getting dinged for phone distractions, however my phone, (which I carry in my pants pocket) is never used when I’m driving.

The only way to consistently get good scores is to be the only car on the road. | The braking feature on drive and safe is not fair because I get penalized for a person pulling out in front of me.  I brake instead of getting into an accident should be rewarded not held against my score. | If you drive safe according to the app chances are you will cause an accident most other drivers don’t drive safe!! Just remember that big brother is always watching you! I wanted to give a one star but the app will not let me post! So I had to change it to five. I haven’t had a traffic violation or an accident in over 40 years that should show that I’m a safe driver but not according to State Farm | This App “dings” me for things that are not a reflection of my driving. For example, if a person pulls in front of me in traffic, even if I am keeping a good distance from the car in front of me, I have no option but to apply the brakes. Another example is being in a busy city, you have to accelerate when you pull onto the freeway. Not doing so, causes potential accidents. Nonetheless, the App sees acceleration and can’t understand the necessity for it in some circumstances. | I look at the app all the time.  It makes me more careful to be sure my numbers stay good. | I have noticed that if you move the phone without being on the phone from the side if you body to a point in the car to charge the phone you will be hit with a breaking.  It’s like the phone is moving and it suddenly stops.  This has caught mr several times and I have reported it to my agent. | I like the app overall, it works well and is easy to use. The only thing that’s an issue is how it measures braking. I consider myself a very safe driver but I pretty frequently get docked for a “braking event” during a driving trip, due to things like a light turning yellow and me stopping fairly quickly or braking so I don’t hit a car that’s pulled out in front of me. I don’t follow closely, so at least I don’t take a hit braking for that, but it’s frustrating to lose points when I’m braking out of necessity and it would be reckless not to.

title: GeoGuessr
description:
Explore the World with GeoGuessr: A Global Discovery Game

The World Awaits
Are you ready to navigate the globe, challenge your friends, and join a community of explorers? Download GeoGuessr now and start your journey!

Discover & Explore
Join millions in the ultimate adventure with GeoGuessr! Navigate from the secluded roads of Australia to the vibrant streets of New York City. Use your detective skills to identify locations based on clues like signs, languages, flags, and natural landscapes. Whether you’re deciphering internet top domains or analyzing architectural styles, every round is a step into the unknown.

Build Your World
As you navigate the world, your goal is to earn coins through your geographical expertise. These coins serve as your key to unlocking iconic landmarks on your personal globe. Each landmark not only symbolizes your achievements but also marks a step closer to becoming a geography expert.

Solo Adventures
Embark on solo games, delve into your favorite maps, and start country streaks to test how long you can go identifying countries correctly. With various single-player modes, including the popular Famous Places map, your quest for global mastery is endless.

Competitive Play
Face off against the world in exciting multiplayer modes. Engage in Duels, enter Battle Royales, and play challenges to prove your geographical prowess against others. Every game is a chance to prove your skill!

Play Together
Create parties, invite friends, and compete in diverse game modes. Discover who among you has the keenest sense of place, with bragging rights at stake. GeoGuessr's cross-platform functionality means you can play with players on both mobile devices and the web, ensuring no friend is left behind.

Express Yourself
Unleash your creativity with extensive customization options. Personalize your avatar with a wide selection of hats, shirts, and accessories, reflecting your unique style in every game.

Terms of Use: https://www.geoguessr.com/terms 
Privacy Policy: https://www.geoguessr.com/privacy

Support
Facing issues? Our support team is here to help! Email us at support@geoguessr.com
releaseNotes: - Bug fixes and stability improvements
reviews:
It’s a fun game, but not friendly to casual players. A subscription is needed to play the game, which is a bad model for gamers unless they’re serious about the game. I’d be happy to pay a one time fee of $5 and play the game every now and then, but a few dollars a month is not a good basis for casual gamers like myself. Other games that require subscriptions, like chess.com provide lessons and professional developments tutored to the players with many updates, but that’s not really a possibility with this type of game - and if it is they haven’t implemented it well. | Really fun game but the subscription saying I don’t have it when I do is really annoying | The overall game is good but the fact that I have to pay to play makes it to where I can only play every 7 hours. 1 star | I just got the game and already deleted it I got 5 places to guess for the entire day and then it asked me to pay 3.49$ to play for the entire month | Rterwhetjryktuyiujkretrytu | Trails was my favorite game mode, so sad to see it gone. I’m not paying a bunch of money for something I only pick up a couple of times a month. that and the new look is absolute garbage. | I used to consider myself to be a casual enjoyer of GeoGuessr, that changed with the removal of the free games and the single player infinity mode. title: Passport Parking
description:
No more digging for coins. This is how parking should be.

Pay, extend, and manage your parking session with just a few taps. It’s easy!

PAY ON THE GO 
Pay quickly and securely with your smartphone.
- Time's precious, stop wasting it feeding a meter.
- Forget refilling the meter in the rain or braving the cold.

NO PRICE SURPRISES
See when parking rates will change in the future – even when there’s free parking!
- Receive email receipts at the end of your parking session.
- Expenses made easy, manage your parking history through the mobile app.

STRESS-FREE PARKING
Get alerts when your parking session is about to end.
- Stop worrying about how much time is left on the meter, we have you covered.

NO NEED TO RUSH
Add time to your parking session directly from your phone.*
- Your plans change, your parking spot shouldn't. Simply extend your parking session via our app.

--------

GET STARTED TODAY
1. Download the Passport Parking app.
2. Park where you see Passport Parking app signs.
3. Pay for your parking session from your phone.
4. Relax, welcome to parking as it should be.

--------

COMING SOON
The Passport Parking app is not done yet! We're constantly updating the app based on your feedback.

--------

APP PERMISSIONS
- Location Services (optional): Used to quickly provide nearby parking zones.

* where applicable
releaseNotes: Performance improvements and bug fixes
reviews:
This app refuses to take payment. Makes claims credit card is a duplicate card on file (when one doesn’t exist) and once credit card is taken makes you restart parking selection. So many better parking apps out there. Not sure why any city would go with this app. | It’s more convenient to use the parking meters at my local VTA parking stations that also don’t charge random convenience fees for using an inconvenient app. | I had to download this to park and it told me every spot that was vacant was unavailable for purchase. The app is horrible. I had to go to the physical machine to purchase the ticket after realizing the app doesn’t work and I ended up being late to my appointment. | I tried 3 different payment cards and all got declined through payments in the app. Using a card in the parking machine worked fine. It should be a simple process but it’s really frustrating. | every single payment method gets this error: "Payment Failed
Payment could not be processed.
Please check the accuracy of your payment information, select another payment method, or pay at the meter."

yall need to fix your app!! | This app refuses to recognize any payment method for reloading my account. What is the use of this??  This app is in desperate need of an update. | To get this app to work I usually have to delete the stores payment information and re-enter it every time I want to use it. Much easier to use a credit card. I will be deleting it. | Paid for full-day parking through their app, double checked to make sure everything looks right, still got a citation saying I did not pay despite the parking session being still active at that time!!! | I’m not entirely amazed by this app, but it does the job. You can pay for parking, and see how much time you have left. The UI is a little rough and no dark mode but it works. Only thing I don’t like is Apple Pay never works. The app always throws an error saying payments aren’t working right now, but then manually entering the same card’s number works fine.

If they could fix Apple Pay the app would be a 4 star. | Around 20% of the time when I use this app, it goes through the basic motions of confirming the parking spot, all the cool lights spin in world like it’s a successful payment, and then I get to the restaurant and I check to see how much time I have left on my parking and it tells me the payment was not confirmed and so my session never began. This Russian roulette makes this app all but useless. You can imagine the anger of getting a ticket when you think you’ve paid for parking. In each case, when it happens, there is nothing wrong with my credit card or payments, and in fact, if I noticed this problem and just rerun the parking it works every time. So there’s clearly something glitchy with this app. So, despite how clean it looks and how magical it all seems it is really a nightmare in disguise, as you’re never really sure that you’ve paid for parking, and it sends you no notification, your phone doesn’t beep ring or buzz when your payment somehow fails even though your banking situation is crystal clean. | I tried using Apple Pay and the app just crashes.  The app is updated and my os is the latest version.  I contacted their support and they said there was nothing they could do. | no option for Apple Pay which should just be default by now | This app is so temperamental. Doesn’t recognize the payment methods already added and refuses to validate when additional payment methods are added.
Thank goodness I am not pressed for time- really doesn’t sell the efficiency and ease of use. | This app has charged me so many times on top of making my payment. It could be a glitch in the app. Please fix that issue. I’m working near by and using the parking lot and have to pay every day and the additional charges are happing often. Definitely a god app but I am having this issues. I hope the owner of the app can make it right. | I used this app to pay for Metra parking at the Lockport station and it didn’t work!  After a long day at work, I found a $30 parking citation on my windshield.  I contacted Passport Parking to complain and all they did was say “sorry” and divert me to the police department.  I called the police department and they told me to attend the hearing.  So unless you want this burden, don’t trust this app. | This app is terrible. I’ve re entered 3 different credit cards and it always declines. Have to go to the crappy mobile web page to actually use it. | Many many tries but app continues to have issues. Other parking apps are so much easier and they work… not this one. | Won’t accept any of my cards despite them all being functional, and I am unable to do anything about it. When I try to input my card information, it declined me and says that card is already and use and continues to reject my payment. | Refuses to accept my payment method entered multiple cards and it won’t accept them or Apple Pay despite my Apple Pay working for everything else. | The app was last updated a year ago. Running the most current iOS, I keep getting “Network Error please try again later.” I’m not alone, as others that tried to pay and park were forced to use a kiosk since the app was not working. 

Tried troubleshooting by switching off WiFi, logging off, deleting and reinstalling the app, but nothing works. Now I can even log in and I get the same network error when I put in my phone # to verify. 

I am able to use the website to log in, but mobile web browser keeps pushing me to use the App (which is broken). Please release an update for iOS 17.4 | I tried three credit cards and none of them were accepted. | It’s quite useless to me but I do like the interface. Setup was quick and easy but it simply would not take either of my cards. | Payment page errors out continuously.  Tried a different card, tried Apple Pay and get the same error message.   Deleted profile, reinstalled app and payment still didn’t work.   Very frustrating. | This app is designed to GIVE YOU TICKETS. If you close the app while it’s still processing a payment, or even for a few seconds after paying, it won’t go through and you’ll get a ticket. If you click “max time” it only automatically selects about 15 min, so if you don’t notice then you’ll get a ticket. It only gives you an alert about ending parking time ONCE, 10 minutes before, with no way to change it, so if you don’t set a second timer for when parking is actually up to move your car or extend time, then you’ll get a ticket. It also doesn’t detect if the same car is already booked on a street before accepting payment, so it’s easy to double charge yourself for parking (my bf does parking in the mornings, I do afternoons). Awful app. | I plugged in my credit card info, but it won’t save the CVV, so this app is useless to me. | This app doesn’t allow me to reload, despite I’ve tried multiple cards. Got a parking ticket eventually. | Tried two cards that are valid and both failed. Also doesn’t take Apple Pay which is stupid. | Tried three cards. Payment failed. Tried to go to support. Says no internet. Tried connecting to WiFi and and cell. Total fail | Good idea for app but sometimes it will have a pop up that won’t let you pay. The app wouldn’t let me pay for my spot all morning, and when I finally was able to (by restarting the app 50 times and uploading different cards) I go outside and see I was ticketed 1 minute before I paid. 
Everything else in the app is decent but this glitch is not an acceptable bug. I don’t want my car towed because of a glitch in a system. | Paid on the app, got a ticket anyway, ticket appeal denied. Just pay the ticket after the fact, at this point don’t waste money trying to pay for parking. | This app doesn’t work more than half the time. Like most users reviews, it gives an error message when trying to pay. I’ve paid with multiple cards, deleted them and re-entered, deleted and redownloaded the app and experienced the same issue. I contacted support and I received automated responses that did not address this issue. It looks like this app hasn’t been updated by the company in a year. Any town/city who is using it is getting ripped off. | This is a solution that nobody wanted to a problem that didn’t exist. Just let me take a ticket and pay on my way out.

Today I forgot to log in my parking start time, I can’t go back and pay it in the app. I’m not sure what I’m going to have to deal with before I leave. It’s a pain. 

On top of that, I had to download an app to park in a garage that I may never park in again because I don’t live in the area. 

The need for an app also discriminates against people who don’t have smartphones, or don’t have a smartphone that is advanced enough to download the app. | Always issues with this app | I never write app store reviews but I was compelled to write one for passport parking. This app has two major flaws:
1) When using Apple Pay, there is a visa animation with a checkmark that appears PRIOR to completing a purchase. This gives the illusion that the payment went through and your session has started, despite it not. I have been ticketed because of this bug.
2) The app begins your session not from the time you check out, but from the time you start setting up a session. This is incredibly misleading. For example, you can open up the app at 1pm and take 10 minutes to check out (putting in license plate info, credit card, etc). You will get charged for 1 hour but your session will only be until 1:50PM. Profiting for the time spent checking out is inexcusable. | If everything goes smoothly, this app is fine for parking. Unfortunately, I’ve had attempts to pay fail for no apparent reason even when I enter multiple credit cards. Why payment can be so difficult on occasion is a total total mystery. Also, why can’t we use Apple Pay with this app, it seems like that would solve the problem? | Extortion | The app isn’t allowing me to pay for my meter! | So much copying and pasting just to pay for a weaselly parking spot. Please just add support for Apple Pay and Face ID. | The app kept giving a network error when trying to add my credit card. The network was fine. The support agent wanted to argue with me that parking is free on Sunday and not to worry about it. Even if that were the case, the app should give a man appropriate error not just something about the network. I just ended up walking to the machine and paying. | I sent them several emails and no body answered me , they took more 120$ for a parking worth 8$ 
Worst app ever | I’ve tried to use this app several times over the last year and the payment method always malfunctions.  I waste more time trying to unsuccessfully add a credit card; better off paying at the meter. | It’s nice and all but this app seems to never work whenever you really need it to. For example you’re in a hurry and need to pay as your walk to your destination after parking and the payment won’t go through. Very annoying and needs to be fixed. | The app was great in the beginning -  making it easy to park and pay quickly without having to use the machines that take forever. However, I’ve noticed recently the app keeps erroring out when trying to pay for my parking. This has resulted in 2 parking tickets. It’s super frustrating and will prob just use the old machines now since it’s more expensive using this app now. | This app is easy to use! I will say that it would be a great added feature if you could add time to the meter from your watch. Our courthouse does not allow cell phones so adding time from my watch would have been helpful. | App not accepting cards and no other way to sort payment.. | Several times I’ve returned to parking violation tickets on my car only to find out that the app had an error in processing my payment. It will chime when you hit the confirm payment button as if everything went through, but not send any notification if the transaction fails. | Repeatedly tried to park and there’s a bug that won’t let me pay. It thinks there’s no payment and when I enter a space it asks to set up new payment. Then it won’t let me add my card because it says the card I added already exists (but doesn’t access it when I need to pay). 

Issue has persisted for many weeks. I deleted and added back the app with no luck. | It starts counting the time when you open the app, it doesn’t matter if you are still looking for the spot number and entering your payment info. When you look at remaining time after the transaction, it always shows a few min less than the time you’re paying for

App also won’t allow you to renew the time in advance. You need to wait until the session expires to do so | Took literally 20 minutes to figure out how to park Downtown and then constantly got network errors from the app. | They charge a convenience fee. There is no other way of payment yet they charge this fee. I would happily pay differently if I could! I am waiting for fed regulations on this capitalism enabled type of fraud!

title: ParkWhiz - #1 Parking App
description:
Take the hassle out of parking with the ParkWhiz app. Find parking in any major city, compare prices, plus save up to 50% when you book in advance.

Free yourself from parking hassles by choosing the way you'd like to book with plenty of choices, parking times to suit everyone, close-by locations, on the go on mobile.  

You'll get paperless passes that travel with you, for convenient parking anytime--with savings of up to 50% off drive-up.

BOOK easier than ever with our all-in-one homescreen.
PARK with your mobile pass, just pull in.
DO YOUR THING with all the time and money you've saved.

- All in one homescreen for the way you like to book.
- New larger date & time selection for better ease and accuracy.
- Control it all, make your own choices. Choose fast, book easy.
- Instant-load map, simple selections, speedy booking.
- Up to 50% off drive-up rate for pain-free city parking.

All the parking you need.

Business? Check. Commuting? Yep. Going to a museum or a concert? Got it. Need airport parking? Even there. Book with ParkWhiz for all of your parking needs.

We're the leading NYC app, sparing New Yorkers from alternate side of the street parking. From the most congested place in the nation, to Chicago, San Francisco, Boston, Los Angeles, Toronto, and all points in between, ParkWhiz gets drivers parking for less. 

Better yet, you book in advance, so your space is waiting. There's no more circling blocks, worrying about full lots or frayed nerves from not knowing where to park.

HOW IT WORKS

We contract with garages and lots across America for insider pricing we pass along to you. But booking couldn't be easier. Here's how it goes:

- The first screen lets you search by destination by address, map 
or past pass.
- Pick the pin on the map with the nearby location's price you like.
- Set date and times.
- Confirm booking.
- Get your virtual pass in your phone.
- Pull in, park, then do your thing.

WAITING TO HELP

We've got real people just dying to help you out. Have a question, need a hand? Our ace customer service folks will answer your call or text and get you on your way. 

Call 888-472-7594
Email info@parkwhiz.com
Follow us on Twitter @ParkWhiz
Like us on Facebook at http://facebook.com/parkwhiz
Learn more at www.parkwhiz.com

ParkWhiz Delivers

"Dead simple to use, just enter your destination and time then it shows nearby spots. Always reasonably priced with clear descriptions. Highly recommend to take stress out of parking." -- PW customer, April 2017

"Customer service is beyond! Love this app. I live 10 miles from NYC so I'm there often. I'm always able to get discounted parking, no matter the area." -- PW customer, April 2017

"ParkWhiz helps drivers get where they want to be for less." -- American Airlines Magazine
"Check out apps like ParkWhiz that will save you money and a spot." -- ABC News
releaseNotes: Bug Fixes
reviews:

Stuck in traffic, getting a bit anxious, finally pulled up to garage and they were closed, EXCEPT for our prepaid pass.

**update** deleted app, reinstalled and was able to login. | No problems with ParkWhiz | Great deal on parking pretty close to the stadium. | Went to a parking garage downtown Chicago, and for one hour parking was $58, and $10 per each 20 minutes going over; found app so fast created a account and found parking near my actual location for $20 for three hours. Love this app! | Bought a parking pass and afterwards it asked me to download the app. Thought that would be easier than opening an email to get my pass. After downloading the app I had to create an account. This app is useless. | The shuttle from the airport to parking was ridiculous!!  I called and they sent another van, then was going to refuse my party from getting on!  They never used the app until that moment, we had no luggage, so we should have been on the first vans there first, not the 8th, on person from our party was on the 6th van, because they kicked the two of us off, so we had to wait for the eighth but van to come. That van came they were going to not allow us on there and had to see our app. I questioned why they hadn’t use the app on the first they didn’t respond and my friend who was on the sixth was heckled all the way to parking from passengers and driver of why she was on there very disappointed!!!!!!! | These clowns have their own rules for parking. DIY parking at the worst! | No form field validation on license plate inputs, so if you put a dash or a space (like your real, legal license plate), you’ll get a ticket from the lot operator.

As a User Experience / Product Design professional with 20+ years experience in software design, this functionality could be researched and implemented in 1-2 dev sprints easily, all factors accounted for. This omission in functionality can only be summed up as “extortion.”

Lot operators use plate scanners and don't actually look at your paid parking thru this app or match your plate to your validation. Their Scanners remove spaces and special characters. So should this app.

The lot operator (Diamond Parking Services) gave me a “one time courtesy waiver of MY violation” given that it was my “first offense”

Talk about a horrible customer experience, having to deal with all that, and being blamed at fault and ‘splained to how dumb of a person i am.. And now I’m wasting more of my time posting this in hopes that a) they fix the issue and/or b) raise awareness for other customers, or better said “victims,” using this app. | I’ve been using this app for a while.
